authoritie whiche shoulde greatly inforce secondly rewardes hee proposeth vigilant carefull pastours large bountiful sweetenesse muche allure thirdly plague heauie iudgementes whiche hee denounceth watche time age wherein watche rightly considered giue vnderstand sufficiently haue good occasion watch howe earnestly god commaundeth appeareth esaie sayth crie aloude spare lift vp thy voice like trumpet shewe people transgression house iacob esai sinnes esaie haue set watchman vpon thy walles hierusalem esai day al night continually shal ceasse ye mindfull lord keepe silence iohn feede lambes feede iohn sheepe ye loue feede tim preache woord instant tim season season improue rebuke exhorte c howe sweetely rewardes allureth doth appeare daniel wise shal shine dan brightnesse firmament turne many righteousnes shal shine starres euer euer tim take heede thy selfe tim doctrine occupie thy selfe continually dooing thou shalt saue thy selfe heare thee fiersly also vrgeth driueth sluggish carelesse sheapheards terrible plague whip threatened vnto appeareth ezechiel sayth sonne man haue made thee watcheman vnto house israel therefore heare woord ezech mouth giue learning shal say vnto wicked thou shalt surely dye thou giuest warning speakest admonish wicked wicked way may liue wicked man shal dye iniquitie bloud wil require thy hand ieremie ver thou therefore trusse vp thy loynes arise speake vnto ier commaund thee bee afraide face least destroy thee cor ver though preache gospel haue nothing reioyce cor necessitie laide vpon woe vnto preach gospell doe willingly haue rewarde multitude wolues rauenous beastes great rage furie fell euery sheepfolde good sheepherdes either put flight pitifully murth red sheepe committed wolues either perish degenerate wolues regenerate soworne windes tempest rente rockes crackt vtterly decayed seemeth rare peece cunning make take sea againe remedie ministerie time loue feare god would haue thing run ruine regard either god themselues brethre must forthwith without delay set selues feede flock teach exhorte strengthe binde vp builde plant water set graffe leaue nothing vndone apperteineth feeding fatting lord flock neuerthelesse written abraham alone fayth reckoned vnto righteousnesse also v whome shal reckoned beleeue c meanes say shal writing old testament also giuen christian againe wrapped lawe shall inforced circumcised sacrifice fleshe bloud beastes admit againe priesthood aaron together temple ceremony shall againe allowed byll diuorcement putting away man wife together sufferaunce marrie many wiues aunswere olde testament muste consider thinges whiche euer obserued thinges whiche ceremoniall suffered onely till time amendement time amendment time christe fulfilled lawe tooke awaye curse lawe christe chaunged circumcision baptisme owne sacrifice made end sacrifice nowe steade sacrifice lefte v onely sacrifice christe wherein also learne offer body prayer together good deedes spirituall sacrifice vnto god christ changed priesthood aaron owne priesthoode al christian temple god god spirit doth dwell ceremony christ make voide also nineteene mathewe abrogate bill diuorcement together marriage many wiues althoughe ceremony externall action abrogated cleane taken away christ bound vnto yet notwithstanding scripture whiche published touching taken awaye else made voide woord god nd ord god reuealed men may teache maner one god towardes men would haue saued faithe christ christ meanes saluation commeth becommeth true worshiper god ought flie ensue neither sufficient know wil god vnlesse saued cause sayde moses heare israell statute iudgements whiche teache ye may doe liue lorde gospell confirming cryeth blessed whiche heare worde god keepe praysed exceeding god goodnesse praysed teaching v great goodnesse god whiche would haue nothing hid fro v whiche maketh whit liue rightly well holily wise learned world doe part beare enuy grudge shoulde attaine vnto true wisedome lorde doth gently accorde offer v whole knowledge heauenly thing desirous goe forward therein yea doth labour bring ende whosoeuer hath sayth lorde selfe gospell shall giuen may haue aboundance euery one asketh receiueth seeketh findeth knocketh shal opened whervpon iames apostle sayth lacke wisdome let aske god whiche giueth al men liberally willingly grudging neyther casteth man teeth shall giuen way see dutie reading hearing worde god pray earnestly zealously may come ende whiche worde god giuen reuealed vnto v touching matter say somewhat come declare maner sorte worde god ought heard nowe bycause haue sayde point true godlinesse taught holy scripture worde god reuealed intente maye fully instructe v wayes god saluation fewe wordes declare vnto dearely beloued worde god deliuered v prophetes apostle aboundantly contained whole effect godlynesse thinges soeuer auaileable leading oure liues rightly well holyly verily must needes doctrine full pointes perfect nothing ought eyther added else taken away doctrine doctrine taught worde god witnesseth moses deuter solomon prouerb therfore dothe confesse pointes true pietie taught v sacred scripture furthermore man denie absolute doctrine man fully made perfect worlde may taken iust man world come called euer companie god beleeueth word god vttered world prophetes apostle liueth thereafter called iust man heire life euerlasting doctrine therefore absolute doctrine paule also declaring largely fully matter tim sayth scripture giuen inspiratio god profitable doctrine reproue correction instruction whiche righteousnesse man god may perfect instructed good workes ye haue brother euident testimonie fulnesse worde god ye haue doctrine absolutely perfect al point ye haue perfect effect ye word god bicause iohn apostle euangelist doth freely confesse lord many thing also whiche written booke immediately addeth sayth written ye might beleue iesus christe sonne god beleeuing ye might haue life name affirmeth doctrine whiche conteined writing faythe fully taught fayth graunted god euerlasting life ende absolute doctrine happie perfectly blessed since commeth man written doctrine gospell vndoubtedly doctrine gospell absolutely perfect knowe lord gospell sayde haue many thing tell time beare therwithal know immediatly added saying spirite trueth shall come shall leade trueth knowe furthermore spirite trueth come vpon disciple therefore beleeue according true promise christ led trueth assuredly certaine nothing wanting whiche apostle set downe writing whole doctrin godlinesse better god v maye gloryfied go curiously search hidden counselles god desire counted skilfull experte many matter let true fayth glory god saluation appointed measure certaine ende oure hearing meete hearer worde god lay aparte worldly affaire whiche signified garment treade vnder foote filthynesse vncleannesse soule bodye refraine season euen pleasure whiche lawfull vnto v holy ghost dothe disease hath lorde rehcarsed reckoned vp parable sower first wanton vaine cogitation whiche alwaies lye wide open inspiration satan talke naughtie men plague word god also voluptuous deintie louers become vaine vnthankfull hearer worde god must praye continually bountifull liberall lorde vouchsafe bestowe v spirit seed god word may quickned heartes holy right hearer worde may beare fruite watreth nothing whiche planteth god whiche giueth increase haue neede therefore god watering word god may growe perfect age may receiue increase yea may come also bringing foorthe ripe fruite within sayth pet haue right sure worde prophesie wherevnto ye attend vnto light shineth darke place ye doe well vntill daye dawne daye starre arise heartes auncient writer tertullian affirmeth heretiques men gainesaying bycause deede fewer place muste vnderstoode according meaning number finally moste effectuall rule whereby expounde scri tures expo ded wi zealous hertaf earnest prayer worde god heart loueth god glorye puffed vp pryde desirous vayne glorye corrupted heresy euill affection whiche doth continually praye god holy spirite ye scripture reuealed inspired also spirite maye expounded glorye god safegarde faythfull let mynde interpreter set fire zeale aduaunce vertue hatred wickednesse euen suppressing thereof let heart suche expositor call counsell subtile sophister deuill least peraduenture nowe also doe corrupt sense god worde heretofore paradise let abide heare man wisedome argue directly worde god good faythfull expositor god worde shal doe although pointes doe prouerbe sayth hit head nayle darker sense scripture yet notwithstanding errour ought condemned heresie authour iudged hurtfull vnto hearer euer shall bring ye darker proper meaning scripture light shall condemne vnperfect exposition whiche authour vnperfect exposition shall reiect proper sense better expositour acknowledging shall receiue thankes giuing thus muche hytherto haue said touching sense exposition god worde god reuealed men also would haue case vnderstand wherefore cause man reason difficulty despaire attaine true vnderstanding scripture scripture dothe admit godly religious interpretation worde god rule men age leade lyues therefore ought interpretation applyed age men sortes euen god self moses many wordes expounde apply people lawe whiche gaue published mount sina furthermore solemne vse among auncient prophet first reade exposition apply god law people lord iesus christ selfe expounded scripture apostle also word god therfore ought expounded whiche woulde haue expounded meaning bicause would sinne frely controling punishment wheras scripture doth admit exposition doth yet admit exposition whatsoeuer sauoureth man imagination vtterly reiecteth spirite god scripture reuealed spirit requisite expound therefore certaine rule expounde worde god religiously worde god self expounde exposition disagree article fayth contrarie charitie towardes god neighbour throughly surueyed grounded vpon whiche went followeth diligent weighing circumstance laying together place chiefly requisite heart interpreter godly bent willing plant vertue plucke vp vice rootes finally alwayes ready euermore praye lorde vouchsafe illuminate oure myndes god name maye thinges gloryfied glory honour dominion euer euer amen true fayth whence commeth assured beliefe minde whose onely stay vpon god worde p fourth sermon last sermo declared vnto howe perfecte exposition god worde doth differ nothinge fro rule true faith loue god neighbour vndoubtedly sense scripture corrupted doeth square faith two point charitie haue therfore next treate true faith charitie towards god neighbour intent man may finde lacke thing herein first therefore god help good mean prayer wil speake true faith word faith beliefe diuersly vsed common talke men taken kinde religion honor done god say christian faith iewish faith turkish faith faith beliefe also taken conceiued opinion thing tolde v whe heare thing rehearsed vnto v indian ethiopian hystorie say beleue yet notwithstanding put confidence hope haue commoditie therby faith wherewith saint iames sayth deuill beleeueth trembleth last faith commonly put assured vndoubted confidence god word among hebrues faith taketh name truth certainty assured constancy latines call faith done sayd wheruppon one sayth demaund thee whether thou beleeuest thou aunswerest beleue thou sayst faith therfore treatise faith vndoubted beliefe firmely grounded minde faith setled de nitions faith vndoubted persuasion beliefe leaning vpon god worde diuersly defined ye perfecter diuines paul saith faith substance thing hoped euidence thing seene substance hypostasis foundation vnmoueable proppe vpholdeth v wheron leane lye perill daunger thing hoped thinges celestiall eternall inuisible therefore paul saith faith vnmoueable foundation assured cofidence god promise life euerlasting good benefit moreouer paul himselfe making exposition spoken immediatly saith faith argument thinges seene argument proofe euident demonstration whereby manifestly proue otherwise doubtfull vndertoke instru te may remain doubt touching ye misteries god reuealed god word themselues owne nature seene bodily eye therefore called thing seene faith giuing light mind doth harte perceiue euen set forth word god faith therfore according definition paul minde euident seeing hart certaine perceiuing thing inuisible thing eternall god say thinges word setteth forth vnto v concerning spirituall thing definition paules eye defined faith sorte faith grouded persuasion heauenly thing meditation wher ought occupy selues assured truthes sake god worde may beleeue minde see thing well eye behold thing sensibly perceiued easy seene description doth greatly differ definition godly learned man saith faith stedfast persuasion minde wherby fully decree selues god truth sure neither choose performe worde hath promised fulfill againe faith stedfast assurednes conscience doeth embrace christ sort wherin offered vnto v gospell another manner almost defineth faith sort faith gift inspired god mind wherby without douting al doth beleue true whatsoeuer god hath either taught promised bokes testamets author definitio therfore doth extend fayth three termes time time past time present time come teacheth beleeue worlde made god euer holy scripture declare haue bene done olde worlde also christ dying v saluation whiche beleeue god daye also worlde church gouerned preserued christe faythfull saued laste shal assuredly light vpon vngodly godly euer holy scripture doe eyther threaten promise definition therefore description true fayth diligently considered maye according scripture make description fayth fayth gift god poured man fro heauen whereby taught vndoubted persua io wholy leane god word word god dothe freely promise life good thing christe wherein trueth necessarie beleeued plainly declared whiche description fayth god helpe followeth vnfolde partes assertion place scripture bothe confirme make manifest vnto ye hytherto ye haue done still giue diligent care heartes praye earnestly god first cause beginning begi ning cause faith fayth commeth man strength man god selfe holy spirite inspireth fayth heart gospell lorde sayth man commeth vnlesse father drawe againe fleshe bloude sayth lorde peter confessing christ true faith hath reuealed thee father heauen whervnto apostle paul alludeth sayth able ourselues thinke thing selues abilitie god another place giuen christe onely beleeue also suffer sake fayth therefore poured heart god welspring cause goodnesse yet haue consider faith planted worde god god giuing inspiring faith dothe vse absolute power miracle working certaine ordinarie meanes agreeable man capacitie although deed giue fayth without meanes howe pleaseth reade lord hath vsed ordinarie meanes euen first creation thing whome meaneth bestowe knowledge faith sendeth teacher worde god preache true fayth vnto bycause lyeth man power wil ministerie giue fayth bicause outward worde spoken man mouth able selfe bring fayth voice man preaching god worde teache v true fayth god dothe commaunde v beleeue god selfe alone sending holy spirite heart myndes men dothe open heart persuade oure myndes cause v oure heart beleeue worde teaching haue learned beleeue lorde could miracle heauen without preaching haue bestowed fayth christe vpon cornelius centurion cesaria yet aungell dothe sende preaching peter peter preacheth god holy spirite worketh hearte cornelius causing beleeue preaching verily sainte paule sayth howe shall beleeue whome haue heard shall heare without preacher howe shall preache sent fayth commeth hearing hearing word god another place also paule sayth apollo minister whome ye haue beleeued according god hath giuen euery one haue planted apollo watred god hath giuen increase planteth nothing watreth god giueth increase doctrine saint peter saint paul doth agree augustine writeth preface booke christian doctrine sayth whiche haue learne man hande let euery one learne man hande without disdaine let v goe tempte beleeue neyther deceiued let v thinke scorne goe churche heare learne oute bookes looking still shal rapt vp thirde heauen let v take heede like temptation pride let v rather haue oure myndes euen apostle paul selfe although cast prostrate instructed calling god heauen neuerthelesse sent taught god cornelius although god heard praiers committed peter instructed whome receiue sacramentes shoulde also heare ought beleue hope loue thing notwithstading might haue bene done angell c augustine also epistle circenses saith euen worketh conuersion bringeth passe minister doth warne v outwardly signes thinges inwardly doth teach v thing themselues also treatise vpon iohn doe men saith preach outwardly doe speake driue eares noise word vnlesse doe reueale say speake without doth husband tree within creator c said euen lorde desire muste raye rue fayth haue v beleue worde prophet crieth saith day ye heare voice harden hart like maner doth require v al heare word slacke praying hearing worde god must pray gifte faith lord may ope hart couert soules breake flie fro place place hart deepely rooted christ sticketh hart inlightened firste sayeth apostle abraham contrary hope beleeued hope say constant hope notwithstanding nothing hope thinges weighed trueth getteth vp againe strugling confirmed reade promise god came abraham mynde shall sonne borne thee art hundred yeres old infirmitie stackering weakenesse fayth apostle commending abraham fayth attaine true wisdome studie philosophie deceiued farre heauen broade philosophie dothe falsly iudge faultily teach many thing touching god workes god chiefe goodnesse ende good euill touching thing rabines iewes god hath dispersed worde god throughout whole world word faith heart faithful paul apostle sayth thus saith iustice faith say thy heart shall descende heaue fetch christ downe aboue shal descend deepe bring christe dead againe saith word nighe vnto thee euen thy heart worde faith preach thou co fesse thy mouth lord iesus doest beleeue thy heart god hath raised deade thou shalt saued faith therefore doth make v wise happy also lord self bearing witnes thervnto saying disciple happy eye see thing ye se say vnto many prophet king haue desired se thing ye se heare thing ye heare heard shal therfore finde faith man may attaine chiefe goodnesse certaine determination ye notable question stirred since ye beginning ye worlde learned excellent wit meanes man may liue happy attaine chief goodnesse ioyned chief goodnesse iustified haue ben yea yet diuers opinios touching matter contrary one briefly truely affirme true faith man doth liue happy attaineth ye chief goodnesse conioyned ye chief goodnes also iustified ye god dwelleth v faith happy blessed pray could haue ben spoken excelletly worthily diuinely touching true faith se faith quickneth v maketh v happy ioyneth v chiefe goodnes yt v may liue faith doth also fully iustifie v nowe best heare ye testimony ye scripture faith maketh v happy pet cofessing ye lord faith maketh happy iesus true faith saide happy art thou simon son ionas flesh bloude hath reuealed thee father heaue paule ye proofe faith bringeth sentence dauid happy whose iniquity forgiu n whose sinnes couered blessed lord shal impute sin faith quickneth maketh aliue faith quickneth eor iust liueth faith doth paule often writing alledge prophet paul also saith life liue fleshe liue faith son god loued gaue self faith ioyneth v ye eternal chief goodnesse maketh v faith ioyneth god inioy ye chief goodnes yt god may dwell v god ye lorde iesus self gospel saith eateth flesh drinketh bloud dwelleth louing father set also liue father eteth shal liue eate drink ye lord leeue ye lord ye hath giue self death v whervpon iohn ye apostle saith haue seene witnesse father hath sent son sauiour world whosoeuer shal confesse iesus sonne god god dwelleth god wherfore also paul saide liue christ liueth moreouer faythe dothe iustifie faith stifieth bycause ye treatise thereof fitlye fullye made ende houre meane deferre till next sermon shall present dearely beloued ye must remember one true fayth christian fayth although said many fayths religion yet notwithstanding onely one true vndoubted fayth dothe increase againe decrease men rightly godly obserued sheweth foorthe sundry vertues bringeth true wisedome finally quickneth maketh v blessed happy deede god father authour goodnesse felicitie prayse glory throughe iesus christ lorde euer euer amen faithfull iustified fayth lawe workes p sixte sermon readye dearely beloued speake vnto fayth whiche without workes dothe iustifie beleeue call vpon father whiche heauen onely begotten sonne iesus christe lorde beseeching open mouth lippes setting foorthe prayse illuminate heart ye acknowledging great benefite god may become thankfull holy deede first speake certaine iustification thing chiefly necessarie argument treatise touching terme iustification terme iustifying vsuall common among hebrues large signification day wel vnderstoode men ought iustifie muche say quite iudgement denounced vttered sentence condemnation signifieth remit offence cleanse sanctifie giue vtterance life euerlasting lawe terme belonging court iudgement exercised imagine therefore man set iudgement seate god pleaded guiltie wit accused conuinced hainous offence therefore sued punishment ye sentence condenation imagine also sonne god maketh intercession commeth meane desiring vpon may layde whole fault punishment due vnto v men death may cleanse take away setting v free death giuing v life euerlasting imagine god highe iust iudge receiueth offer tra slatet punishment together fault v vnto necke sonne making therwithall statute whosoeuer beleeueth son god suffered sinnes world brake power death deliuered v damnation shoulde cleansed sinnes made heire life euerlasting therefore dull mankinde finallye almost wyth labour hee brought al forth large writte moses first genesis thou shalte compelled amazed goodwill power god yet waye wee muste thincke creatour thinges one sonne eternall wysedome hath created al thing visible inuisible yea nothing doth moreouer preset sustaine nourish rule preserue thinges euerlasting spirite wtout euery thinge woulde presently fall ruine lorde withal hee worshipped therfore let v also belieue worship let v belieue iesus sonne god father beinge one power father althoughe person hee differ father dauid testifying sayth lord said lord substaunce signification doth apostle call brightnesse glory father liuelie image substance consubstantial oessetiall well therefore holy father saye sonne substaunce beinge father whereunto belongeth hee called onelye sonne onely sonne another place onely begotten first begotten sonne wee also called sonnes participation nature likenesse substaunce naturallye adoption therfore iewes offended hee called himselfe sonne god sense faithful called sone god perceiue ye extoll himselfe saying ye hee naturall sonne god equall god god himselfe thus wee reade fifthe iohn therefore iewes sought kill vnto doe yee stone mee iewes replied thy good workes sake wee stone thee thy blasphemie thou man makest thy self god euidente testimony natural godhead christ whosoeuer belieueth hee hath father hee honoureth sonne honoureth father hee withoute sonne hath father vnlesse sonne god nature hee coulde sauiour worlde second thing iesus marked name onely begotten sonne god opened called iesus christ name expressely set downe ye may know beleue lest peraduenture might deceyued ye person iesus name geuen vnto god appointmet heauen euen also prefigured duke iosue iosue ye high priest angell gospell mathew instructinge ioseph sayth mary shall bring forth sonne thou shalt call name iesus hee shall saue people sinnes sonne god iesus christe sauiour worlde forgiueth sinnes setteth v free al power felicitie wherin sonne god doth sit doth dwell humanitie also member christe shal place without dolour griefe ioye euermore although lorde deliuered grieuous businesse yet meane sitteth idlely leaning elbowes king prieste god temple god choose therefore natural propertie office work saluation elect thing lye god king prieste hande doe nowe knowe lorde doth sitteth heauen neither trouble worke doth worketh compulsion naturally owne accord thus otherwise ancient saint hierom ight fa interpreter holy scripture handle article belief whose testimony alledge saint hierome exposition paules first moreouer sinnes sinnes forgeuen men one two age certaine number sinnes forgiuen onely sinnes men age whole multitude sinns whatsoeuer called sinne whether original actuall else short sinnes forgiue v hereby learne onely sacrifice christ effectual enough wash away offence sinner fayth come mercie seat god grace yet wee teach men sinne lorde hath long since made satisfaction sinnes man sinne wee saith euery sinne hee say saith euery one excepteth none vnlesse yt ye lorde himselfe excepted meane sinne ye holie ghoste verie iohn forbiddeth v pray againe also hee saith acknowledge sinns god faithfull iust forgiue v sinnes clense v fro al vnrighteousnes apostle thought enough say barelie forgiue v sinnes hee might declare thing deede plainly might easily vnderstoode hee addeth moreouer saying clese v al vnrighteousnes loe hee saith againe vnrighteousnes cauiller mighte peraduenture make obiectio say kinde doctrine maketh men sluggish slowe amendment men vnder pretence god grace wherfore assuredly true death christe sinnes forgiuen belieue moreouer ye lorde alone forgiueth god alone man forgeueth sinns sinns glorie god alone forgiue sinnes vnrighteous make men righteous therefore wheras said forgiue sinnes vnderstood ministerie power minister pronounceth people christ sake sinns forgiuen saying hee deceyueth god deede forgiueth sinns belieue according saying whose doth pardon howe sin forgeuen sinnes v leaue reliques behind sting flesh imputed v damnation concupiscence sticketh faste sheweth selfe flesh striuing still good spirite god euen holie one log life sainct hierome compelleth iohn eishoppe hierusalem openly confesse resurrection flesh bodie onely fleshe saith hath one definition bodie al flesh bodie euery body fleshe flesh properlie compacte bloud veynes boanes synewes bodie althoughe called fleshe yet sometime said like substance firmamet ayre subiect touchinge seeing oftentimes maye touched seene wall bodie fleshe thus much hierome let v therefore belieue men body taken earth liuinge men beare aboute wherein liue also die turne dust ash body say quickned liue againe thou demaundest howe fleshe beinge resolued duste whether body ut ifie rise ash nothing rise againe former shape substaunce torne teeth beastes consumed nothing flame fyre whe graue founde small little quantitie dustie powder referre thee omnipotencie god apostle spake hee sayth christ hath transformed vile bodie make conformable glorious bodie power wherein hee make thing subiecte himselfe wherefore hee beginning yet man world could bring forth man oute duste earth although man resolued hee taken meane earth saying dust thou art dust shalt thou retourne againe yet notwithstandinge god againe ende world able rayse man earth lorde gospell saith plainely houre shall come wherein graues shall heare voyce sonne god shal come forth haue done good resurrection life haue done euill resurrection iudgement fayth wee throughly persuaded apostle sayth hath promised able also per forme moreouer liuelie example matter moste euident testimony holie scripture ionas swallowed vp whale syrian sea ye third daye hee caste vppe againe alyue vppon shoare beastes entrailes token fleshe shall verily rise againe wherefore harde belieued apocalipse said yt sea casteth vp dead force fyre force hurte three companion daniel yea rage wilde beastes contrary nature absteyned bytinge daniell himselfe marueile therefore day neither force fyre rage wielde beast able resiste power god disposed raise creature vp againe lord christ rayse vp lazarus lyen three dayes graue yea stancke life againe hee hauing broke ye tyrannie death rise vp againe thirde day deade rise againe substaunce fleshe forme bodie wherein hee hanged crosse beinge taken downe crosse buried chap first epistle corrinthians doth make ful discourse resurrection fourth chapter epistle hee sayth wee liue alwayes deliuered death iesus sake life iesus also mighte appeare mortal fleshe see coulde spoken plainlye lyfe christe shalbe made appeare mortall flesh hee saith know hee raysed vp lorde iesus shall rayse v vp also meanes iesus fifth chapiter againe wee must appeare iudgemente seate christe sayth hee enerye man may receiue woorkes body according hath done whether good euill therefore verie bodyes shall rise againe day iudgement deerely beloued haue declare vnto manner bodyes shall rise againe sorte shalbe resurrection shuttinge vppe ende sort body shal rise age world lord iesus christe shall come iudgement great maiestie whomsoeuer day shall finde alyue shall momente time chaunged first saye shall dyed firste adam laste shall dye ryse vppe againe owne flesh stande amonge lyuinge chaunged tribunall seate christe lookinge laste pronounced sentence iudgemente doth paule set downe woordes loe tell mysterie shall verilie sleepe shal chaunged moment time twinckling eye sounde laste trump shall sounde dead shall ryse againe incorruptibly shalbe chaunged corruptible must put incorruption mortall must put immortalitie facion body shalbe resurrection euident testimonie apostle wee maye gather facion bodyes shalbee resurrection verilie oure bodyes shalbe none resurrection bee onely excepted shalbe cleane without corruption corruptible affection apostle sayth deade shal rise againe wee shalbe chaunged againe pointing expressly precisely bodyes wee beare aboute hee sayth corruptible mortall yea body saye iob also witnessed shal rise againe shall rise agayne incorruptible corruptible shall rise againe immortall resurrection mortall body resurrection shalbe set free euill affection passion corruption substaunce therof shall brought noughte shall chaunged spirite shall loose owne proper shape body verilie purification cleansing dreggs yea rather heauenlie diuine giftes called spirituall body also glorious purified bodie glorious body paule thirde philippian sayth conuersation heauen whence wee looke sauiour lorde iesus christe shall chaunge oure vile bodie maye made like vnto glorious bodie see apostle calleth oure resurrection deade transubstantiation losse substaunce body chaunging also shewing kinde bodie chaunged bodie hee calleth glorious bodie without shape voyde facion augmented glorie yea hee setteth v verie bodie oure lorde iesus christ sheweth v facion oure body shall haue glorie plaine woordes hee sayth hee shall make oure vile bodie like glorious bodie let v therefore see kinde bodie oure lorde resurrection neither tourned ghoste broughte nothinge yet able knowne shape figure shewing handes feete easilie knowne printe nayles wherewith hee crucifyed hee sayde see euen hee wit cladde agayne wyth bodie wherein hong vppon crosse speaking yet plainely prouing bodie spirituall substaunce hee sayde spirite hath fleshe bone yee see haue hee hath therefore purified bodie fleshe bone verie member hee yet bodie purified cause lorde offer thomas syde scarres fiue woundes bee fealt handled ende wee shoulde doubte verie bodie raised vp againe hee eate drincke wyth disciple peter actes witnesseth cornelius men might know verie self bodie died rose death againe althoughe bodie comprehended within certaine limited place dispersed ouer euerie although haue iust quantitie figure shape iust weight owne kinde nature yet notwithstanding free euerie passion corruption infirmitie bodie lorde raysed vppe gardeine sepulcher woman came annoynt meeteth waye returne sepulcher offereth selfe seene magdalene gardeine goeth company emaus two disciple iourneyed emaus meane time hee wyth bodie hee among disciple twayne returned eleuen lord himselfe euening present wyth hee goeth disciple galile presently hee commeth iurie againe body taken vp mount oliuet heauen doth prone certayne veritie christes shall resurrection likewise clarified lord himselfe gospell alledginge woords daniell sayth shal righteous shine sonne father kingdome cause glorious body called also clarifyed clearenesse heauenlie brightnesse wherewith glister adorned secondarilie glorie vilenesse made contrary paul saith glorious body rest free vilenesse hee shall chaunge vile bodie make facion like glorious bodie woordes passion infirmity clad eternitie heauenly feelinge glorie apostle sayth sowen corruption riseth incorruption sowen dishonour riseth glorie sowen infirmitie riseth power sowen naturall bodie riseth spiritual bodie giftes therefore glorious clarified body great many incorruption glorie popower quickening spirite apostle himselfe shewing ment natural spiritual bodie addeth immediatly sayth naturall body spirituall body written firste man adam made liuing soule laste adam made quickening spirite yet agayne plainely sayth howbeit first spiritual naturall spirituall first man earth earthy seconde lord fro heauen earthy earthy heauenlie also heauenlie wee haue borne image earthy shal beare image natural spi tuall body heauelie paul calleth naturall bodie earthy bodie wee haue first father adam whose quickening soule doth liue hee calleth spiritual bodie heauenly body wee haue christe made likenesse body christe althoughe verye body deede fleshe thereof verie fleshe deede yet notwithstanding quickened preserued spirite christ needeth power vegetatiue although therefore body member beare fleshe oud hal heauen shall resurrection heauen yet neuerthelesse clarified clensed corruption feelinge naturall su ani li bodie shal verilie natural corruptible sense affection vse carnall bodie member animalis doth lord affirme againste sadduces dreamte marriage heauen rather absurditie made mocke resurrection hee sayth sonnes worlde marrie wyues giue marriage shalbe thought worthy world resurrection dead neyther marrie wyues giue marriage neither die equall angells yt sonnes god assoone sonnes resurrection effect also paul sayth flesh bloude cannot inherite kingdome god least peraduenture anye man shoulde mistake wordes thincke hee spake substaunce fleshe hee addeth immediately interpretation thereof sayth neither shall corruption inherite incorruption wherefore fleshe bloud saye affection lustes fleshe shall electe liue heauen ioyes heauen differ greate deale ioyes earth farre forth condition canot admitte corrupt creature inheritours cause corruptible body muste firste purged corruption meanes purely clarified turkes therefore deceiued looke earthly ioyes moreouer body wicked body th wicked shall also rise aga n shal also rise againe paule actes sayth belieue written lawe prophetes hopeing god resurrection deade themselues looke also shalbe iust vniust see apostle saith vniust also resurrection shal taken bodyes infirmitie corruption dishonour miserie euen body risinge agayne dishonour shall iudgement power god surely shut dishonour corruption condemned euer beare endlesse tormentes death corruption shall neyther dye yet corrupt euen earth founde certaine bodyes doe indure euen fire cursed bodyes wicked shall worne broken torment euer euery minute shall receiue newe strength suffer continuall suffering shall abyde deserued punishmentes euer euer without end lorde gospell sayeth haue done euill shall rise againe resurrection damnation induring euerlasting damnation daniell sayde multitude sleepe duste earth shall awake euerlasting life shame perpetuall contempt gospell againe lorde sayth worme dyeth fire quenched wordes rest elfth article belief life euerlasting haue heard vnderstoode soules men immortall oure bodyes doe rise againe ende worlde haue confessed beliefe felloweth latter ende creede whether immortall soul body raised vp shal come therfore confession say life euerlasting beleeue lyfe eue lasting shall haue life liue euer bothe body soule euerlastingnesse verily perpetual hath ende litle proued holy putrifie yet notwithstanding shal without life euer shall length receiued eternall lyfe raysed vp shall time iudgement caught ayre meete christ may euer lord doe soules returne heauen euery one owne neighbour self v loue neighbor selues lorde hath sayde loue thy neighbour thy sel intirely dearely meanes thou mayst affection force vehemencie selfe loue neyther lord minde loue neighbour whit lesser samaritane sight wou ded man moued pitie therefore required v mercifull motion pitie regard men calamity thoughe owne looked handes shoulde sorrowfull mynded another man trouble feeleth miserie according saying apostle mindfull bondes bound whiche suffer aduersitie thoughe ye selues also body suffered aduersitie secondarily samaritane passeth commeth vnto doth sorrowefull word wish health wounded letting lye depart dispatche owne affaire iames apostle saith brother sister naked destitute dayly foode one say vnto depart peace ye warmed filled yet notwithstanding giue thing needefull bodie shall profite samaritane therefore conuneth vnto setteth hande sheweth skyll hath whiche muche ywis heale sillie magled man doth loath turne face yllfauoured colour bloudy matter corrupted filth stenche woundes bindeth vp selfe letting alone another doe maketh excuse physician dothe necessitie vsing suche medicine time present readinesse til conueniently might come better wine oyle taken beganne iourney necessitie doth vse inconueniently bycause wine purgeth woundes oyle doth make supple moreouer whatsoeuer hath dothe employ silly man behoofe doe ease doth euen disease selfe alighteth backe beast whereon rode maketh serue maimed man necessitie also owne hand lifteth vp grounde man weake stande setteth beast lastly selfe becommeth guide leade way suffring take charge ouer could readily bring owne house yet conueigh comon inne againe spareth cost paine taking selfe taketh charge miserable man bycause common innes sicke folk part slenderly looked vnto earnest businesse calleth make hast iourney taketh much money doth thinke sufficient till returne giueth inkeeper therewithall content giueth hoast especiall charge sicke man also bindeth self saying whatsoeuer thou shalt lay thing necessarie recouerie thou shalt loose one myte returne pay thee againe vttermost farthing promiseth returne therwithall declareth shall quiet vntill see thorowly healed woundes ye haue dearely beloued lorde parable moste goodly absolute example loue samaritane doth liberally willingly imploy whole seruice vpon needie neighbour necessitie therefore owe selues wholy haue neighbour behoofe bestowe doe fulfill dueties loue ciuil humanitie yet adde testimony scripture therby pith charity may fully vnderstande innermost pith loue yet peraduenture thing may seeme wanting hitherto haue alledged paule therefore writing corinthian sayth loue suffereth wrong curteous loue enuieth loue doth frowardly loue swelleth dealeth dishonestly seeketh hir owne prouoked anger thinketh euill reioyceth iniquitie reioyceth trueth suffereth thing beleeueth thing hopeth thing indureth thing againe apostle epistle romanes saith loue striueth goe giuing honour oth r loue distributeth saintes necessitie giuen hospitalitie speaketh well persecuters curseth persecute loue reioyceth reioyce weepeth weepe applyeth selfe weaker sortes infirmitie againe owe nothing man loue one another loueth another hath fulfilled lawe loue fulfilling la thou shalt commit adultrie thou shalt steale thou shalte kill thou shalte beare false witnesse thou shalt lust commaundement compreheded briefly saying namely thou shalte loue thy neighbour thee selfe loue worketh yll neighbour therefore fulfilling lawe loue charitie hitherto also pertaineth workes workes mercie mercy flowe loue rehearsed lorde first sermon summe lawes loue god neighbour euery parte whereof bycause haue already spoke last sermon next nowe also make particular discourse lawes euery part kinde thereof let v therefore call god cause beginning lawes lorde iesus christe vouchsafe spirite alwayes direct v waye trueth righteousnesse heathen writer base authour law ywis made definition lawe especiall reason placed nature comauding done fordidding contrarie verily lawe nothing declaration god appointing thou hast thou oughtest leaue vndone beginning cause lawes god selfe fountaine goodnesse equitie trueth righteousnesse therefore good iust lawes come god selfe althoughe parte published brought light men touching lawes men muste haue peculiar consideratio selues lawes diuision awe god nature men concerning god law wil speak seconde sermon present touch first lawe nature lawe men law nature instruction la natu conscience certaine direction placed god self mindes heart men teach haue doe eschue conscience verily consciec knowledge iudgement reason man whereby euery man selfe owne minde made priuie euery thing eyther hath committed committed doth eyther condemne else acquite self reason proceedeth god prompteth writeth iudgementes heart mindes men moreouer call nature proper disposition inclination nature euery thing disposition mankind flatly corrupted sinne blinde also pointes euill naughtie knoweth god worshippeth god neyther doth loue neighbour rather affected selfe loue towarde selfe seeketh still owne aduauntage whiche cause apostle sayde nature child wrath wherefore lawe nature called lawe nature bicause ye nature disposition selfe reason light exhorting best thing holy working bycause god hath imprinted ingrauen myndes knowledge certaine generall principle religion iustice goodnesse bycause grafted v borne together v therefore seeme naturally v let v heare apostle paule beareth witnesse saith gentile whiche haue lawe nature thing conteined law hauing law law vnto themselues shew workes lawe written heart conscience bearing witnesse thought accusing one another excusing day lorde shall iudge secret iesus christ according gospel two argument doth ye apostle euidently proue gentile sinner first least peraduenture might make excuse say haue law sheweth haue law bicause transgresse law become sinner although written law moses yet notwithstanding nature thing coteined law office law disclose wil god teache thee thou haste leaue vndone haue thei nature know lawe nature whiche followeth maketh plaine haue law selues law haue selues written law sort haue selues againe e manifest followeth shew worke lawe written heart writeth heart god alone searcher hart pray writeth lawe nature forsooth lawe saye selfe commaunding good forbidding euill without written lawe instruction nature knowledge imprinted god nature may vnderstand good euill desired shunned wordes apostle doe vnderstande lawe nature set written law god therefore called lawe nature bycause seemeth placed grafted nature vnderstande lawe nature written lawe grafted man hath office written lawe hath meane direct men teach also discerne betwixte good euill able iudge sinne vnderstande beginning lawe corrupt disposition mankinde god selfe finger writeth hart fasteneth nature planteth v rule knowe iustice equitie goodnesse also apostle maketh seconde argument wherby proueth gentile guiltie sinne argument fetcheth witnesse bearing conscience conscience instructed lawe nature doth accuse condemne euill committed bycause conscience onely alone steede thousande witness againe excuseth absolueth acquiteth nothing committed contrarie lawe although present life doe set light iudgement conscience yet verily may despise lightly passe ouer conscience accusation lorde shall come iustice equitie iudge world followeth nation sinner whome vnlesse sonne god common onely sauiour deliuerer worlde doe cleanse offence nation must needes perish sinnes nowe come againe two especial point law nature lawe nature whiche two pointes especially put mynde firste acknowledge god worship seconde keepe mainteine societie friendship among touching first haue wordes christ apostle whatsoeuer may knowne god manifest among wit among gentile god hath shewed inuisible thinges vnderstoode workes throughe creation worlde seene eternall power godhead without excuse bicause great large booke nature thinges seene god whiche sorte euerlasting eternitie vertue power maiestie goodnesse godhead woulde haue esteemed according visible thing thinges whiche hath created god eternall godheade knowne man creation continuall mouing heauen perpetuall course riuers muste needes moste mightie whiche susteineth thinges whiche moueth strengtheneth keepeth thinges decay becke straunge sense sayde straunge fyre carried labernacle wit fyre god comaunded kindle prouerbes called straunge woman whose companie lorde hath allowed thee vse therefore straunge god whome haue made selues hang seeke ayde god notwithstanding hath appointed haue charge ouer v wherefore saintes selues triumphant nowe heauen christ king shall reputed straunge god saintes selues say respect selues v pain ye citizen constantinople sayth moreouer bycause besides vnspeakable lustes men lash cursings othes god thereby prouoking anger therfore exhort abstaine cursings othes haire head wordes like vnto reproches done vnto men left vnreuenged muche worthy punished stirreth god anger villanie offence doe many dearthes erthquakes plague come vnto therefore admonish abstaine crime soeuer admonition oures shal found faultie therin shal first shewe selues vnworthy beloued men suffer punishment lawe shall appoint haue giue charge right honourable lieftenant royall citie apprehend guiltie punish extremely leaste peraduenture length sinner contempt haynous offence citie also whole common weale iustly destroyed god iust vengeance thus much writeth may gather least part calamity dayes doe happen vnto v bycause detestable cursings horrible blasphemy verie fewe magistrate none almost al go redresse punishe doe name liuing god blasphemed passing deepe horrible othes sort kindes age thinke verily beginning world ther neuer suche blasphemous people cursed age oures therefore vexed vnspeakable endlesse calamity god true lye sayth shall scape fcotfree take name vaine time take vain doe malice also blasphemously defile woulde god magistrate would sincerely set forth worship god among people else may obteined handes yet leaste woulde worse godlesse caiphas heard thought blasphemie againste name god rent cloathes crie blasphemer worthy dye surely vnlesse christian magistrate doe become sharpe seuere blaspheming villaines doe see must needes great deale worse wicked knaue caiphas vndoubtedly lord true euery one must seuerally thinke within selues verily punish men defiling name much malicious blaspheming matter place doe nowe require also speake oath somewhat taking othe swearing whiche done calling taking witnesse god name nowe handling matter many thing thought considered first al see yt doubt whether lawfull take othe bycause whether lawfull sweare matthew lord hath said ye haue heard sayd old thou shalt forsweare thee selfe shalt perfourme thine othes vnto lord say vnto sweare c lord minde matthewe take cleane away true auncient law interprete bring saunder sense bycause corrupted marred diuers forged counterfaite gloses pharises people taught euermore eye keep mouthes periurie touching superfluous vnprofitable needlesse othes care thinking amisse sweare heauen earth wherefore lorde expounding father lawe sayth othes generally forbidden wit wherein name lorde taken vaine whereby sweare neede meane neyther condemned yet tooke cleane away solemne lawfull othe great difference betwixt solemne oth daily othes nothing el deepe swearing needelesse also hurtfull solemne oth profitable needfull lawe god wordes christ forbid thing profitable needfull therfore condemne solemne lawfull othe yea lawe permitted solemne othe forbiode alone vnprofitable vsing lordes name christ lord came break lawe fulfill lawe therefore saint matthewe condemne othe vnlesse man shoulde goe proue sonne taught doctrine cleane contrarie doctrine heauenly father blasphemie father sonne suffered moreouer god selfe also sweareth vndoutedly would othe coulde taken without sinne long exposition lawe saith ye holy holy ye perfect euen heauenly father perfect reade also holiest men testamentes calling taking witnesse name god matter weight sweare sware without sinne othe therfore lawe christ forbidden lawfull christian man exact also take othe rather verily see howe man worthy called christian lawfully required sweare wil seeme refuse haue fully disputed another place ye anabaptistes secondarily haue co sider cause ought swere many comon weal cause ought sweare vsual receiued custome take othe vpon euery light occasion cause see othe lightly set little esteemed take name god vaine let magistrate therfore learne knowe othe ought required earnest affaire standeth glory god safetie neighbour publique weale must marke therefore people god haue sworne scripture abraham sware made yt league confederacie abimelech people god doth often sweare vnder king making couenant god ye keeping true religion olde time cleare themselues heinous suspicion taking othe exodus reade man shall giue neighbour beast kepe shall dye stoalne awaye man seeing shal othe lorde goe betwixt twaine hath layd hand neighbor thing owner thing shal take shall restore paule hebrues sayth men verily sweare greater othe confirmation end strife end therefore let magistrate apply vse othe let haue especiall regard giuing othe reuerently let peeres people keepe inuiolably sweare let take heed rashly require othe light headed fellowes let compare thing thinke thing equall othe let reuerently last haue recourse vtmost remedie finde truth therewithall let vse sharpe punishment periured person woe people prince wicked negligece othe esteemed without doubt punishe sharply sayth cause suffer goe vnpunished taketh lordes name vaine thirdly tell othe swears othe calling taking witnesse god name confirme truth say difference betwixt othe deepe kynde swearing whereby god blasphemed torne peeces difference betwirt othe bitter speaches vse curse ban circ stance ceremony swear swearing auncesters olde wont lift hande vp vnto heauen sweare name lord lord god dwelleth heauen therfore manifestly declare iudges eye lifte hand heauen euen mindes ascend bycause child god know mynde doe let v beseech heauenly father illuminate myndes may faithfully deede worship lord god praised world without end amen fift precept second table order fifte tenne commaundements touching honour due parent p fifte sermon nowe followeth second table god lawe good helpe god holy spirite declare briefly vnto haue already gone first first conteined loue god doth second teach v charitie due neighbour instructing men owe euerie one neighbor howe may world liue honestly ciuily quiet peace among selues good god woulde haue v liue well quietly knowe liue well yet obey good commaundements doe sinnes iniquity neuer cease heap vpon pate infinite multitude miserable calamity table conteineth sire comaundemets first whereof honour thy father fifth ecept thy mother thy dayes may long lande lord thy god shall giue thee well rightly doth lorde beginne second table honoring parent dutie god next reuerende loue owe parentes whome next god haue life infancie brought vp incredible care exceeding great labour order nature doth require excellent dearest thing alwayes haue firste chiefest place commaundement may easily vnderstood mean diuide treatise therof three part first whereof declare degree kindes men comprehended vnder name parent secondarily search kinde honour howe farre extendeth lorde commaundeth giue parent lastly touche promise made godly child therevpon coniecture gather punishment appointed vngodly disobedient ofspring none ignoraunt hat name parent knoweth parent lord god hath giuen v v take beginning life might nourish bring v vp rude almost brutish thing might make v e men greater good turnes parent child greater cost labour bestowe greater care grief trouble take tha man eloquent soeuer able expresse name father also name mother expresse word set downe law least peraduenture seeme contemptible wtout offence god bycause weaknes fraile sexe godly vertuous mother doe feele abide pain grief bearing bringing vp nourishing child father smal cause therfore haue name ye mother precisely expressed co maundemet also comprehend herein grandfather grandmother ye great grandsire great granddame like natiue countrie second place vnto thy child shalt talke thou art home thine house thou walkest way thou liest downe thou risest vp thou shalte bind signe vpon thy hand shall frontlet betwene thine eye againe thy sonne asketh thee prouerbe worthy remebred v time euerie lande mainteyneth arte setence meant learning science surest preparation euery iourney cannot taken away theeues whether soeuer thou goest beare thee company burthen thee beare therefore mishappe doe spoyle thy child wealth thou leauest thou hast taught occupation enough liue king depriued princelike dignitie put besyde exceeding rich meruayle though life doth wholy take fro mind man immoderate affection anger enuie two pestilent euils reignes among men concerning anger meane present speake ouer busily eue also haue determined briefe touching enuie anger many men anger haue vttered many profitable sentence yet holy kind anger scripture disalloweth vnlesse man angrie sort shal neuer good godly man good man hath zeale god godly zeale angrie iniquitie naughtinesse mankind whereof many example seene scripture anger doth stomache sinn comitted rather person doth commit sinne ye good seruaunt god hateth nothing wicked ma person sinne wicked ceasse sin wil leaue hate angrie therwithal longer anger vtterly codemned whe springeth euil corrupt affection iust cause giue offended doth anger either fulfil affection else hurt determine hurt angrie great euil fruit sowen doth yeld bring forth one mischiefe vppon others necke therefore doth ye apostle christ cou sel al men giue place anger happen enter mindes stick yet wee suffer catch fast hold take deepe roote therin angrie saith sinne let sonne set vpon anger giue place diuel apostle meaning happen ye angrie yet sinne yt yet bridle anger neither doth apostle bid v angrie willeth v let anger continue long breake ye working iniurie nonlatin alphabet word paul vseth signifieth anger deede yet rightly stirring prouoking anger thereby wee haue vnderstand yt iniurie prouoked anger although hee somewhat greeued touched quicke griefe ought short continuance neither must case suffer aduersary diuell fasten foote heart doth anger little litle creepe mindes cotinuall wrath doth worke enuie doth captiuate peruert whole man sens word workes enuie anger growen custome long continuaunce doth part vexe burne enuie partie enuied although enuious doth neuer ceasse deuise mischiefe office magistrate many haue ye magistrate two sort wit either good badde good good magistrate badde magistrate hee lawfully ordeyned doth lawfully execute office duetie euill magistrate whe hath euil meanes got authoritie doth tourne dispose hee himselfe lusteth herevpon question wont demaunded whether euill tyrannicall magistrate god wheth aunsweare yt god author good euill god nature good purpose good directed health preseruation destruction v men therefore good healthfull ordeyning magistrate without al doubt god himselfe author goodnesse heere requisite wee make difference betwixt office good ordinaunce god euill person doth rightly execute good ffice therfore magistrate euill founde ye good ordeyned commeth cause fault thereof men person neglecte god corrupt ordinaunce god god ordinaunce either euill prince seduced diuell corrupteth wayes god owne fault naughtinesse transgresseth god ordinaunce farre yt hee doth worthily deserue name diuelish power diuine authoritie wee haue example hereof ye magistrate ierusalem although able referre beginning power degree vnto moses vnto god himselfe ordeyne yet hee taketh sauiour gardeyne byndeth seruaunts sayd ye come theefe sword staues whe daylie temple ye stretched forth hand mee euen houre power darcknesse loe heere calleth ordinarie magistrate power diuell hee abus th power could euidently spoken ye must marke king hee god diuell whereas honge vp beheaded apostle christ mouing bloudie persecution church sprang elsewhere diuel father murder verily wee ought time defend tyrannicall power say god tyrannie diuine diuellish kind gouernment tyrauntes themselues properly seruauntes diuell god else otherwise people deserue wicked deedes haue king tyraunt people sinne cause euil magistrate found common weales meane king lord sometime hee make hypocrite reigne wherefore euill magistrate god euen also sedition warres plague hayle frost misery mankind come lord punishment sinne wickednesse lord hath appointed executed hee himselfe sayth giue child bee king infant shall rule togue hart hath bene lord likewyse lord stirred vp cruell kinges assyria babylon citie owne peculiar people whose liuing agreeable profession sort subiects ought affected toward opp essed must behaue themselues vnder tyrannical prince hard cruel tyrannical prince wee learne partly example dauid partly doctrine ieremie supposing euerie one ought rather left owne wil discretion apostle dede say lawe giuen iust vniust cause whie lawe giuen iust hee iust iust worketh iustice doth owne accord thing ye lawe exacteth euerie mortall man wherefore lawe troublesome iuste man agreeable mind thought vpright liuers doe imbrace heart vniust desireth nothing liue hee iusteth hee conformable point lawe therefore must hee lawe kept vnder brideled marring himselfe hurting since good men lawes troublesome burden acceptable pleasure also necessarie vniuste ordeined brideling lawlesse vnrulie people followeth consequently good profitable men bee reiected man may bee said moreouer god himselfe foresee disposition v men wee would bee hath still fauoured true libertie hee desired alwayes haue preserued amonge people one euer meant good neuer ordeine thing tourne hinderaunce discommoditie god himselfe say lawegiuer hath suffered age time liue people without lawe yea common weales haue beene happie alwayes haue admitted lawes submitted themselues gouerned lawes contrarilie kingdomes haue beene miserable torne peeces ciuil dissentions forreigne enimies hauing banished vpright lawes striue mainteine owne kind freedome vncomptrolled dealing licentious libertie beastly luste vnciuil rudenesse good lawes therefore health preseruation people necessarie peace safegard common weales kingdomes wherefore wonder see follie ome christian since verie heathen haue giuen honest report lawes lawegiuers tooke lawegiuers god confessing therby good lawes ye gift god gift god cannot superfluous vnprofitable plutarch called lawes life city demosthenes expressely confesse lawes giftes god cicero named lawes bondes citie without lawes loosed dispersed foundation libertie wellspring iustice perfect honestie lawes vndoubtedly strongest sinewes co mon weale life magistrate neither magistrate without lawes conueniently liue rule weale publique lawes without magistrate shew forth strength liuely force magistrate therefore liuing magistrate lawe dued wit life lawe lawe dumbe magistrate executing applying lawe lawe made liue speake prince consider wont say wir sind da racht wee right wee lawe suppose yt pleasure may comaund liste men must take lawe kind ruling without al doubt extreme tyrannie saying poet verie well knowen representeth verie word tyraunt say shalbe lust shalbe lawe prince deede liuing lawe mind obey written lawes square lawe nature power authoritie therefore subiecte vnto lawes vnlesse prince heart agree law brest doe write ye law woords deedes expresse law worthie called good much lesse prince againe good prince magistrate hath power ouer lawe maister lawes may tourne put vndoe make vnmake liste pleasure hee may put practise among ye people applie necessitie state attemper interpretation ye meaning maker therefore deceyued farre heauen wide thinck put take awe priuileges emperours kinges graunted magistrate adde diminish chaunge point lawe therefore may vtterly abolish good lawes liue lawe seemelinesse emperours kinges permitted graunt priuileges contrarie iustice goodnesse honestie graunt privilege ought receiued taken good subiects good tourn benefite counted rather deede vtter destruction cleane ouerthrowe among men time age meaning substaunce ye lawes touching honestie iustice publique peace kept vnuiolable chauge made circumstance law interpreted case requireth according iustice good end law sayth let man kill let killeth killed law remayneth euer vnchaungeable neither lawfull man time put wipe away yet rigour law may diminished law selfe fauourablie interpreted example man kill one hee loueth entirely well kill chaunce set purpose pretended malice hee hath done hee soarie verie hart would possible buye life soeuer hee hath giue case killer ought killed therin magistrate may dispence rigour lawe beareth deadly continuall grudge one hee killeth goeth colour matter vnder pretence happe misfortune hee sought occasion hee might haue shew chauncemedley case magistrate cannot chaung iote law must needes kil meaning law commaundeth kill could alledge example like vnto care purpose somuch may bee tedious vnto long discourse haue spoken apparauntly euident lawes good broken farre forth doe admit prince nonlatin alphabet prince moderation interpretation limitation dispensation least peradueture old accustomed prouerbe bee rightly applied vnto lawe extremitie extreme iniurie hetherto haue declared lawes good profitable necessarie wh mann lawes mag ought vse bee broken remaineth tell kind lawes magistrate ought chieflie vse ordering mainteyning honestie iustice publique peace according office whose opinion magistrate ought vse written lawes hee rather giue sentence hee thought best according naturall equitie circumstance written wes eedfull place time person case doe seeme require indeuour thrust kingdomes common weales iudiciall lawes moses hauing reiected lawe moses wil haue iudgement giuen law deriued lawes heathen prince since haue preeminence magistrate autoritie men either good bad since euen best men courtousnes anger hatred fauour griefe feare affectios rife found pray haue committed common weale reiecting written statuts certein lawes would haue euerie man magistrate giue iudgment hee thinketh best haue committed common weale rule beast shal say euill men authoritie since best men thnges amisse good kingdome subiecte fury hel bound iudgments naughtie men wee say haue giue iudgement according equitie nature lawe luste corrupt affection mine aunswere giue iudgement affection leadeth without controllment say iudged naturall equitie cannot wil say iudge otherwise otherwise vnderstand pith matter thincke beste haue determined nothing done contrarie conscience thou thy labour shalt called coram nobis daring find fault sentence iudgment shal iust man perish barbarous affection shall haue vpper hand naughtie men rule roste yea admitte wee graunt men good called magistrate yet diuersitie opinion rise giuing iudgement stirre vp among endlesse braules continuall trouble thinges therefore well considered best way great deale put written lawes vre let v learne example eternall wise excellent mightie god gaue iewes peculiar people lawes comaundement set downe writing magistrate hath otherwise busines enough iudge applie conferre cause lawes see farre wherein agree disagree iudge hath offended law haue transgressed lawe marked moses iudiciall lawe many thing proper peculiar iewish nation ordeyned according state place time person wee goe thrust applie nation seeme shew selues halfe madde end wee bring lawe moses forced vpon kingdom country backe set vppe againe among people god ofscouringes heathen cast great agoe aposiles lord iesus christ binde burden faith charitie iustice temperaunce knew whose heartes vertues settled either easilie make good lawes themselues picke choose beste men make maketh mattter whether magistrate pick moses iewish lawes alloweable lawes heathen sufficient lawes countriemen else doe keepe still old accustomed lawes haue beene vsed countrie hee haue eye cutte wicked vniust lawelesse lawes found thrust among ye better sort suppose vpright magistrats ought take curiositie prouerb vsed one make blinde disanull wise men haue allowed new inuented nouelties seeldom saith prouerbe crowes eye pickte without troublesome stirres curious men new lawes ye part worse old broken vtterlie abolished furthermore al lawes giuen ordering religion outward worship god else ye outward conuersation life ciuil behauiour touching difference erre stubbornely doe indeuour drawe keepe men errours blasphemer troubler subuerters church maye lawe bee put death followeth therevppon euery one erreth must therefore suffer losse life thing threates faultfinding may bee remedied amended must punished sharper correction meane euerie thing alwayes best penaltie paiment money prison shut vppe corrupted poison false doctrine lacke beliefe least peraduenture infecte others contagious disease also meanes punish bodie whereby keepe vnder erre trueth keepe marring sounde preserue selues perish vtterlie repentaunce may fall amendment feare god iustice iudges wisedom shal circumstaunces make perceiue hee ought punish naughtie doctrine stubborne rebellion malicious seducer howe beare foolishe lighte beliefe sillie seduced men grounded vppon simplicitie enuenomed rancour earnest diligent admonition giuen late fault allreadie admonition punishm committed detestable ought streight waye plagued sword let magistrate therefore alwayes haue eye admonish time warned take hede fault earnest admonition earnestlie commended men authoritie vse subiects begin worke broile moreouer godly wise magistrate haue many time pardoned vnwitting offender saw readie repent vppon geuing warning lord gospel biddeth v admonish sinner hee repent pardon fault hee reiect faire warning giuen punish much sharper iosue made open warre proclaymed vppon child ruben first embassage commaunde digge downe altar seemed haue made cotrarie law lord emperour iustinian also grauted pardon repented turned sounder opinion constitut moreouer iosias vtterly kill al wrapped errour idolatrie especiallie incurable would recante magistrate therfore must wiselie moderate matter verie circumspecte punishinge offender cannot heere wincke ylie obiections answe ed passe ouer obiections men make hetherto haue said touching punishment witte apostle paule hath commaunded kill punishe heretique first second admonition auoyd againe faith gift god cannot giuen ingraffed man rigour sword also man compelled hee constreineth may make hypocrite deuoute ealous man hee cannot make lastly apostle required ayd king either mainteine set religion christe else punishe blasphemous railers enimies god word aunswere thus paule hee writte epistle titus write apostle epistle therefore hee instructeth apostle behaue himselfe according duetie towarde heretique paste recouerie written sergius paulus liefetenaunt hee would vndoubtedly haue taught office paule standing sergius paulus prince cyprus deed declare vnto duetie magistrate first hee onely sharpelie rebuke false prophet elymas forsake companie eschue shunne apostle iohn cerinthus strake also bodilie blindnes graunt confesse faith faith gift god god gifte hearte manne god alone doth search knowe men iudged woordes deedes admitte therefore erronious opinion minde may bee punished yet notwithstanding wicked infectiue profession doctrine must wise bee suffered verilie man doth world punishe prophane wicked thoughtes minde thoughtes breake foorth blasphemous woords blaspheming tongue bee punished good prince yet saye godlynesse lyeth magistrate giue bestow iustice verie gifte god none god doth giue men whoe foolish gather thereuppon vniuste men robber murderer witch bee punished magistrate punishment cannot bestowe righteousnesse vppon vnrighteous people wee must therefore make difference betwixte faith gifte god heart man outwarde profession vttered declared face men false faith doth lurke lye hidde within heart infecteth none vnbeleeuer longe vnbeleeuing infidel cannot bee punished false forged faith laye hidde doe breake foorth blasphemie open tearing god infecting neighbour must blasphemer seducer bee pluckt vnder kept creeping annoyaunce suppresse fellowe put sword madde man hand kill vnwise weakelie men faith gift god bestoweth faith hee vseth meanes giue meanes hee wil haue v neglecte householder knoweth faith gift god yet notwithstanding hee instructeth child word truth hee chargeth goe church pray faith learne preacher mouth good father would thinke much yea would thinke well sonne say father pray teach mee sende mee much church beate mee faith gift god whipping cannot bring mee man quietlie abide heare faith gift god therefore man ought faith corruption faith open blasphemie suffer punishment yet petilian chapiter augustine booke contra petiliani whether lawful compel one faith literas crieth saith god forbid farre bee conscience compel man religion shall wee therefore goe speake woords heretiques say lord god scripture hath planted hypocrisie threates punishment hee hath driuen men goodnesse dauid saith good lord thou hast chastised mee ieremie saith thou hast chastised mee lord chastised like vntamed heffar man ought bee compelled goodnesse intent doth salomon ye wisest al men many time commaunde chastise child hee spareth rodde hateth child saith hee thou deede doest strike rodde thou deliuerest soule death dailie experience disposition men doe plainly teach men vehement affection vnlesse bee remedied brideled betimes destroy bee men yt first might easilie light punishment haue beene preserued men madnesse despise compulsion chastising punishment come themselues againe see great euills deliuered copelled reioyce health chastised praise compulsion despised let v heare augustine doth thinke teach hereof whose experience matter verie much epist ad vincentium contra donatistas de vi coercendis haereticis hee writeth thus opinion sometime man ought force compelled vnitie christ ought deale word fight disputation ouercome reason least peraduenture wee haue counterfaite themselues bee catholiques wee knew bee open heretiques opinion mine confuted word gainsayers example shewed contrarie first mine owne citie hippone obiected mee whe sometime held wholie donatus feare imperiall lawes conuerted catholique vnitie day see greatly detest naughtinesse ticall stomach thought verilie heresie neuer within many place name reckoned vppe vnto mee effect thing selfe might confesse case may rightly vnderstoode written giue wise man occasion wilbe wiser againe euerie one spareth friend euerie one striketh enimie better stripe friend voluntarie kiss enimie better loue seueritie deceiue lenitie hee byndeth phrensie man waketh sick lethargie doth trouble yet hee loueth loue v god himselfe doth yet teacheth v mildely hee ceaseth terrifie v health thinckest thou man ought bee compelled righteousnesse thou readest goodma house said seruauntes whomsoeuer yee finde compell come thou readest hee first called saul afterward paule constrayned violent force christe compelled know keepe fast trueth gospell augustine againe epist ad bonifacium comitem saith wont crie say euerie one free choice belieue belieue christ constreine hee compell loe haue apostle paul example let confesse christ first compelled taught first struck afterward comforted wonderfull punishment bodie compelled gospel consider time like thinges done due time season emperour time belieue christe serue making lawes defece religion vngodlines whe yet prophecie fulfilling whie heathen rage people imagine vain thing kinges earth stoode vppe ruler toke counsell god christ yet begunne followeth psalme said vnderstand ye kinges ye learned ye iudge earth serue feare reioyce trembling doe kinges serue god feare forbidding punishing deuout seueritie thinges done god commaundements hee man hee serueth one way king serueth way hee man hee serueth liuing faithfullie hee kinge hee serueth establishing conuenient lawes co maund iust forbid contrarie ezechias serued destroying groaues temple idol highe place erected lord commaundement iosias serued like king niniuie serued compelling whoale citie please appease anger lord darius serued geuinge idole daniells power bee broken peeces casting enimies amonge lyon nabuch odonosor serued terrible proclamation forbadde men within dominion blaspheme true verie god forbid vngodlines counsell rather taken put vngodlines practise course time turne iewes kil preacher christe thinckinge thereby god good seruice gentile also freat rage christian make martyr kingdom let trouble marke honest dishonest within dominion since god hath giuen man free whie adulterie bee punished sacrilege left vntouched lighter matter soule breake promise god woman man forbecause thinges committed contempte ignoraunce religion bee mildely punished therefore vtterly neglected better doubteth men bee brought worshipping god teaching rather compelled feare griefe punishmente better therefore bee neglected hath profited many men wee see experience first haue beene compelled feare griefe afterwarde might either bee taughte followe deede learned woordes hetherto haue rehearsed ye word augustine aunswere obiections opinion lawe disobedient rebells seduced people deceiuers ought punished case religion see hope doth faile mee wherin thought could haue beene able sermon haue made ende say touchinge magistrate perceiue heere must staye vnlesse shoulde goe deerely beloued bee tedious vnto meane morrowe therefore adde rest yet behinde make ye humble prayer vnto lord vppon knee depart peace p warre whether lawfull magistrate make warre scripture teacheth touching warre whether christian man may beare office magistrate duetie subiectes p ninth sermon right swoord god hath giuen magistrate doth warre belong last sermon taught vse sword magistrate hand two fold two sortes either hee punisheth offender else repelleth enimie spoyleth would spoile people cutteth ye rebellious purpose owne seditious citizen many make doubt whether hether law l magistrat make lawful magistrate make warre meruaile see blinde bitells matter selfe plaine may bee magistrate doth god lawe punish offender theeues harmefull person maketh matter whether many number declared yesterdayes sermon euen law may hee persecute repell kill rebellious people seditious citizen barbarous souldiers vnder pretence warre attempt openly theeues robber wont doe priuilie prophete confesse amonge thinges prophecie v christian say shall turne swordes spade iauelyns sythes christian haue peace men altogether absteine armour euerie one doth would wish haue done himselfe forbecause minded many vnrulie person wicked theeues oppressours poore liue dwel among honest good meaning men wilde beastes amonge harmelesse creature therefore god heanen hath giuen sword ye magistrate hande bee defence harmelesse people vnrulie cut throates wee reade place wee forbidden suppresse kill wolues wilde boares beares beastes annoy pray vppon men cattell lett bee whie wee lawfull warre begunne good quarell repell vniuste iniurie violent robber since theeues robber barbarous souldiers seditious citizen doe differ little nothing wilde beastes scripture verilie doth vouchsafe cal name name beastes hereunto co senteth common fense nature herewithall agreeth doctrine faith religion possible saith apostle much lyeth liue quietly men reueging selues see much lyeth saith ee possible otherwise hee addeth immediatelie magistrate beareth sword vaine hee meaneth trouble thinges annoy men doe desire liue peace confirmed example holie excellente men haue beene world haue taken warre hand defence countrie harmelesse countriemen haue alreadie declared paules epistle hebrues exposition fift precept shewed honour euerie man doth owe countrie adde reason augustine vttered contra faustum manichaeum lib cap neither let saith hee meruaile astonied warres made moses euen hee followed god peace finde faulte rather cowardly touch part religious christian desire hurt crueltie reuenging vnappeased stomach brutenesse rebelling greedines rule whatsoeuer else like thinges warre worthie blamed right lawe sharpely punished violence iniurious enimies commaundement either god himselfe lawfull power euen good men wont take warre hand since state world politique order doth iustlie binde magistrate case commaunde subiectes obey otherwise iohn souldiers came bee baptized saying shall wee doe would haue aunsweared said caste armour forsake souldiours life strike wounde kill bodie knew souldiers warre manquellers minister lawe reuengers owne iniuries defender common weale hee said vnto strike man doe man iniurie content wage maniches haue vse blasphemed spoken iohn let heare lord iesus christe himselfe commaunding giue caesar stipend iohn say souldier content withall giue saith hee caesar caesar god thinges doe belong god ende tribute paide souldier warre may haue pay hand paine verie well therefore centurion said man set vnder power hauing souldiers vnder mee say one goe hee goeth come hee commeth seruaunt doe doth lord commend faith comaund forsake souldiershippe hetherto also apperteyneth yt followeth chapiter next purpose willinglie beare somewhat meaning ouerlong rehearsing many sentence bee tedious vnto thus hetherto haue shewed lawful magistrate make warre way also wee gather subiectes doe lawfullie without offence god take armour batteile take hand magistrate bidding magistrate purpose bee kill guiltlesse declared former sermos people ought obey wicked commaundements let magistrate therefore haue eye himselfe hee abuse lawfull authoritie although magistrate bee licensed make warre iuste necessarie cause yet notwithstanding warre thing full perill draweth warre thing full pe il daunger selfe endlesse troupe mischiefous euills warre iust iudgement god doth plague men fatherly warning could neuer moue amonge many time guiltlesse feele whip warre part souldiers misuse themselues thereby incurre god heauie displeasure euil world warre vpholdeth warre scarcitie euerie thinge dearth doe arise highe wayes stopped corne vppon grounde troden downe marrde whoale village burnte prouision goeth wracke handicraft vnoccupied merchandice doe ceasse doe perish rich poore valiaunt stronge men flame batteile cowardly sorte runne away lyues hide head reseruinge themselues tormeted exquisite terrible kindes cruell punishmentes wicked knaues promoted dignitie beare sway abuse mankinde like sauage beastes hand wrouge euery side widowes child crie lament wealth hath beene carefullie gathered helpe want come spoyled stolne away city raced virgin vnmariageable maydes shamefully deflowred honestie vtterlie violated old men handled vnreueretly lawes exercised religion learning nothing set godlesse knaues cut threat haue dominion therefore scripture warre scourg god warre called scourge god warre plagueth incurable idolatrers stubbornely quarel made warre beniamites purposing reuenge detestable crime wicked knaues horriblie committed wherein whoale tribe bare oute vphelde beinge parteners thereby heynous offence twice israelite put woorse wicked beniamites vpper hand battaile time heli israelite minded driue tyrannous rule idolatrous philistine countrie slaine arcke god taken caried city idolatrous enimies likewise excellente
