esteemed victorie ouerthrowe people religion bee true right whose fauourers haue vpper hand againe false vntrue whose professours mainteyners put worse wee must distinguish betwixt religion men personnes keepe religion cause suffer lord visitation admonisheth v magistrate hath neede great feare god eye making repelling warres leaste hee goeth aboute auoyde smoulthering coasepitte hee happ fall scalding lyme kill least hee supposeth ease shoulder one euill hee doth way whereby hee soughte ease heape vppe either farre greater euills prince therefore must precisely looke throughly examine ye cause warres beginne take hand cause many many sortes chiefe followe either magistrate compelled sende ayde rayse siege enimie doth enuironne garrison hee hath appointed defence city offence parte parricide forsake giue ouer oathe honestie city garrison extremitie else magistrate duetie compelled make warre vppon men incurable verie iudgemente lord condemneth biddeth kill without pittie mercie warres moses madianites iosue amalechites sorte warres wherein men oppressed inuincible malice perish themselues drawe destruction well themselues also reiecting iustice equitie doe stubbornly go blindnes addeth reason hee stroak blinde fetcheth fro keeping religion saith ceassest thou peruert right wayes lord c act paul againe lye waite supposinge hee made away good parte preachinge gospell would come ende thereby iewishe religion notwithstading vtterly false haue beene set vp mainteyned truth paul negliget remedie case neither turned hee ye cheeke haue stricken since asked heathen woulde great deal soner haue hand c ri ian gistrates f earnestlie humblie requireth deliuerie defence hee requested christian magistrate yet none romane centurion neither hee gainsay hee sawe hee make warre vppon put often much trouble busynes thus saith hee lawful therefore magistrate defend people su iect inst idola ra cause magistrate may take warre hand either barbarous enimie inuadeth ye people comitted thy charge tearing spoyling cruellie like wolfe flocke sheepe notwithstading thou diddest first prouoake thereunto iniurie also causelesse beginning thou hast offered equal condition peace made case magistrate comaunded stand forth like lyon defende subiectes open wronge mercilesse utthroates moses hee fought arad sehon og kinges amorites iosaphat hee foughte ammonite make vppon owne fellowes innocente person people hope amendmente warres also vniust begunne lawfull meanes matter weighte thinges must first assayed com tryed batteile men territory must bee desired libertie people thine owne subiectes must repressed thou must followe affection may withdrawe seduce thy minde sort desire rule couetousnesse greedinesse giftes enuie affection like vnto warre common weales remedie deede perillous daungerous euen launcinge cuttinge er hand poysoned arme danger enuenomed whereby whoale man perhapps may cast awaye yet thou cuttest thy hande vntill thou hast tried medicine thou doest plainly perceiue mean remedie soare cutting alone likewise al helpes faile last let warre beeginne yet neuerthelesse prince doe remember beeginne warre helpe hope recouerie vtterly paste word god farre finding fault warre begun word god hath made lawes war e vppon iust quarell doth make lawes warre sheweth number exaples vpright warrs wise worthie warriours lawes warre recited chapiter deuteronomie profitable necessarie withalso euident neede word mine expound moreouer euerie place scripture lawes warre still bidden bee kept first al chiefe vppermost place must giuen religion euerie campe garrison lord himselfe hath appointed priestes minister true religion attend serue warres secondarilie let vprighte lawes bee force campes abroade wel city hoame let souldiers liue honestly instly rightly order discipline wonte require citie home sayinge commeth god diuell commonly spred abroade let lawes warre bee huisht still thirdly let chosen guide general ye warre scapula setteth downe thus marcus aurelius also warres germanes prayer christian souldiers made vnto god obteyned shower raine great drought time haue drought beene turned awaye oure prayer fastinges la ine copie ath et solus ten hiche inke hee ant mperour people cry ioy god god emperour himselfe vnder name iupiter confessed wonderful working god thus much tertullian eusebius ecclesiasticall historie hath largelie fullie set downe historie saith history report marcus aurelius brother antoninus caesar making warre vppon germanes sarmatians armie daunger loste drought wittes ende knew way armie daunger christian made supplication presently queched enimies hoouered haue bene destruction stricken scattered thunder fyre lightening heauen deede reported heathen historiographer obtained chaunged emperour called legion thunder tertullian addeth letter marcus emperour yet wherin full manifest trueth matter plainly declared hetherto eusebius wherby wee gather christian souldiers old onely giuen prayer iustice also holines lyuing knoweth iames apostle said earnest prayer righteous man auayleth much elia man vnder infirmity euen wee hee prayed prayer heauens gaue rayne earth brought forth fruite moste euidente therefore souldiers old verie godly religious men dure souldiers dayes farre religion yea enimies true religion doe steede victorie suffer ouerthrowes abroad losse destruction citties hoame worthilie doe common weales suffer plague trustinge somuch wicked souldiers trust one put confidence verie diuells souldiers doe parte exceede kinde filthines vncleannesse wicked men vnlawfullie vsurped amonge god people restoaring againe libertie religion prophete samuel numbred amog notable capitaynes god people ionathas saules sonne worthie capitaine singular example godlie man dauid none excellent worthie praised warre hee vaquished philistine idumits syrian good part easte beside warre hee reuenged iniuries warre hee mainteyned libertie kept god people number mischiefes yet notwithstanding warred thus said man according god heartes desire father lord iesus christ touching flesh humanitie dauids posteritie yu maiest finde manie excellent warriours valiaunt capitaynes abia asa iosaphat amasia ofia ezechias moe amonge iudas machabeus hath last leaste place fought verie stoutely lawe religion people god died last ye middest batteile defence religion countrie quarrell adde example consta tine gratian theodosius excellent feates warre writeth augustine ende fi booke de ciuitate dei orosius verie largelie booke historie vnto ende cap sufficient godly magistrate hetherto haue discoursed warre made magistrate vse sword magistrate hand touching gaue note way sermon wherein expounded fifte commaundement thus ended haue proue christia men may beare may office magistrate treatise meane therfore take hand madde headed anabaptistes builder deuised common weale gainsayinge hetherto haue alledged goe proue christian may beare office magistrate reason christian say may striue lawe kil man recouer warre thinges violently taken away reuenge iniurie done vnto although cause aunsweared euerie one fitte seuerall place yet briefely gather heere together substantiall argumentes politique christian man may vnderstand contrarie madnesse dreames anabaptistes hee bee called beare rule authoritie may dutie ought serue lord god taking vpon executing office magistrate whereas faine doctrine gospell doth vtterly cutte kinde defence whatsoeuer else belongeth defence christian men good body nothing deceiued farre heauen wide truth doth teach v cleane contrarie whatsoeuer thinges ordeined god meanes men safe gard good estate farre misbecoming vnsemely christian man hee vse applie himselfe vnto hee refuse neglect cannot rightly called true christian first greatest care euerie christia meanes may set forward mainteine yt health safegard sortes men magistrate ordeined man god health wealth mankinde expressely witnessed prophet apostle paule especially rom cannot therby perceiue christian may praiseworthilie execute magistrate office furthermore man denie knowe christian man faith wordes onely deedes also giue proofe iustice mercie meanes care publique peace tranquillitie doe iudgemente iustice defend fatherlesse widowes child deliuer poore oppressed people neither doth hee contemne flee reiect occasion place meanes hee may put good woorkes vre therfore christian refuseth place office magistrate magistrate office doe iudgement iustice prouide publique peace moreouer vndoubtedly true haue declared moses samuel iosue dauid excluded name christianitie since authoritie bare name magistrate let pray whie true christian man may beare yt office magistrate co mon weal may thought moreouer new testament certaine notable men well reported authoritie put beside office christian sound religion touchinge ioseph arimathea thus read luke behold man named ioseph counsellour marcke saith noble senatour honestus senator good man iust consented counsel deede arimathea citie iewes waited also kingdome god marke beseech notable testimonie man hath ioseph counsellour senatour yea yt noble senatour sate senate amonge iudg codemne sauiour christ hee consented deede iudgement acquited guiltlesse horrible murder said haue beene good man iuste number looke kingdome god number christ called christian yet neuerthelesse counsellour senatour citie ierusalem christian therfore may lawfullie beare office magistrate hereunto belonge example thiopia treasurer actes cornelius centurion act erastus chamberleine corinth rom tim oure desire haue anabaptistes proue declare scripture obiecte saying men beinge conuerted yt faith streightway put roabes estate lay aside magistrats sword wee haue litle wordes augustine vpon iohn baptist answere also preach gospel alreadie proued souldiers baptised put beside office comaunded iohn giue ouer armour ceasse souldiers obiecte againe lord lord conueieth away whil people wold haue made king conueyed priuilie away people minded haue made king say would haue done example hee would commend humilitie christian people thereby commaunde suffer charge rule common weale laid neck adde moreouer sayinges lorde kingdome world againe king nation haue dominion ouer ye shal vnderstande cause whie lord conueyed selfe away fond purpose foolish people went making kinge doe wil god blinded affection seeke bring thinges passe ease fillinge belly much hee fedde miraculously little therefore thoughte would king purpose able giue subiectes meate without coste labour furthermore oure lord came reigne earth maner world yt iewes imagined pilate feared dreamt messias reigne salomon cause lord doth rightly say kingdome kingdome worlde world hee ascended heauen sitteth righthand father hauinge subdued kinges himselfe world beside wherein hee reigneth word spirite hee shall come iudge ende world although christe denieth kingdome world yet notwithstanding hee neuer denied kinges prince come oute world church serue lord therein men alone kinges men authoritie kinges cannot otherwise serue lord kinges thinges called kinges vnlesse christian made kinges continue office gouerne kingdom according rule lawes christe beseech christe called kinge kinges lord lord therefore hee said kinges nation haue dominion ouer shal ye bee hee spake apostle stroaue amonge themselues chiefe highest dignitie hee haue said prince haue dominion world doctrine displaced seates put beside throanes magistrate authoritie force still world church also kinge magistrate shall reigne shall yee yee shall reigne yee shall prince teacher world minister church thus briefely haue aunsweared anabaptistes obiections place also haue many time confuted somewhat largely heere haue saide thincke haue sufficiently proued christian man cannot onelie ought duetie also take vpon office magistrate lawfully offered vnto make end biects discourse place briefly adde duetie subiectes euerie man doth owe ordeyned matrimonie preseruatio mankinde end man lyfe might pleasaunt sweete thoroughly furnished ioyes sufficient al cause may reduced ye number three first god himselfe doth say good man alone let v make helpe therefore dwel yt first cause whie wedlecke instituted man commoditie thereby life man might bee pleasaunter comodious adam seemed liue halfe happilie sweetly enough vnlesse wife ioyne himselfe vnto wife scripture called impediment necessarie euill certaine poet beastly men hated woman haue foolishly iangled helpe arme man antipater heathen writer sermone de nuptiis doth wonderfullie agree saying scripture expresseth plainly kinde help manner arme wife husband whosoeuer saith hee hath triall wife child hee vtterly ignoraunt true mutuall goodwill loue wedlocke minde let neither luste ye bodie stranger conceiue hatred loathsomnes wedded spouse thy body thou art married thy body thy wiues also thy wiues body thy wiues thine thou stealest doest commit robberie thou take away another body good thou hast conueyed proper owner doest giue another let minde wedded mate vnspotted body vntouched euery one first commeth solemnise wedlocke holie ceremonie ordeyned none worlde holy effectuall loue greater ye loue christ toward church neither loue chaste church doth beare christe required therefore handes wedded mate mutually beare ardente holy loue one let vse common weale heere stand shew honour glorie god verie greatly augmented child onely begotten also brought vp feare god knowledge woord hierocles saith confesse marriage profitable especially bringeth child forth deede goodly fruite oure verie bloud doe wee health ayde v affayres olde age yeares come vppon v succour v well maye familiar companion ioy prosperitie aduersitie partner sorowing v heauie mishapps forth antipater also saith man indued ciuil disposition mainteyne societie must augmente countrie common wealth increase child city could haue bene preserued meanes vnlesse head men euerie citie sonnes noble gentleman seing auncetours wither fal away like goodly leaues faire tree married time couenient left behind child woorthie plantes succeede countrie thereby make flourish euer doinge beste farre coulde keepe assaultes conquestes enimies straungers therefore shooting nothing defend assist countrie life time dead thincke necessarie especially conuenient marrie married desiring thereby doe thinges nature requireth also touche health increase countrie worship god c since therefore lawefull matrimonie marriage must egonne ith religion great effect auayleable liue well happilie faithfull doe withoute cause beginne marriage religion religious rite lord verilie presently beginning blesse first marriage oure parentes adam eue himselfe couple wedlock whervppon church god hath receyued custome ioyne marriage dwell together doe come temple lord prayer made middest congregation ioyned together blessed minister god name god himselfe wherefore wedlocke first chiefest thinges bee required earneste continuall prayer married folkes god wil vouchsafe make husbandes wyse relligious modest gentle honeste painefull sufferer louers wiues please make wiues obedient meeke chaste faithful louers theyr husband child housewiues fruitefull one man able declare euills come euen one corrupte naughtie marriage whoale house wonderfullie disquieted wealth honestie vtterlie decaye child bastard god offended prouoaked anger endlesse mischiefe brought whoale comon weale god therefore must bee earnestly beseeched blesse married people glorie holy name common weales prosperitie may thereby dailie increase come speake adulterie sinne whereby adulterie husband goeth woman wyfe tourneth side man make common vse body owne body nowe mate wedlocke flatter themselues opinion culpable adulterie haue companie vnbetrouthed mayden one vnmarried woman play harlotte vnwedded man haue god name fornication adulterie scripture teacheth contrary thou goest woman thou arte adulterer thou breakeste thy faith thou art forsworne thy bodie thine thy wiues therefore thou bestowest bodie thou committest adulterie thou wedded doest lye married wife thou doubleste sinne thine adulterie offece plagued sharpe punishmente euen beginninge almost soone ye world created pharao kinge aegypt commaunded sara abraham wife taken away carried palace hee mighte vse wyfe thinckinge verily shee bene abraham sister scripture sayth lord gene vexed pharao house great plague sara abraham wife loe yt king aegypt punished greeuous plague adulterie yet knew sara abraham wyfe great plague therefore prepared men wittingly willingly without shame commit adulterie abimelech king philiftines lord doth saye loe thou shalt die woman gene thou hast taken away hir husband yet king also taken away sara knowing shee abraham wife ioseph gene prouoked adulterie maisters wife doth simplie saye doe great wickednesse sinne god euery word doth beare weight adulterie heynous sinne wherevpon booke iob find woords iob himselfe mine heart iob haue bene deceiued woman haue layde waite neighbour doore let wife bee man harlot let men haue doe wickednesse sinne worthie bee iudged death yea fire vtterlie consume roote oute mine increase iob sayth hee hath onely committed adulterie hee hath much time giuen attempt defile man wife hee confesseth adulterie sinne greeuous offence yt doth deserue haue adulterer wife defiled adulterie addeth adulterie fire vtterly consumeth deuoureth thinges lastly yt sinne bee iudged punished death moreouer solomon wisest men saith may man take fire bosome prou cloathes brent one go vppon hoat coales feete brent euen goeth neighbour wife toucheth hir cannot vnguiltie men doe vtterly despise theefe stealeth satisfie soule hee hungrie may gotten hee restoreth againe seuen time much else maketh recompence substaunce house whoso committeth adulterie woman hee lacketh vnderstanding hee doth destroyeth owne soule getteth himselfe plague dishonour reproch shall neuer bee put iealosie wrath man intreated neither accepteth person mediatour receiueth giftes howe great soeuer bee word solomon many thinges bee noted first cannot otherwyse bee fire must burne garment wherein carried man comit adulterie without damage daunger punishmente secondarilie comparison made betwirte theefe adulterer theft thereby defended theeues although infamous doe seeme yet sinne greate deale lesse adulterer doe theefe may make satisfaction restoring worth thing hee stoale whole hee stoale away adulterie amendes bee made hee would rather wish haue theeues ransacke chest take away substaunce haue wife dearling defiled adulterie moreouer solomon calleth adulterer madde without vnderstanding adulterie iudged sinne worthie death endlesse infamie lord lawe doth say onely thou shalt commit adulterie place also goeth addeth comitteth adulterie man wife eue hee comitteth adulterie neighbour wife let adulterer adultresse bee slaine leuit punishment adulterie death abrogated chaunged gentile romane lawe called lex iulia well knowne commaunded adulterer bee put death lawe force time hierome wee may gather historie hee wrate adultresse chopping whose head seuen stroakes giue neither meruaile vndoubtedly adulterie amonge olde yet day according lawes punished death vppon one many sinnes deped first al adulterer periured man hee hath broaken violated faith gaue openly god face congregation calling witnesse holie reuerend trinitie minister christe solemnise marriage couple wife geuing hand hand secondarily adulterer hath committed thefte robberie whe adultresse doth make body common man doth shee set sale defile marre owne husbandes body thirdly bastardes borne adulterie doe often time enioy equall parte inheritaunce yt right begotte child cannot without great wrong done lawfull heyres legitimate ofspring al right robbed due inheritance wher equall portion giuen lawe parcel due lastly beside innumerable mischiefes doe spring adulterie since therefore serpente many heades lawes god men rightly punish adulterer losse life iollie fellowes forsooth adulterie make dauids adulterie sport persuaded dauids adulterie doeth make side place scripture wee read lord fauourable ye adultresse taken euen deede whie doe merrie conceipted men cosider seuerely lord punish dauid offece bloudie house dauid immediately defiled filthie inceste amnon doth perforce defloure sister thamar streightway vppon necke yt againe house defamed cruell parricide absalom banquet murdered brother amnon verie absalom also dauids sonne defileth deflowreth father wyues openly laying al feare god shame aside hee driueth father kingdome hasteneth shorten dayes al calamity dauid confesseth hee doth worthily susteine adulterie murther committed lastly many thousand people slaine batteile dauid hardly much adoe restoared kingdome afterward restored hee repented sinne dayes life nowe meruaile adulterer consideringe punishment goe yet alledge example dauid defence naughtinesse sauiour come world iudge sauiour neither lord solueth ulterie place vsurpe take right sword therfore make meruayle see adultresse condemned stoned death yet hee said hath man condemned thee minded haue resisted ye lawe iudgement passed vpon hee came patrone adulterer breake lawe fulfill like adulterer well adultresse condemned lord let also like sentence wherwith historie ended lord saith go thy wayes sinne let therfore leaue defile destroy themselues filthie adulterie lord lawe hath expresly thing forbid en vnder title adulterie named adulterie alone therewithall hee doth inclusiuely vnderstand kindes luste luxurie al thinges else egge forward stirre vp fire men wa tonnesse hee forbiddeth seuerely adulterie selfe lord gospell doth onely forbidde outward worke adulterie affection also waton lust hart minde ye haue heard sayth hee said old thou shalt commit adulterie say vnto whosoeuer loketh woman luste hath committed adulterie alreadie heart place hee teacheth v plucke oure eye cut oure hand extinguishe vncleane affection rise oure mindes yet bee younge beginne bud least peraduenture breake oute thoughtes deedes precepte euery vncleane thoughte ribaulde talke filthines bodilie deedes vtterlye forbidden precepte forbidden fornication kinde whoorehunting said medlinge single man vnmarried woman kinde whoredome thought many either verie small offence none kinde men doth diuell harten bewitch ill thoughtes driue commit sinne doctrine euangelists apostle doth teach v contrary actes apostle synodal epistle sent hierusalem al nation doe expressely name p co forbid fornication peter reckoneth fornication amonge filthie sinnes hee would haue christian cleare paul saith flee fornication againe let v defiled fornication committed fornication fell one day three twentie thousand fornication doth directlie fighte couenaunte god whereby hee ioyned v wee whooredome also spoyleth god glorie doth filthilie pollute temple lord let v heare apostle co paule saith touchinge matter knowe yee body member christe shall therfore take member christ make member harlotte god forbidde know ye hee coupled harlotte one bodie two saith hee shalbe one flesh hee coupled lord one spirite flee fornication euerie sinne man doth without bodie hee committeth fornication sinneth owne body know ye body teple holie ghost ye haue god ye owne ye bought price therefore fornication shutteth fornicatours kingdome ephe god apostle saith neither whoremonger adulterer shal inherite kingdome god therefore place hee suffereth fornication bee much named amonge christian farre hee admitting stewes brothel house amonge god people moreouer whooredome doeth fill whoale bodie sondrie disease depriueth whoorehaunters good substaunce bringeth pouertie extreeme miserie driueth laste vtter desperation ouerthroweth fame good name shame ignominie viewe wherof liuely expressed holy scripture example sampson strongest man amonge israelite solomon therefore wise doth verie fitly time place conueniente admonish men flee enticinge baites flattering allurementes whoorish strompets ende deadly poyson throw man downe headlonge bottomlesse pitte endlesse misery lawe also kinde whoredome prohibited consisteth dden defloratio virgin violent rape child perforce defiled carried parent difference betwixt rape perforce deflowring mayde done without violence sichem defiled dina daughter iacob althoughe hee desired haue defloured mayde wife chaunge religion yet notwithstanding hee himselfe slaine leui simeon bretherne dina citie raced filled bloude murdered men whose good ransackte layd open spoile historie extant genesis rape roderychus kinge gothes spaine committed vppon daughter one iulianus liefetenaunt spaine manner mingled fire bloud volaterranus second booke geographie saith roderychus reigned three yeares whose filthie lust brought end aswell name quiet kingdome gothes spaine meanes saracenes inuaded land fell oute hee defloured daughter one iulianus lieftenaunte part mauritania called tingitana priuate griefe pricke father seeke reuengement whereto hee vsed commoditie place wherefore iulianus doth priuilie cal saracenes oute aphrica whoe yeare grace vnder conduicte capitaine muzta sente mirmomelinus king time entring streightes marrocko two yeares space subdue al spaine almost asturia countrie spaine betwixt galacia portugall except asturia space time reported seuen hundred thousand men side destroyed warre wherin also king defloured virgine nobilitie vtterlie slaine israel yt leuits concubine citizen gibea tribe beniamin violently rauished beniamites slaine beside perished fro among eleuen tribe whose number amounted men neither vnknowen anye king expelled citie rome troy wearied tenne yeares warre troubled ye east west laste vtterly sacked cleane ouerthrowe tarquinius perforce rauished lucrecia alexander paris stolne oute greece menelaus helena man wyfe euerie age almost doth minister innumerable sorte like example ye iust god hath alwayes euidente example declared greatly hee offended deflowrers virgines rauishers woman cause lawes sharpe punishment ordeyned appointed lasciuious knaues rape villanies committed perforce lawes punish losse life doth defloure maide violently yt lord doth say marrie endowe lawes appoint penalty touchinge spoken ciuil lawe moreouer incest especially prohibited ncest call incest vnlawful medling man woman honour bloud affinitie cestus signifieth marriage girdle bride weare shewe marriage iuste lawful wee germanes call sinne ye name blout schand wherby wee signifie sinne committed corrupting defiling bloud kinred leuiticus degree bloud wee forbidden marrie lord doth presently adde ye defiled thinges nation defiled caste hereby land defiled haue visited iniquitie thereof vppon land hath spewed inhabitaunts thereof yee shall therefore keepe statute mine ordinaunces shall doe abhominations whosoeuer shall doe hee shall cutte amonge people chapiter leuiticus hee hath appointed death punishment incest changed ciuil lawes imperiall constitution abhominable sinne sodomie medling beastes also sodom plainly forbidden wee haue euident expresse lawes set downe chapter leuiticus wee haue also verie senere yet iust punishmente layde god himselfe vppon pate detestable sodomite fire stincking brimstone sent downe fro heauen hee consumed filthie men duste ash ash hee washed away waues dead sea hee would haue much ye verie cynders remaine wicked men moreouer whole city fruitefull field burnte fire requisite one iote substaunce wicked men remaine vndestroyed place city sometime situated daye ouerflowen water called dead sea whereby consequetly gather iust god wil spare gentile entangled verie sinne althoughe time hee wincke dissemble fire shall destroy themselues shall euer burne hell nothing shal remaine reprochfull memorie reuelation oure lord iesus christ apostle iohn read fire came downe god heauen deuoured diuell deceiued caste lake fire brimstone beast false prophete shalbe tormented day night euer apoc furthermore thinges else dden hidden doe incite allure v vnlawfull lustes baites ouer nice pranckinge decking body euill wanton companie gluttonie surfetting dronkennesse ezechiel amonge rest prophecy saith iniquitie sodom pride glutonie aboundaunce thinges idlenesse men prouoaked luste eyther hearing reading dishonest ditty bawdie ballad looking beholding wanton dau ce vnseemely sightes ribauld talke filthie example therefore lawe reproued wincke chearish bawdes bringers together adulterous person vnto wicked lord psalmes doth say whie sal doest thou take couenaunt thy mouth whereas thou hatest refourmed doest cast word behind thee thou sawest theefe thou consentedst vnto hast bin partaker adulterer c iust lord therefore doeth punish offence wicked men euery one according greatnesse ye sinne sinnes farre heynous hee adulterer minde doeth lust man wife hee sinneth greeuously hee indeuoure finishe deede wicked thought hee offendeth yet deepelie hee deede sinneth hee fall vnto againe likewise ye adulterer sinneth doth bawde also vpholdeth adulterie whooremonger sinneth deepely hee defileth himselfe incest sinneth greeuously hee heynously al medling beastes committeth filthie sodomie precept charge giuen maintenaunce shamefastnesse modestie sobri tie temperancie chastitie publique honestie true holinesse soule bodie next mee say somewhat touching continencie abstinence refraine men good take fro man continencie thing haue temperancie extend farther continencie wil make one part treatise doe simplie make contiuencie contrary intemperancie incontinencie continencie vertue power minde receiued spirit god suppresseth affection doth wise permit vnlawful pleasure conuersant doth shew selfe common vsual talke men pleasure allowed apparell building dweling house meate drinke thing also present wil onely examine point continencie already rehearsed continencie b deling tounge first required v keepe oure tongue let loose randon blaspheming god glory hurt neighbour let talke christian man bee honeste profitable seasoned salte let vnacquainted scoffinge lightnesse lyinge ribauldrie filthinesse iames third chapiter epistle hath spoken sufficiently tongue property first chapiter also hee sayth let euery manne bee swifte heare sloaw speake sloaw anger paule saith let filthie communication proceede oute mouth good edifie withall oft neede may minister grace vnto hearer greeue holie spirite god yee sealed vnto daye redemption againe let fornication vncleannesse couetousnesse bee named amonge becommeth sainctes neither filthines foolishe talkinge nether iesting seemelie rather giuinge thanckes let man deceiue vaine word thinges commeth wrath god vppon child disobedience another place citeth sentence oute ander saith ill woordes corrupt good maners moreouer man minde bewrayed talke harte aboundance mouth doth speake therefore thing tongue especially behoueth christian sober continent lord confesse hath graunted man vse certeine pleasure graunted pleasure may lawfully without offence god cloath body garmets thereby keepe limmes cold god hath doth allowe embracing man wyfe holy wedlocke graunteth choice dwelling place coueniently situated vntemperatenesse ayre biddeth v wander like beastes cattell throughe field desolate wood hath necessitie pleasaunte feeding allowed v vse meate drinke graunteth v quietnesse ease sleepe doth wonderfully refresh strength decayde tyred paine therefore often godly man doth enioy doth vse delighted honest pleasure let giue thanks god vse moderately feare lord hee sinneth lord abuse thinges vnthanckfulnes immoderate vsing hee doth offende god maker allowed permitted married folkes haue already declared sermon neede againe repeate vn solomon saith glad wife thy youth let beloued hinde pleasaunt roe let loue alwayes refresh thee bee thou still delighted therein c meane time let euery one refrain abuse intemperancie necessitie time require let man wife lye sonder paule doth counsell else let giue eare prophete ioel saith proclaime holy fast gather people together let bride grome come forth chamber bride cloaset garmentes must bee cleanly honest according oure countrie facion couer become v vnlesse countrie facion farre order must bee hypocriticall sluttishnes beeyonde sea gawdes newfangled toyes vnseemely sightes chiefe apostle christe peter paul peter timo titus ashamed theyr epistle write somewhat largely touching manner ordering woman apparel kinde people doe bende foolishe brauerie let euerie faithful body thinke seemely weare much degree dignitie condition rich religion excesse euery thing discommended christian end doe wee iagge gashe garmentes sowed together couer oure body thereby wee may fonde ridiculous anatomie open laye foorth eye menne kinde people wee oure inward heart iagged god wotte ragged vaine lighte nothing sounde linnen wollen garmente doth well couer become bodye damask veluetts coste whereof doeth ouerlade thy purse expense buye misshape thee like ill fauoured picture thou wearest vppon thee buildinges god forbiddeth continentie buil inge cleanlynesse necessary coste sumptuous expense gorgeous excesse ouer braue building seeldome time finished withoute extorting wronge ouer great iniurie done poore ieremie bringeth lord speaking king iuda saying woe buildeth house vnrighteousnesse parloure good wrongfully gotten neuer recompenseth neigh bours laboure payeth hyre saith himselfe builde mee wyde house gorgeous parloures causeth windowes hewen therein seelinges ioystes maketh hee cedar painteth sinoper thinckest thou reigne nowe thou haste incloased thee selfe cedar thy father eate drincke prosper well longe hee executed iustice equitie let none v therefore build sumptuous house robbinge poore hyre labour let euery one dwell house agreeable profession degree condition hierome condemneth sumptuous coste euen church temple neither see gorgeous buildinges bringe manne mischiefe miserie lord vnwillingly doe wee die departe goodly dwelings whereby double feare death terrour sicknesse patriarch verily dwell tentes whereby witnessed pilgrimes sought another countrie heauenly hierusalem continencie meate drincke loathinge wyne victualls continecy meate drinke moderate vsinge supplie oure necessitie cloye v gluttonie god scripture doeth condemne gluttonie surfettinges riottous afterbanquettes dronkennesse hee forbiddeth moste dronkennesse doe springe endelesse misery innumerable mischiefes greeuous disease pouertie pinchinge beggarie solomon saith hath woe hath sorrowe hath strife hath brawling hath woundes withoute cause hath redde eye euen follow wyne seeke excesse thereof looke thou vppon wyne redde colour giueth glasse goeth downe sweetely last byteth like serpent poysoneth like adder rehearse could alledge oute heathen writer surfetting dronkennesse solomon alone one sentence conteyneth great christe dru nnesse deale matter moreouer hee heareth christ likely hee wil giue eare vnto world christ gospel parable riche glutton doth meruaylous euidently set forth wofull end insatiable paunch gospell also hee taketh occasion touch ye surfettings dronkennesse age meane age immediately ye iudgment day hee saith happened dayes noe lot eate drincke euen vntill day noe entred arck lot departed amonge sodomits incontinently deluge came fire brimstome powred downe heauen destroyed al againe addeth take heede selues least time heart ouercome surfetting dronkennesse care life day come vpon vnawares snare shall come vpon dwel vppon face whoale earth watch ye therefore time praying ye may escape al thing stand sonne man would god yt al men would write golden heauenly diuine admonition sauiour hall dineing parlour onely seuerall heartes also since dronkennesse hath dayes good intertainment degree estate kindes age wee daily feele wofull misery god doth threaten dronkards cap esaies prophecie feared greatly day lord shal sodeinly light vppon innumerable sorte dronkardes endlesse paine vtter destruction let heare therefore hath eares heare neither heere refraine needes must recite vnto dearely beloued martine bishop tour fraunce dumia germanie flourished yt dayes iustinia emperour write miro kinge gallicia touching ye ordering leading co tinent life saith thou dost loue continencie cut superfluitie keepe vnder thine appetite consider thee selfe much nature requireth much lust desireth bridle thy cocupiscence cast alluring baytes serue draw hidden pleasure eate without vndigested surfetting drinke without dronkennesse neither glut thee selfe presente delicates long deintrells hard come bye let thy diet bee cates good cheape sit pleasure meate let hunger sauce prouoake thee eate pay little pastime delighte thee thy care leaue pleasure thereby thou facioning thy self example god mayste much thou canst make hast reduce thee selfe body spirite thou louest continencie choose pleasaunt whoalsome dwelling place make lord knowne gorgeous house house honest landlord boast thee selfe thou hast thou hast neither couet seeme thou art rather take hede thy pouertie vn clenly thy niggishnes filthie thy simplicitie cotemptible thy lenitie feareful though thy estate poore yet let extreeme miserie neither loue thine owne degree wish estate man life thou louest continencie auoyde dishonest thing happen feare man aboue thine owne coscience thinke al thinges tollerable dishonestie excepted absteine filthie talke libertie whereof doth nourish vnshamefastnes loue rather profitable comunication merrie conceites pleasaunt talke set blunt spoken trueth tha fayre soothing speech thou mayste sometime mingle mirth matter weighte must bee done moderately without hurte detriment thine estate grauitie laughter blameworthie bee immoderately vsed childishly squeaked taken vp fittes woman wont esteeme saucie scoffing ciuil mirth curteous humanitie let thy conceites mirth without biting thy sportes without profite thy laughter without vnseemely writhing thy mouth visage thy voyce without hriking thy pace going without hastie shuffling let thy rest bee idlenesse play take thou holy honest thing hand thou art continent take heede flatterie let greeue thee much bee praised naughtie men thou werte praised thine owne naughtie deedes gladder thou displeasest euil men impute euill opinion naughtie men haue thee best praise giue thee hardest woorke continencie put away soothinge curtesies dissembling flatterer whose fawning woordes vndoe minde pleasaunt sensualitie presume much vpon thy selfe neither thou arrogant submit thee selfe farre thou mayste keepe thy grauitie yet make thee selfe footestoole cousshen euery leane told thy faultes willingly suffer thee selfe gladly reprehe ded man cause angrie chide thee acknowledge thy faulte let chiding profite thee chide thee without cause thinke therby would haue profited thee feare sharpe sugred word thou thee selfe eschew sortes vice ouerbusie searcher men faultes thou sharpe fault finder admonisher without vpbrayding still thy warning maye beare shew chearefull mirth condiscend easily pardon errour neither praise dispraise man ouermuch still giue eare speake bee readie instructe doe hearken asketh giue readie aunsweare despiseth thee giue place easily fal chiding cursing thou art continent haue eye motion thy body minde vnseemely set light bodie seeth maketh matter body see thou thee selfe spie perceiue bee moueabl light constant stubborne bee liberall men fawninge man familiar fewe vpright euery one beleeue lightly euerie rumour accusation conceyued suspicion despise vaine glorie bee sharpe exactor good thou hast vse fewe wordes thee selfe suffer speake bee graue roughe contemning merrie nature bee desirous appliable bee taughte wisedome imparte thou knowest demaundeth without arrogancie desire learne thinges thou knowest without hiding thine ignoraunce wise manne chaunge common countrie facion make people gaze newe found deuises thus much haue hetherto recited touchinge continencie writinges blessed bishoppe martine dumia wee oure partes must praye lord hee vouchsa e bestowe v holy spirite force continencie thinges may take roote oure heartes bringing foorth fruite deed agreeable prescript rule commaunded continencie vnlesse holie ghoste doe quicken inspire v wee doe vaine giue eare many good commaundementes vnlesse wee liue lead temperate sober life wee vtterly vnwoorthie beare name christian place also doth treatise fastinge belonge meane fasting handle fewe woords conueniently bee christian fasting discipline ordering chastening body presente necessitie wee beginne keepe oure owne accord without compulsion wherewith wee humble selues sight god drawing body matter setteth flesh fire therby make obey spirite longe wee mortal men doe liue body flesh doth stil resist spirite rebelleth delicates pamper body wherefore fasting doth drawe body euery euil stirreth vp strengtheneth good commaundements god holy spirite necessitie wee keepe fastinge two sortes publique priuate wee faste publique common necessitie calamitie doeth either oppresse else hange ouer head church manner fasting wee see example cap ioel ionas prophecie order fasting vsed time lord apostle euidently extant actes apostle kinde fastinge doth seeme haue differed verie little amonge old generall mourninge yea seemeth altogether haue beene nothinge else kind lamenting scripture euery booke full example teach instructe v holy saincts humble themselues sight god true repentauce sinnes offence priuate necessitie euery particular man doth fast hee feeleth himselfe vexed bodily concupiscence thereby hee may take flesh flame fewell least body last fired burned lord gospel saide child bridechamber fast whe bridegrome taken hard dau gerous time marriage doth signifie bond wherby knit christe faith holy ghoste yet notwithstanding godly man doth still reioyce hee doth geuing thanckes temperancie eate drinke much sufficiente delighted also externall giftes god hee feeleth bridegrome readie departe hee alreadie almost departed oute heart hee feeleth spirite extinguished fleashes wantonnesse faith doth beginne bee cold doth hee settle himselfe prayer doth appointe solemne fastinge thereby eyther keepe bridegrome still else pull backe ready departe neither publique priuate qualitie kinde fastinges must bee fasting abide inforced compelled desire proceede free cheerefull voluntarie minde vnwillinge men doe nothinge well god requireth chearefull giuer moreouer let fastinges moderated according qualitie place person perills temptation continuall yet let often till time wee deliuered ridde vtterly let without superstitio fayned hypocrisie lord sixte matthewes gospell hath taught v herewithall doe word hierome agree wel hee wrote nepolianus touching fasting followeth prescribe thee selfe longe time faste thine abilitie suffer thee beare let thy fastinges pure vncorrupte simple moderated superstitious auayleth eate oyle seeke seldome sond cates harde bee come figges pepper nuttes date pure flowre ouerfine breade honie garden digging nouelties tourned ouer ouer wee eate common cribble breade oure deintie mouthes seeke delicates oure soules pulled kingdome heauen heare moreouer menne contrarie nature refuse drinke water feede vppon bread sucke vppe swallowe verie costlie suppinges deintie hearbe brothes iuyce beetes cup shell shame blush wee fond toyes wee ashamed superstition thus much saith hierome euidente euen day vice ospecially receiued amonge oure wealthie relligious menne end christian fastinges end fasting church sinner submitt humble themselues lord flesh bee obedient subiect spirit fleshe hinder sinner woorke righteousnesse intent minde prayeth bee earnestly bente towarde god fastinge number woorkes themselues absolute perfecte haue meaningefor ordeyned ende purpose therefore fasting certaine help prayer vertues godly men wherevppon prophetes wee finde fastinges iewes displeased lord naught else fast alone certaine appointed time abstein vsuall maner eating restrayned themselues sinne wickednesse let flesh haue bridle deede haue ceassed haue pampered thereby weaker spirite might bee stronger doe fulfill sorte good woorkes therefore saith lord haue chosen manner fasting rest foloweth chapiter esaie chapiter zacharies prophecie apostle paul verily doth expressely say meate commendeth v god neither wee eate trueast haue wee thing neither wee eate haue thing lesse hee therfore doth fast truly doth absteine onely certaine appointed time certaine manner meates hee doth therfore refraine pleasure flesh therby hee may make subiect spirite ye work faith charitie acceptable sight lord therfore thou doest desire faste true fast eate drincke sleepe take heede thy body waxe insolent faste al sinne eate meate malice tast iuncates luste pleasure set fire wyne wantonnesse faste euil deedes absteine euill woords refraine thee selfe naughtie thoughtes basile also faith true fasting consisteth freenesse vice continencie tongue suppressing anger cutting cocupiscence backbiting lying periurie c euen good woorkes themselues done faith doe merite kingdome heauen glorie due merite christe alone euen fastinge ayde helpe good woorkes doth meritoriouslye deserue kingdome god see doubtfull disputation arise amonge diuines choice oure age touching time maner fasting also ye choice meates affirme vpholde fastes lent embring dayes fastes god hath appointed say thou hast fasted meanes thou tast flesh prescribe appointe certaine houres faste part see doctrine taught v yt scripture lord gospell kepte anye deuised fastes hee fasted fourtie dayes altogether absteine kindes meate euen moses helias also done wherefore hee deede giue v lawe faste moreouer lord gospell doeth euidently teach thing entreth mouth doth defile ye man issueth heart pure thinges pure paul saith know persuaded lord iesus christe nothing common selfe thincketh thing common comon againe let eateth despise eateth let eateth iudge eateth eateth lord hath taken moreouer place euident paul writeth fourth chapiter epistle timothie affirmeth forbidding meates doctrine diuels neither needeth manne tel v whit tacians encratites slaunder good creature god paul speaketh although doe vtterly condemne meate mariage doe yet notwithstanding forbid vse meate furthermore read difference fasting lawes ordeyned age followed disciple woorkes mercie doe consiste feedinge hungrie giuing drincke thirstie cloathing naked visiting prisoner sick harbouring stranger banished men hee therefore graunteth disciple proprietie possession peculiar goodes wherewith may frankly good vnto helpe needie man miserie proper owning seueral goodes taken away good deedes almes must necessitie bee vtterly lacking thinges common doest thou giue nothing thine thou spendest common richesse yet paule apostle epistle corinthian biddeth euery one lay vpp almes himselfe hee might receiue hee came vnto corinthe hee doth also commaund euerie one bestowe much finde hart willingly giue according quantitie euery one possesseth according possesseth yet bestowe whome giuen haue enoughe giue bee pinched penurie lacke thing necessarie apostle saith beseech brother studie bee quiet doe owne businesse worke owne hand comaunded may walk honestly without ye may haue lack nothing could epistle alledge many proofes sort enoughe declare sufficiently proprietie good testament permitted christian men actes apostle wee read among primatiue apo le age thinges ere common apostolicall church al thinges common followeth booke doth declare kinde communion luk saith none said anything possessed loe heere first christian possessed house groundes rich right proprietie yet possessed owne good good men common notwithstanding right proprietie stil remaine possessours owne hand time necessitie required sould land house helped neede lacked sould sould vndoubtedly owne good man doth sel man substance owne hee hath taken hand husband owne moreouer peter compounding controuersie saith ananias while yt land remayned thine owne sould thy power thou lyest holy ghoste keepest backe part price land makest notwithstanding though thou haddest brought whole price vnto v ananias power haue sold ye land sold haue kept whole summe monie yet deed hee haue beene excluded church faithfull free therefore time euen day also eyther sell sell landes possession bestowe commonly relieuing poore therefore place actes apostle doth take away right proprietie commaunde communion euery man goodes maddheaded anabaptistes goe ordeine forbeecause perceiue doe stiffely sticke letter vrge communion substaunce shal tedious recite vnto dearely beloued men iudgments touching point meane opinion conference scripture haue made matter plaine manifest whereas wee read second chapiter actes beleeued ioyned one must bee vnderstoode though like monk forsaking euery one proper house dwell together common one house immediately added continued daily temple one accord left euery man eate owne house prouide thing necessarilie required nature euery one sold house hee since afterwarde added breaking bread house house brake bread house house let anabaptistes aunsweare house christian hierusalem breake bread house vnbeleuers think nay therefore brake bread eate meat house faithfull howe therefore sell forsake lad house howe liue together like cloysterers whereas luke saith therefore many beleeued ioyned one vnderstoode often time assemble temple communicating good among christian nothing else sale welthier sorte made landes house end bestowing money thus much thus farre may saide ouer many wealthie men gospell reported haue beene worshipper god ioseph arimathea buried lord hee crucified said haue bene wealthie man disciple christ also woman welthie folowed lord galile ministred disciple good substance gelded treasorer queene candace welthie man tabitha ioppa peter raysed death life rich spent substance freely vppon poore needie people lydia seller purple wealthie innumerable godly faithful people wheras ye lord therefore say younge man thou wilt perfect goe sell thou hast giue poore thou shalt haue treasure heauen come folowe mee generall lawe simple doctrine belonging men demonstration onely shew yonge man spake yet perfectly fulfilled lawe thought verily n hee thought hee done nothing wanting younge man sett good hee god voyce god commaundement departed sadly lord bidden thereby declared hee yet fulfilled lawe moreouer wee may place gather lord ca e downe disciple miserie beggarie neither paul apostle ashamed make lawes riche men prescribe order howe ought behaue themselues riche sayth world giue charge bee highe minded trust vncertaine rich lyuing god giueth v abundantly al thinges enioy good bee riche good woorkes ready giue glad distribute laying vp stoare selues good foundation time come may lay hold vppon eternall life hereunto belong admonition sauiour sayth yee cannot serue god mammon againe rich thornes choake seede word god againe verilie say vnto riche man shal hardly enter kingdome heauen easier camel goe throughe eye needle rich enter kingdome god mindes wealthie men vtterly discouraged driuen desperation thoughe impossible saued admonished imminente perills least peraduenture sleepe securely ouer rich beeing seduced satan abuse wealthe deede ought rather vse rule apostle euen nowe particularly speake would bee labour tedious heare dearely beloued litle profitable therefore wee saye wee frame manner customes oure age wee vtter shall tend auaile principally thinges wee must close shutt vpp euill eye least wee bee carried away much concupiscence desire light body saith oure sauiour christe gospell eye therefore thine eye single thine whoale body shalbe lightened thine eye bee euill thy body shalbee darcke minde man beeing indued faith infected concupiscence naughtie lustes doth giue light thinges hee shall take hand goe doe mind bee corrupt vncleane shall deedes sauour also corruption vncleannesse wherfore faith vpright conscience must subdue beate downe muche concupiscence couetousnesse take originall roote distruste making vnholie vncleane al counsells man thoughtes woordes deedes wee may able force sufficiet captiuate bring subiection necessarie grace christe assiste v euery godly minded man woman doeth aske god godly faithfull prayer beehoofull wee alwayes set eye haue deepely grauen heartes doctrine sauiour christ touching instruction also holie apostle much may bee well borne away wee therefore rehearse vnto derely beloued three seuerall place two gospell third paule place perfect abridgment may haue comprised thinges soeuer bee required worship god trueth gospel according matthew thus saith lord sauiour hoord vp selues treasure earth rust moth doeth corrupt theeues breake steale lay vpp treasure heauen neither mothe rust doth corrupt theeues breake steale wher treasure wil harte also man serue two maisters eyther shall hate one loue else shall leane one despise yee cannot serue god mammon therefore saye vnto bee carefull life ye shall eate drink yet bodie ye shall put life woorth meate bodie worth rayment beholde fowles ayre sowe neyther doe reape carrie barnes yet heauenly father feedeth yee muche better whiche taking carefull thought adde one cubite stature care ye rayment consider lillie feelde howe growe labour neither doe spinne yet saye vnto euen solomon royaltie araide like one wherefore god cloath grasse fielde though stande day morrow cast fornace shall muche ye little faith therefore take thought saying shall wee eate shall wee drinke wherewith shall wee cloathed thinges gentile seeke heauenly father knoweth ye haue neede thinges seeke ye firste kingdome god thinges shall added vnto care morrowe morrowe shall care selfe sufficient vnto daye euill thereof saith lorde sixth matthewes gospell matt againe twelfth chapter sainct luke gospell saith take heede beware couetousnesse mannes life standeth aboundance thing possesseth life hath neede superfluitie man life hath neede enough put foorth similitude saying grounde certeine riche man brought foorth fruites plentifully hee thought within selfe saying shall doe haue roome bestowe fruites saide doe pull downe barnes buyld greater therein gather fruites goodes saye soule soule thou hast muche goodes layde vpp stoare many yeares take thine ease eate drinke merrie god saide vnto thou foole night doe require thy soule againe thee whose shall thinges bee thou hast prouided hee gathereth richesse selfe riche godwardes paule vessell election followinge thinges teacher maister cryeth sayth godlinesse greate lucre man bee content hee hathe wee brought nothing world certaine wee may carrie nought away hauing food rayment wee must therewith cetours leauing let cosider theselues meanes ye rich gotten nowe inheritaunce fallen lott perceiue heires vniust gotten good let liberall make amendes doubling euil possessing vniustly wickedly hath ordeyned diuers artes occupation labour yet neuerthelesse would haue al serue common weales commoditie nowe mee definitiuely pronounce al vse occupation godly man ought chiefly first choose put practise let euery man weigh selfe thing hetherto haue alledged let searche make triall selfe kinde life occupation minde willing whereunto selfe fitt profitable let also haue diligent regarde consider art simple agreeable nature occupation haue lest neede crafte deceipte lastly science least drawe v god iust dealing scande let euery man choose selfe whiche taketh bee best conuenyent moste whoalesome bothe soule also bodie cannot v manure ground neither heades apte take learning fewe among many gouerne common weale fitt handicraftes men euery one hath sundry disposition euery one inspired god euery one hath ayde counsell friendes welwillers euery one hath sundry occasion euery one hath rule god worde let content staye selfe vppon yet god comaundements may still haue preeminence laboureth taketh paine occupation rule admonition followe beware prodigalitie necessarie alreadie rehearsed first euery one must take heede prodigalitie ryot meate drinke apparaile nice pranking bodie gorgeous buyldings needlesse expences must alwayes spared lord euery man keepe lashe wealthe hath neede requireth lorde doth hate detest riott needelesse cost mainteine pride withall moreouer man prodigall owne parte desirous mennes good whence arise innumerable mischief theafts conspiracy downright deceipte shamelesse shiftes murder sedition secondarily let laboureth vocation prompt actiue let watchefull able abide labour must litherbacke vnapt slouthfull fellowe whatsoeuer doth let faith diligence slouth sluggishnesse displease god vtterly lorde mislikes yawning mouth folded armes signes sleepe commonly followe carelesse man doth neglect state condition house familie side scripture commendeth highly faithfull labourer good painefull people woorke let v heare beseech golden woordes solomon wisest among men blameth sluggardes saith go emmet thou sluggarde consider wayes learne wise hath guyde ouerseer ruler yet summer prouideth meate gathereth foode haruest howe long wilt thou sleepe thou sluggarde wilte thou arise thy sleepe yea sleepe still little slumber little folde thine handes together yet little take thine ease meane shall pouertie come vpon thee like traueyler necessitie like weaponed man againe dauid psalmes cryeth saying labour thine handes shalt thou eate well thee happie shalt thou may thought moreouer lorde god would haue adam liue ydlely paradise happie place state condition inioyned tending dressing goodly garden idle people therefore moste vnhappie mortall men slouthfull drousieheades nothing else vnprofitable lumpe vnoccupyed earth lastely let artificer haue regarde hurte man arte occupation let rule keepe eye vpon businesse affaire science whatso euer thou wouldest haue done thy self thou another soeuer thou wouldest haue done thy selfe thou another moreouer thou doest hurte another man two sundrye wayes keeping backe taking awaye example thou withholdest thou oweste thine owne thou takest awaye whiche another man doeth owe vnto thee hurt done withholding taking away present speake somewhat largely thereby ye may better vnderstande lordes commaundement thou shalt steale perfectly perceiue kindes
