shall ye haue lorde god brought lande aegypt deuteronomie read thou shalt haue thy bagge two maner weightes greate small neither shalt thou haue thy house diuers measure great small ende receiuing buying thou maist vse greater laying selling thou maist vse ye lesser thou shalt haue iust right weight iust right measure shalt thou haue thy dayes may prolonged vppon land lorde thy god giueth thee thinges vnrightly abhominable vnto lord thy god hereunto appertaineth sentence salomon prouerbes saith two manner weightes two maner measure abhominable vnto lord heard thought grieuous horrible man abhominable sight god sixth chapter micheas also lorde doth threaten diuers grieuous punishementes myndeth lay vppon neckes vse iustice weightes measure therefore rather flye wrong vnrighteousnesse choosing sooner happie vnhappie hearken vnto lorde saith good measure pressed downe shaken together running ouer shall giue bosome measure ye mete shall mete againe let v throughly persuaded therefore rich gotten crafte theaft neither florishe long yet health enioye againe men endammaged ye withholding possesse inheritance due vnto breake promise deceiue men contractes bargaines couenauntes make face though gaue thinge either chaunge reteine selues coloured shifte else giue selues haue marred vtterly destroyed one verily fraude guile flatt deceipt nowe waye marke manifest vsuall point god iust iudgement wrongfull possessours mennes heritage short lyued vnfortunatest men people touching wrongfull withholder salomon pronounceth shall finde gaine gaine vniustly gotten howe great soeuer deserueth rather called losse truely gaine precept thinges thinges found found belong thou denyest demaunder though thou either hast founde else dost challenge thine owne lawe hereunto appertaineth pledge pawne thou withholdest pledge pawnes man taketh iourney farre countrie hath put thee trust certeine siluer plate pound weight golde keepe returne hope thou wouldest keepe safely comminge backe demaundeth thou deniest thing dooing thou hast stollen cracked credite thy friende thee last thou hast doubled sinne poore man hath guaged thee pretious thing setteth much claimeth againe readie monye hande paye thee summe borrowed vppon thou denyest pledge thou quarellest vsest subtiltie defraude pawne dooing thou stealest moreouer lorde gaue people lawes ende effecte touching taking pledge guages deuteronomie hee saith man shall take neather vpper milstone pledge hath layde life pledge thee one saide thou shalt take thy neighbour hande steed pledge wherewith getteth liuing doeth mainteine familie thereby thou shouldest take life liuing immediately saith thou lendest thy brother thing thou shalt goe house fetche pledge thence thou shalt stande without borrowed thee may bring doores thee lord forbiddeth crueltie woulde haue riche men sharpe ransacking poore mennes house ouer curious takinge pledge poore mennes handes addeth afterwarde poore body thou shalt sleepe pledg deliuer pledge againe sunne goeth downe may sleepe owne rayment blesse thee shall imputed righteousnesse vnto thee lorde thy god lastly moste endammage neighboures withholding labourer hire withholde labourer wage labourer hyre withheld two sundrie wayes thou doest either neuer paye else thou payest grudging grunting thou doest delaye payment long otherwise diminishest parte hire marke nowe name hireling ample signification extended kindes artificer common sorte wealthie men haue caste nowe adayes vse helpe handicraftes men bidde keepe reckoning hire wage bookes accomptes meane though perceiue poore men lacke money yet paye much one penye yea require debt due take vp bitter woordes sende emptie away till selues disposed paye foolishe wicked wealthie men ceasse lash riot prodigallie thinges clearely owne withholde fro poore men let v heare therefore ye lawes iudgements lord god touching horrible abuse detestable fault deuteronomie reade thou shalt denie withholde wage hired seruaunt needie poore whether thy brother straungers thy lande within thy gate shalt giue hire daye let sunne go downe thereon hee needie hire holdeth life layeth hope life therein lookes line therby lest cry vnto lord turned vnto sinne thee lawe lorde wordes iames apostle moste fitly agree saith beholde hyre labourer whiche haue reaped downe fieldes whiche hire kepte backe fraud cryeth cryes haue reaped entred eares lorde sabboth terrible ye hearer eares labourer hire withheld doth crye cryeth euen vp heauen doth enter eares moste iust seuere mightie god nowe may defrauder looke godshand heauie punishment light vppon cursed heades tobie therefore moste rightly briefely concludeth matter giueth excellent counsell sortes people saying whosoeuer worketh thing thee giue hire immediatly let thy hired seruauntes wage remaine thee fearing god thou shalt haue thankes nowe followeth second member parte detriment whiche doth consist taking awaye damage taking away mannes goodes takinge awaye also sundrie sortes first place sortes attributed thefte selfe wee haue spoken somewhat thefte committed taking awaye monie onely ware also wrongfull dealing mennes groundes remouing landmarkes meere stone whatsoeuer translated denyed cleane taken awaye right malitiously conscience consent partie true owner delayed foaded till longer time ought nineteenth leuiticus ye lord setteth downe lawe saith ye shall steale ye shall lye man shall deale neighbour deceiptfully paule ephesian saith laying lye aside speake ye euery man trueth brother wee member one another let stole steale rather labour handes woorking thing good may giue hath neede may wee extende almoste office dueties men soeuer denyeth debte duetie whiche right oweth doth sinne commaundement example housholder denye duetie oweth familie againe familie consume housholders substaunce doe deceiue good man whose care bent mainteine charge sett vndoe prodigall spending money good filche priuilie againe lorde maister although poynte may well bee referred title dammage done withholding rough hyndes husbandman ploughfolks idely wast maisters substaunce slackly looke tillage businesse spende ryott wealth richesse seruaunt offendeth agaynst commaundement doeth seeke meanes may haue diligent care maysters affaire faithfully augment wealth possession like manner maydeseruauntes dueties whyche owe offende mystresses therefore paule hauing eye precept giueth titus charge saith exhorte seruauntes obedient vnto owne maisters please thinges aunswering againe picker shewing good faithfulnesse may adourne doctrine god sauiour thinges like vnto apostle repeateth sixth chapter ephesian colossian timothie sixth chapter commaundement doctrine dueties maisters seruauntes hath fitt place farre concerneth housholders rich soeuer else like vnto precept also robberie robberie deceipt deceipt fully belong whiche extende farre conteine manye kindes fraude infinite iniquitie men bottomlesse theire craftes diuerse manye sortes one man number robbery alwaies armed force weapon sometimes furnished sleight coloured wordes neither robber lurke lay waite wooddes wide open fieldes alone conuersant also ye thickest throng euery good citie thou takest away thy neighbour good vnder false title pretence lawe thou robbest saye thy suite thy gift fetch thou dost extort iudges corrupted sentence maintaine thy wrongfull claime whiche vnder title deede gift stick wrest whole heritage legitimate heires shiftes coosenings like vnto conteined partely vnder robbery partely vnder deceipt altogether flatly vnder plaine theeuerie although dice player giue dicing carding mutuall consent fall gaming yet eche one desire greedily set gett others money make blinde fortune meane dice cardes diuider goodes betwirt therefore dice cardes worthily condemned al good diuines iustinian emperour extant cod lib tit vltimo hauing regarde subiectes commoditie decreede lawfull man eyther publique priuate house play dice although dice playe hath bene vsed great antiquitie yet hath ended burst teares many hauing lost substance haue laste playe breake forth cursinge blaspheming god otherwise none ignorant knoweth well enough exercise witt bodie free poysoned desire filthie gayne whereon neither hurte neyghbour selfe doth depend lawful enough vsed christian vsurie thou grauntest another man vse thy goodes lande house money anye thing else whereof thou receiuest yerely commoditie thou hast manour farme landes medowes pasture vineyardes house monye thou dost let hire vnto another man vpon certeine couenant gaine returne thee vse thereof bargaine couenant selfe vnlawfull yet condemned holy scripture verie name vsurie vnhonest self abuse thereof hath made vnhonest without cause day detested men vsurie scripture condemned farre ioyned iniquitie destruction brother neighbour forbid let vse landes house monye hire thereby may receiue iust lawfull commoditie buying setting hyre like contract lawfully allowed v parte giueth good duetie taketh vse good turne without maner recompence hurte hinderance giueth bestowing meere benefites another consideration wherof read luke ye lende whome ye hope receiue againe c lawyer discusse matter thus vsurie debtour giueth pension yerely fee recompence money hath borowed sauing principall summe hath borowed whole couenant made selling backe againe thing doth cease lent graunted another man vse vnlesse debitour creditour cannot claime thing long debitour payeth pension assured payment whereof hath put selfe bond crediting flatt contract buying saye therefore vsurie committed lending alone ought without hire contractes bargaines let therefore deale kinde trade haue alwayes eye rule ledd whatsoeuer thou wouldest haue done thy selfe thou whatsoeuer thou wouldst haue done thy selfe thou another let thinke wordes apostle let man beguyle brother bargaining knowe verie wel touching money wont alledge endureth landes vineyard consumed made lesse vse tossing man man therefore commoditie ought taken vse thereof man put monye another mannes hande wherewith buyeth selfe farme manour landes vineyardes otherwise occupyeth gaine profite see cause good christian honest man may reape lawfull commoditie hire monye well letting leasing lande power letteth monye monye buy farme take whole gaine selfe nowe wee see letting haue graunteth vse monie whereby verie greate gainer fellowe whome summe leant otherwise giuen vppon couenauntes contract doeth money gett stay lyuing reuenue whereof nourisheth familie paying creditour portion agreed whiche hath made full restitution maketh liuing owne euer acquiteth selfe yerely pension kind couenanting man think say poore oppressed thing selfe doth rather crye vsurie poore greatly helped vsurie therefore forbidden ye worde god farre forth byteth vse verie tearme scripture neighbour hindereth otherwise vndoeth thus saith lorde leuiticus thy brother waxen poore fallen decaye whether straunger indweller releue may liue thee thou shalt take vsurie right feare lorde thy brother may liue thee thou shalt giue thy monie vppon vsurie lende thy victual increase lorde god therefore lorde misliketh artes couetous deceiptfull men wherewith doe onely exceede measure exacting vsurie purpose let money substaunce hire occasion may wipe debitours haue man thinke fewe wordes expresse wicked fetch subtile vsurers inuent suche newe one euery daye therefore recite iudgement lorde fewe wicked artes detestable deedes vsurers lending letting selling ende considered men may iudge take heede like prophet amos eight chapter saith heare ye swallowe vp poore make need e lande faile saying moneth wee sell corne weekes ende wee sett foorth wheate wil make epha small sickle greate sure small price great falsifie weightes deceipte wee may buy poore siluer need e shooes sell refuse wheate lorde hath sworne excellencie iacob surely neuer forgett woorkes shall lande tremble shall euerye one mourne dwelleth therein shall rise vp whollie sludde c wherefore wrathe god may turned awaye falling vpon common weales kingdomes aga su vniust extortion vsurie detestable vsurers parte holie magistrate brydle vsurers vpright lawes according qualitie time place state person appoynt lawfull iuste honest lucre vsurers may lending lettinge buying selling oppresse poore people equitie iustice may kepte thinges duetie magistrate hath notable example nehemias suppressing couetousnesse crueltie extreme iniurie vsurers oppressours iewish commonaltie large let downe fifth chapter historie nehemias therefore whiche haue hitherto alledged meane father defende vniust occupier vsurers insatiable couetousnesse affirme flatly liue bloud bowel brother countriemen shalbee vndoubtedly damned vnlesse repent sinne extortion verye lawe nature doth make greatly whiche obiecte saye vnto whatsoeuer thou wouldst haue done thy selfe thou another publican also came iohn might baptised saide maister shall whome saide exact appointed publican liued vppon publique toll customes farmed roman hand certeine summe readie menye nowe publican leaue toll gatheringe willed content appointed duetie like manner vrge sentence saye vsurers occupyers exact appointed ye want certeine constitution ordinaunce set downe magistrate gaine money euery seuerall trade let equitie humanitie charitie preuaile mindes let common lawe sinck heartes saith soeuer ye woulde men shoulde ye thine eye saith lord single thy bodie lightsome light thee dark nesse howe great darkenesse sacrilege spoyling holye thinges whiche consecrated sacriledge god vse churche churche god hath hallowed goodes richesse wherwith doth partely mainteine sincere dectrine holy ministerie church partely releeue needie sainetes impotent brother churche also hath goodes possession keepe place prayer spirituall house hospitalles due reparation lastly publique healpe people common calamity greenous affliction therefore churcherobbers whiche conuert churche good lawfull holie purpose ordeyned prophane godlesse vse spending prodigally hunting gaye cloathing superstition whoorehaunting diceing drinking excessiue banqueting whiche thinges bishop magistrate dayes doe greately offende cannot otherwise bee greate misfortune calamity one must need followe foule abuse ecclesiasticall richesse spirituall goodes christe lord verye sonne god spoyled defrauded poore needie doctrine godlynesse come ende honest study doe vtterly decaye sheepe christe altogeather destitute good faithfull sheepeheardes leaft praye rauening wolues mercilesse robber yet wee must haue regarde accompt number churcherobbers suche heades ouerseers holye religion kinges iuda ezechias especially manye bishop pastours primitiue church many troublesome broyles either warres waste theire country common weales else hunger publique calamitie oppresse pinch sillie countriemen stick bestowe churche good liberally emptie treasure hallowed money thereby might oppressed good vndoubtedlye beene wrongfull churcherobbers spare money others vessel whiche without life would haue redeemed liuing creature countriemen death penurie excellent place matter sainct ambrose officiorum lib cap also notable example hereof ecclesiasticall historie moreouer number churcherobbers diuines accompte simoniaks simoniakes merchauntes meane buyer seller spirituall ecclesiasticall dignity suche one simon magus graunde patriarche reported haue beene actes apostle ciuile lawe whosoeuer went priuie giftes ambition buy voice man speake syde publique office dignity bestowed guyltie ambition beside shame open infamie copelled pay hundred crownes offence belonges sacrilege lett passe returne matter churcherobbers whosoeuer either paye else paye vnwillingly goodes due church meane tithe yerely reuenues seene scripture howe terribly prophetes doe threaten churcherobbers haggeus testified grounde brought forth yll little fruite nothing else forbecause people truely paye whiche duetie ought temple malachie god promiseth people make ground fruitefull pay liberally stipendes tribute due temple nowe minister church may vse reuenues stipendes good lawe right vse profite grounde selues haue husbanded doth lord expressely teache booke number wherewithall paules saying agreeeth ninth chapter firste epistle corinthian lorde iesus selfe also gaue almes poore stipend seene thirteenth chapter sainct iohns gospell moreouer beggers committe sacrilege abuse name christ make pouertie cloake keepe ydle still apostle commaundeth timothie cherishe ydle hypocrite wandering vacabondes almes expences churchegoods nowe greatest sacrilege man translate glorie god creator vnto creature kinde theaft called peculatus committed filching common treasure purloyning away prince substance kinde robberie breedeth euery houre newe exaction giueth wicked magistrate good cause fitt opportunitie poll poore co monaltie sort robber cato happily speake saide priuate theeues lead liues chaines fetter publique theeues golde purple vnder title robberie conteined either pay else paye yll tribute tax due magistrate lastly compted faultie kinde theeuerie soeuer abuse publique wealth treasure common weale take vp child whome know verie well sell thereby gett aduauntage else steale away mennes seruauntes kinde theaft lawyer call plagium offence people guyltie whiche euill whispering persuasion seditious doctrine drawe seruaunts handmaydes obedience maisters child reuerence duetie parent capitaines hired straunge prince serue money forreine warres ye ace uch llingers n coun e e rue en oney actise ily parent knowledge carrye awaye whole bandes sillie young men whome intice many faire promise entrap sundry sleight leading warres wherein perishe neuer returne friendes againe suche captaines saye reckoned number menstealers offence old punished death euident exodus law constantine seene cod lib tit sorte theeues call felones bigei steale driue away mennes cattel order theeues people placed misuse cattel lent also may helpe another man cattell ieopardie lorde lawe commaunded bring back goeth astraye restore right owner thus much hetherto haue spoken brother touching sundry kindes theaft iust lawfull getting good also proper owning peculiar richesse p lawfull vse earthly good howe may rightly possesse lawfully spende wealth rightly iustly gotten restitution almes deedes second sermon laste sermon dearely beloued declare vnto meanes good rightly gotten howe many kind theaftes sundry sort getting wealth vnlawfully yet behind treatise adde therein teache true vse good rightly gotten howe may lawfully possesse iustly spende dispose transitorie life iustice doth onely descaude man doth muche may endeuour selfe good al men neither nough godly man vnlesse also good point many men sinne persuaded haue done al duetie owe hurt man possesse whiche haue without trouble man although meane haue regarde whether helpe good man sinneth greatly sight lord doth vse rightly good iustly gotten hath heaped vp wealth wickednesse naughtie meanes tell therefore farre god shall giue grace howe sort godly men may holily possesse dispose earthly good first vse worldly wealth maye healthfull owner holie men haue diligent care nothing another mannes nothing f another man must e posse ed remaine possession carefully seperate wealthe rightly come vniust gotten goodes fathfully restore soeuer finde haue belong right vnto men thoroughly persuaded verily beleeue meanes wealth lefte although restitution bee somewhat diminished yet notwithstanding prosper better endure longer farre fruitfull vnto nowe restitution flatly commaunded also necessary restitutio necessarie put practise lord lawe doth sundry meanes verie carefully giue charge seene exodus moreouer often iust exod holye commaundement god couetousnesse wickednesse mankinde cast neglected lorde raysed vp grieuous almost vnspeakable euils contemners thereof scattered abroade vniust gotten good warres mishap diuers calamity prophet esay cryeth saying lorde shal enter esai iudgement elder prince people shall saye vnto ye haue burnt vp vineyarde spoyle poore house amos thirde chapter prophecie cryeth stoare vp treasure palace violence robberie therefore thus saith lord god misery shal inuade thee euery side lande enimies shall bring downe thy strength richesse thee thy palace shalbe spoyled read therefore gospell zacheus owne accorde promised restitution fourefolde double full absolute recompence whatsoeuer taken wrongfully away assuredly certeine perfourmed promise vnderstood inspiration holie ghost restitution yll gotten good especially necessarie neuer happie vntill made full amends wrongfull dealing rightly therefore saide sainct augustine epistle macedonius writeth thou maist thou doest restore thou hast another mannes good repentance truely perfourmed falsly fained repentance truely taken sinne forgiuen vnlesse restitution made taken away saide may restored touching time restitution ought made example zacheus teacheth v soone receiued fauour christ vnderstande workes trueth equitie immediatly promise restitution hande perfourme wherefore must foad day day make restitution man hath neede double offence thou needest thy morrowe ouermorrowe delayes augment discommoditie hinderance longer thou hast thy subtile meanes wicked violence wrested goodes hath considering yt losse hath lacked long enough without long god wott thou demaundest thou oughtest make restitution aunswere estitution bee ade thou tookest thou knowest thou hast thou haste defrauded meanes sayest thou shal bring mee selfe obloquie infamie bidd thee doe thou diddest inuent meanes take finde handsome way restore againe whereby thou mayste escape incurre noate infamie pray lord hee vouchsafe shew thee readie waye apt accomplishe thinge thou mindest thou meanest good sadnesse make true restitution thou shalte vndoubtedly finde way doe without reproache obloquie thou doest dallie ieast lord thou wilt bee without thousande excuse best soundest wherof neuer sett thy conscience quiet libertie neither god mocked cannot tell sayest thou whome haue taken therefore knowe whome restoare verie deede thou knowest whome thou hast taken hast thou poore needie bestowe thou oughtest deale thy vniuste gotten good superstition minister thereof nowe let euery one make restitution owe ch one ght much hee hath taken away least much hee able restoare many haue spente prodigally wasted mennes goodes able make restitution thinge againe let fellowes acknowledge fault repente follie bottome heart happen time afterward come goodes let bee much liberal owne prodigall spending men richesse thou possessest bee men goodes gotten thee theft robberie thou madeste full restitution pennie bee lefte thee thou must needes goe begge art thou verilie hard bestedde wofull takinge yea thou art madd farre beside thee selfe thou wilt sticke stil goe paint thy pride maynteyne port men penny satisfie thy luste bowells bloud sweate poore men browes doest thou rather abase thee selfe pouertie vse thy vniuste gotten goodes needie people vse almes thou lyuest bee poores good cou sell aduise therefore lay downe thy pride forsake thy ruffling riott consider thee selfe thou art whereuppon thou lyueste still doe thy endeuour make restitucion farre thou canste let greeue thee see thee selfe able restoare whoale againe griefe thee time suffer pouertie labour faithfully excercise honest occupacion trayne vp thy child leading hand woorke thou shalt wante whereon liue althoughe thou restoarest whatsoeuer thou hast men good small almost faith many men whereby commeth passe fewe none bee persuaded make true restitu ion adde goe ought especially thincke restitution haue euil wordes corrupted mind simple soules priuie backbyting raysed slaunders men peruerse counsell stirred vpp mightier men weaker sorte thinges doe passe farre aboue earthly richesse thus much haue said hetherto touching ample large discourse haue bene made touching restitution restitution men haue left ample discourse part see godly minde worke restitution short plaine enough therefore haue spoken shortly haue godly well disposed man doeth al hart desire seeke obey lawe god therefore calling god ayde shall easilie finde way woorke iustice equitie whose desire rather seme iust men iust deede loue world becommeth doe ouer many question innumerable perchaunces put case make treatise restitution tedious intricate man shall euer bee able make plaine vnderstand wil therefore aunsweare onely warne examine owne conscience see doth bidde doe would haue coscience settled mindfull generall lawe saith whatsoeuer thou wouldest haue done thee selfe doe thou another whatsoeuer thou wouldest haue done selfe doe thou somewhat wee must set ou mindes rich freely discourse vppon iust possessing vsing disposing well gotten earthly substance first man must put confidence richesse deede thing transitorie doe quickly decay wee must settle mind vpon loue meanes take heede driue v idolatrie hinder ye course haue passe heauen goale wherat runne againe must giue eare diuine heauenly woords vttered prophete dauid said put trust god alwayes powre heartes god refuge child men vaine child deceitfull vppon weightes altogether lighter vanitie selfe truste wronge robberie giue selues vanitie rich increase set harte vppon apostle paule beeing indued spirite biddeth v vse world worldly thinges though vsed againe hee calleth couetousnesse worshipping idolls chargeth rich men put trust vncertaine rich lyuing god ministreth creature lyuing sufficiently enough therefore lord gospell forbiddeth heape vpp treasure vppon earth side bidden apostle spend oure good prodigallie riot wantonnesse wee may abuse wealth lord hath lent v pride luxurie many doe lash al dieing sumptuous building straung clothiong excessiue drinking ouer deyntie banquetting end destruction kind people lord doeth verie finely though without terrour heare set downe parable rich glutton delicate fare coastly apparell life tormented hell vnspeakeable thirste toasted vnquencheable fire therefore temporall good must rightly holilie moderately vsed without excesse euerie man must acknowledge terrestriall good ye meere iches e gift od hich ust anked free giftes bountifull heauenly father giuen desert gotte might wee haue god liberalitie thinges necessarie mainteyne oure liues lord blesseth doth prosper labour finallie euil good gift god giueth maintenaunce liues destruction fault selues rich snare bring many men euill end moreouer ye lord himselfe requireth woord commaundeth v thanckful vnto good benefit bestowed v vse thankes giuing praise name al thing reioyce fatherly goodnes shewed vnto v thus doth moses seruaunt god deuteronomie charge israelite thou hast eaten therefore filled thee selfe thancke lord thy god good land hee hath giuen thee beware thou forgett lord thy god thou wouldest keepe commaundementes lawes ordinance commaund thee day yea thou hast eaten filled thee selfe hast built goodly house dwellest therein thy beastes thy sheepe waxen many thy siluer thy gold multiplied al thou hast increased beware least thine heart rise thou forgett lord thy god brought thee land aegypt house bondage say thine heart power might mine owne hand hath prepared mee aboundance remember lord thy god hee giueth thee power gett substance c moreouer paule apostle saith al creature god good created good preseruation v men biddeth v vse feare god giuing thanckes againe whether yee eate drincke whatsoeuer ye glorie god another place let maners bee farre couetousnes bee content thinges yee haue hath said forsake leaue thee may boldly say lord helper wil feare man doe vnto mee let earthly goodes also serue necessitie nowe necessitie requireth good serue supply necessitie commodious dwelling place much victualls sufficiente comely apparell honeste company keeping wyth oure neighbour equalls let euery man measure esteeme circumstaunces first owne personne familie household householder must warely prouide foresee necessarie thinge wanting familie care househoulder sundrye testimony scripture extant especiallie saint paule fifth chapiter first epistle timothie note necessitie thinges mente body life man doth necessarily require stand neede finally whatsoeuer honestie beseeming euery man doth craue demaunde thus farre verily ende purpose lawfull man lay somewhat vp stoare yeares come man whose charge much keping great house hath neede maintayne withall hee whose familie bigge needeth much lesse house ye smaller one state life greater port becommeth magistrate countenaunce lower sayle beseemeth priuate person case let euery man consider necessitie requireth lust riotting egge vnto let thincke seemely vnseemely one degree yet wee doe treatise make stricte definition necessitie necessitie excludeth allowed plesure thereby wee vtterly condemne pleasure moderate libertie sensualitie lururie know god hath grau ted giuen man onely vse necessitie meane vse thinges wee men cannot without also doth allowe moderate pleasure wherewithall delight let man therefore make scruple conscience sweet pleasaunt vse earthly good though sweete pleasure hee enioyeth hee sinned god let maketh conscience make rather iust lawfull vse terrestriall rich lord hath place forbidden myrth ioy sweete vse wealth farre foorth nothing done vndecently vnthankfully vnrighteously prophete ieremie alluding yt promise god lawe conteyned leuiticus deuteronomie sayth shall come reioyce sion shall haue plenteousnes goodes lord shall giue namely wheate wine oyle young sheepe calues soule shal well watered gardeine shall sorrowfull shal mayde reioyce daunce yea youg old folkes turne sorrowe gladnesse wil comfort make merrie wil make drunken heartes priestes fatte people shal filled goodnes saith lord ieremie moreouer chapiter thirde booke kinges wee read vnder solomon increased many number sand sea eating drinking making merrie againe chap booke wee finde solomon made solemne feast al israell verie great congregation came together amonge people euen entring hemath vnto riuer aegypt lord seuen dayes seuen dayes dayes afterward sent away people thanked king went vnto tentes verie ioyfully glad heart goodnesse lord done dauid seruaunte israell people like vnto wee read chap nehemias woords esdras leuites saide people sad sorrowfull day holy vnto lord god ye sorie weepe ye go way eate fat drinke sweete send part vnto haue c lord verily doeth require v men without sense feeling pleasure hee grace hath giuen v enioy neither would haue v al together benummed like blockes stockes senselesse stone himselfe hath graffed v al ye sense feeling good euill sweete sowre god maker hath eternall goodnesse wisedome ordeyned certaine natural excellencie creature hath adourned made delectable wee may delight desire yea god hath plated nourishing force vertue cherish v men keepe oure body fayre good liking dauid sayth maketh grow earth wine maketh glad heart man oyle make haue chearefull countenance bread strengthen man hart tree lord also ful sapp wherein birdes make nestes sing c moreouer reported iacob patriarch drincke drunkennesse ioseph brethrene scripture sayth common english translation hath made mer ie drinking made drunken wine man take drunckennesse excessiue bibbing holie scripture doth euery condemne certayne sweete pleasant measure drinking wherewith satisfied made merrier madd kind drunkennesse bereaues sens farre causing men bee iocund merrie cleane contrariwise maketh wayward vnciuil order beastly swinelike filthie like phrase speach vseth haggeus prophet saith consider wayes hart ye sowe much ye bring litle ye eate ye haue enoughe ye drinke vnto drunkennesse vnto sweet pleasaunt sufficiencie filled iocund therewith ye neede desire plentie giue thankes ye lord good benefac bestowing doe somewhat largely declare anabaptistes certaine senselesse stoickes newe sprung vp hypocrite carthusian monkes goe make men meere blockes doe tragicall outcry condemne vtterly allowable pleasure laweful delightes colour commend odd opinion eares men abuse many place sacred scripture woe say nowe full doe laughe nowe time come ye shall hunger weepe deede like saying vttered god wicked vnthankfully abuse benefites creature good god therfore conclusion haue hitherto said ad godlye men must still take carefull heede let loose ye reynes lust exceede golden meane meane measure allowed plesures also liked loked wel thing furthermore let goodes earthly substaunce serue doe honour rich must serue honour shewe curteous behauiour betweene man shew curteise humanitie one man duetie owe honour humanitie oure kinsfolkes alliaunce friend acquaintance countriemen straungers must good familiar v also whome wee neuer see keeping hospitalitie wayfaring stranger farre substance wil stretch mainteyne otherwise thy wealth slender wil mainteyne thine owne house familie parcell god law doth binde bid thee distribute men wealth thou thee selfe doest neede much sufficient thee prouide thine owne household bee burden men backes man whose wealth small compelled spend litle hee hath honour shewing courtesie men enoughe beare valiaunt hart owne harde hap take heede pouertie procure offend right honestie let indifferently stoared richer menne haue wealth wil courteous liberall enterteyne straungers wyth francke hospitalitie let mind set vse liberalitie owne praise honestie giuen filthie greedinesse vnhonest sparing euery odd halfpenie thou shalt finde thoughe bee indifferently well stoared wyth wealth possession yet withstanding whoalie giuen ouer gathering neither owne honesty sake shewe courtesie bestowe dodkin vppon man whatsoeuer bee hee owne countrieman stranger vnknowne kinde fellowes alwayes chambered keepe themselues cloase secreate counting house baggs pillowes whereon sleepe dreame ruddockes seene sturre abroade least peraduenture occasion bee offered giue entertainement shewe ciuilitie aliaunts straungers scripture doth giue farre better reporte holie famous patriarch graund predecessours lot sate gate sodome wayte straungers wayfaring men ende hee might take hoame house giue enterteynment well hee could fell mette straunger hee desire hoame house fashion sake onely fainte fayned woordes hee vsed earneste meanes hee could compell perforce take vp inne lodge night oure father abraham yee read genesis verie heate day hee sate doore tent hee espied three men trauellers whome first sight althoughe hee knewe hee enterteyned louingly badd wellcome hartily stayeth looke come request refreshe themselues wyth starteth vppe meeteth come doore tent hee himselfe preuenteth speaking first vnto hee courteously countrie manner obeysaunce saluted hee biddeth louingly hoame house sayth beseech thee lord may finde fauour thy sight passe away pray thee thy seruaunt loe heere hee calleth traueller straunger name e say nglish lord euen wee germanes enterteyning straungers wont say sind mir gott wol kommen lieben herr vnd gouten friind althoughe hee land hee dwelt man highe authoritie verie great name yet notwithstanding hee forget himselfe say passe pray thee away thy seruaunt calleth seruant stranger goeth moreouer sayth let little water fet wash feete refresh selues vnder tree fet morsell bread comforte heartes shall yee goe way fewe woordes hee conteyneth manner pointes ciuil courtesie neyther abraham vse woordes make shewe onely bounteous liberalitie hee entreatie requested stay graunt obteyned desire hee bestirreth stumpes accomplishe deedes thinge hee promised hee maketh hast sara tent sayth make readie three measure fine meale kneade peckes make cake scripture yet addeth cause abraham running vnto beast caught calfe tender good gaue younge man hasted made readie hee tooke butter milke calfe hee prepared sett stoode himselfe himselfe serue ate vnder tree wonderfull verilie bee thought deepely good well woorthily bestowed vppon bountifull liberall courteous man abraham knewe howe vse wealth honestly commendable courtesie neither hee alone house francke liberall wife familie readilie giuen willing put holie excercise vre practise thinges therefore readie wyth trice making preparation also diligence wantinge choice made thinges riffe raffe refuse geere serued straungers best likelyeste found good man himselfe taketh paynes like seruaunte hee himselfe bringeth countrie fare whiche farre doeth excell costly cates princelike dish setteth guestes meate butter milke serueth ye last course veale well fedd housewife like dressed neither hee contente courtesie enterteynemente humbled himselfe yet wayted table guestes meate table loe serued great ample promise made god father faithfull roote graundsyre christe oure lord friende god confederate puissaunte kinges beeing himselfe honourable prince land hee warre ouercome vanquished foure mightieste kinges easte brought backe againe slauerie bondage deliuering people taken captiue excellent worthie man say may well bee paterne wealthie men followe bestowing honour courtesie hospitalitie vppon straungers men vnknowen lastly beside rare seldome seene hospitalitie shewed moreouer point courtesie rose meate bare companie part way let wealthie pinchpence therefore last bee ashamed leaue niggish liues insatiable couetousnesse pleasure pray haue rich whome doe good doe honour close kept coyne honour honestie doeth monie procure gett liue amonge men whie doe wiser sorte wealthie men rather leaue crue miserable wretch hearken apostle word saith remember keepe hospitalitie meanes many haue lodged angel vnwittingly vnawares verilie hee speaketh lot abraham neither bee doubted wee interteyne verie angel god christe himselfe often wee shewe courtesie hospitalitie good godly mortall men lastly let goodes wealthie men serue interteynment good must serue reliefe poore men credite onely reliefe also poore needie crea re whoalsome saying paule must beaten head charge riche doe good rich good woorkes readie giue glad distribute laying vp stoare themselues good foundation time come may lay hold vppon eternall life wyth doctrine apostle doeth prophete esaie well agree hee sayth touching tyre occupying also ware shalbe holie vnto lord gaynes shall bee layed vpp kept stoare shalbe dwell lord may eate enough haue cloathing sufficient loe heere esaias teacheth v meanes lay vpp treasure euer shal indure moreouer sixt chapiter matthewe verie repeated spoken let euerie one also call memorie wholsome sentence lord god stirr vp giuing almes deuteronomie moses sayth beware thou harden thine heart shutt thine hand thy needie brother open thine liberallie vnto thou shalt giue let greeue thine heart giue vnto thing lord thy god shall inrich blesse thee thy workes thou puttest thine hand vnto lord shall neuer without poore therefore commaude thee saying open thine hand liberallie vnto thy brother poore needie land psalmes wee finde good man mercifull le deth guideth wordes discretion hee dispearseth abroad giueth poore righteousnes remayneth euer horne shalbe exalted honour solomon also saith let mercie weldoing faithfulnes neuer part thee binde thy necke write table thine hart shalt thou finde fauour good estimation sight god men againe honour lord thy substace firstlinges thine increase giue poore shal thy barnes filled plenteousnes thy press shall flowe ouer sweete wine againe whosoeuer stoppeth eare crie poore hee shall crie himselfe bee heard pointes doe sayinges apostle enangelistes plainly agree giue euerie one asketh thee againe verilie say vnto much ye haue shewed mercie least bretherne ye haue shewed mee sentence surely woorthie bee noted deepely printed heartes christian lord iesus reputeth bestowed himselfe whiche thou bestowest poore vndoubtedly hee thincketh himselfe neglected despised thee often thou neglectest despisest needie vndoubtedly true surely certeine lord iudge people assureth v promise end world last iudgement hee wil giue sentence maner order come ye blessed father possesse kingdome c hungrie ye gaue mee meate thirstie ye gaue mee drincke forwarde seene chapiter sainct matthewes gospell hereunto also belongeth woordes sainct iohn apostle hee saith whoso hath worldes good seeth brother haue neede shutteth vpp co passion dwelleth loue god hence vndoubtedly first arise common voyce old wot say thou seest needie bodie die hunger doest helpe thou mayest thou hast killed giuen consent vnto death let therefore hath stoare earthly goodes knowe suretie heart thoroughly persuaded hee bounde especiallie doe good needie moreouer let wealthie must good doe good men neere canne lord sayth giue euerie one asketh thee tobias giueth sonne lesson saying turne thy face poore man thou canste thoroughe lacke abilitie doe good men succour chieslye whome thou perceyueste bee godly disposed yet pinched penurie paul saith let v doe good men especiallie household faith let v therefore ayde succour relieue fatherlesse child poore widowes old men impotent people afflicted persecuted profession trueth oppressed miserie calamitie let v helpe forwarde good holie learning woorshippers true minister god liue want scarsitie finally let v relieue straungers whome euer else wee maye nowe duetie aide stand steede counsell howe ought good comfort helpe monie meate drinke lodging rayment commendation thinges else wherin wee perceiue lacke helping hand touching spake somewhat tenth sermon firste decade must also succour readily willing hart cheerfull mind god requireth cheerfull giuer helping let v liberally tobias saith bee mercifull thy power thou farre must good haue much giue plenteousely thou haue little thy diligence gladly giue little lorde shall blesse thee thine thus much brother haue hetherto saide touching lawfull vse earthly good god graunt euery one may print saying hearte put practise holy worke let v praye lorde vouchesafe direct v wayes getting transitorie good wee loose euerlasting treasure heauenly kingdome p patient bearing abyding sundrie calamity misery also hoape manifolde consolation faithfull thirde sermon shall doe amisse think reuerend brethre treatise haue alreadie made earthly richesse vse abuse also adde discourse diuers calamity wherewith man long liueth fraile flesh continually vexed daily afflicted since many men eyther loose temporall goodes else meanes gett whiche cause oppressed penurie needinesse canot profitable verie necessarie euery godly man knowe worde god verie reason ground calamity consolation misery lest swallowed vp great sorrowe entangled vtter desperation giue selfe ouer satan bondslaue nowe treatise serueth whole life man meane speake one calamitie alone pouertie penurie generally misery happen man verily since man borne griefe miserie birdes flying fish swimming life neuer possibly bee either sweete quiet vnlesse hee knowe maner reason calamitie knowe reason thereof religiously taken deriued worde god life cannot choose sweete quiet howsoeuer otherwise seeme moste bitter intollerable minde man verily sorely afflicted grieuously tormented lamentable misery ye side sweetely eased mightily vpholden true knowledge misery holy consolation deriued taken ye worde god first requisite lay eye reckon vp seuerall kind terrour farre grieuous death added death destruction notable men whome make moste accompt robbery oppression endlesse yll chaunces pouertie beggarie lacke friend infamie banishment persecution euils wherunto miserable mankinde wofully endaungered euery moment tormented newe misery rise vp euery daye elder neuer heare appointed fealt suffered v newe neuer heard sinnes daily deserue newe neuer seene punishmets otherwise misery forefather fealt beene ynough sufficient haue plagued v euils wel good euill afflicted calamity good godly worshipper god wicked contemners name troubled kept vre yea saincts al life time afflicted vexed contrarily wicked abounde kindes ioy delightful pleasure whereupon commeth great temptation complaintes arise mindes godly wicked gather happy state pleasant life god doeth like religion accept maner dealing whereby confirmed grounded errours side godly reason misery whiche haue long suffered doe reuolt godlynesse turne vngodly think state ye wicked farre better nowe good knowe seuerally learne al ye scripture godly haue beene afflicted well wicked since beginning ye worlde manifest seene example abel came one pitifully slaine ye sincere worshipping god murther made vagabonde daring feare abyde place take rest iacob sirnamed israel read haue beene vexed many calamity reported also aegyptians persecuted israelits saul vexed dauid especially woderfull discourse iob friend prophet abacuch coplayneth saith lord abac howe long shall crie thou heare log shal crie thee violence suffer thou helpe whie compelled se iniquitie spoyling vnrighteousnes mee whie doest thou regard despise thee holdest thy tongue wicked treadeth downe man righteous himselfe wicked doth circumuet righteous therfore wrong iudgment procedeth malachie hypocrite crie vaine serue god profite wee haue kept comaundements haue walked hu blie face lord therfore call proud arrogant blessed happie worker wickednes liue happilie set vp tempt god go saith haue treasure earthen vessells excellencie power may god v troubled euerie side made sorrowfull wee pouertie extreeme pouertie wee suffer persecution forsaken therein wee cast downe wee perish heauenly thinges finally lord doeth trie tried affliction bee laying crosse vppon neckes purgeth like gold fire hee cutteth v many occasion euill hee may bring v bearing greater plentifull fruite wisedome lord doeth therein followe manner goldsmythes put gold fire purge marre hee imitateth also good husbandman corne somewhat ranke mowe downe prune tree destroy make beare abundant fruite flesh verilie peace quietnesse luskish lazie drowsie slowe good honest exercise content seeketh earthly thinges whoalie giuen pleasure doth vtterly forget god godly thinges nowe therefore expedient onely also necessarie haue dull sluggishe lumpe stirred vpp excercised trouble afflicions sharpe persecution saint herein like toyron vse somewhat woarne diminished lying stil vnoccupied eaten ruste canker truely therefore said peter dearely beloued thincke straunge pet yee tried wyth fire thing trie though straunge thing happened vnto reioyce rather yee partaker affliction christ glorie reucaled yee may merie glad paule timothie saith remember iesus christe seede dauid raised dead according gospel afflicted euill doer euen vnto bondes yet suffer al thing electes sake might also obteine saluation church liuing god throwen grounde holie scripture set fire broade open streetes thus muche worde worde booke ecclesiastical historie yet make difference betwixt sinne sinne kind sinnes saint sinnes sainctes sinne yet abstaine commonly heynous crime although nowe fall euident example dauid yet parte flye theft murder whooredome grieuous sinnes like vnto sainctes afflicted tyraunts neglecting iustice true religion yt contemninge superstition stedfast sticking christ gospell lorde therefore doeth forgiue bloud christ washe away yt sinnes holye martyr reputing suffer deathe sinnes whiche haue committed zeale loue true religion also punisheth tyrant death martyr putting death follow owne tyrannous affection iust iudgement liuing god lordes mynd verily tyrauntes chasten people israel tyraunts esaie chapter witnesseth take bee rather following owne affection passed measure afflicting neuer sought iustice equitie therefore punished lorde killing innocent guiltlesse seruauntes thing lorde persecute people sinnes meane offence tyraunts neyther punishe persecute yt thing pleaseth god loue meane true religion vtter detesting idolatrie madde vpon persecute swoorde fire vnspeakable torment therefore doeth saying sainct peter belong see none punished murtherer theefe euill doer busie bodie mennes matter man suffer christian man let ashamed rather glorifie god behalfe yet would heynous offendours whit despaire haue example theefe crucified christ let follow let saye confesse faultes beleeue christ commit themselues wholie grace mercie lastly suffer patiently paine punishment doubt shal receyued christe paradise liue euer ye theefe doth christ although godly slame amonge transgressours yet ee god oth pu ishe ood euill defiled suffe ing christ ou lord hanged amonge theeues though godly vngodly wrapped coupled together one kinde punishment yet seuered vnlike ending wicked bodily death carried hell burne without intermission godly taken immediately heauen liue christe lord committed commended himselfe touching matter cause affliction holy men god wil agreeued recite vnto dearely beloued notable place augustine first booke de ciuitate dei wheresoeuer sayth hee good men doe suffer like punishment euil sort marked yt therefore difference betwixt diuersitie ye thing suffer one yt fire gold doth shine chaffe doeth smoke vnder one flayle huske broken corne purged scummy froath mixed oyle althoughe one weight presse doth crush euen one selfe miserie falling vppon good badd doth trie fine melt good yt otherside condemne wast consume euill sort whereupon commeth passe one affliction euill doe detest blaspheme lord contrarily good doe praye vnto praise name layeth vpon much matter maketh affliction mark minde euery man doeth suffer stirre vp durt sweete oyntments alike shall haue one stincke filthily cast forth sweete smelling sauour therfore hurlie burlie irruption made barbarous people christian suffer rather profite faithfully cosider trouble especially humbly considering sinnes god wroth fil world many great calamity although farre committing heynous greeuous outragious offence doe yet neuerthelesse repute themselues cleare faultes iudge themselues worthie suffer temporal calamity crime commit euery houre moment ouer besides euery man liueth peraduenture laudably enoughe doeth pointes yeeld little carnall concupiscence although outragiousnes horrible sinnes goulfe heynous offence abhominable iniquity yet notwithstanding yeeldeth sinnes eyther haunteth verie seeldomely else committeth much oftener lesser ouer besides therefore say man hee seeth knoweth well men whose pride lasciuious liues couetousnes damnable iniquitie god hath threatened doeth plague earth doeth esteeme thought liue ought liue wyth kinde people often time many thinges wickedly dissembled wicked doer taught corrected chidden admonished euil behauiours either thinke paine much tell fault afrayd haue heauie lookes liue else auoyde displeasure least peraduenture hinder hurte v temporall matter either greedinesse desireth haue somewhat oure infirmitie feareth lose thing hath alreadie hold possession yt althoughe life wicked displease good cause fall damnation life prepared euill yet since doe therefore beare forbeare damnable sinnes feare lighter smaller tris e iustly scourged wyth temporall life albeit punished eternallie bee punished god wicked doe iustly feele bitternesse life loue whose sweetenesse would bitter telling wicked offence therfore seemeth smal cause good whipped wyth euill pleaseth god punish naughtie manner men affliction temporal paynes scourged together forbecause lead euil life together loue temporall life together doe say alike together better sort ought despise euill rebuked corrected might obteyne eternall life getting wherof would oure fellowes parteners caried louingly drawne euen oure enimies longe liue alwayes vncertaine whether mind shalbe changed bee better wherfore haue like farre greater cause admonishe men faultes whome lord sayth mouth prophete verilie shall die sinne bloud require hand watchman ende watchman guide people ordeyned church forbeare rebuke sinne wickednesse yet man altogether excusable fault although hee guide ouersee people deeth notwithstanding knowe many thinges worthie controllment yet winck whome lyueth couersant giue none offence feare least hee loose thinges world hee vseth hee ought delighted hee forth haue hether rehearsed sainct augustine last hindermost cause calamity oppresse yt holy sainctes god lord afflicting friend deeth thereby giue euident testimonie iuste iudgement shall fall vppon enimies contemning name maiestie saint peter sayth time iudgment must beginne house god first beginne v shal ende bee beleeue gospell god righteous scarsely bee saued shall vngodly sinner appeare like notable sentence lord hee spake hee went place execution saying doe luke moyst tree shall bee done drie saincts meante fruitefull tree bringing foorth pretious fruites good woorkes su eraunce god world miserably tormented wofully vexed shall wee say pray wicked farre vertue good woorks shal vndoubtedly bee plagued vnspeakable paynes punishment touching cause calamity wherewith wicked cause afflictitions wicked sorte tormented bee none heynous crime commit day day therefore punished god iuste iudgement end men may perceiue god hateth wicked men wickednesse alike wee reade pharao afflicted saul fell vppon owne sword slaine mounte gelboe wyth many thousand israelite sinned lord purposed destroy example iudgement terrour followe antiochus epiphanes herode great herod agrippa galerius maximianus emperour taken horriblie wyth greeuous disease died reason sinned god seruaunts whome hee determined take vengeaunce make proofes iuste iudgemente bee example tyrauntes perceiue plague remayne seeke bloud godly faithfull although oure good god doth ordeyne thinges beste creature sendeth manner calamity misery drawe v wickednesse yet beecause hypocrite wicked people despise counselles admonition god neither acknowledge god hee striketh turne hee calleth thinges doe turne destruction euen loue lord thinges woorke beste therefore doe perishe calamity world feele wrath almightie god horible punishmentes world come parted oute life euer beare farre greater bitterer paynes tongue tell happen wicked vngodly sorte doe infelicitie vngodly life feele anye plague greeuous affliction shall bee punished much soarer woorld come man knoweth euangelicall parable riche vnmerciful glutton life hee liued hee iusted passinge delightes notwythstanding hell tormented wyth vnquencheable thyrste parched wyth fire neuer ceassed burning felicitie therefore wicked life nothing else ertreeme miserie saint iames apostle sayth yee haue liued iames pleasure vpon earth beene wanton ye haue nourished hart day slaughter say wil turne well fedd beastes fatted vp slaine make meate ieremie goeth ere litle plainly woorke sayth lord thou art righteous dispute thee yet notwithstanding talke thee howe happeneth waye vngodly doeth prosper well goeth wel without shame offend wickednesse thou haste planted take roote growe bring forth fruite immediatly drawe thou lord like sheepe slaine ordeine appoint day slaughter wyth also doeth agree prophete asaph hee roundly largely reckoned vp felicitie psal ye wicked addeth saying thou verilie hast set slipperie place thou shalt cast downe head long vtterly destroy wyth howe soudaine calamity oppressed perished swallowed vp terrours euen dreame vanisheth sone one awaketh thou lord shalt make image contemptible citie dauid also cry saying yet little vngodly shal bee thou lookest psal place shall appeare haue seene vngodly great power slourishing like greene bay tree went loe gone soughte hee could bee found like maner also doth malachie prophet witnesse great difference day iudgement betwi te worshipper despiser god betwixt iuste vniust dealer day lord shall come proude woorke wickednesse shalbe burnt stubble fire fro heauen shall remaine vnto neither roote braunch wise therefore wil neuer hereafter offended felicitie wicked neuer desire long made partaker vnhappie prosperitie wil grudge beare miserie crosse daily heare layd god vppon saintes end may tried fined drosse fleshe vncleane world thus farre haue sufficiently reasoned cause calamity let v see reuerend brother howe order godly haue godly sincere worshipper god doth behaue himselfe calamity worldly affliction courage quayleth kicketh rather desperation aside hee vnderstandeth hee must manfully faith beare al sort euils therfore doth arme himselfe hope patience prayer verily among men soone feele affliction presently crie common voyce best neuer borne else destroyed assone borne verie wicked saying worthie heard christian man mouth farre wicked sticke destroy selues rather liuing would compelled suffer longer smal calamitie abide tauntes open world yet side againe men must reiecte vnsauerie opinion stoickes touching indolentia lacke griefe stoikes opinion valiant man ought gree ed misery calamiti touching recite vnto dearly beloued excellent discourse notable doctour church christ sett downe wordes following vnthanckful towards god vnlesse willingly chearefully suffer calamity hand yet chearefulnes stoiks dolentia required v take away sense feeling griefe bitternesse otherwise patience sainctes suffering cresse christe vnlesse pinched heart griefe vexed body outward trouble pouertie sharpenesse disease paine infamie sting death horror fortitude temperancie make small accompt set litle since euerie one doeth naturallie nipp mindes v certaine bitternesse ingraffed valiant stomache faithfull man doth therein shewe selfe pricked feeling bitternesse howsoeuer greuously payned therewith doeth notwithstanding valiaunt resisting continuall struggling worthily vanquish quite ouercome therein doth patience make proofe self man sharpely pricked doth notwithstading bridle selfe feare god neuer breaketh forthe immoderate vnrulynesse therein doth chearefulnesse clearely appeare man wounded sorrowe sadnesse doth quietly staye himselfe vppon spirituall consolation god creatour conflicte faithfull susteine natural feeling sorrowe griefe studie exercise patience temperance apostle paule hath finely described woordes followeth troubled euerie side made sorrowfull wee pouertie extreeme pouertie suffer persecution forsaken therein caste downe perishe thou seest beare crosse patiently altogether senselesse vtterly bereft kinde feeling stoicks old foolishly describe valiaunt man one laying aside ye nature man affected alike aduersitie prosperitie sorrowful matter ioyfull thinges yea one moued nothing whatsoeuer pray exceeding great patience forsooth painted image patience neither euer possiblie ca found among men yea went haue patience ouer exquisite precise toke away force therof life man daye also amonge v christian certaine newly vpstarte stoickes thincke fault onely sigh weepe also sad sorrowfull matter paradox verilie doe part proceed idle fellowes whiche exercising themselues rather contemplation working doe nothing else daily breede nouelties paradox wee christian haue nothing doe yronlike philosophie since oure ferrea philosophia lord maister hath word onely owne example also vtterly codemned greaned wept ouer owne men calamity taught disciple like world saith hee shal reioyce ye shalbe sorrowful ye shall weepe least man make weeping fault hee pronounceth openly happie doe mourne meruayle teares misliked iudge lord himselfe whose bodie bloudie teares trill feare noted proceede vnbeleefe shall thincke horror wherewith read lord himselfe stricken mislike sorrowe sadnesse shall wee like lord confesseth soule heauie vnto death thus much minde say intent might reuoake godly mind desperation least peraduenture doe therefore hand forsake seeke patience cannot vtterly shake naturall motion griefe heauinesse cannot choose happen patience make kinde senselessenes valiaunt constant man senselesse blocke stone without passion scripture doth praise saincts patience afflicted sharpenesse calamity thereby stomach broaken courage vtterly quayled stounge pricke bitternesse yet filled spirituall ioye oppressed heauinesse minde yet chearefull god conselation yet repugnancie stil heart naturall sense doeth flye abhorre thing feeleth contrarie selfe side motion godlinesse doth euen thoroughe difficulty striuing seeke way obedience god repugnancie iohn lord expresse said peter thou wast yonger thou girdedst thee selfe wentest whether thou wouldest thou shalt old shal gird thee lead thee whether thou wouldest vnlike verilie peter neede glorifie god death much adoe drawen vnto beene martyrdom deserued litle praise none howsoeuer great cheerefulnes heart obey ordinaunce god yet hee layde aside affection flesh minde drawne two sundrie wa e saw eye bloudie death suffer hee vndoubtedly strucke thorowe feare therof would al heart haue escaped side remembred god commaundement called thereunto ouercomming treading dewne feare willingly chearefullie yeeld himselfe vnto therfore wee meane christe disciple chiefe especiall studie must haue oure mindes indued great obedience loue god able tame bring vnder ill motion mindes ordinaunce holie come passe kinde crosse soeuer wee vexed wee may euen greatest trouble oure mindes constantly reteyne quiet sufferaunce patience aduersitie haue sharpenesse nippe v likewise afflicted sicknesse disease wee shall groane bee disquieted wishe health oppressed wyth pouertie wee shalbe pricked wyth sting care heauinesse like manner wee shalbe stricken wyth griefe infamie contempte iniurie done vnto v also death oure friendes nature moue v shedd teares sake must still ende thought whie ye lord would haue let v therefore followe thus much hath hee wherefore faithfull ouertaken entangled wyth saint patience calamity doe chieflie remedie misery patience lactantius sayeth quiet bearing wyth indifferent minde euills eyther layde doe fall pate faythfull man patience hauing eye thoroughly fastened vppon woord god doeth fayth hope sticke faste god cleaue woord hee suffereth aduersities whatsoeuer bechance moderating alwayes griefe minde paynes bodie wyth wonderfull wysedome time ouercome greatnesse griefe sorrowe hee doeth reuolte god woord doe thinges lord hath forbidden patience therefore hee vanquisheth himselfe affection ouercommeth calamity standeth stil steadfaste quiet minde well disposed heart godwarde althoughe faythfull doe patience suffer thinges yet doth hee finde faulte wyth thinges wicked hardly beare wyth oughte againste trueth oure sauiour christe iesus onely perfecte example patience patiently yeeld handes whoale bodie bee bounde wicked yet neuerthelesse hee reproueth iniquitie saying yee come foorth theefe swoordes stanes althoughe daily temple houre power darcknesse nowe belongeth excellent description liuely image image patience patience layd downe tertullian woords followeth goe let v see image habite patience countenaunce calme quiet forehead mooth without furrowed wrinckles signes sorrowe anger browes neuer knit slacke cheareful wise wyth eye caste comely downe ground sorrowe calamity onely humility sake vpon mouth shee beareth marke honour silence bringeth vse colour like nigh daunger guiltlesse euill head often shaked diuel therewithal hath threatening laughter moreouer cloathes breast white cloase bodie waggeth euery wind tosseth vp euery blast shee sitteth throane meeke quiet spirite troubled tempest ouer cast cloud plaine open goodly clearenes helias saw third time god also patience darling nourisheth moreouer blessed martyr cyprian sermon de bono patientiae force pati nce reckoneth vpp force workes patience saith patience commendeth v god preserueth v patience whiche mitigateth anger brideleth tongue gouerneth mind keepeth peace ruleth discipline breaketh assault luste keepeth vnder force pride quencheth fire hatred restrayneth power riche relieueth neede poore maynteyneth maydens vnspotted virginitie widowes chastitie married people vnseperable charitie maketh humble prosperitie constante aduersitie meeke taking iniurie teacheth thee forgiue quickely ye offend thee neuer ceasse craue pardon thou offendest others vaquisheth temptation whiche suffereth persecution finisheth martyrdome groundeth surely foundation fayth doth augment ye increase hope guideth v wee may keepe way christe wee doe goe sufferinge thereof maketh v continue sonnes god imitate patience father thus much cyprian please may add conclusion short verie euident sentence lord gospell patience luke possesse soul word apostle cast away heb confidence hath great recompence reward ye haue neede patience ye haue done god ye might receiue promise yet verie little hee shall come come tarrie iust shal liue faith withdraw himselfe soule shall haue pleasure wee withdrawe selues vnto perditio wee perteyne faith vnto winning soule since patience borne together v bestowed god fro aboue wee must beseech heauenly father hee vouchsafe bestowe vppon v according doctrine iames apostle saith lacke wisedome let aske god giueth men indifferently casteth man teeth shalbe giuen let aske faith nothing wauering nowe sound hope faithfull vpholdeth christian patience hope dayes vsed opinion thinges come referred commonly well good euill thing verie deede hope assured expectation looking thing truely expressely promised god beleued v faith certaine relation hope faith mutuall knott betwixte faith beleeueth god sayth nothing trueth lifteth vpp eye god hope looketh thinges fayth hath beleeued shouldest thou looke ought vnlesse thou knowest thing thou lookest promised god thou shalt haue time conuenient faith beleueth oure sinnes forgiuen v eternall life thorough christe redeemer prepared v nowe hope looketh patiently wayteth receiue due time thing god hath promised v howsoeuer meane time tossed aduersities hope doth languish vanishe away althoughe seeth hopeth yea quayleth although thing fall cleane crosse contrarie thinges doth hope nothing hope thinges ab ent therfore paul said saued hope hope seene hope man hope hee seeth hope wee see wee patience abide abraham hoped receiue promised land yet possessed one foote ground sawe inhabited puissaunt nation moses hoped deliuer people israel aegypt place ye land promise yet sawe maner meanes hee doe dauid hoped reigne ouer israel yet felt peril saul seruaunts hanging ouer head yt oftener hee daunger life enoughe shewe miserablie rome plagued afflicting church christ neuerthelesse maugre tyrauntes heades remayned safe ouercame brunt shall reigne christ euermore like maner sarracenes extinguished vtterly destroyed first suffered many great ouerthrowe beene plagued thoroughout world sundrie mishappes ouerthwart calamity turkes also daily feele woe misery likely hereafter feele sharper punishmentes moreouer pope wyth poyson one slaine straughly vexed wonderful terrours place sure liues euen middes frendes beset misery liue feare continual whoale packe furthermore euen amonge opes dye ocks doth ray haltitie liue happilie rot away wyth disease followeth filthie pleasure kind death either sharper patient detested amonge men adherent setting persecute ye church christ doe either dropp away like disease wayteth vppon thei aten vormes aliue cke horribly man could abide filthy lust litle litle consume away herode antiochus death long dispatche doeth torment beyond measure yea besids bitter plague destroy one endlesse ciuil warres lord therefore righteous iudgmets iust equall neuer forgetteth reuenge friend finding owne seruants enimies punish desarts since brother case standeth let v beseech conclusion patiently suffer hand lord god often wee touched calamitie tempted lord god knowing lord doth strike v may heale v trouble v hee may comfort v receiue v himselfe ioyes euerlasting wee may doe since otherwise weake selues let v pray father heauen thoroughe iesus christ oure lord hee vouchsafe bee present v temptation guide v way constancie peace righteousnes example let euery one set eye order christ oure sauiour maister vse litle cr sse passion betooke himselfe prayer going vp mount olyues beseecheth father humblie prayeth ardently hee instant prayer order ninth tenth commaundements thou shalt speake false witnesse thy neighbour thou shalt couet thy neighbour house c p fourth sermon come exposition ye two last preceptes ye tenne comandements ninth commaundement nint commau demente doe speake faise witnesse thy neighbour precept cofirmed faith couenauntes contractes ruleth tongue commendeth vnto v veritie fayrest vertue al teacheth v vse witnesse lawfull therefore true witnesse especially magistrate demaunde thee therfore hebrue phrase significant sayth aunswere false witnesse thy neighbour aunsweareth asked question bearing witnesse hee speaketh must haue regard god alone simple truth hee must laye aside euill affection hatred feare parte taking hee must hide nothing dissemble speache hee must deuise thing owne making corrupt indifferently common priestes ephod thought haue beene linnen cloake one dauid ware hee daunced arcke priestes saule slue handes doeg edomite thus wee read killed day men ware linnen ephods meaning slaine ephodes backes killed age order might weare ephod mighte minister priesthood lord therefore osee wee read thou shalt bee without ephod teraphim without priesthood religion ephod began vsed priesthood garment signe thing signified man take word osee spoken ye notable ephod shal haue cause speake anon greatly gainsay nowe linnen ephod seemeth differ much papistes call surplice fiue garment chiefe priest vnder priest vse alike foure doe properly belong high priestes alone first soure called megil coate downe ancles megil garment blew silke necke downe soale foote cloase euery side vnlesse place put head armes hemms beneath hange bell many pomegranate placed still betwixte two bell hounge one pomegranate betwixt two pomegranate one bell cause thereof made highe priest went holy holy sound might heard die ye death vnlesse nowe solloweth ephod high priest differeth much fro brestlappe highe priestes ephod whereof spake lynnen woauen weauers worke diuers colour gold purple silke vnlike shape making belonged highe priestes alone brestlap comming ouer ye bulke necke hippes like curet couered breste came ouer hinder parte shoulder side vnder armehooles bearing facion day woman stomacher doe wee switeers call libli ephod hee ware vppon topp megil came downe ancles vppon eche shoulder hee bare onyx stone called schoham wherein grauen name child israell breast nothing handes euening sacrifice nowe one incense altar alone whosoeuer builded hee condemned blasphemous wickednesse onely altar figured christe oure lord god man mediatour intercessour betwixte god man whome sainctes doe offer prayer god lord heauenly father therfore build many altar choose themselues creature bee intercessours whose mediation desire obteine lacke hads god end cap expressely said soeuer shall make like incese smell therto shal perish fro amonge people therfore christ alone ye faith full church christe doeth offer prayer god father altar whereof speake bound crowne gold christ twice eare f april october lewes egan ckon fro reckon morning till night three clocke nine clocke ou fiue eleuen chose lambe bee eaten fourteenth day killed also set downe houre daye bee slaughtered euen tyde wite betwixt three fiue clocke noone according course dialles iewes wont reckon ye houres daye bee killed betwixt nine eleuen clocke killing lambe euen tyde meaning lye hidde christ slaine burnt without tent therefore iesus also hee might sanctifie people bloud suffer without gate hebr although haue hetherto alledged haue fittes declared ende fruite ceremonie yet thinke muche againe beene saued haue beene saued since beginning worlde enimies aduersaries doctrine paule apostle christ gentile whose skill ye lawe inferiour man doth call fooles madde vnconstant light headed carried euery pusse winde wicked apostataes haue reuolted christe lyars false prophet false apostle deceiuers schismatiques dogges inchau ters witch detestable cursed therefore angel heauen teache v wise let washe selfe water steede came another cleane gathering ash lay vpp cleane place therefore often neede required put ash earthen vessel powred running water sorte holie cleansinge water alwayes prepared sprinckle sprinckler made hysope vppon defiled manner ceremonie cleansinge vse ende whereof doeth immediately followe apostle paule doeth testifie circumstance ceremonie lay v euidet type iesus christ ninthe hebrues sayth ash younge cowe sprinckled doeth sanctifie partaker purifying fleshe howe much bloud christe therfore priest cowe beare type christ female kinde cowe doth note infirmitie man nature redd colour doth admonishe v lord bloud whiche wee washed vncleannesse spot found christ hee holy holy altogether free without sinne hee brought death yoke necessitie hee offered himselfe vnto owne free yea hee offered himselfe willingly go death without hoast wall citie mount caluarie thing apostle paule doth touch hebrues christ god man whoalie offered body soule whose bloud hoalesome v holyghost sprinkled hart faithfull also must die wt christ must humbled burne loue godward redd scarlet meaning cedar wood hysope scarlet lace cast fire moreouer ash came sacrifice gathered vp preserued purifie cleanse withall ash nothing else type figure effect christ death sacrifice meane verie cleansing remission sinnes therefore bloud water gushe aboundantly pierced side christ wee might learne death christe doeth flowe cleansing life bloud life doeth consist water purgeth signe clesing ash gathered man cleane neuerthelesse made remaine vncleane vntill euening finally water sprinkled sprinklar made hysope vppon defiled end thereby hee might bee sanctified purged water kept holy place margarites holy ought caste dogges filthie swine lord also doth require preacher teache effecte christ passion cotemptible lowly preaching gospell lay world redemption sanctification death bloud christ doth require say holy teacher themselues faithfull cleansed bloud christ yet teacher whole church beside euen til euening meane ending liues pray stil forgiue v trespass lord himselfe said hee washed cleane hath neede washe feete onely appertaine often washing vsed ceremonie signifie decree ordinance people certein eternal thing ruling whole world discretion commaund bidd leaue vndone latine copie hath mentem dei whiche call wisedome god saide chiefe highest law wisedome god commaundeth forbiddeth thing reason whereupon law god haue giuen mankinde rightly commended reason discretion wise whiche able either commaund else forbidd foorth therefore iudicial lawes god vnder mischiefous offendours iudgement therefore sitting meeting iudges assises session rather diligent discussing cause giuing sentence accordinge right equitie lawes god also assertion defence whereby good deliuered punishmet executed vppon yll disposed wicked offendours iudges ouerseers iudgement iustice meane doe iustly according lawes giue sentence twixt discorde defende deliuer good punish brydle wicked ye iudicial lawes informe iudges howe determine controuersies question howe iudge iustly punishe wicked howe defend good peace honestie iustice publique tranquillitie may among men ende marke alone whereto iudge iudiciall lawes tende directed god good lord lawegiuer would haue go well wt man may liue happily ciuilie tranquillitie therfore treatise exclude care defence pure religion make one especiall poynts iudiciall lawes looke vnto euen ceremoniall lawes also iudiciall lawes iudi iall lawes belong tenne commaundements added god vnto ten comandements expounde confirme therewithall precept ten commaundements chiefe principall preceptes whereunto wee must referre lawes eternall minde god think neede stande shewe dearely beloued precept ten commaundements euery seueral iudiciall lawe referred verie plaine euident euery one take small paynes conferre laye together iudiciall lawes set murther iniurie apperteining precept thou shalt doe murther whatsoeuer spoken adulterie fornication filthie lustes added commaundement thou shalt committ adulterie likewise whatsoeuer saide iudiciall lawes deceipts shiftes cousinings vsurie doe belong commandement thou shalt steale lastly lawes touching brideling heretikes suppressing apostataes force set downe make plaine first seconde thirde fourth comaundements firste table lawes may applyed precept one ten comaundements easie plaine perceiued euery man therefore stande longer nowe iudiciall lawes first require iudges lawes dges meane mainteine put lawes execution lawes without executours seeme dead side aliue vnder iust magistrate cause called liuing lawe therefore lawes placed iudicial lawes giuen god touching magistrate iudges office election election thus reade bring ye saith moses people men
