congregation lord sheepe without shepehearde herein moses hath leaft example v imitate making prayer god election iudges often time opinion iudgements men vtterly deceiue v god spirites doth behold mindes heartes kneweth euery one thoughtes inward meaning therefore must besought giue shewe v hypocrite iudges men trueth vertue place doth moses leaue v description consecrating newe chosen iudges set lorde handes laide vpon making prayer supplication moreouer office iudges verie briefely yet moste effectuall absolute sentence described lord ye mouth moses wordes heare cause brother iudge righteousely betwixt euery man brother straunger ye shal haue respect person iugement heare small greate alike feare face man iudgement god againe iudge people iust iudgement decline iudgement haue respect person neither take thou bribe rewardes blinde eye wise doeth peruert iust cause doe iudgement iustice thou mayst liue possesse land lorde thy god shal giue thee againe vniust thing iudgement accept face poore neither feare thou face mightie iudge thou iustly vnto thy neighbor againe thou shalt haue doe false reporte thou shalt followe multitude doe euil neither shalt thou speake matter iustice according greater number peruert iudgement thou seest innocent condemned multitude thou therfore condemne multitude hath condemned iudge thou iustly committ euil many voice multitude thou shalte esteeme poore man cause neither shalt thou hinder poore right suite keep thee farre false matter innocent righteous see thou slaye thou shalt oppresse straunger seeing ye selues straungers aegypt god verily deliuered king people tyrannie king aegypt putt subiection kinges againe burden tribute king wont exact subiects made common weale aristocracie moste excellent kind regiment wherein choicest men multitude piked beare yt swaye rule rest yet hee ignorant people foolishenesse wearie libertie woulde craue king thing afterward also disuade seruaunt samuel made lawes sam king also hee might vnderstand liue vnder lawes giue iudgement according lawes discipline institution king thus expressed chapter deuteronomium whe thou art come land lord thy god giueth thee shalte saye wil set king ouer mee like nation thou shalt make king ouer thee whome lord thy god shall choose one among middest thy brother shalte thou make king ouer thee thou mayest set straunger ouer thee thy brother shall gather many horse vnto selfe bring people back againe aegypt increase number horse get selfe strong troope horse men much lorde hath saide ye shall hencefoorth go againe waye also let take many wiues selfe least heart turne awaye neither let gather much siluer golde sett vppon seate kingdome shall write copie law booke according copie booke priestes leuites vse shalbee ought reade therein dayes life hee may learne feare lorde god keepe woordes lawe ordinaunces let hart arise aboue brother neither let turne commandement either right hand leaft hee may prolong dayes kingdome hee sonnes middest israel thus much hitherto magistrate iudges kinges nowe suppose institution kinge thinges conteined moste largely set author touching discipline education prince waye especially bee noted kinges set lordes ruler ouer worde lawes god subiectes bee iudged god worde ought rule gouerne thinges according rule worde commaundements haue rehears vnto iudiciall lawes meane euery seueral one alone chiefe choicest noted ye may consider rest plainly perceiue people israel destitute anye lawe necessarie profitable good state welfare recite vnto briefely may bee naturall playne order possibly bee holie buyldings makinge awaye thinges holy thinges consecrated lorde finally mainteining publishinge true religion large speache euery throughout whole scripture neither thinke greatly purpose worde worde recite lawes particularly make mencion commandment touching matter verily heathen ouerthrowing temple superstitious holie toyes commaundement briefely giuen lord selfe lorde thy god hath cast many nation thee thou shalt roote neither shalte thou make league pittie ioyne affinitie seduce thy sonnes serue straunge goddes furie waxe hoate thee destroy thee shalt thou ye shall digge downe altar ye shall breake idoles ye shall cut downe groues burne image fire holie people arte thou vnto lord thy god lord thy god hath chosen thee peculiar people vnto selfe lawe set downe ye dolat ie exodus againe repeated twelfth deuteron herevnto belong law published idol image nineteenth leuiticus lorde saith looke backe idoles neither make moulten god lord god also chapter ye shal make idol grauen image neither reare vp piller neither shal ye set vp image stone lande bow downe vnto lord god againe deuteronomie thou shalt plant groue tree nighe vnto altar lord thy god neither shalt thou set thee vpp image lord thy god hateth beside also many lawes ende purpose euery place volume scripture well handling entreating poore poore widowes orphanes straungers lorde giueth commaundement ye shall afflict widowe fatherlesse ye goe afflicte without doubt shall crye mee wil assuredly heare wil angrie wil slaye sworde wiues shalbee widowes child fatherlesse beelongeth good parte fifteenth chapter deuteronomie chapter lorde saith peruert iudgement straunger fatherlesse widowe remember rhat thou wast straunger lande aegypt receiuinge refusinge tnesse wi ne ring witness witnesse bearing men sinne vnrighteousnesse death lawe god expressely said cursed euery one whiche abideth writte booke lawe doe one v fulfilleth man liuing perfect vn spotted pointes lawe pray either heretofore hath day hath pure heart within man hath euer loued doeth loue god heart soule minde man neuer luste euill lusteth euery day therefore imperfection sinne lawe bewraying lawe reuealed mankinde shall say pray doth appeare man diuine absolute righteousnesse whiche lawe requireth iob crieth knowe verilie man compared god cannot iustified shall man found righteous hee compared god wil argue shall able aunswere one thousand haue righteousnes answere beseech iudge like word apostle iohn saith wee say wee haue sinne deceiue selues truth v againe say haue sinned make lyar word v therefore meanes lawe beleeue faith came wee kept vnder lawe shut vp faith afterward reuealed wherefore lawe scholemaster vnto christ iustified faith loe could bee said plainly lawe hath concluded vnder sinne end promise ye faith christ iesus bee giuen vnto beleeue againe faith came came faith directed vppon grounded kept vnder lawe forsooth shut vp vnto faith bee reuealed therefore father shut vpin law breake time seeke life saluation else christ alone wherefore lawe lead v faith directly vnto christe yet plainly hee saith lawe oure scholemaister vnto christ loe againe law doth bring v christ againe addeth bee iustified faith therefore lawe setteth forward true doctrine iustification teaching plainly iustified faith christ merit owne workes whiche point opely like vnto gospel taketh selfe office gospell manifest lawe required ye outward woorke onely also purenesse inward affection said euen nowe certaine heauenly absolute perfectnesse lord himselfe one place crieth ye perfect eue father whiche heauen perfecte absolute perfectnesse found v longe wee liue fleshe fleshe euen last ende life doth keepe still corrupt disposition although doth many time receiue ouerthrow spirite striueth yet doeth still renue ye fight v found strength doth remaine heauenly absolute perfectnesse let v heare testimonie ye holy apostle paul touching matter saith wee knowe lawe spiritual carnall solde vnder sinne doe allowe would doe hate doe againe know flesh dwelleth good thing wil present finde meanes performe good againe delight lawe god inward man see law member rebelling lawe mind subduing vnto law sinne whiche member last concludeth saith minde selfe serue lawe god flesh law sin nowe thincke paule spake wordes himselfe paul spake cha romanes person person others carnal men yet regenerate word apostle doe enforce reader whether wil confesse word recited may applied eue man spiritual augustine lib retractat cap saith himselfe sometime opinion woords apostle ought expounded man vnder lawe vnder grace hee confesseth compelled ye authoritie others writing treatise thincke yt apostle spake men spirituall owne person doth large declare book pelagians euen hierome also said haue thundered horrible curse taught yt law commaund thing vnpossible doth expressly write rusticus paul place speaketh owne person flesh corrupte disposition thereof remaine wherby doth vncessatly striue spirite verily yt heauenly perfectn neuer perfecte v longe liue consequently longe liue none v fulfilleth ye law also inserted disputation paul proueth mortall iustified workes lawe meaning yt man iustified work law man iustified workes corrupt nature doth performe whiche lawe god requireth apostle saith able performe well truly saith knowe man iustified deedes lawe faith iesus christ haue beleued iesus christ might iustified faith christ deed lawe deed law flesh shalbe iustified neither must deedes lawe vnderstand ceremony onely euen ceremony likewise moral iustifie v men apostle speaketh moral speaketh deed law chap roman apostle saith deedes lawe shall flesh iustified sight immediately addeth reason saying lawe cometh knowledge sinne cap sheweth lawe wit morall lawe moral law saith thou shalt lust ye apostle saith knew sinne law known cocupiscence lawe said thou shalt lust epistle ephesian speaketh gentile saith simplie workes iustifie speaking gentile could meane ceremoniall lawes morall vertues kind workes seemed good galathians saith many deedes law vnder curse proue addeth writte cursed euery one continueth thing written booke lawe vnlesse deed lawe vnderstand moral wel ceremonial doe see howe proofe hange went saith expressely thing writte booke lawe nowe knoweth ye ceremonial written alone moral written also augustine booke de spiritu litera cap doth many argumentes proue paule deed lawe vnderstand moral also nowe wee may conclude place heere recite word apostle romanes saying lawe could doe much weake thorough flesh god performed sending owne sonne similitude sinnefull flesh sinne condemned sinne flesh righteousnesse lawe might bee fulfilled v walke flesh spirite apostle word teacheth v two thing first law neither neuer could iustifie v men fault weakenesse lacke abilitie casteth vpon law selfe good effectual doctrine absolute righteousnesse layeth fault therof vpon corrupt flesh flesh neither could performe whiche required v ye law god beloued paule barnabas men haue ieoparded liues name lorde iesus christ haue sent therefore iudas silas shal also tell thing mouth seemed good holie ghoste v charge necessarie thing say ye absteine thinges offered idol bloude strangled fornication fro ye keepe selues ye shal wel fare ye wel word worde catholique synodall apostolique ecclesiasticall epistle counsell helde hierusalem briefe easie speeche trueth simple also may true religion christian faith easily layde downe verie fewe euident wordes immediately beginning false apostle doctrine accustomed manner subscribing inscribing epistle hand fall touche subscribe owne name inscribe name epistle sent false apostle paule barnabas controuersie declare kind doctrine false prophet til preached vnto church catholique true apostolique doctrine wite wilbe saued must bee circumcised keepe lawe moses thought faith christe without helpe lawe sufficient ynough full absolute iustification made bostes sent hierusalem apostle disciple lord one consent teach doctrine preache saide paul companion barnabas alone schismatiquelike sowe church certein doctrine peculiar selfe touching faith iustifieth without woorkes lawe wherfore apostle streight way beginning epistle declare thinke false teacher vnwarranted doctrine wee confesse saye false teacher went hence hierusalem deny either sent instructed v gaue commandement testifie vtterly false fellowes taught wite apostle disciple lorde preach lawe requisite full iustification yea yet go plainly declare doctrine false apostle trouble saye wordes cumber mindes co maunding circumcised keepe lawe summe therfore doctrine vnlesse man circumcised keepe lawe could saued whereby ascribe saluation keepinge lawe merite workes vnto doctrine apostle attribute two perillous effectes first trouble wordes woordes saye rather amaze appease cofort pacifie mind yea doe trouble yt ye tell beleeue whereto trust moreouer stirre vp strife discordes iarrings amonge wordes apostle doeth paule seeme haue alluded epistle galathians saying marueile gal ye soone turned christ called grace vnto another gospel gospel deede besome trouble inted peruert gospel christ latter effect cuber weaken mindes leane lawe woorkes haue nothinge stable stedfast mindes since lawe requireth moste exact absolute righteousnesse doth thereby kill righteousnesse found v therfore mind weakened subuerted taught leane woorkes lawe lawe man doth keepe right ought therefore paule romanes saith belong vnto lawe heires faith vaine promise made none effect immediately againe therefore heritage giue faith according grace promise may sure seede c false apostle therefore subuerte weaken mindes teachinge saluation gotten lawe verily grieuous iudgement againste teache like also like libertie goe side shewe span opinion paule barnabas yea doe adourne messingers moste holie testimoniall ende maye amonge men haue authoritie men may vnderstand betwixt twaine apostle ful agreement consent doctrine religion wee gathered together one accorde saye haue sent messingers vnto lo false apostle testified sent gaue commaundement men sende doe one accorde giue commaundement whome sende beloued paule barnabas haue testament wee beleeuers newe couenaunt one church one people saued vnder one congregation vnder one testament one manner meanes wit faith christ iesu difference olde newe testament people thus much haue hetherto said touching likenesse agreement vnitie betwixt old newe testament people god wil add somewhat touching diuersitie betwixt thinges wherin differ verie substaunce truly thou canst find diuersitie difference betwixt doth consist maner administration f w accident certeine circumstaces promise doctrine faith chiefe principall lawes annexed certeine external thinges whiche added vntill time amendment whole ecclesiasticall regiment manner teaching doctrine godlinesse outward worship god amonge old father one sort amonge v especiall thing wherin differ may rehearsed sett downe thefe fewe principall poinctes first foremost thing al thing ident newe people couenant tha ere newe couenaunt cleare manifest tha old testam preaching old couenaunt alwayes parte mystie cloudie thing still couered wrapped vpp shadowes dimme sh wes publishing newe testament cleare manifest called light without mystes darckenesse moses vayle couer face neither could child israel behold countenance wee beholding countenance moses nowe vncouered pleasant amiable face christ himselfe doe greatly reioyce see saluation openly reuealed eye sense say disciple happ hee brake w d happie eye see thinges ye see say vnto many prophet kinges desired see thinges ye see sawe heare thinges ye heare heard iust man simeon sense call himselfe happie man liued thereupon promise hee willing die saying lord lettest thou thy seruaunt depart peace according thy woord mine eye haue seene thy saluation thou hast prepared face al people light lighten gentile glorie thy people israel althoughe forefather much light doeth shine v christe since comming fleshe yet little light whiche sufficiet getting saluation faith christ e en wee selues although wee see farre clearelie oure forefather doe notwithstanding behold myste comparison brightnesse wherein hee shall appeare wee shall hereafter see face face glorie maiestie yet notwithstanding euen sighte haue sufficient saluation therefore fine similitude preatily said say althoughe day breake brightnesse sunne great noone day yet wayfarer trauellers doe stay till sunne highest take morning goe iourney haue light enough see way like manner thincke oure forefather euen little portion light morning sufficient leading saith bring imp dimentes eternall felicitie ye meane time haue great cause reioyce christ sunne light righteousnes doth maystie light daye starre lawe shine forth v newe testament moreouer forefather old testament type shadowes figure thing come haue nowe receiued thinge selfe prefigured therfore thinge god promise hath performed giuen v verilie beleeue christ come deliuer faithfull sinnes beleene alreadie come hee hath redeemed v hath fulfilled ye prophet foretold therfore lord gospell said prophet lawe prophecied vnto iohn since time kingdom god preached suffereth violence euerie man whereuppon gathered thinge prefigured come present figure shadowes foreshewe thinges come come end vanishe away therefore yoke burthen whiche father christ hath taken burthen shoulder beare thereby taken neckes worshipping god vse externally busie burthensome aaronicall priesthoode tabernacle temple throughly furnished exquisite thing instrument sundrie sort sacrifice many moe ceremony like vnto nowe coste businesse wee people newe couenaunte freely disburthened set libertie hee wee disburthened iesus christ alone haue thing necessarie life saluation pleased god father recapitulate paul saith bring summe thinges requisite life saluation thinges seemed dispersed christ alone fullie exhibited broughte vnto v christ fulfilling type ceremony whose spirite since wee doe nowe possesse thing prefigured wee haue longer neede representing type shadowes external thinges christe hath ordeined fewe small coste therefore people newe testament doth enioye passing great ample libertie suppose doeth belonge excellent place paul seene galathians handling matter diligently hee fayneth two mother one whereof doth gender bondage vnto libertie doeth vnder type agar sara whiche hee noteth two doctrine law gospell lawe gendreth bondage gospell doth gender vnto libertie therefore lawe gender holie bondage law old testament father prophet vnto bondage abide bondslaues euer might keepe vnder discipline yea yt mighte lead vnto christ full perfection lawe libertie father weight heape ceremony oppressed couered althoughe free spirite lord yet notwithstanding outward shewe differ little nothing bodslaues reason burthen lawe laye vppon shoulder much lawe yet abrogated compelled precisely obserue christe come fulfilled thinges shadowes vanish away heauie yoke taken necke v christian meanes mother sara gendreth v vnto libertie mother v mother whiche also called holy mother church wee haue seede life shee hath fashioned v brought v forth light shee colleth v bosome wherein shee carrieth milke meate meane word god nourish saue bring v vpp nowe bond caucelled people new testament newe without al number middle wal stopp broken downe god doeth liberally rule church reteine longer vnder streite custodie neither people god conteined within boundes land promise dispersed end world neither circumcised keepe lawe people although doubted eue circumcision force hee people amoge getiles iob mo himselfe knowe people whiche doe acknowledge christ although neither circu cised busied lawe new people gathered together world faith holie ghoste new testament hath christ giuen owne name wherin people testament name christ called christian iewes haue none inheritance vnlesse forsake stubborne opinion lawe cleane christ alone without affiaunce lawe bookes prophet fullie fraughted testimony touching calling gentile vnto communion fellowship god also touching reprobation iewes vnreclaymeable affiaunce lawe vtterly reiected furthermore apostle paule putteth difference betwixte giftes new testament ample manifold two testamentes alluding prophecie ieremie sene eighth chapiter epistle hebrues attributeth people new testament certaine excellent gift witt absolute full remission sinnes saith wil merciful vnrighteousnesses remember sinnes iniquity hee doeth also attribute people newe testament exquisite reformation absolute illumination mind saith wil plant lawes mindes write heartes shall teach neighbour brother saying knowe lord shall knowe mee little vnto greate ye law written grauen table stone yet let man thinke father obteined remission sinnes faith free forgiuenesse sinnes god write lawe powre spirite heartes v day saye wee excell knowledge faith either abraham moses samuel dauid esaie daniel zacharias difference father old testamente without remission sinnes illumination holie ghoste wee alone people newe testament haue obteined difference doeth consiste alone breed good holy men day able reckon yt king prince noble men prophet bishop doctours martyr excellent person euery sexe estate age whiche haue beene day bred onely iurie also arabia idumea phenicia mesopotamia persia asia aegypt africa greece italie easte south weste north free remission sinnes preached country kingdomes faithfull euerie nation vnder heauen throughe christ receiued grace fauour god father haue receiued great abundaunce gift holy ghoste haue prophecied haue knowen lord finallie lawe maketh man perfecte gospell simplie maketh perfect doth directly without stopp lead v christe causeth v rest content oure selues alone last slippe ouer difference althoughe little newe promise weight one like vnto may easilie obserued lawe appointing certeine land peculiarly separated nation promise old father possession ye long keep law transgresse lawe threaten rooted vpp vtterly cast good land v one limited lande expressely promised earth lord fulnesse thereof rounde world therein althoughe hee doeth heere assigne v hee oure forefather olde certeine peculiar thinge yet doeth hee time neglecte v hee feedeth blesseth preserueth v euery land nation therfore promise old made oure forefather concerning land promise come end vtterly vanished away age two agoe incite many nation arme themselues recouerie holy land doe seeme haue beene besides witts christ comming world hath sanctified earth euerie nation world sonnes heires god kingdome touching likenesse agreement vnlikenesse difference meane old newe testament people haue therfore spoken briefely beecause haue first sermon first decade sixte sermon third decade alreadie hadled selfe matter finallie haue shortly touched abrogation ye law good ago set foorth two treatise one auncient faith eternall indifferently well settled euery mann memorie thus haue god grace sufferance made end treate god holy law wherin haue beene occupied good sort dayes seuerall sermon blessed bee god oure heauenly father world without end whome beseech blesse v thorough iesus christ lord sauiour amen p christian libertie offence good workes reward thereof p ninthe sermon alreadie many sermon discoursed longe vppon god lawe nowe therefore vppon consideration handling lawe doe arise certaine pointes bee omitted doe depend vppon annexed hand hand vnto lawe sort christian libertie good woorkes reward good woorkes sinne reward punishment sinne wil speake order god shall put mouth shall desire praye vnto mee beseeching suffer speake point holy doctrine thing shall sounde holy vppon abrogation lawe doeth christian libertie depende christian libertie follow effecte abrogating lawe libertie doth minister v occasion speake offence nowe concerning christian libertie holy apostle christ sainct paule hath reasoned verie diligently largely whereby may gather consideration christian libertie neither weighte yet little profite treatise therof especially necessarie v age amonge small number men doe either vnderstand christian libertie else knowe foulie abuse thereby fulfill lustes flesh therefore tell deliuerer setteth v libertie setteth libertie wherein howe farre forth setteth libertie whiche thing knowen wilbe easie matter perceiue christian libertie propertie disposition set libertie howe farre forth must beware giuing office man abusing graunted libertie none deliuerer promised giuen preached vnto v christ iesus sonne god doth deliuer men must himselfe free band wherewith tyed wishe loke set libertie throughout age none bee found world yet heauen iesus christ alone sonne god cause gospell say sonne set libertie ye free deede nowe whome lord deliuereth bondslanes wherefore hee e tha christe doth doeth deliuer bondage doth incorporate libertie sonnes god hee doth set bondseruauntes libertie excluding none owne default owne vnbeleefe disobedience exclude themselues comming sonne god set libertie entangled bondage therefore doth farre forth deliuer v bondseruaunts bondage libertie one opposed contrarie without consideration one wee cannot conceiue meaning wherefore thincke best heere speake much bondage present argument shall seeme require first bondage nothing else bondage state condition wherein bondseruauntes bee nowe bodage either bondman borne else made bondseruauntes child issue bondseruaunts bondslaues borne made bondseruantes made either captiuitie wherevppon take name called captiues pomponius saith slaues therevppon called capitaines commaunded sell monie warres taken captiues souldiours mean spare liues saue bondman latine also called mancipia eo quod ab hostibus manu caperentur taken prisoner hande enimies else made bondslaues ciuil law free man aboue twentie yeares age doeth lucre sake suffer himselfe bee sould monie bondman therefore haue loste libertie doe whoalie hange vppon maisters gouernment whose power lyeth kill list nowe bondage two sortes politique spirituall politique bondage sort bon ge grace preaching gospell taken churche faithfull bee bondman doe duetie doe seruice right doe owe apostle paule saith let euery man walke according called ordeine al church art thou called seruaunt care yet thou mayest free vse rather againe seruauntes obey bodilie maisters feare trembling singlenesse hearte vnto christ eye seruice men pleaser seruauntes christe doinge god heart good seruing lord men knowing soeuer good thinge man doeth shall hee receiue againe lord whether hee bond free epistle timothie hee saith let many seruauntes vnder yoke counte maisters worthie honour name god doctrine bee blasphemed haue beleeuing master despise brother rather doe seruice much beleeuing beloued partaker benefite yet bondage faithfull haue comfort ye preaching gospel howsoeuer bee bond body yet free mind soule ye apostle againe doth say hee called bondman lord lord freeman likewise paradox libertie hee called free bond christ comfort faithful affliction knowe spirite safe free howsoeuer bodie streightly imprisoned sharpely tormented therefore saincts libertie although neuer narrowely looked shutt vpp custodie victorers vanquisher howsoeuer bound oppressed finally enioy exquisite pleasure euen vexed infinite euils knowe child world doe mocke scoffe pleasure libertie faithfull beleeuers though meere dreames fantasi fooles ass god doth soundly pay home scoffes mockerie world come onely also preset life themselues like miserable caytifes beeing extreme captiuitie doe notwithstanding euen slauerie thincke themselues libertie absolute felicitie serue filthie seruice detestable slauerie making themselues bondme abhominable whoredome beastly madd drunkennesse wicked mammon vile pleasure wherein die rott endlesse shame infamie seruice affliction sainctes doe euen affliction enioye libertie reioyce lord apostle paule speaketh saith troubled euery side yet wee made pensiue wee pouertie extreme pouertie wee suffer persecution vtterly forsaken therein wee caste downe wee perish bearing alwayes body dying lord iesus life iesus might also appeare bodie againe thing wee doe cor endeuour shewe oure selues doth become minister christ much suffering affliction necessity sorrowes stripe imprisonmentes sedition labour watchinges fastinges glorie ignominie reproches prayses deceiuers yet speaker trueth vnknowen yet knowen dying loe wee liue chastened killed sorrowfull yet alwayes reioycing poore yet making many riche hauing nothing yet possessing thinges loe heere ye see howe saincces extreme seruitude haue cheerefull consolation alwayes libertie seene infinite example actes apostle ecclesiasticall history nowe wee come second part bondage spirituall bondage hath certaine likenesse bodily seruitude spiri l ondag adam owne fault became bondman wee borne bondman hee libertie lord bee friend fauourer hee dis oyallie reuolte god gost himselfe maister diuell tyraunt cruell maye bee sinne hauing gotten power ouer like mercilesse lord miserablie handle like bond seruaunte nowe wee oure corrupte graundsire borne corrupt sinner sinne also vnder diuels dominion wee danger lawe curse thereof bondslaues sinne wee made subi te sundrie calamity reason sinne therefore called spirituall bondage onely minde man beecause opposition whereby opposed bodilie bondage otherwise sinne hath made oure bodie also subiecte curse neither doe wee sinne minde alone bodie also euery part al member body subiecte vnto sinne infected iniquitie therefore serue miserable bondage beeing vnder abortion made hen woman time deliuered childe diuels dominion wee doe thinges please fleshe egging euil affection bringing forth fruite rather making abortion perill oure liues diuell cruell ouer rigorous maister verilie oure hardest lametable seruitude spiritu l libertie farre forth made free christ bondage nowe side let v see christian libertie say howe farre foorth lord hath made v free one word wee doe briefly say christe oure lord hath deliuered v greeuous bondage wit hee hath farre forth made v free wee sinne slaues bondseruants maye largely expound say sonne god came world hauing first oppressed tyrannie sathan crusshed head death passion hee hath traslated v owne kingdome hath made himselfe oure lord king secondarilie hee hath adopted v sonnes god blessing tooke awaye bitter curse lawe toke awaye sinnes purged faithfull iniquity thirdly hee liberally bestow free gift holy ghoste end sonnes god willingly owne accorde submit themselues god doe thinges lord would haue hatred lawe doeth remaine although weakenesse fleshe abideth still lastly lord king hath taken shoulder electe burthen law type figure coste belonging hath forbidden v set libertie entangle selues againe lawes tradition men layed together make definition christian libertie deliuer make free set libertie bondage hee free manumised beeing deliuered bondage doeth enioye libertie therefore manumission libertie nothing else state made free commoditie saye whiche free made man hath receiued doth enioy reason deliueraunce witt hee deliuered tyrannie sathan sinne curse lawe death made sonne god heire euerlasting life also hath receiued spirite libertie whiche hee doeth wholie giue himselfe bee seruaunte god doe seruice life long lastly beeing deliuered lawe moses lawes mortall men hee doeth altogether depende vppon gospell onely hauing libertie free vse external thinges meate drincke cloathing like indifferent thinges three last rehearsed point doth christia libertie chiefly consiste nowe add testimony scripture shall testimony proue christian libertie better confirme plainely declare exposition first alledge testimony found bookes holie euangelistes extant writinges apostle zacharias priest father iohn baptiste hymne thanckesgiuing luke doeth declare trueth goodnesse god wherein wee lord deliuered enimies visible inuisible longer serue feare serue oure god ioye gladnesse added also manner order howe serue holinesse righteousnesse holinesse doeth cutt caste awaye vncleannesse incontinencie righteousnesse giueth euery man whiche due witt thinges wee duetie doe owe euerie man doeth conteyne bothe freedome beneuolence kinde seruice doe whiche made free serue lord god day two certeine fewe yeares dayes life therefore true christian libertie perpetuall seruice wee owe doe god eighth chapiter saincte iohns gospell iewes whiche made great bragges vaine sillie libertie receiued auncestours christe lord maketh obiection verilie verilie say vnto whosoeuer committeth sinne hee seruaunt sinne seruaunt abideth house euer sonne abideth euer sonne therefore shall make free ye free deede woords hee maketh mention bondage libertie hee bondman sinne cruell maister neuer contented tyrant whosoeuer doeth committ sinne doth obey one bound sinne bondman sonnes men whose punishment haue none inheritaunce father house whiche heauenly hierusalem whiche sonne god restoareth freedome partaker heauenly kingdome fellowe heires sonne god christe maketh none free faithfull therefore sonnes god fellowe heires christ christ sake onely deliuerer made free set libertie neither heauen earth beside christ iesu able set v freedome libertie paule sixte chapiter romanes sayth let sinne reigne mortall bodie ye therunto obey lustes neither giue ye member instrument vnrighteousnes vnto sinne giue selues vnto god aliue dead member instrumentes righteousnesse vnto god sinne shall haue power ouer ye vnder lawe vnder grace wordes exhorteth purged made free christ liue holilie spirituall bondage saith let sinne mortall body saith let sinne reigne mortall bodie reigneth sinne forsoothe sinne reigneth wee obey thorough lust thereof yt resiste doe fulfill lustes fleshe sinne therefore doth reigne mortall bodie longe fealt bodie obeyed permitted rule rather resisted trode vnder foote sentence doth expound somwhat easie vnderstood would haue permit member sinne tyraunt vse instrumentes woorke vnrighteousnesse rather require giue selues bee ruled gouerned god since hee hath set free death brought life againe requisite ye giue member god liuely instrumentes woorke righteousnesse shall ye bee easilie able doe ye vnder lawe vnder grace vppon doth rest chapiter depend vnto end saith hee shall sinne wee vnder lawe vnder grace god forbidde knowe ye whomsoeuer ye commit selues seruauntes obey seruauntes ye whome ye obey whether sinne vnto death obedience vnto righteousnesse god thanked ye seruants sinne ye haue obeyed heart fourme doctrine ye brought vnto made free sinne ye become seruauntes righteousnesse yet sheweth freeman christ abuse libertie giue themselues againe gouerned old tyrannous maister sinne maketh sinne righteousnesse bee two maisters addeth eche hire reward giue seruauntes one life death lastly saith generallie seruaunts whome wee giue selues obey vppon hee inferreth redeemed grace god bondage sinne death whiche rewarde sinne translated bondage righteousnesse whose reward life thereby may liue doth significantly expresse meaning followeth saying speake manner men infirmitie flesh ye haue giuen mebers seruaunts vncleannesse iniquitie vnto iniquitie euen giue member seruauntes righteousnesse vnto holinesse ye seruauntes sinne ye free righteousnesse fruite ye thinges whereof ye nowe ashamed end thinges death nowe ye made free sinne made seruants god haue fruit vnto holinesse ende euerlasting life reward sinne death gift god eternall life thoroughe iesus christe oure lord plaine euident needeth larger exposition mine yet seuenth chapiter next following hee doeth comparison parable fullie expounde hee said woman saith hee whiche subiection man lawe bound man longe hee liueth man liueth shee goe side counted adultresse man dead shee may couple selfe man euen saye wee dead lawe christ died v bodie offered vpp sacrifice oblation cleanse purge oure sinnes might thenceforth bee vnited coupled wee conceiued made childe holy spirite maye trauaile bring foorth deliuered excellent issue holie fruite good work euen serued sinne subiecte vnto oure maister wee brought foorth ill fauoured babe death meane iniquitie wickednesse punishing whereof death appointed ordeined let v heare verie woords holie blessed apostle saying euen brother wee also deade concerning lawe bodie christe wee bee coupled raysed dead wee bring forth fruite vnto god flesh lustes sinne lawe wrought oure member bring forth fruite vnto death wee deliuered law dead vnto wherunto wee bondage wee may serue newenesse spirite oldnesse letter place eighth chapiter romanes vnknowen man saith lawe spirite life thorough christ iesus hath made mee free lawe sinne death manner deliueraunce hee doeth immediately add saying lawe could doe god sending owne sonne forth followeth woordes sufficiently plaine vnderstoode men seuenth chapiter first epistle corinthian hee saith yee bought price doe ye become seruauntes men woordes holy apostle exhorteth seruauntes vnder colour pretence worldly bondage committ anye thinge earthly maisters pleasure whiche soundeth sinceritie repugnant pure religion witt althoughe bee called name seruauntes yet obey wicked lawes vngodly ordinaunces mortall men cause oughte pull draw v redeemed set libertie price christes bloud would therefore bad vnwoorthie thinge wee contrarie effecte oure libertie obey naughtie lawes ordinaunces man also extended stretcheth oute lawes men whiche free fro lawes ordinance men made matter religion fifteenth chapiter holy gospell written euagelist matthewe lord sauiour sayeth vaine doe worship mee teaching doctrine precept men let alone blinde leader blinde apostle paul saith ye dead christe rudimentes world yet liuing world ye ledd tradition touche taste handle doe perishe abusing commaundementes doctrine men thinges haue shewe wisedome superstition humblenesse minde neglecting body honour satisfying flesh first hee sheweth faithfull one christ iesu haue nothing doe decree man inuentions bound obserue men tradition dead tradition christ say christ iesu redeemed set free tradition whiche tradition christe deathe finishe come ende hee make v owne sett v libertie also hee doth imitation counterfaite woordes whiche make decree saye oh touch taste handle three preceptes stretch farre comprehende manye petit decree hee doeth unmediately confute probable argumentes first appoinct worshippe god thinges perish vse thereof kingdome god neither meate drincke doth consiste spirituall thinges whiche entereth mouth doeth defile man secondarilie beecause made god authour goodnesse haue beginning man inuentions vaine doe worshippe mee sayeth lord gospell teaching doctrine preceptes men neither doeth holy apostle saincte paul wincke slylie passe ouer hee aunsweare thinges whiche doe commende tradition first commended shewe appearaunce wisedome seeme haue beene without great wisedome ordeined wise menne doe fittlie serue euerye person time place earnest defender men tradition crie saye oure auncestours weee fooles lawes full wisedome ieremie cryeth side saying haue reiected woord god therefore wisedome bee cause tradition commended greekes nonlatin alphabet say chosen kinde worshippe wee owne braynes haue chosen taken oure selues serue god worship men gladly willingly receiue tradition men agreeable inclination yea christ holie gospell sayth ye beene world world would haue loued owne nowe haue chosen worlde world doth hate againe hee saith whiche men set great store abhominable vnto god moreouer men tradition commended humilitie vnderstoode two manner respectes first said humilitie man doe readily obey easilie yeeld vrged obtruded thrust vpon men countenaunce authoritie secondarilie lawes men seeme exercise humblenesse keepe men humilitie obedience humilitie may rather bee called sacrilege ruled directed woord god thinge whereby alone tempered squared doth transferre conueighe ouer honour god god men last men tradition commended neglectinge fleshe oh discipline chasticemente fleashe seemeth goodlye thinge whiche wantonnesse flesh somewhat brideled tamed finallie apostle addeth honour satistyinge care body fleshe say whiche thinges although haue shewe religion holinesse haue notwithstanding verie deede honour considering externall thing ordeined god ease releefe menns necessity yea paul doth flatly finde fault decree giue bodie honour satisfying according measure body necessitie moderate care looking bodie permitted also commanded least wee perhapps muche lacke neerenesse marre bodie make vnapt doe good woorkes neither care flesh place forbidden vnlesse tend lustes sensualitie wherfore apostle saith cherish flesh vnto concupiscence therefore god hath graunted man necessitie vse meate drincke sleepe cloathing reste alloweable pleasure thinges necessarie fourth chapiter galathians saincte paule saith fullnesse time come god sent sonne borne woma made vnder lawe redeeme vnder lawe wee mighte receiue adoption right inheritaunce child nowe ye sonnes god hath sent spirite sonne heartes cry abba father wherfore thou art seruant sonne thou sonne thou art also heire god thoroughe christ immediatly againe stand faste libertie wherewith christe hath deliuered v bee againe wrapped yoke bondage second hebrues hee saith christe made partaker fleshe bloud v ende throughe death might expell lordship ouer death diuell hee might deliuer feare death life time daunger bondage thus hope testimony scripture suffice purpose thinges wel weighed christ throughly considered plainely teache kinde libertie haue whiche made free christ propertie inclination witt religious altogether giuen holy thinges say point addicted spirite without whiche libertie al sonnes god alwayes gouerned lord free men doe diligently beware doe vnaduisedly offend man libertie vainely abuse purchased freedome haue continuallie mind eye weightie saying holie apostle lord christe iesu sainct peter second chapter first epistle saith free hauing libertie cloake maliciousnesse euen seruauntes god paule hath brother ye haue beene called vnto libertie onely let libertie occasion flesh loue serue one free haue made mee selfe seruaunte maye winne therefore specially abuse christia libertie seeking carnall thing vnder colour pretence spirite libertie doe make bragges preachinge gospell set free bodily debtes dueties therefore denye maisters creditours magistrate prince dutie owe meanes reuolting rebelling againste fellowes seditious stirrer reuerencers euangelical doctrin paule crieth giue euery one due tribute whome tribute belongeth custome whome custome due feare feare honour whome honour doeth appertaine owe nothing ye loue one another moreouer also abuse christian libertie haue receiued spirite libertie sonnes god yet deliuered satan iustified christ notwithstanding promise libertie men think opinion haue conceiued libertie maye whatsoeuer pleaseth yt meanes gainsaying good lawes seuere discipline exclamation outcry libertie lawes intrapped betrayed trode vnder foote especially teacher vaine pernicious libertie sainct peter taketh stomach saith welles without water clowdes carried tempest whome myste darknesse reserued euer haue spoken great swelling wordes vanitie entice lustes voluptuousnesse fleash suche cleane escaped wrapped errour promise libertie wher selues bondseruaunts corruption whome man ouercome vnto brought bondage foorth followeth licentiousnesse nowe men doe manner abuse libertie licentious lust worthie called name libertie last doe abuse christian libertie whosoeuer abuse thinges indifferent haue regarde weake brother offende vnaduisedly wee must therefore case alwayes haue minde notable saying sainct paule thing lawful mee thinges expedient thing lawfull mee thing edifie touching matter bee seene fourteenth chapter paules epistle written romanes occasion yea rather offenc compelled necessitie speake little much shall requisite godly disposed knowe touching offence scandalu worde latines borrowe greekes doth signifi fallinge tripping stumbling blocke offence let hinderance stone streate sticke vpp higher rest ginnes purpose subtily sett hidde snare feete passe ouer doe either light stumble doe fall else turned streight path kinde snare stumbling bl ck metaphore transferred estate religion manner giueth offence whosoeuer doth ouerthwart foolishe vnseasonable wordes deedes either saye another man thinge whereby taketh occasio sinne therefore scandalum occasion giuen sinne doe wickedly verie impulsion driuing fall wickednesse define scandalum offence ioyned contempt offence doth vsually drawe contempt may say also offence doth rise vpon contempt conclude therefore put iniurie offered one man another nowe wee offende men either howe meanes offence giuen woordes else deedes offence giuen wordes partely euil foolish vnseasonable doctrine partely daily talke communication greatest offence doth arise wicked doctrine directly contrarie true doctrine ye holie gospell nexte offence doeth arise foolishe vnseasonable doctrine though deriued worde god notwithstandinge either vnaptly vttered vnwisely applyed preacher may sinne either much sufferinge lenitie else much sharpnesse ouerthwart wai wardnesse hearer beeing offended wholie drawe back hearing gospell yet light gospel must bee hidden trueth sliely winked men wilbe offended preacher must diligence take heede woorde god bee wisely set foorth aptly dispensed soeuer thinges lawes god must moste constantly accused without feare moste diligently confuted howsoeuer worlde worldlinges storme nowe daily talke cause brother stumble whosoeuer let toungues runne loose talke care pleasure without aduise babble care howe sorte filthie speech ribaulorie especially blasphemous wordes vnreuerently vttered god holie scripture article faith euil wordes corrupt good manner exclude letter writinges men doe vnaduisedly offend brother lastly stumbling blockes offence laide many men either promise else threatenings often meane alluring inticements many faire promise else terrible threates torment turned right path trueth bywayes errours pharao laye stone offence king zedechias causing make league meanes truste power aegypt mightie hand god tyrauntes doe often time giue weake christian cause offence torment driue deny ye name maister christ deedes whereby men offended bee two sortes saye either lawfull free choice else vnlawfull vtterly forbidden v euen lawfull deedes abuse made vnlawfull lawfull faithfull eate luste cleane thinges cleane thy eatinge made vnlawfull thou doest eate offence thy weake brother doeth vnderstande lawfull eate indifferently euery kinde thinge thou knowest verie wel thou eatest hee bee offended yet notwithstanding thou doest eate despise assure thy selfe dooing thou giuest cause offence sinnest little thy weake brother wee adde vnseasonable vsing free thing indifferent ye must note doctours churche doe diligently weklings distinguish make difference betwixt weake brother stubborne person weakelinges vtterly ignorant point religion yet notwithstanding tractable enough feare lorde erring purpose malicious ouerthwartnesse touched certeine weakenesse faith religion suffering themselues neuerthelesse willingly bee instructed apostle saith weake faithe receiue ye strife disputation stubborne obstinate people knowe trueth libertie sainctes notwithstandinge harden mindes set selues againste trueth libertie know desiringe haue muche graunted euery man beare much doe euer meane giue place truth ende occasion graunted maye last subuerte trueth christian libertie steede thereof set vpp trifle superstitious vanity men lorde speaketh gospell saying let alone blinde leader blinde paule seconde chapter galathians saith titus beeing greeke circumcised incommers beeing false brother came priuily spie libertie haue christ iesus might bring v bondage whome muche houre wee gaue place subiection trueth gospell might continue moreouer place bee referred difference offence giuen offence taken men doe verie wisely make betwixte giuing taking offence offence giuen thy faulte thy importunitie saye thy lightnesse thou either doest sayest thing thy brother hath cause bee offended kinde offence giuen taken picked thy faulte malice wickednesse another man example thou doest sinne neither woorde deede thy deedes nothing insolent thy woordes vnseasonable thou either sayest doest thing free lawfull thee saye yet another taketh pepper nose offended libertie thine one man walketh plaine pathe shoulde happe trippe stumble presently quarell companion though hee layed blocke waye nowe vnlawfull forbidden deedes wherewith men offended doe tende god lawes done contrarie seemlinesse equitie right reason stirre vpp others imitate like reuels desire ill rule suche idolatrie murther whoredome couetousnesse pride luxurie wicked king ieroboam set vp golden calues bee stumblinge blocke vnto people israel like manner doe many drunken tippling ouerneece brauerie gawdie apparaile offend others also make worse ill example drawe like foolishe vanity finally giue offence verie giue offence great sin great sinne saying lord gospel affirmeth matthewe saith wo vnto worlde offence must needes offence come wo man offence commeth whosoeuer offendeth one little one beleeue mee better milstone hanged necke hee drowned deapth sea paule apostle speaking brother giue offence doeth saye thy giuing offece perisheth thy brother whome christ died againe ye sinning againste brother wounding weake conscience sinne christ selfe bee deuised heynous sinne christ let v therefore take heede abusing christian libertie giue occasion offence weake wayes thinges doe belong charitie last must especially confirme mindes enimies offence gospel gospel gospell ceasse daily lay innumerable heapes offence vppon preacher zealous follower euangelical doctrine ye saye cause broyles sedition warres hurly burlies wherewith world day disquieted offensiue outeries saye wee must confirme mindes notable saying christe gospell came sende peace sworde come set man variaunce father daughter mother daughter lawe mother lawe mannes foe shalbe owne houshold wee must call remembrance laye eye notable example prophet apostle king achab saide helias prophet hee disturber plague kingdome prophet replyeth king troubler countrie rebellious iewes obiected ieremie since ye time began leaue worship idol god hearken ye preaching worde god neuer one iott felicitie mishappes troupe fell one vppon anothers necke obiection answered misfortune light vppon sinnes especially rebellion vnthankfulnesse sake vnbeleeuing iewes thessalonica cryed paule silas saying fellowes haue troubled whole worlde come hither also paule speaking iewes enimies persecutours saide haue killed lord iesus owne prophet doe persecute v please god aduersaries men resisting v preach gospell vnto gentile saluation may stil fulfil sinnes last endlesse anger god may fall vppon saying like let faithfull think vppon haue mindes let perseauer stil constancie patience spread abroade doctrine gospell howsoeuer world doth freate cast offence way thus much hitherto touching offence remaineth promise beginning saye somewhat good oorkes ende sermon concerning good woorkes wee haue learned christian libertie licentiousnesse adoption number sonnes god bestowe life vppon studie godlynesse vertues wee haue learned lawe god rule doctrine good workes course order therefore doth require haue somewhat saide touching good workes first let v determine wor verie true certeine signification workes worde vsed diuersly ample signification workes labour busie exercise menne get liuings paule commaundeth euery man woorke owne handes lawe forbiddeth v doe woorke sabboth day israelite oppressed aegypt harde wearisome worke toyle also workemen whome lorde gospell commaundeth paye hire due woorke also thing made expressed artificer workeman prophet ieremie speaking potter saith made worke vpon wheele moreouer woorke doth signifie office duetie paul saith worke meaning office euangelist holy ghoste speaking church antioche saith separate paule barnabas woorke whereunto haue chosen furthermore workes lorde mightie deedes god whereby doeth declare power goodnesse vnto men significatio heauen earth man selfe saide ye workes god hand workes also benefites god bestowed vppon v men gospel saith haue shewed manye good workes haue said haue done many good turnes also euil workes meane workes iniquitie wherevppon men called woorkers iniquitie whose deedes woorkes fleshe darknesse againe good workes meane sundrie vertues fruites faith sorte iustice temperaunce charitie patience hope c lorde gospell saide let light shine beefore men may see good workes glorifie father heauen apostle saith wee made good workes walke called fruites repentance woorkes worthie repentance called ye work light fruites spirite workes humanitie beneuolence charitie suche commended tabitha read haue beene full good work paule saith let v woorke good haue time especially houshold faith like worke humanitie charitie marie bestowe vppon christe sauiour saide hath wrought good worke mee beeing thus declared wee nowe describe good woorkes colour quality good workes deedes action good workes wrought regenerate spirite god faith according worde god glorie god honestie life profite neighbour briefe description prosecute partes expounde well lorde shall giue mee grace first proofe shewe none welspringe originall cause good workes whence good workes flowe god selfe author good thinges prophet saith men lyars god alone doth speake trueth lorde gospell saith none good god alone good woorkes therefore must haue beginning man lyar corrupt god selfe welspring goodnesse god doeth spirite faith christe iesus renue al men regenerate doe longer owne workes fleshe ye workes spirite grace god selfe woorkes regenerate doe growe vpp good spirite god within spirite euen sappe giueth strength tree bring foorth fruite doth like manner cause sundrie vertues budde braunch v men lorde selfe doth gospell testifie saye vine ye braunches braunche cannot beare fruite selfe vnlesse abide vine cannot ye also vnlesse ye abide mee whosoeuer abideth mee hee bringeth foorth much fruite without mee ye nothing ye cause referred whereas wee say good worke done faith faith gift god whereby wee laye holde christe throughe wee iustified quickened scipture saith iust shal liue faith another place saith paule faith christe dwelleth heartes againe liue yet christe liueth mee life liue fleshe liue faith sonne god loued mee gaue selfe mee nowe liueth doeth workes life doubt whome quickened iustified doeth woorkes righteousnesse iustified righteous christe woorke righteousnesse righteousenesse conteineth whole companie vertues god alone remaineth stil onely welspring author good woorkes let v nowe see testimony scripture wee may euidently learne workes regenerate attributed god selfe spirite faith doeth woorke heartes regenerate moses testifieth saying lord shall blesse thee lorde thy god shal circumcise thy hearte heart thy seed thou maist loue lorde thy god thy hearte thy soule thou maist liue lo cause ye godly men doe rightly loue lorde doth proceede circumcision heart praye doth circumcise hearte beside lorde prophet esaie doeth plainly saye thou lorde shalt ordeine peace euen thou haste wrought workes v gospell sainct iohn sauiour saith worketh veritie commeth light workes may seene wrought god againe whosoeuer abideth mee bringeth foorth much fruite without mee ye nothing paule also philippian saith giuen christe onely beleeue also suffer yet againe plainly god woorketh doe accordinge good purpose minde likewise also sainct iames saith euerie good giuing euerie perfecte gifte aboue commeth father lightes moreouer sainct peter ascribing partes good woorkes god deeth saye god grace hath called eternall glorie christe iesus restore vpholde strengthen stablishe wee able paule place saith selues thinke thinge selues abilitie god therefore god alone remayneth still onely welspring good workes whome spring head good work flowe sainctes sundry streames chanels yet waye muste added good woorkes although doe deede proceede god verie true proper phrase speeche fruites spirite faith notwithstanding also sayde bee saye woorkes faithfull men partely god worketh v vseth ministerie dooing partely wee faith sonnes god therefore made brother ioyntheires wt iesus christ right inheritaunce workes god v god giftes beginne anothers owne proper woorkes yea verie scripture doeth attribute v vnto sonnes freeborne child lorde gospell saith seruaunt abideth house euer sonne abideth euer therefore thinges father house right inheritance title proprietie come sonne although sonne hath gotten owne industrie gathered owne labour hath receiued liberalitie parent euen workes god doth woorke v v god gift bestowed vppon v saide owne sonnes houshold adoption therefore lawful heires wherefore signe verie vnthankfull minde adopted sonne beeing forgetfull father beneficence liberalitie make bragges good hee enioyeth right inheritaunce gotten come owne labour trauaile whereuppon paule saide verie religiously hast thou thou hast receiued thou hast receiued doest thou yet boast though thou receiuedst verie well thought holy martyre christe sainct cyprian wont saye boast thing wee haue nothinge owne place belongeth saying prophet esaie shall axe boast heweth shal sawe brag draweth verily instrumentes tooles god chapter doth saye grace giuen doe merites begin good grace grace bee taken awaye man doth fall set vp cast downe headlong free wil wherefore man beginneth haue good workes hee must attribute selfe easily vnderstande howe manner scripture doeth attribute righteousnesse vnto oure merites haue another place sufficiently declared againe saye somewhat come treatise gospel faith woorkes doeth iustifie v sight god especiall point chiefe foundation euangelical apostolicall doctrine workes generally either work nature fleshe else workes lawe else workes faith grace nowe workes nature fleshe iustifie co demne v borne fleshe fleshe luste fleshe death enimitie god ye apostle thought saide touching woorkes lawe declare former sermon woorkes lawe saith shal fleshe iustified beat examin workes grace faith wee shal finde haue beene done faithfull iust men whereupon manifest iustification alwayes goe beefore workes righteousnesse ye iust man doth worke righteousnesse ye righteousnesse fruite ye iust bring forth man verily iustified freely grace woorkes followe iustification may saide ye scripture saith euen abraham father beleeue iustified woorkes grace faith liued yeres lawe beleeued god true faith excellent workes yet woorkes faith hee iustified paule doth plainly argue thus abraham iustified workes hath wherein boast god saith scripture abraham beleeued god counted vnto righteousnesse worketh rewarde reckoned grace dutie worketh beleeueth iustifieth vngodly faith counted righteousnesse nowe whereas wee conclude also shalbee iustified according example abraham faith workes wee ground conclusion vppon owne mindes vppon apostle doctrine saith neuerthelesse written onely faith imputed righteousnesse written v also whome shalbe reckoned wee beleeue christ touching matter haue alreadie disputed sixte sermon first decade verily persuaded doctrine apostle euangelistes ought bee laide vp bottome euery faithfull heart wee iustified grace god merites faith workes wee vrge repeate good workes doctrine vnto people saide many patrones naughtinesse vtter enimies al good workes vertues wee preaching doctrine faith doeth iustifie contemne good woorkes thinke superfluous wee saye good cry vppon abuse good woorkes corrupt doctrin good work defiled leauen phariseis teache good woorkes wee haue set sale bought cannot tell order bargaining wil haue man put confidence wee almightie neither manye thinke separate good woorkes faith doctrine workes faith seuered cleaue together closely may bee yet notwithstanding iustification properly ascribed faith workes workes consist worthinesse faith doth leane promise god setteth v righteousuesse life onely begotten sonne god christ iesus sauiour christe sufficiently able self owne power vertue iustifie beleeue name without ayde helpe winke mennes obiection freely confesse sense scripture doth attribute iustification vnto good workes scripture sorte attribute life iustification vnto good work scripture contrary selfe therefore must searche examine sense howe life iustification ascribed woorkes sainct augustine dooth aunswere obiection hee referreth workes vnto grace god booke de gratia et libero arbitrio eighth chapter hee writeth eternall life duetie giuen good work scripture doth moste plainly testifie saying beecause god rewarde euery man according workes howe eternall life grace consideringe grace giuen due workes freely without desertes apostle paule doth say worketh reward reckoned grace duetie againe remnant saith hee saued election grace immediately addeth grace nowe workes grace grace howe eternal life gotten workes gift else apostle say euerlastinge life gifte yes verily saide plainly cannot denye neither word obscure require sharpe vnderstander attentiue hearer saide rewarde sinne death addeth streightwayes gift god life euerlasting iesu christ lorde mee thinketh therefore question bee none otherwise resolued vnlesse wee vnderstand euen good workes eternall life giuen must referred grace gift god lord iesus saith without mee ye nothing apostle saide ye saued grace faith doeth presently adde selues gifte god workes lest man shoulde boast thus much hitherto saincte augustine nowe although aunswere sainct augustine godly plain enough simply searcheth trueth yet sure neuer bee aunswered wil knowe go vppon sainct augustine whic nto w kes wordes inferre work faith alone iustifie v men thus argue wee iustified doe obteine eternall life grace good workes doe belong grace god therefore good workes iustifie v nowe amisse cloase buckle hande hande disputers little ye may perceiue bee meere shiftes sophistrie set sale vnder name colour verie sounde argument firste man foolishe hee hath read doctrine sainct paule knoweth verie well two proposition cannot hang together wee iustified grace iustified workes sentence saincte paule cleare sunne saith grace nowe workes grace grace wee freely graunt proposition wite iustified grace woorkes belong grace god gifte god wee denye consequence say false wite workes iustifie true may like manner truely saye man doth see hande doeth belong vnto man therevppon inferre therefore hande doth see would gather vaine consequent doe vnderstande man doeth consist sundrie member euery member hath effectes office againe knoweth grace god whiche otherwise vndiuided diuided distinguished according diuerse operation worketh god certeine generall grace whereby created mortall menne hee sendeth raine vppon iust vniust grace doth iustifie wicked vniust iustified againe singular grace whereby doeth onely begotten christe sake adopt v bee sonnes doth meane adopt beleeuers onely whose sinnes hee reckoneth doeth impute righteousenesse onely begotten sonne sauiour grace doeth alone iustifie v verie deede moreouer grace beeing powred mindes doth bringe foorth good woorkes iustified grace doeth iustifie doeth ingender fruites righteousenesse iustified therefore confesse graunt good woorkes belong grace certeine manner order facion againe obiect saye grace faith woorkes iustification also sanctification ioyned together cannot seauered one another therefore thinge agreeth one also applyable vnto verilye neither dare doe case gainesaye faith woorkes cleaue together vtterly denye twaine one thing attributed one may also bee applyed vnto faith although bee weake vnperfect v doeth notwithstandinge leane staye vppon christe perfection alone farre foorth doth iustifie v workes haue vse myledest phrase speache sprinkling vice sparckle errour beecause originall disease naturall v followeth therefore grace god polluted vice fault necessitie followe consequently reason streight knott betwixte property one common although light sunne bee separated heate therof yet light heate neither good consequence saye sunne giueth light worlde therefore heate sunne giueth light worlde sunne heate light cannot separated yea rather sunne respecte light doth lighten worlde respect heate hath yet sunne doeth warme lighten earth like manner wee freely iustified mercifull grace god christe sake lord sauioure respect consideration work grac found v although woorkes ingendred brought forth free grace must attribute glorie wholy grace god parte stake take owne share parte glorie wrangler haue yet another shifte saye although saye eternall life giuen god faithfull beleeuers faith onely christ iesus also workes faith glorie neuerthelesse shall redounde god namely since acknowledge confesse workes wrought v power grace god answere glorie must giuen god doth please haue giuen purpose counsell god receiue v friendship workes sake spirite grace doeth bring foorth v vnaduisedly without discretion haue sent onely begotte sonne worlde rashly haue appointed terrible pangues bitter death god hath created either heauen earth much lesse case greatest belongeth man chiefe excellent creature hath made neuer time doe thing rashely without greate aduisement wherefore assuredly certeine neuer counsell purpose god good woorkes vertues redeeme v tyrannie satan accept v sonnes sacrifice satisfaction onely begotten sonne christe iesus oure lorde sauiour iudgement paule matter remaineth firme inuincible hee saith righteousnesse come workes lawe christe die vaine diuine saying sainct peter remaineth euer vncomptroleable saluatio none againe doe laye certeine place scripture together therevpon argue thus although paule one place doth saye ye saued grace faith yet another place paule doth saye saued hope knoweth hope vpheld strengthened patience christ selfe gospell agreeing therevnto saying patience ye shal possesse soules therefore faith onely hope patience doe bring v saluation aunswere thus holie apostle doeth sufficiently expound selfe man take paine read weigh selfe end cause spake euery seuerall sentence ye saith saued grace faith selues gifte god woorkes least man boast c hath fewe wordes euidently declared beleefe touching grace faith workes would desire plainer speeche none verie dorrhead hee vnderstandeth benefite saluation wholie merely ascribed grace hee doeth diuide saluation iustificatio partly faith grace partely woorkes neither doeth hee attribute firste place faith seconde place woorkes hee doeth vtterly exclude boasting ye saith saued grace faith immediately hee addeth youre selues hee annexeth cause gifte god againe workes sheweth least man boast hee vnderstandeth doth vndoubtedly vnderstand nothing speake wresteth otherwise cauilleth doth speake againste sunne saith light darknesse nowe whereas ye apostle doeth another place saye saued hope marking whole place gathered meaning hee saide told beleeue christ sonnes heires god haue thereby saluation felicitie woulde haue euery one vnderstande hope expectation enioying thinge selfe present fruition nowe herevppon inferre therefore hope doth iustifie rather make argument patience patience vnlesse patient man firste iustified true faith therefore commendation patience doth wholy depende vppon faith praise faith vpon patience although faith declared shewed forth patience t sentence vtterly vnworthie come christian mannes mouth saye faith made perfect good workes say faith doth want piece good workes patch vp wee name faith wee doe name simplie qualitie beleeuing min e wee haue eye christe selfe lorde sauiour together righteousnesse heauenly giftes vppon whome alone vppon base sure foundation faith doeth rest firmely stande go supply want thinge christe iesus nothing else diuelish blasphemie disgrace sonne god faith sainctes confesse doth declare shewe selfe woorkes followeth vppon workes therefore make perfect seemeth wanting christ perfectio nothinge lacking deliuerance redemption iustification wrought christ apostle iames saye deede seest thou howe faith made perfect workes meaning none say seest thou howe faith workes followed declare selfe true righteous faith hypocriticall faith woordes saide seest thou howe faith effectuall workes againe apostle paule saide fulfill lacking affliction christe fleshe body sake church may better translate greeke nonlatin alphabet rather behinde lacking affliction christ greekes call nonlatin alphabet thinges wanting also remnant word sainct ambrose also vsed meane remnant thinges remaining behinde sainct peter saith christ suffered v leauing behinde example v wee might followe trace footesteppes therefore apostle affirmeth suffering fulfilled remnaunt behinde againe alledge wordes apostle paul obiection saith haue faith remoue mountaines place yet haue charitie nothing vpon inferre therefore faith onely also charitie yea rather charitie faith doth iustifie say paul sentence doth neither denye faith alone doth iustifie yet doeth attribute iustification sainctes charitie affirm iustified faith wee make faith cause iustification thing must often repetition beaten memory wee vnderstand faith vertue v doth worke ye qualitie sticketh v doeth merite righteousnesse sight god often wee make mention faith wee vnderstande grace god exhibited christe whiche faith freely applyed v receiued free gifte god bestowed vppon v sense doeth paule vse name faith affirmeth faith doth iustifie place thirteenth chapter corinthian hee doth take name faith putteth power workinge miracle manifest followeth saith remoue mountaines faith doeth comprehende christe wholie onely power shewing miracle therefore may sometime vniust man hypocrite iudas iscariot faithe miracle profited nothing hee without iustifying faith faith neuer without selfe ingendreth charitie againe whereas obiect saying gospell saincte iohn whosoeuer knoweth commaundementes keepeth loueth mee father loue wil come make abidinge therefore obseruation commaundements woorkes sake g ioyned v againe alledge saying euangeliste apostle iohn wee knowe weabide v hath giuen v spirite spirit god free gifte therfore wee ioyned god meere free grace followeth iohn wee haue seene testifie father hath sent sonne bee sauiour worlde thou hearest hope worlde saued christ sauiour worlde nowe knoweth hee sent vnto v father meere onely grace god followeth nowe howe grace receiued whosoeuer confesseth iesus sonne god god abideth god sixte iohn steede confesseth put beleeueth merueile since true faith true confession doth arise faith therefore saued faith wee ioyned vnto god letting passe wrangler neuer bee without store sophistical shift againe returne purposed argument shewe howe sense life iustification attributed workes well exercised reading holie scripture place f faith work eeme sigree may reconcile place scripture seeme blushe bee discorde teache faith work verie deede separated one another holie spirite giueth faith doth therwithall also regenerate vnderstanding faithfull doeth ardently desire indeuour thing doe seruice god maker therefore vnseparable knott betwixt faith good workes alwayes keepe company attende vpon faith saye iustification somtimes somewhat vnproperly attributed workes somewhat properly bee attributed faith moste properly ascribed christe apprehended faith verie deede foundation subiect faith yet assaye make manifest true faith two thinges considered reconciliation obedience reconciliation faith wee vnderstande verily beleeue god reconciled v christe sake whome wee adopted number sonnes god obedience reconciled doe wholie yelde selues whome bee reconciled carnest desire zeale doe pleasure wee saye faith two sortes iustifying ye obeying faith iustifying faith sainct paul maketh mention saith beeing iustified saith haue peace toward god lorde iesus christe whome wee reconciled againe hee maketh mention obeying faith hee saith knowe yee whome yee giue selues seruauntes obey seruauntes ye whome ye obey whether bee sinne vnto death obedience vnto righteousenesse saye obedience maketh doe thinges righteous bee seruauntes righteousenesse shall turne eternall life seruauntes sinne turneth vnto death nowe therefore iustification properly attributed reconciling righteousenesse christe iesus improperly ascribed obeying righteousenesse righteousenesse obedience obeying righteousenesse reconciling without reconciling righteousnesse obedience shoulde bee called righteousenesse also bee added iustified doe put confidence obedience alwayes spotted worlde reason fleash also agreeth explication annexe moste proper woorke faith purification sanctification sainct peter doeth expressely saye faith heartes purified sanctification holie scripture doe shewe two especiall thinges firste faithfull freely purified bloud christe iesus againe ye peter saith ye knowe redeemed transitorie thinges golde siluer precious bloud christe vnspotted lambe sainct paule saith ye sanctified god oblation bodie iesus christ made one oblation made perfecte euer whiche sanctified sainct iohn also saith bloud iesus christ sonne god doth cleanse v al sinne therefore moste proper phrase speech saye sanctified faith bloud christe saide sanctifie selfe also may bee sanctified trueth latter sanctified bloud christe faith doe day day sanctifie selues giue mindes holynesse studie whereof apostle doe moste earnestly exhorte sainctes peter saith hee called holie ye also holie conuersation written bee ye holie holie sainct paule saith god euen holinesse c thessal sainct iohn saith nowe wee sonnes god yet doth appeare shal wee knowe shal appeare shalbe like wee shal see euery one hath hope purifieth selfe euen also pure nowe purging purification made care industrie called name sanctification made v selues made sanctified bloud christe respecte christe bloud vnlesse sanctification verie true onely sanctification deede goe sanctification meane whiche worke none go oures imputed sanctification although meane spottes sinne remaining v doe defile put confidence therefore often thou shalt reade holy scripture righteousnesse attributed good woorkes thou shalt thinke streightwayes done none cause haue hitherto alreadie declared vnto thee apostolical spirite cannot repugnant contrarie selfe wil yet made great deale manifest call remembraunce doe consider apostle deale two kindes men one sorte whereof affirme sufficiently able owne strength satisfie fulfill lawe coulde desertes good woorkes merite eternall life yea affirmed merite christe sufficient enoughe gettting saluation vnlesse righteousnesse men added therevnto paule disputed verie constantly pithiely epistle made christe grace god none effect sorte men abusing stles gain abuse grace faith doctrine grace faith wallowe like swine filthie sinnes beecause thought sufficient vnto saluation saye beleeued neuer declared faith beleefe good woorkes although occasion therevnto giuen peter well wisely dispute chap epistle iames chap epistle hee affirmeth abraham iustified faith onely workes say iustified vaine opinion faith bare full good woorks iames doeth vse name faith iustification one sense paule another paul putteth faith assured confidence merite christ hee vseth iustification absolution remission sinnes adoptio number sonnes god lastly imputing christ righteousnes vnto v iames faith doth signifie vaine opinion iustification doth import imputing righteousnesse declaring righteousnesse adoption vndoubtedly true holy apostle christ peter iames would writinges make voyde grace merite christ aduaunce merites mortall men rather withstand vnpurenesse put faith christ perill disgracing offence good men liuing meane wickedly detestable sinnes without repentaunce therefore apostle christ requiring good workes handes faithfull doe first require true liuelie faith doe referre vnto grace god let v therefore firmely hold apostle doe attribute iustification life saluation good workes improperly true faith properly properly christ subiecte foundation true faith although true faith without good woorkes yet doeth iustifie without good work selfe alone certaine life saluatio bestowed v maner health life giuen child israel whiche wildernesse poysoned serpent health restored workes onely beholding loking vppon brasen serpent therfore also made partaker eternall life faith alone true holding looking vp christ moses deed cannot newe deriued euangelicall apostolicall doctrine albeit doctor church gainesay denie therefore giue eare euen best word onely say write also proofes shewe faith alone doth iustifie origen ancient writer vppon chap epistle origen cap ad rom sainct paul ye romanes doth say paul saith iustificatio faith alone sufficient man euery one doeth beleeue onely iustified although workes wrought require example euer iustified faith alone wtout good workes theefe suppose example good enough crucified christ crie crosse ord iesu remember mee thou commest thy kingdome writinges euangelistes mention made good worke whiche hee life time yet faith onely iesus said vnto verilie say vnto thee day thou shalt bee mee paradise therefore theefe thoroughe faith iustified without workes lawe whome thou art seruant finally signifieth crime guilte whereby wee indaunger oure selues rodd punishment verilie augustine taketh much definition sinne paine finde proper definition sinne second booke de co sensu euangelistarum sayeth sinne transgression lawe ad simplicianum lib sinne inordinatenesse peruersenesse man turning excellent creatour turning inferiour creature de fide contra manichaeos cap hee sayeth else sinne erre preceptes truth truth selfe againe contra faustum manichaeum lib cap sinne deede woord wishe lawe god augustine de duabus animabus cotra manichaeos cap sayeth sinne wil reteine obteine whiche iustice forbiddeth free absteine retract lib cap sayeth motion minde without compulsion either loose else obteine one thinge whiche definition doe vtterly reiecte doe wishe bee considered thought reste sinne naturall corruption manhinde action whiche ariseth contrarie lawe god whose wrath death sundrie punishment bringeth vppon v thou hearest howe well definition doeth consist vppon partes thou hearest natural corruption naming whereof appeareth definition doeth agree sinne first parent whome naturall corruption meane speake place conuenient thou hearest action named whiche ariseth natural corruption repugnaunt lawe god thou hearest sinne doeth bring vppon v wrath god death sundrie sort punishment appointed mouth god plague v sinnes wil speake order lye farre foorth lord shall giue mee grace abilitie therefore seemeth treatise maye aptly bee begonne discussing originall cause beginning sinne bee doe deriue originall cause euill sinne influence planet saying sinned borne vnder vnluckie planet sinne rebuked make aunsweare diuel fault haue committed greeuous crime sometime laying side excuse doe directlye cast blame vppon god saye god would bee hee bee staffe staye falling lawe declareth would haue doe sheweth wisheth death destruction adam teacheth may escape death liue felicitie perfect happinesse cause also hee prouided lawe plaine easie onely grace god therefore withdrawing god grace hardening mannes hearte wee leafte vnto selues wee hardened pharao king aegypt murthering israelitish infant tyrannie many vice horribly committed lawe nature offende eye god moste iust heauenly maiestie therefore meruaile hee hardened heart man admitt receiue exposition yet denye god scripture doeth vse kindes phrase manner speech nowe wont saye father doeth much cockering ouer gentle dealing marre harden sonne maketh stubborne stiffen cked yet father doth teder destroy saue ye sonne deede abuse father clemencie doeth destroye harden selfe therfore wheras ye sonne hardened cometh owne father fault although father beare name haue hardened made past grace verily thou doest diligently consider historie pharao thou shalte oftener finde sentence repeated god hardened pharaos heart namely benefite god hardned pharao hart deliuerie euil wrought though scripture shoulde haue saide benefite deliuering euil god harden ye heart pharao hee
