ye calling moses saye knowe king aegypt let departe againe see thou signes wonder haue put thy hande pharao harden pharaos heart shall let people goe saying doe tende hereunto make god author pharaos falshood rebellion stubborn dealing lorde rather spoken comfort confirmation moses therefore premonished dealeth earnestly king yet cannot obteine suite hee shoulde notwithstanding knowe god businesse hande god long sufferance cause delaye notwithstandinge laste hee woulde temper thing owne honour glorie case similitude al one housholder sende seruaunt debitours saying go thy waye demaunde debtes also afterwarde annexed layeth hardening pharaos heart vppon pharaos owne head saying hardened hearte hearkened vnto ninthe exodus pharao well whipped hee cryeth haue nowe sinned lorde iust people vniust wicked immediately againe pharao sawe ceassed rayning hee sinned yet hardened heart hardened like place must bee conferred woordes haue hardened pharaos heart must gathered godly sense sense meane maketh god author euil nowe also prophet amos doth verie plainly saye euill amos citie lorde doth augustine contra adimantum ca euil verie religiously write euil place bee taken sinne punishment worde euil vsed two significati one euil man doeth euil paine suffereth nowe prophet place speaketh euil punishement men suffer prouidence god ruleth gouerneth thing man h committ euil e first euil may suffer euil would therefore euil god doeth euill respect god euil vppon whome vengeance lighteth respect selfe doth good euery iust thing good vengeance iuste consequently good place esaie also grace firste naturall corruption mankinde originall sinne nowe therefore called originall originall sinne sinne commeth firste beginning deriued firste parent v lineall descent continual course one perfectnesse saye corruption mannes nature maketh wee doe truely obey lawe god without sinne againe call want defect call concupiscence whiche might better seeme fruite originall sinne oure corruption call inordinatenesse appetite leaft nature anshelmus late writer saith originall sinne want originall righteousnesse thought haue beene spoken somewhat briefely force sinne seemeth bee sufficiently expressed nature onely voyde baren goodnesse also aboundant fruitefull euils naughtinesse therefore definition hugo taken better saith originall sinne ignoraunce mynde concupiscence fleashe yet seemeth bee farr fuller better definition originall sinne vice deprauation whole man whereby hee cannot vnderstande god peruerse iudgement thinges doeth ouerthwartly peruerteth thinges nowe among borne sinner haue allreadie sufficientlye spoken treated cause sinne hereafter shall followe somewhat argument haue neede repeate thing therfore passe forth rest pelagians denyed euill originall sinne sinned like transgression adam c doeth apostle woordes manifestly shewe propagation sinne saying sinne entred one man worlde death entred men muche haue sinned wite muche subiect corruption men either beefore moses might excepted addeth death reigned adam vnto moses ouer also sinned like transgression adam saye ouer sinned owne wil adam drew fro originall sinne propagation sainct augustine doth esteeming men sinnes lawe god must onely looked vnto thinges contrarie god lawe sinnes neither hath man authoritie make new lawes trasgressing wherof men bee counted sinner glorie belongeth god alone whome dauid crieth thee alone haue sinned thee haue wrought wickednesse neither part office take vppon v oure owne iudgementes determine whiche smallest greatest sinnes v would thinke sinne say brother thou foole yet lord gospell pronounceth sinne gospell also affirmeth wee shal giue accompt euery idle word latter day iudgement verie rightly therfore sayeth sainct augustine second booke de bapt contra donatistas capit esteming sinnes let v bring deceiptfull balance wherein weighe wee liste wee liste owne minde phantasie saying heauie light let v bring weight god holie scripture secrete treasury lord thereby let v weighe heauie light naye rather let v weigh acknowledge accepte weighed lord although might seeme sufficient whiche hath sufficiently declared nature actuall sinne yet wee large consider sundrie sortes kindes difference sinnes stoikes opinion sinnes equall whome perhappes iouinian followinge patriarch heresy tertullian said bee philosopher written haue affirmed verie conteined affection desire man haue alreadie told affection desire two sortes witt naturall affection whiche repugnaunt lawe god whiche sort loue child parentes wife desire meate drincke sleepe although know doe denie sometimes affection defiled originall spott againe carnall desire affection men directly contrarie god affection nourished increase vaine thoughtes carnall delightes increasing thy bosome last breake sinne month yea deede dooing actuall sinne selfe example thou ustest man wife ettlest luste bottome thy eart still delighting thee selfe vaine cogitation thou callest minde passing beautie lineament bodie doest thy often vehement imagination delight set thee selfe sire content herewithall alone thou ceassest lie whome thou louest word writing spott chastitie occasion serue thee thou doest deed defile also doest reiterate sinne thou hast comitted lastly laying aside feare god plague shame world thou doest daily frequent openly vse seest thou heere example howe one sinne doeth increase degree doeth still require sharper punishment according greatnesse enormitie crime verilie lord gospell sainct matthewe confirmeth sayeth ye haue heard said old thou shalt kill whosoeuer killeth shalbe danger iudgement say vnto angrie brother vnaduisedly shalbe daunger iudgement soeuer shall saye vnto brother racha shalbe daunger counsell whosoeuer shall say thou foole shalbe daunger hell fire wordes lord thou hearest first difference sinnes anger token angrie mind open scouldinges whiche doe part end open fightinges thou hearest sinne increaseth greatnesse sharpenesse punishmente still augmented therefore vnapte sillie distinction made actuall sinne said one sinne thoughte mouth deede againe diuide certaine kindes sortes reducing againe partly scelera scelera delicta partly delicta scelera heynous crime whiche conceiued committed set purpose pretended malice whiche sorte especiallie whiche called cry sinnes murther peccata clamantia vsurie oppression fatherlesse widowes sodomie withheld hire needie labourer touching murther voyce lord genesis sayeth voice thy brother bloud crieth vnto mee twentie two exodus hee sayeth ye vexe fatherlesse widowes crie mee heare slay word god doeth bitter quippes baighte vsurie vtterly condemne sinne sodomite ascended vpp heauen requiring vengeaunce lighte vppon villaynous beastes iames apostle saith behold hire labourer whiche haue reaped downe fieldes whiche hire kept backe fraude cryeth cry haue reaped entered eares lord sabbaoth sinnes men also annexe seuen principall vice principal vice comonly called deadly sinnes pride vaine glorie anger enuie slouth couetousnesse gluttonie lecherie yea make seed first beginning sinnes wickednesse therefore doe call principall sinnes bee seene sentence peter lombard moreouer call sinnes delicta committed infirmitie vnwittingly witt good forsaken duetie god man neglected certeine kinde idle sluggishnesse peraduenture pec atum alienum othe sin made sin mea e ye shall hereafte perceiue bee numbred sinne ignorance sinne called alienum sinne vnwillingnesse although euen also often time made heynous crime detestable offence ignoraunce said bee two sortes one naturall verie ignoraunce whiche springeth originall ignorance sinne ye affected counterfeite whiche riseth sett purpose pretended malice naturall ignoraunce disease fault sinne springeth poysened original worke darcknesse appeared aboue testimonie apostle sainct paule verilie sainct augustine third booke de libero arbitrio cap sayeth euerie one ignorance doeth rightlie cannot doe though willeth rightlie therefore called sinnes haue beginning sinne free precedent deserue haue cosequents giue name tongue member moueth mouth wee speake euen also whiche followeth vppon mouing member witt forme tenour woordes tongue doeth vtter according whiche phrase speach wee say one man diuers tongue meaninge greeke latine tongue euen wee doe onely call sinne properly called sinne committed free wil wittingly also followeth vppon punishment whiche haue said somewhat doe cloake ignorance saying lord gospel come spoken vnto wherewithall cloke heir sinne haue sinne herevppon inferre therefore whome nothing hath preached free blame accusation sinne lord said first spake pretended colour innocencie euery pretence iust lawefull hee said cofesse haue sinne addeth presently nowe haue nothing cloake sinne withall secondarilie doth vniuersally acquite ignoraunt kinde sinne sinne rebellion onely augustine vppon iohn sayth haue excuse euerie sinne beleued christ hee came vnto neither haue heard heare may haue excuse cannot escape condemnation haue sinned without lawe shall perishe without lawe paule also first timothie first chapiter sayeth thanke hee hath counted mee faithfull putting mee ministerie blasphemer persecuter oppressour yet obteined mercie ignorantlie vnbeleefe loe heere apostle saith obteined mercie hee sinned thorough ignoraunce ignorance deriueth vnbeleefe attributeth filthie fruites furthermore wee call false counterfeite ignorance malice feigned obstinate stubborne people thou thing displeaseth thee shouldest say thou doest vnderstand whe thou mayst thou wilt vnderstand ignorance iewes professed enimies god grace christ paul sayeth beare wittnesse haue zeale god according knowledge ignoraunt god righteousnesse seeking set vpp owne subiecte righteousnesse god lord gospell said phariseis demaunded blinde also ye blinde ye haue sinne nowe ye say wee see therefore sinne abideth sinnes called aliena whiche wee oure selues commit peccata aliena others sinnes men doe yet without v witt allowe helpe forward persuade commaund wincke giue occasion doe resist gainesay wee may apostle paul forbiddeth timothie lay hand man hastilie communicate men sinnes therefore giue vnfitt man order place ecclesiasticall ministerie kind sinne wee doe call others sinne thee worthilie imputed vnseemeelinesse soeuer committed god church ignoraunce man whome thou hast ordeined sinne others sinne whiche offer violence doe tormentes threatenings compell men denie truth commit heynous offence deniall trueth peccatum alienum others sinne whiche compelleth denier renounce thes sinnes referred compeller one respect man compelled respect compeller selfe therwithall man owne sinne respecte himselfe impietie tyrannie sacrilege murther causing renounce trueth way wee well admonished sinnes wilfull vnwilfull inforced call vnwillfull sinne whiche committed either man inforceing else oure owne ignoraunce therefore peccatum voluntariu inuoluntarium whiche done neither compulsion ignoraunce concluded bee voluntarie willfull sinne againe inforced sinne make two sortes whereof call one absolute conditionall nowe thincke absolute violent sinne lyeth v either doe commeth man without consent whome violence offered euen wind driue v place vnlooked kinges officer doe perforce compell thy handes offer incense idol thou thy power resistest doest denie farre thou canst case acquite man compelled blame punishment reproche nowe touching seconde kinde violent sinne whiche call conditional thincke riseth vppon sundrie cause wee maye sticke longe vppon pointe wee doe simplie saye vnwilfull violent sinne either hath hath consent whiche compelled hee giue consent example either renouncing euangelicall trueth whiche hee hath hetherto professed comitting greeuous horrible crime man compelled voyde blame neither feare death torment excuse choose death rather denie trueth committ anye heynous crime see augstine demenda ad cose tium cap bee compelled consent wicked horrible sinne thou shalt rather choose die doe filthie deede tyraunt shall inforce compell thee thy hee maye deede kill thee compell thee doe euill againste thy hee able dyinge thou confesseste trueth dyinge thou declarest thou wilt doe whiche thou lyueste doe exacte thee meanes neyther ouercome compell thee themselues ouercome compelled see haue triall greeueth full soare antiochus epiphanes hee mighte haue polluted holie body machabees vse vncleane forbidden meate choosinge ratherto die liuing bee defiled dyinge ouercome tyraunte could bee compelled verilie thing receiued approued amonge professours sounde religion death extremity whatsoeuer must sooner bee tasted thing committed nature filthie repugnaunt religion proceede nowe consent bee giuen meere vnauoydable violence offered godly man heere wee make difference beetwixte vppon compulsion doeth yeeld doe wickednesse whiche compulsion cannot bee broughte vnto violence spotteth vncorrupt holy mind example godly man hauing feete bound armes fast pynnioned bee perforce brought idole temple compelled present detestable sacrifice vnspotted virgin honest matrone bee warres barbarous broiles villanousiye abused without consent deede cannot haue leaue rather die vntouched bee vndecently handled shee assure selues vnspotted face god verie wisely said saincte augustine suffer vniustly doe vniustlie sinne god lib de libero arbitrio capit againe de mendacio ad consentium capit hee sayeth whiche bodie luste went doeth violently suffer ought rather bee called vexation corruption vexation bee corruption yet corruption filthie corruption onely whiche luste hath procured wherevnto lust hath consented againe first booke de ciuitate dei capit hee sayeth purpose minde remayneth costant bodie sanctified offered violence others luste taketh bodie purposed holinesse constant perseuearance party owne chastitie doeth still reteine much like hath hee place also god either giue leaue commaundement man haste v mortall men kill oure selues thereby sooner obteine immortalitie auoyd imminent euill must vnderstoode wee forbidden doe lawe whiche sayeth thou shalt kill namely since hee addeth thy neighbour hee precept forbiddeth beare false witnesse beecause nameth thy neighbour hee doeth precepte include thee selfe also therefore doctrine seneca vtterly condemned whiche counselleth men miserie dispatche themselues death miserie maye ended saincte augustine disputing doe therefore murther themselues beecause wil bee subiecte men filthie lustes doeth saye bee detestable crime damnable sinne man murther himselfe truth doeth manifestly crie madd saye let v sinne least peraduenture hereafter happen sinne let v nowe committ murther least hereafter perhappes wee fall adulterie iniquitie haue farre vpper hande innocencie mischiefe set bye better liuinge hazard chaunce vncerteine deflouration time come dying commit certaine murther time present others luste consent owne stirred vpp doe thincke ought ridd themselues shortening liues farre bee christian minde trusteth god settled hope doeth staye surestayde farre bee say minde yeeld pleasure faithful one sinnes verily thou respectest corruption infirmitie woorkes sinnes workes v selues without filthie spottes therefore ye work bee wrought v cannot bee perfect otherwise ought sight god yet verie workes faithes sake v wee receiued grace god therefore wrought v nowe grace sonnes god bothe deede also called good ende tendeth saying apostle minde euen doe serue lawe god fleshe lawe sinne lo one apostle euen regenerate doth reteine selfe two sundrye disposition verie woorke working diuers respectes bothe sinne good worke also much mynd serueth god farre foorth doeth good woorke muche hee againe serue lawe fleshe therein woorke without spott hee selfe little seuenth chapter saide finde woulde good euill nonlatin alphabet saye present mee euill vndoubtedly making alwayes shewe selfe woordes workes thoughtes doeth cause worke done v regenerate cannot bee pure god iustice doeth looke grace therefore mercie god reputed esteemed pure vnto doth sentence oure lorde gospell sainct iohn belong saith hee washed hath neede saue washe feete hee cleane euery whitt hee bee cleane euery whitt neede hath cleane washe feete feete must washed howe hee cleane euery whitt yet saying repugnant betwixt selues euen also saying wee saye good woorkes sinnes according plentifullnesse imputation god grace mercie wee cleane euerye whitt thoroughly purged sinnes shall condemne v yet alwayes v lawe sinne whiche sheweth selfe v long wee liue therefore feete euill motion naughtie lustes oures muste resisted power repressed finallie wee must acknowledge selues verie workes neuer oute imperfection therefore consequently workes stande neede grace god question beeinge thus resolued wee nowe come expounde sinne againste holye ghoste sinne againste holy ghoste perpetual blaspheminge reuealed sin gainst oly ghost knowen trueth witte conscience falsely reuolting knowen trueth without intermission inueigh rayle againste blasphemy euill speech despightfull tantes wherewith inueighe slaunder man casting forth wicked detestable speech againste whereby credite estimation either crackte vtterly disgraced wee e therefore blaspheme magistrate elder good men wee doe onelye withdrawe oure obedience honour due vnto doe also reprocheful wordes bayte ceassing call tyrauntes bloudsuckers wicked headds odible guide wee doe especially blaspheme god detracte glorie gaynsaye grace set purpose doe stubbornly contemne dispraise truth reuealed vnto v euidente worckes declared world euerie sinne verilie blasphemie blasphemie properly blasphemie sinne beecause tendeth againste god sinne therewithall propertie singularitie hath dothe also despise god speake reprochfullie againste workes many doe sinne againste doctrine trueth doe either neglecte receyue trueth else haue receiued doe reuerence set foorth kinde men thoughe bee sinner doe yet deserue called blasphemer beginne tauntes quippes mocke doctrine whiche neglect calling hereticall schismaticall seditious diuellishe maye rightely bee termed blasphemer wherefore propertie sinne againste holie ghoste onely reuolte truthe also againste conscience speake againste trueth floutes incessauntly ouerwhelme bothe verie woorke moste euidente reuelation lorde conscience euidence reuelation woorke holie ghoste conuinced suggesteth telleth ought onely temper selues reprochfull speech oughte doe thing oughte yeelde truthe giue god due honour glorie nowe exclude inspiration holy spirite reiecte ouerwhelme stubborne falshood flatt apostacie wicked contradiction perpetuall contempt flatly committ sinne holie ghoste verily taketh beginning sinne holy ghost beginning originall sinne nourished set forwarde diuellish suggestion peruerse affection indignation enuie hope feare stubborne selfewilfull malice lastly contumacie rebellion nowe course matter requireth heare lorde saide gospell concerning sinne twelfth matthewe saith euery sinne blasphemie shalbe forgiuen vnto men blasphemie holie ghoste shal forgiuen vnto men whosoeuer speaketh worde sonne man shalbe forgiuen whosoeuer speaketh holie ghost shall bee forgiuen neither worlde world come sentence sauiour thus expressed thirde chapter sainct markes gospell sinnes shalbe forgiuen vnto child men blasphemy wherewith soeuer shal blaspheme speaketh blasphemie holie ghoste hath neuer forgiuenesse daunger eternall damnation twelfth chap sainct luke woordes manner vttered thus soeuer speaketh worde sonne man shalbe forgiuen vnto blasphemeth holie ghoste shal forgiuen woordes lorde haue mention made blasphemie sonne man blasphemie holie ghoste holie inquire wherevppon sainct augustine tracta ioan saide greate diuersitie punishment sinnes howe ordeined wisedome god doth deepely declare man coniectures possibly seeke vtter wordes hee verily lawe giuen man gaue rule according measure sinne shall measure punishement bee beeing selfe moste equall iust doeth iudgement exceede measure abraham notable communication god reported genesis doth amog notable demonstration lorde vseth towarde ionas beeing angrie lorde iudgements hee sheweth hee hath iustly care infant yea cattel niniue place extant fourth chapter prophecie ionas let v therefore stedfastly holde lord punisheth doth iniurie creature hee hath made therefore disputation question come ende wherein men wont demaunde whye ye lorde doeth sometimes vse sharpe torment towards infant suckling rewardeth temporal offence eternal punishment ye lord righteous wayes holie workes dauid truly witnesse whereas another place saith thou arte iust lord thy iudgement right blessed hee stumbleth doeth murmur lorde happen lorde god punisheth surely time somewhat long deferre iudgement punishment wee must therefore thinke hee vniust spareth wicked sharpely correcteth friendes vice let v rather laye eye euangelicall parable riche glutton poore sillie lazarus lazarus though friende god notwithstanding die want foode though god enimie spend life deintie fare pleasure felt none ill hearken life iudgement abraham saith riche glutton sonne remember thou thy life time receiuedst thy good lazarus likewise receiued euill nowe reioyceth thou art tormented therefore godly bee time afflicted present life shalbe abundantly rewarded life come wicked spared worlde grieuously punished world come god iust rewardeth euery man accordinge merite hereafter therefore thou shalte chaunce euer amen belongeth also god doeth well afflicte good sin plagued temporall punishment considering forgiuen grace god badd touchinge spake large thirde sermon thirde decade nowe therefore demaunde god sinne away yet immediately prophet addeth sworde shall departe thy house wee aunswere simply plague layde v beefore remission sinnes punishmentes due sinnes remission sinnes conflictes exercise woman finger pointe christ iesus openly declare hee looked messiah whome iesus christ th looked messia prophetes promised god giuing vnto woorld hath done hee promised wholie powred himselfe benefites shall baptise holie ghost fire gospel iohn wee read next day iohn seeth iesus comming vnto sayeth beehold lambe god taketh away sinne world whome said mee commeth man preferred mee mee knewe hee declared vnto israel therfore come baptising water immediatly hee sayeth sawe spirite descending heauen like vnto doue aboad vpon knew sent mee baptise water said vnto vpon thou shalt see spirite descending tarying still hee whiche baptiseth holie ghost sawe bare record sonne god againe disciple iohn enuie ye happie successe christ greeued see maister iohn neglected coparison christ iohn said disciple ye selues witness said christ sent hee hath bride bridegrome friend bridegrome whiche standeth heareth reioyceth bridegrome therfore ioy fulfilled hee must increase must decrease father loueth sonne hath giuen thinges hand beleeueth sonn hath life euerlasting hee beleeueth sonne shall see life wrath god abideth vppon testimony firme cleare euident enough might suffice confirmation cause let v yet many moe picke add fewe whiche may declare christ alreadie exhibited vnto v therefore lord himselfe whome wee beleeue bee messiah hee great beene verie greatly commended testimonie iohn doeth length come abroad preach woord life read age since euer taughte great grace therewithall hee shewed almost incredible wonderfull miracle easilie argue hee sufficient winne man whome woordes might possiblie preuaile hee louing gentle sinner repeating still beating head hee come saue call repentance therefore disciple iohn come vnto saying art thou hee come shall looke hee aunsweared goe ye tell thinges iohn whiche ye see heare blinde receiue sighte lame walke leper clensed deafe heare dead raised life poore preached glad tydinges gospell nowe doctrine meane woorkes miracle minde shewe hee exhibited true messiah vnto world none lokedfor moreouer synagogue nazareth hee read expounded esaies prophecie comming messiah declared scripture himselfe fulfilled historie immediatly annexed bare record vnto wondered gratious saying proceded fro mouth againe tenth chapiter iohn gospell iewes came round lord said longe doest thou make v doubt thou bee christ tell v plainely iesus aunsweared told ye beleeue workes father name beare witnesse mee ye beleeue ye sheepe presently hee addeth ye say blaspheme said sonne god doe woorkes father beleeue mee doe ye beleeue sicke diseased therefore whiche thinke selues cleare without sinnes righteous selues vtterly reiect christ make death none effect side feele disease mynde bottome heartes confesse sinner vnrighteous freely obteine remission sinnes christ sake receiued number sonnes god would speake place concerning faith iesus christ remission sinnes inheritannce life euerlasting alreadie sirste decade declared large way ye haue remember gospell sincerely preached ye taught made partaker life christe owne desertes meritorious woorkes wee freely saued without respect workes either first last although haue resisted declaration confirmation sake thereof produce two place onely suche apparant enough euident prooue confirm one gospell christ lorde paules epistle lorde iesus christ howe christ preach gospel teache briefely waye txue saluation preach gladd tydinges life vnto nichodemus gospell saincte iohn doth firste beginne repentaunce doth wholie take nichodemus selfe leauinge merites owne wherein put trust hee doeth vtterly condemne firste birth man nothing auailable obteine eternall life doeth hee beeseech leaue nicodemus wherin may bragge make boaste doth expressely saye verily verily say vnto thee vnlesse man regeneratio largely spoken sermo repentance bee borne aboue cannot see kingdome god firste birth giftes thereof able promote man kingdome god neede shoulde haue bee borne seconde time seconde byrth wrought meanes holye ghoste beeing heauen powred oure heartes doth bring v knowledge selues wee may easily perceiue assuredly knowe sensibly feele fleshe life righteousenesse consequently man saued owne strength merit spirite forsooth doth inwardly teache v sounde gospell doeth outwardly tell v saued merite sonne god lorde gospel saith man ascendeth heauen hee descended heauen sonne man heauen place doth plainely saye man commeth father mee againe nicodemus saith moses lift vpp serpent wildernesse muste sonne man lift vp euerie one beleeueth shuld perish haue eternall life nowe moses hang vp brasen serpent health recouerie poysoned bytings serpent died presently stung ye serpent vnlesse immediately looke vp brasen serpent verie sight thereof poysoned sting loose force person enuenomed hande restored cured againe neither host israelite medicine alone whosoeuer despised died wt remedie force poyson expelled life ye infected preserued either power prayer multitude sacrifice medicinable hearbes kinde physicke meanes mannes inuention woulde escape peril death behoued beholde brasen serpent aloft nowe brasen serpent type figure christe lorde lifte vp vppon crosse ordeined god onely saluation nowe whome doeth sauing health befall forsooth beholde beeing lift vp lorde selfe telleth v beholde doth signifie steede thereof doth put beleeue therefore woorkes none meanes merites saue v eternall death force sinne poyson wher infected olde serpent aduersarie satan faith alone whereby wee beleeue christ lift vp remission sinnes whome alone life sure saluation doeth assuredly consist onely thinge quickeneth v alreadie dying enuenomed sting satan sinne heare moreouer lorde doth adde instructing nicodemus yet fully true faith making onely cause saluation meere onely grace god receiued faith christ saith god loued worlde gaue onely begotten sonne euery one beeleeueth perish haue eternall life god sent sonne condemne world worlde might bee saued beleeueth condemned hee beleeueth alreadie condemned cause beleeueth name onely begotten sonne god loe coulde bee spoken plainely faith made partaker christe repeatinge faith often meaning beate heades man shoulde hereafter muche doubte manifest euident peece doctrine nowe thou doest little set authoritie christ whose authoritie wilte thou esteeme thou wilt knowe reiect testimonie yet albeit warrant sufficient giue eare notwithstandinge disciple whome lorde loued epistle expounding wordes lorde way exposition repeating beating mennes mindes doth strongly cry wee receiue witnesse men witnesse iohn god greater witnesse god testified sonn beleeueth sonne hath testimonie selfe hee beleeueth god doth make lyar lie beleeued recorde gaue sonne recorde god hath giuen v eternall life life sonne hath sonne hath life hee hath sonne god hath life else haue sonne god beleeue sense gathered went beeing selfe euident mee add thing vnto nothing else goe tallowe candell help adlight sunne rising nowe come place sainct paule seene paul gospel third fourth chapter epistle romanes rightousenesse god saith hee without lawe made manifest witnessed testimonie lawe prophet paul place doth preache gospell euidetly knowe place wherein doeth plainly hee teacheth herein howe iustified god true righteousenesse saluation mankinde meanes commeth vnto v saith righteousnesse god saye righteousenesse god bestoweth whiche doth preuaile god reuealed without lawe say doeth come vnto v without helpe lawe wite without ayde merites workes lawe touching testimonie lawe ye prophet witnesse together beleeue iustified righteousnesse god righteousenesse doth immediately declare saying righteousenesse god commeth faith iesus christ vnto vppon beleeue righteousenesse saith whereof wee speake humane mortall man altogether diuine god selfe god alone onely iust righteousenesse god true onely righteousenesse god saueth v righteousenesse god maketh v partaker faith iesus christe wite wee beleeue christe hope bee saued neither man excluded righteousnesse saluation paule doeth plainely say vnto vpon doe beleeue wherefore god doeth repute esteeme righteous beleeue iesus christe onely sonne lorde sauiour doth presently annex cause attributeth saluation vnto righteousnesse god man gospell commendeth v ye righteousenesse god saying difference al haue sinned haue neede glorie god men owne nature destitute glorie god since without true image god likenesse whereof created ye beginning therefore men verily vnrighteous sinner wherevppon followeth righteousnesse haue nothing wherein boast righteous god else beseech doe sinner carrie iudgement seate god confusion ignominie men case therefore apostle doth verie wisely add man er order sanctification purification iustification iustified freely grace thorough redemption christe iesus whome god hath sett foorth bee propitiation reconciliation faith bloud whiche one saide men iustified christ sake ye meere grace mercie god without anye helpe merite owne beleeue god hath giuen sonne worlde shedd bloud reconcile purified sinner vnto father heauen wordes moste fully plainly declared whole manner order sanctifying purifying iustifying sinner good repeate apostle woordes nerely examine deepely consider saith hee freely iustified wherefore freely forsooth iustified meere grace god without helpe owne workes merites men sinner therefore haue nothinge selues alledge iustification wherevppon followeth since iustified iustified freely grace god apostle eleuenth romanes saith wee bee saued grace nowe woorkes grace grace workes nowe grace followeth paule immediately doth yet make argument manifest notwithstanding verie manifest alreadie redemption saith christe righteousenesse saluation worke meere grace redeemed respecte selues workes merites wee seruaunts death diuell muche wee sinner subiecte sinne god sending sonne redeemed v yet beeinge enimies wee bounde diuell open aduersarie therefore hee freely redeeme v esaye prophet chapter plainly foretell come passe true saluation whatsoeuer bee saue christ alone oure true lorde sauiour heauenly father eternall counsell set forth sonne lorde iesus christe bee propitiation wite hee might bee reconciliation whose sake onely father pacified adopte h v number sonnes god accomplished none way faith bloud wee beleeue sonne sent father shedde bloud thereby set v cleansed iustified sanctified heauenly father wherin see againe saluation doth freely consiste faith iesus christ poyntes beeing thus vnfolded apostle proceedinge shewe hath seemed howe farre benefite redemption iustification doth stretche doth immediately adde declare righteousnes forgiuenesse sinnes past god suffer shewe time righteousenesse god saith hath set forth christ onely propitiation hee might shewe one righteousenesse age christ saye selfe righteousenesse beleeue nowe heere hee maketh mention two seuerall time aunciet age father present tyme wherein wee nowe liue auncient age went comming christ latter age beginneth christe nowe present shalbee extended ende worlde god verily long sufferaunce beare suffer sinnes olde age christe sake whome whome hee hath forgiuen neither doeth set beefore v daye righteousenesse saue christe alone receiued embraced faith apostle doeth obscurely afterwarde adde might iust iustifier beleeue iesus haue saide nowe meaninge vnderstand men vnrighteous altogether sinner god alone righteous without whome righteousenesse hee doeth communicate righteousenesse beleeue cstriste wite beleeue christ sake father pleased reco ciled vnto v reputed iust holie woordes apostle errours refuted two verie wicked blasphemous errours certeine fellowes notably refuted one twaine errour whiche saye oure father iustified faith christ law owne merites affirminge christ suffred father alone liued vppon earth followed death errour saye christ offered vp bodie father originall sinne onely v sinnes therefore wee must make satisfaction owne sinnes apostle paule doeth place condemne opinion holie euangelist iohn agreeing paule doth saye bloud sonne god doeth cleanse v sinne propitiation sinnes sinnes onely sinnes worlde therefore merite christ redemption doth extende selfe faithfull testament apostle paul proceedeth vpon saide hee inferreth boasting excluded lawe woorkes naye lawe faith gathereth euangelicall doctrine hetherto taught boasting euery mannes owne righteousenesse bragginge euerye one merites vtterly taken away altogether exempted vanished lawe woorkes doctrine concerning work wont moste parte puffe men vpp make swel lawe faith ye doctrine concerning faith doth emptie leaue v nothinge humble confession acknowledging owne lacke merites attributing oure helpe grace christ iesus last gathering cheefe proposition hee sayth therefore holde man iustified without woorkes lawe summe breuiarie whole gospell wee iustified saye absolued sinnes definitiue sentence death damnation sanctified adopted number sonnes god faith assured confidence name christe giuen father onely sauiour workes name excluded ende giuen v occasion entangle faith workes attribute workes glorie title due faith alone rather christe vppon whome faith grounded vphelde proposition beeing put foorth doth presently cofirme argumentes shewing withall saluation common iewes gentile saying god iewes onely hee also gentile yes euen also gentile one god shal iustifie circumcision faith vncircumcision faith hee fetcheth confirmation saide nature god one god owne nature life righteousenesse god bothe iewes gentile therefore life righteousenesse people righteousenesse hee bestoweth faith therefore faith doeth iustifie make righteous declared example cornelius centurion iustified rather saye iustified hee declared acceptable god sendinge downe holie ghoste visible fourme vppon hee neither circumcised yet kept lawe onely heard preaching gospell beleeued iesus christ nowe god iustifie cornelius alone wil also iustifie nation faith euen hee wil anye meanes faith alone iustifie iewes followeth paule doe wee destroy lawe faith god forbidde rather mainteine lawe defender disputers defence work rather iustification workes wont obiecte faith alone christ doth iustifie lawe doctrine lawe altogether vnprofitable ende wee commaunded doe good woorkes good workes iustifie apostle aunswereth lawe abolished faith rather mainteined since faith doeth directly tende christe whome alone doth seeke finde fullnesse lawe selfe scholemystresse vnto christ doth shut vpp vnder sinne iustification faith giuen faithfull moste euident lawe destroyed darkened confirmed made lighte ye doctrine faith apostle goeth confirmation saith shal wee raham e father faith iusti saye abraham oure father pertaining fleshe finde abraham iustified woorkes hath hee wherein boast god saith scripture abraha beleeued god counted vnto righteousenesse verily many example holy father among rest apostle chose abraham handle large scripture called father beleeue wherevppon assuredly certeine child shalbe iustified sorte theire father apostle hath expresse woordes taught latter ende fourth chapter moreouer abraham famous good workes aboue rest holie father therfore could haue beene iustified good woorkes merites much might abraham rest forbecause iustified faith workes manifest therefore sainctes also haue beene iustified faith workes furthermore abraham liued yeres lawe reuealed moses wherevppon followeth woorkes cannot called workes lawe denyers iustificatio faith without lawe therefore workes hee hee faith woorkes ye work faith yet iustified faith therefore lorie iustification faith remaineth sounde vnspotted vnmingled thing else saith shal saye oure father abraham founde concerninge fleshe wite farre forth man also men saye shal wee saye hee deserued demaunde answere must added hee founde nothing woorkes hee deserued nothing proofe followeth workes deserued thing merit iustified hath wherein boaste hath nothing wherin boast therfore iustified workes god alone righteous keepeth glorie vnto selfe alone without partener ioyntpossessour freely iustifying faith iesus christe end grace may alwayes praised paule selfe bringing place scripture doeth shewe abraham nothinge wherein make boast saith doth scripture say abraham beleeued god counted vn righteousenesse lo scripture doth moste plainly say abraham iustified faith rather faith imputed righteousenesse therefore abraham faith counted righteous moste iuste righteous god let v heare paule howe applyeth place scripture vnto purpose followeth worketh reward reckoned grace duetie worketh beleeueth iustifieth vngodly faith counted righteousenesse woordes verily maye bee briefely reduced kinde argument soeuer doeth woorkes deserue anye thing rewarde giuen thing duetie due vnto imputed freely though debte faith imputed abraham vnto righteousenesse therefore receiued righteousenesse rewarde duetie ought vnto gifte due freely giuen againe worketh beleeueth iustifieth vngodly faith reckoned righteousenesse abraham faith imputed vnto righteousenesse therefore obteined righteousenesse faith workes nowe emphasis fayth beleeueth iustifieth vngodly therby signified iustified doth bring nothing onely acknowledginge owne miserie vngodlynesse seeke mercie hande lorde vnderstandeth destitute good workes may abide tryall god iust iudgement doth therefore flye mercie god presuming certeintie righteousenesse faith ayde helpe sinner must freely saued grace god way ye must note righteousnesse christian imputatiue christian righteousenesse saide imputatiue righteousenesse thing alone able breake necke boastinge imputation contrarie vnto debte god duetie bound v either owne sake woorkes sake farre forth hee hath bounde selfe v free grace goodnesse v many thinges hinder perfection righteousenesse v wherevppon dauid cryed enter iudgement thy seruaunt thy sight shall man liuing iustified therefore god doeth freely impute v righteousenesse faith hee reputeth v righteous beleeue sonne wee read euangelicall parable lorde saye debters able paye hee forgaue bothe debte god also forgiueth v debtes sinnes reputinge vnto v countinge v righteous christe sake apostle moste euidently testifying thinge seconde epistle corinthian saith god christe reconciling worlde vnto himselfe imputing sinnes men againe whiche knewe sinne made sinne v wee might bee righteousenesse god canst thou require euident wee counted righteous god christ sacrifice oure sinnes purged wee shoulde heereafter bee longer helde guylte wee proceede nowe reckon vpp argumentes saincte paule firme manifeste alreadie rehearsed chapter therefore followeth euen dauid describeth blessednes man lorde imputeth righteousenesse without workes saying blessed whose vnrighteousenesses forgiuen whose sinnes couered blessed man whome lorde impute sinne beginninge hee doeth cleare euident woordes expresse thing hee intendeth prooue confirme wite god imputeth righteousenesse saincts without woorkes coulde bee saide plainly proue bee inferreth testimonie dauid doeth manner conteyne three sundry member clause firste blessed saith hee whose vnrighteousenesses forgiuen blessed whose sinnes couered lastly blessed man whome lord impute sinne nowe force argument demonstration doeth consist wordes forgiue couer impute creditour forgiueth debtour whiche hee hath payde whether bee able able paye wee respecte sinnes whiche debtes able paye nothinge god forgiuenesse therefore debtes sinnes oures gifte god meere grace liberalitie creditour cannot forgiue thinge alreadie payde vnto hee giueth backe thinge hee hath receiued dooing hee doeth forgiue giue deede scripture called donum gifte remissio forgiueing wherevppon sainct paul saith god gaue abraham inheritaunce therefore abraham woorkes merite secondarily filthie thing offendeth eye men vsually woont bee couered yet notwithstandinge filthie thinge abydeth filthie still although doeth appeare outwardly vnto eye men mercifull god hath couered sinnes shoulde bee shoulde appeare come iudgement whiche thing gifte grace merites coueringe nothing else bloud sonne god bloudes sake wee sinner damned lastely god might right iustice impute sinne vnto v grace hee imputeth layde together doe confirme prooue righteousenesse freely faith without workes imputed vnto v verie place saincte paule taken dauid doeth discusse make plaine vnto v poyntes doctrine also whereof controuersie wee learne iustification nothinge else sanctification forgiuenesse sinnes adoption number child god learne saincte paule speaketh ceremoniall woorks lawe also sainctes good woorkes euery sorte furthermore wee learne sinnes iniquity manner sinnes faithfull freely pardoned vtterlye forgiuen moreouer wee learne sinnes fullye remitted fault onely punishement also whiche punishment saye reteined god doeth impute sinnes place saith wil haue remembrace sinne lastly learne ye satisfaction sinne man inuention moste vaine lye flatlye opposite apostle doctrine haue hitherto alledged two euident place one gospell christe sainct paule epistle written romanes meant prooue christe beeing preached v gospell receiued workes faith hope haue diuine testimony declared matter importance man shall neede hereafter either doubte wauer nowe adde note still moste necessarie obserued good holie men church christ must power indeuour doctrine gospell maye abyde sincere vtterly vncorrupted must case admitte iustification partely attributed faith mercie god partely workes faith owne merites admitted doeth gospell loose force vertue thinke therefore men must onely incessantly vrge faithful iustified saued sanctified faith without woorkes grace mercie saye god thorough christe alone suppose verily doctrine gospell must kepte sincer vncorrupte churche verie many cause among especially followe hereafter firste manifest doctri aith iustifieth without workes ke vncorrupted church christ often repeated doctrine grace god onely sonne doeth thorough faith alone woorke iustification manye diuine testimony euen beginning worlde manye demonstration many determination vnreproueable counsel assembled counsel determine decree place counsell al men reteine hauing gathered togeather disciple caesarea philippi demaunded men thinke nowe answered diuersly according diuersitie opinion common people hee inquired selues thought peter name rest saide thou art christe sonne liuing god whome lorde replyed happie art thou simon bar iona flesh bloud hath reuealed thee father heauen woordes hee concludeth two seuerall thinges first true faith doeth make v happie neither doubted make happie vsed signification ye hearde paule euen nowe dauid vsed lastly sanctifying faith woorke oure owne nature heauenly gifte god also taketh occasion vppon notable confession true faith giue newe name simon peter eternall memorie thinge imprintinge signification mysterie mennes mindes peter confessed christ stone rocke therefore christe syrnameth peter petra stone one shoulde call liuinge stone layde vppon liuing stone christe christian yea leaste peraduenture man shoulde tye thinge vniuersally beelonginge whole churche vnto peter alone lorde selfe doth apply vnto churche saith vpon stone buylde churche gate hell shal preuaile haue sayd nowe done thee peter shall hereafter bee done faithfull thou faith art layde vpon stone arte made member church therefore ordeine whosoeuer confesseth mee stone shalbe member churche sanctified iustified deliuered diuell power death thy confession christe sonne god whome thou confessest shalbe foundation churche vppon whiche foundation whosoeuer layde shal iustified freely saued paule also saide foundation cannot layd alreadie layde christ iesus apostle iohn saith victorie hath ouercome worlde euen faith nowe least peter fellowe disciple shoulde knowe waye howe men shoulde admitted fellowship churche receiued communion christe addeth immediately giue thee keyes kingdome heauen whatsoeuer thou loosest earth shalbee loosed heauen c gaue keyes hee sent apostle preache gospell therefore preaching gospell keye ye kingdome heauen heauen opened waye poynted howe graffed christe church may bee made heires eternall life wite faith christe wee taught gospell christe thus much touching counsell wherof christ presidet helde caesarea philippi extant iohn counsell held capernaum famous ful people greate multitude disciple men hee doeth determine eternall life gotten faith christe none waye v come life eate fleshe drinke bloud beleeue among audience schisme reason many reuolted christe hee demaunded neerest disciple whether also woulde forsake p ter name rest aunswere since thee christe life saluation wee departe thee wee cannot bee partaker lif therefore faith wee rmely sticke cleaue close thee euer moreouer reckoned two counsel also helde apostle one whiche man denye bee verie generall vniuersall uout men euery nation vnder heauen counsell peter apostle expresse wordes teache christe sauiour worlde whome whosoeuer beleeueth hee shall haue life euerlasting place knowen actes apostle second chapter chiefe passingly adorned good giftes described fifteenth chapter actes counsell proposition allowed faith without woorkes doth iustifie freely touching matter haue spoken large place see actes ap stles sermo christe shall bee daunger wracke ieopardie glorie christe darkened corrupted myndes men althoughe selfe remaineth alwayes sounde cleare wee beginne diuide righteousenesse whereby wee stande appeare god attributing oure owne merites good woorkes owne glorie sonne god vnder heauen none name giuen vnto men whiche must bee saued herevppon paule saide christe made none effecte soeuer iustified lawe ye fallen grace againe doe despise grace god righteousenesse bee lawe christe dye vaine hee dyed vaine glorie christe crosse perished thirde cause certeine assured reason oure saluation saluation bee vtterly vncerteine depende vppon woorkes merites oure naturall corruption vnlesse wee bee beside selues doe saye ought saye iob haue righteousenesse aunswere humbly beeseeche iudge therefore paule verie rightly saye inheritaunce bee lawe faith voide promise made none effecte therefore faith according grace promise may bee firme seede fourth cause doctrine especially repayred v image god likenesse whereof wee firste created faithe christe dwelleth liueth v also delighted humilitie image diuell stirred vpp v wee beginne bee proude selues vsurpe glorie god whiche done vndoubtedly often wee doe attribute righteousenesse saluation vnto oure selues though oure owne woorkes merites wee deserued kingdome god diuell swelleth pride doth indeuour robbe god glorie saintes knowe acknowledge saued true grace mercie god doe therefore attribute honour glorie selues confusion ignominie wherevnto vndoubtedly belongeth parable gospell phariseie boastinge good workes publicane praying saying god mercifull sinner whiche twayne publicane read haue gone heauie house rather iustified fifte cause value estimation sinne semeth greate faulte may mennes workes blotted god holy scripture teacheth sinns could none meanes cleansed death innocent bloude sonne god nowe euery man hath anye vnderstandinge may easily gather sinne sight god moste abhominable detestable thinge wherevpon doeth arise faithfull sainctes carefull diligent watchinge sinne continuall bewaylinge oure miserable condition passinge humilitie exquisite modestie coulde yet add cause al men ought st iue endeuour keepe doctrine catholique church iustified grace god otte sonne faith workes sincere vncorrupt ye church christe hope sufficient purpose set quarell v yet notwithstanding perill doctrine good woorkes
