christe iesus redemption onely made partaker doe beleeue trust whosoeuer doe true faith receiue christ iesus preaching gospell therewithal iustified acquited sinnes sanctified made heires eternall life vnbeleefe hardnesse harte receiue christe giuen ouer eternall paine bondes hell wrath god abydeth vppon let v therefore giue hartie thankes god redeemer humbly beseech keepe increase v true faith lastely bring v life euerlasting amen p repentaunce cause thereof confession remission sinnes satisfaction indulgence olde newe man power strength men thinges perteining repentaunce seconde sermon promised last sermon made gospell iesus christe adde discourse repe taunce helpe god good prayer purpose sermon perfourme amonge latines repent sayde repent agreeued ashamed thing haue done thou hast done good turne thinckest vnworthie whome thou hast done cause arte sorie thy selfe sorrowe thine repentaunce wee german call denriiwen greekes doe name metanoeam nowe skilful toung saye nonlatin alphabet signifieth bethinke afterwarde metanoea properly vsed man hauing slipped dooynge thing foolishelye doth notwithstanding length come himselfe againe verily purpose correcte owne errour therfore referred thought minde onely also deed done perceiueth hath offended doth deuise himselfe amend thing beginneth displease thee please thee nowe thou eschuest thing thou ensuedst moreouer hebrues call repentaunce theschuah conuersion returning right way minde againe metaphore seemeth bee taken whiche straye right path doe againe lengthe returne way word translated minde maners deedes men nowe word diuersly vsed worde repentaunce signifieth chaunging purpose conceiued thing ieremie lord sayeth turne euill also repente mee euill whiche ment lay vppon therefore god doth repent chaungeth purpose repenteth doth alter paule sayeth giftes calling god without repentaunce dauid said lord hath sworne repent elsewhere repentaunce figuratiuely attributed god like affection mortall men hee sayeth repenteth mee haue made man god owne nature doeth repent men doe hee touched griefe thing mislike hee like doeth barely alter whiche hee hath done amonge ecclesiasticall writer said repent prescribed manner punishment doe penaunce sinnes haue comitted scripture place doth vse ye whole effect matter gospel actes wee read god gaue gentile repentaunce vnto life disputation vse repentaunce conuerting turning lord acknowledging sinns griefe conceiued sinnes committed mortification beginning leade newe life finally chaunge correction amendement ye life euil better germanes call bekeerung enderung oder besserung diuersly repentance repentance defined ecclesiasticall writer howbeit agree conuersion turning lord alteration former life opinion therefore say repentaunce vnfeigned turning god whereby wee sincere feare god humbled doe acknowledge sinnes mortifying old man afresh renued spirite god definition doeth consist vppon partes whiche somewhat largely opened diligently expounded wil declare vnto v laye oure eye ye whole nature repentaunce first say repentaunce conuersio god vnfeigned turning vnto god hereafter shewe two sort repentaunce wit feigned vnfeigned apostle peter sayeth repent turne sinnes may blotted expounding first last witt repentaunce returning meaneth turned themselues away certeine relation beetwixt turning turning fro thou hadst neuer turned away hadst thou need haue turned againe haue turned away true iust good god holy vnto diuel owne corrupt affection therfore must againe turne v fro diuel oure old naughtie life vnto liuing god holy pleasure wee significantly say god creature help man lord ieremie doeth say israel thou wilt returne returne whosoeuer therfore turne god make themselues conformable holy wil soeuer turne creature meanes man inuention yet esteemed counted penitent nowe none blinde seeth stirring v vpp repentaunce preaching doctrine doctrine veritie needful repentance trueth needeful requisite teache v god whome wee must bee turned goodnesse holinesse wee must bee turned whoe diuel euill wickednesse wee must turned lastly thing must amended oure minde life also howe must altered amended truely prophetes apostle ye lord exhorting men vnto repentaunce doe traueile much sticke verie long describing god nature goodnesse righteousnesse trueth mercie painting lawes office life man accusing heaping vp sinns men wherevnto add greeuous horrible token god iuste iudgements euery place prophet writing found rifely therefore whiche bidd v euen nowe preache lawe men whome would drawe vnto repentaunce thing doe gainesay well like withal admonish preaching gospell also doeth obiecte men sinnes greeuously accuse lord gospel sayeth holy ghoste commeth shall argue world sinne beleeued mee whervppon peter actes apostle vpbrayding iewes sinnes committed preaching vnto christe faith christ exhorteth vnto repentaunce place well knowen actes paule going drawe athenie vnto repentaunce doth say god hath hetherto winked time ignoraunce doth preach al men euery repent hee hath appointed day wil iudge world righteousnesse christ let therefore whome charge giuen drawe men vnto repentaunce learne heere vse much libertie wisedome men maye acknowledge sinne ye greatnesse iniquitie moreouer god doeth stirre vpp men repentaunce woord onely also diuers affliction sundrie sortes punishment yea calamity happen world certeine sermon persuading drawing v vnto repentaunce maye silence ouerpasse written prophet lord himselfe gospell heard tidings slaughter pontius pilate made vpon galilean death men vpon ye tower siloc fel presently say thincke ye greater sinner rest verilie vnlesse ye repent ye shall likewise perish assuredly certeine therefore warre famine plague doe alwayes inuite v vnto repentaunce premonishe v laying sinne aside conuerted vnto god wholie giue selues sincere integritie vaine repentaunce preached feare god vnto v vnlesse feare trembling conceiued mind doe reuerendly dread wrath iudgement almightie god conceiued v oure sinnes wickedness feare outwardly stirred v externall preaching discipline minister told external doctrine auaileth nothing alone vnlesse inwardly heart moued holy spirit heauenly father therefore ieremie lamentation cryeth turne v lord shalbe turned chap turne thou lord shalbe turned beecause thou art lord god turned repented mee euill wee read peter prouoked wordes damsel kept doore souldiers foulie denie master christ reuoked cockes crowing repented fault folly bottome heart yet crowing cocke selfe alone stirred motion woord christe together said vnto verilie saye vnto thee cocke shall crowe till thou hast denied mee thrice wherevppon matt sayeth peter remembred wordes lord sayed vnto cock crowe thou shalt denie thrice c also ioyned secrete touching peter mind good lord touched heart peter euangeliste testifieth saying lord turning himselfe loked vpon peter loking back ye lord made peter hart melt drue destruction wherinto fall therefore care pierced woord god oure heartes touched holie spirite shall wee like true penitent vnfeignedly reuerence dread lord therewithall humbled humbling acknowledging sinnes iust holy god sinnes much offend prouoke wrath indignation confesse iudgment iust v freely acknowledge sinns iniquity yt word god obiected v cry saying prophetes thou verily lord art righteous thou art true thy iudgements iust wee vnrighteous lyers wicked wholie ouerwhelmed detestable iniquity nothing sound sincere within v wee haue corrupt miserable wee haue sinned wee haue beene wicked wee haue done vniustly wee haue forsaken thee wee haue gainesaid thy seruants prophet haue obeyed word thy mouth thee therefore god doeth righteousnes belong v wretch shame confusion humiliation free confession sinnes doth god require penitent sinner touching wil hereafter speake somewhat returne fully expound feare lord present speake syncere feare god two sortes feare god confesse feare god two sort sincere vnsincere sincere feare god perceiued faithful godly reuerence consisting loue honour god prophete bringeth god saying sonne honoureth father seruaunt maister therefore father honour lord feare paule sayeth ye haue receiued spirite bondage againe vnto feare ye haue receiued spirite adoption crie abba father therefore sincere feare god doe repent seruile dread punishment carefull studie mixt loue honour god honest wife feareth husband gratious daughter feareth father yet ech doeth therewithall loue one father husband doeth holy loue indeuour herselfe keepe fauour feare least time thing loose therefore penitent feare knowe taught spirite god haue committed sinnes haue deserued forsaken lord doe also loue merciful father therefore sorie heartes sinnes committed doe aboue al thinges ardently require reconciled againe mercifull god louing father sincere feare god ioyned griefe sorrowe sorrow god ward conceiued spirite god sinnes commit paule maketh mention two sortes sorrowes sorrowe godward sayeth doth bring forth repentaunce repented contrarilie sorrowe world bringeth death king prophete dauid sorrowed godward cried thine arrowes sticke fast mee thy hand doth presse soare whole part flesh thy displeasure rest bone reason sinne forward seene psalme whiche althoughe written greeuous disease sickenesse doth yet notwithstanding shadowe shew v great griefe saincts offending good gratious father continuall sinnes godward sinnful woman sorie luke falling prostrate lord heeles washe feete teares wyped haire godward peter sorie wept read ful bitterly offece godly greatly greued doe oftentimes offend fouly good god gratious father woordes thincke possiblie expresse griefe sorrowe conceiue prophete ieremie describing contrarie affection impenitent sinner doeth saye doe men fall maye rise againe doeth man go astray may turne againe howe doth happen people hierusalem turned away stubbornely gaue eare hearkened spake rightly none repent wickednesse say haue done euerie one turned owne course like fierce horse headlong batteile worldly griefe sorrowe men knowe god without faith true loue god yea yeeld vnder burthen sorrowe aduersities verie sinnes like also maner co sideration vnsincere feare god wicked head diuel feare god father whome sorie offend whome desire reconciled father tormentour beecause knowe wil reuenge euill deedes therefore iudas runne roape loue god honour goodwill reuerence meere hatred horrour vtter desperation feare apostle euangeliste iohn denied bee charitie saying perfect charitie casteth feare meane feare lord ye beginning wisedome haue spoken feare meane diuel wicked men member nowe gather vnto penitentes faith god merite christ especially needeful sense thincke many haue made faith part repentaunce greatly denie yet doe see paul made difference betwixte faith repentance actes hee sayeth hee witnessed iewes gentile repentaunce toward god faith iesus christ therefore repentaunce faith seeme diuers true repentaunce without faith must bee distinguished confounded wee doe knowe true faith without workes whiche necessitie sheweth forth good woorkes yet wee make difference betwixt faith work yet separate rend one like manner wee acknowledge true faith true repentaunce vndiuidedly knit together closely fastened one wil stand argument whether faith part repentaunce doth meanes depend vppon seemeth notable point follie goe tye matter diuinitie precept logicke learne lord apostle admonished sermon gospel thinge repeate againe acknowledging sinnes doeth selfe obteine grace forgiuenesse sinnes euen bare acknowledging disease remedie eue damned men also acknowledge sinnes yet therefore healed acknowledging sinne certaine preparatiue vnto faith ye acknowledging disease doth minister occasion thincke vppon remedie present wee add verie feare god howe sincere soeuer bee verie sorrowe conceiued oure sinnes great soeuer bee verie humiliation howe submisse soeuer bee doe themselues make v acceptable god rather prepare entraunce make waye v vnto knowledge christe consequently doe leade v christe himselfe incarnate crucified v redemption lay v vppon christ alone quickened purely cleansed truly conuerted god vtterly turned himselfe hope worldly ayde doth truely feare god sorie deede bottome heart doeth feare sorie sinnes committed alone findeth himselfe corrupted wholy haue himselfe soundnesse integritie yea reuereceth god father doth disclose wound cheirurgian desiring instantly recociled louing father wheras true godlinesse doeth crie man reconciled god father onely begotten sonne penitent doeth faith lay hold sonne seeke meanes recociliation faith grounded vppon onely grace mercie god exhibited v christ iesus penitent beleeneth yt accepted god christ sake alone therfore maketh supplication god committing himselfe wholy vnto mercie read dauid prodigal sonne cap luke gospell place might bee annexed doctrine gospell faith iesus christ remission sinnes touchinge whiche haue alreadie spoken heere thincke amisse sinnes fully surely forgiuen vnto penitent mindes penitent must meanes bee confirmed many euident place scripture plainly vttered concerning full remission sinnes end hereafter wee haue scruple conscience cause v despaire doubt oure temptation wherein notwithstanding repeate againe againe note thoroughly marcked confirmation glorie onely begotten sonne god lord christ iesus penitent sinner haue sinnes remitted repentaunce respecte oure worke action respecte comprehendeth renuing man holy ghost true faith whiche deliuereth v christ physician may heale disease bynde vp al griefes although treatise doeth properly belonge common place faith gospell haue briefly could alreadie discoursed yet notwithstanding wil heere recite euident sentence touching grace god free remission oure sinnes dauid hundreth thirde psalme sayeth praise lord soule forget thinges hee hath done thee whiche forgiueth thy sinnes healeth thine infirmity saueth thy life destruction crowneth thee mercie louinge kindnesse hee hath dealt v sinnes rewarded v according wickednesse loke howe highe heauen comparison earth great mercie toward feare looke farre east west farre hath hee sett oure sinnes v yea like father pitieth owne child lord merciful feare hee knoweth wee fraile proane sinne doth remember dust esaie first chapiter prophecie sayeth thus sayeth lord though sinnes bee red scarlet shal bee made whiter snowe thoughe bee redd purple shalbe made like vndied woll againe fourtie three chapiter bringeth lord saying hee blott transgression mine owne sake remember thy sinnes chapiter ieremie saying also alleged paule eighth tenthe chapiter hebrues lord sayeth couenaunt make dayes wilbe mercifull vnto iniquity remember sinnes chapiter ezechiel lord sayeth sprinckle cleane water vppon yee shall bee cleansed vncleannesse newe heart also giue newe spirite put within stonie heart take flesh giue fleshie heart wil deliuer vncleannesses wil doe sake sayeth lord ye sure c daniel ninth chapiter leaueth v manifest example confession sinnes doeth expresse word say messiah sinnes forgiuen iniquitie purged euerlasting righteousnesse brought steed doth prophet acharie thirde chapiter affirme iniquitie earth purged onely sacrifice christe iesus lord gospell matthewe doeth say whole neede physician sick neither come call righteous sinner repentaunce therefore called iesus sauiour angel said hee shall saue people sinnes sainct paul timothie sayeth sure saying worthie meanes receiued iesus christ came world saue sinner gospel lord sayeth euerie sinne blasphemie shalbee forgiuen men blasphemie holy ghoste shall bee forgiuen men whosoeuer shall say word sonne man shall bee forgiuen whosoeuer speaketh word holy ghost shall forgiuen nether world world come concerning sinne holy ghost haue alreadie spoken another place nowe place doe belonge example liberall kinde forgiuenesse whiche expressed gospell example sinnefull woman luke seuenth also iohn fourth matthew eighth chapiter zachee sainct peter theefe vppon crosse able briefely reckon also doe apperteine three parable gospell euangeliste sainct luke gospell sainct iohn forerunner lord doeth crie saying behold lambe god taketh awaye sinnes world lord himselfe say disciple whose sinnes soeuer ye forgiue forgiuen peter apostle actes doth crie say prophet beare witnesse christe whosoeuer beleeueth name receiue remission sinnes apostle againe epistle sayeth christ owne selfe bare sinnes bodie vppon crosse pet wee beeing dead sinne might liue righteousnesse whose stripe ye healed apostle paul chap epistle corinthian saith god christe reconciling world vnto himselfe imputinge sinnes vnto knewe sinne hee made sinne v wee throughe might bee made righteousnesse god tenthe hebrues hee hath christ hauing offred one sacrifice sinne set downe right hand god euer henceforth tarying till foe bee made footestoole one offering hath made perfecte euer sanctified moreouer blessed apostle euangeliste iohn doth lesse truely euidently testifie saying bloud iesu christ sonn god doth cleanse v sinne againe propitiation sinnes sinnes also whole world nowe vaine verie nouatians anabaptistes messingers sathan himselfe nouatians anabaptist whiche feigne wee baptisme purged angelicall life whiche polluted spotts polluted hee defiled looke pardon passe ouer many place holy scripture peter co secrated god baptisme hee tasted god good grace notable confessio made lord said vnto happie arte thou simon bar iona flesh bloud hath reuealed vnto thee father heauen againe lord demaunded disciple saying ye depart also peter name aunsweared lord whome shal goe thou hast word eternall life wee beleeue knowe thou art christe sonne liuing god yet fame peter baptisme tasting grace god sinneth notwithstanding lightly denying foreswearing lord maister sinne altogether vnpardoneable returne god againe stopped vp stumbling verilie heard cocke crowe remembred presently wordes lord hee descended himselfe hee considered hee done hee wept bitterly mourned lamentablie yet hee longe tormented griefe without consolation third day woman came ye lord sepulchre said angel tell disciple peter risen goeth galilee loe lord wil haue knowen peter name hee risen peter name forsooth sinned greeuously lord like peter sinne hee would therby declare v penitent doe obteine forgiuenesse sinnes often turne heauenly grace god againe many dayes restored peter ministerie againe commending charge sheepe moreouer lord ieremie speaketh people israel saying man put away wife shee marrie man first husband turne againe land defiled hast thou committed fornication many yet turne thee againe sayth lord galathians rightly instructed ye apostle paule seduced false apostle reuolted trueth preaching gospell yet notwithstanding obteyned pardon corinthian also receyued grace wittingly willingly sinne many thing yet vppon repentaunce apostle paule promised forgiuenesse sinnes ye handes lord manifest saincts doe daily earnest truly hypocritically falsely praye saying forgiue v trespass whiche praye thus doe plainelye confesse sinner lord promiseth heare praye faith therefore euen sinnes forgiuen prayer penitent whiche committed grace god knowen obteyned nowe place epistle hebrues whiche nouatians alledge confirmation opinion haue place thoroughly discussed neede heere busilie stand longe vppon nowe gather summe thinges whiche haue hetherto said concerning repentaunce let v hold repentaunce turning god although hee doeth woord meanes stirre vpp v notwithstanding especially holy ghoste wrought v feare wee loue loue wee feare iust god mercifull lord whome wee turned backe sorie withall oure heartes wee oure sinnes euer offende gratious father humbled eternall sacred maiestie acknowledge sinnes obiected v word god yea acknowledge v integritie soundnesse doe hartily desire bee reconciled wyth god againe since reconciliation cannot otherwise made mediatour lord christ iesus wee doe faith laye hold whome wee acquited oure sinnes reputed god righteous holy benefite whosoeuer doe sincerely acknowledge cannot choose hate sinne mortifie old man would therfore add member beloging treatise repe taunce witt mortification old man renuing spirite matter selfe doth require haue somewhat said touching confession sinnes satisfaction ye speake repentaunce doe speake somethings contrarie trueth ende therefore dearely beloued ye bee ignoraunt thinke pointes according trueth sticke stay somewhile exposition hope ye shall woordes gather fruite ye shall hereafter repent selues confesse confession holy scripture diuersely vsed co fession sinnes signifieth praise lord giue thanckes benefites wee receiue hand therefore confession put praise thanckesgiuing prophete sayeth praise lord hee good mercie endureth euer paule epistle titus speaking hypocrite sayeth woordes confesse knowe god deedes denie heere confesse doeth signifie say professe boast place taken trust staye vppon god goodnesse testifie confidence well woords deedes sense sainct iohn vse fourth chapiter first epistle paule romanes moreouer confesse giue glorie god freely acknowledge thy sinne iudgement whiche obiected thee thy sinne solomon twentie eighth chapiter prouerbes sayeth whosoeuer hideth iniquity doth defend nothing shall goe well whoso confesseth forsaketh shalbe shewed mercie hebrue tongue vseth woord iadah wee call confesse nowe iadah signifieth let slacke loose bowe bended vnbended againe modeh commeth iadah one say confessing yeelding graunting vaquished god accuseth v pleadeth v guiltie sinne indaungered punishment whiche flesh doth presently acknowledge yet standeth stiffe like bended bowe vntill length stiffenesse vnbended doeth acknowledge euery thing god obiecteth v acknowledging called modeh confession germanes say e hat gelassen er hat geschnellt meane thing hath yeelded man hath last confessed whiche hee afore either flattly denie else dissemble nowe confession sinnes confessio sinnes ordeined god sortes one one diuine humane wil first speake diuine confession humane wee call diuine whereof euident testimony example holy scripture whiche instituted god himselfe free acknowledging flatt confession sinne god obiecteth v whereby doe attribute glorie god oure selues shame confusion therewithall doe craue pardon god neighbour whome wee haue sinned sinne obiected v god himselfe outwardly word ministerie men sometime signes wonder inwardly secrete operation holy spirit doth plead v guiltie sinne indaungered punishment requiring v free voluntarie confession sinnes liketh free voluntarie feigned extorted confession truly citizen hierusalem people iewishe religion owne accord come baptisme iohn confessing sinnes whiche iohn preaching obiected ascension christ heauen sainct peter accused sinnes iewes immediately vppon accusation followeth historie heard pricked heartes said peter apostle men brother shal doe forth followeth second actes likewise also keeper prison philippos feeling earthquake sprang instructed ye apostle wordes confessed sinnes baptised men ephesus whiche giuen magicall art heard calamitie diuel brought vppon sonnes sceua fellowes practisers magicke sorcerie feare exceedingly came confesse sinnes vpon cause part doeth confession sinnes especially arise againe confession instituted god two sortes whereof con ssion od one made god ye neighbour made god either priuate publique make oure confession god priuately disburden hart god open secretes oure heartes alone acknowledging sinnes v doe earnestly beseech haue mercie vppon v confession necessarie obteyning pardon sinnes vnlesse wee doe acknowledge oure owne corruption vnrighteousnesse shall neuer true fayth lay hold christ whome alone iustified heere wee thincke penitentes must hasten confessour confesse sinnes vnto vnto god alone alone doth forgiue blot offence penitent hee physician whome alone wee must discouer open wound hee offended v therefore wee must desire forgiuenesse reconciliation hee alone doeth looke heartes search oure reines alone therefore must disclose heartes hee alone calleth sinner vnto let v therefore make haste vnto prostrate selues confesse faultes vnto craue pardon confession made zealous minde godward although cannot made word mouth reason sonie impedimet want tongue notwithstanding acceptable god doth much respecte mouth minde man side wee make confession mouth hart thoroughly bent although wee make confession god high priest yet doth lord regard vaine confession concerning true confession god haue alreadie spoken whereas definition repentaunce said penitentes doe acknowledge sinnes whiche scripture doeth many place substantially speake dauid psalmes doeth pray saying haue mercie vppon mee god according greatnesse thy mercie acknowledge sinnes sinne euer mee thee alone haue sinned done euill thy sight forth psalme haue made fault knowen vnto thee mine vnrighteousnesse haue hidd said confesse mine vnrighteousnesse vnto thee mee selfe thou hast forgiuen wickednesse sinne gospel lord teacheth pray prayer confesse saye forgiue v debtes wee forgiue debitours wee pray biddeth v goe aside oure chamber oure heart deuotion heartes may appeare vnto heauenly father alone prodigall sonne field none swine alone bee seene priuately make offer confession sinne vnto father publicane gospell compared phariseie knocketh breast lamentable voyce doeth selfe confesse say lord bee mercifull mee sinner let v nowe also heare iohn holy apostle euangeliste comprehending maye bee truely spoken touching confession one saying wee say wee haue sinne wee deceiue selues truth v wee confesse sinnes god faithfull iust forgiue v sinnes cleanse v iniquitie priuate confession whiche made god voluntarie confession alwayes ioyned made men penitent humbled often matter ye glorie god safegard neighbour requireth doe men openly testifie haue sinned vnto god dauid nathan ye prophete told sinne cryed saying haue sinned lord also zacheus vnderstanding lord vppbrayded receyuing doeth openly confesse sinne promise amendement wee verily publiquely make confession god told litle aboue much rather yet publique open confession hearing woord trueth wee doe publique solemne maner either ye church otherwise congregation holy assemblie recite sinnes committed crie god mercie pardon truely old lord appointed oure forefather dayes prieste going woordes premeditated purpose leuit whole people followe woord woord openly confesse sinns temple whervppon vndoubtedly daye receiued church christian pastour doctour church going woordes conceined end exposition scripture assemblie dimissed people openly temple confesse sinnes god hartily desire mercie forgiue publique confession sinnes notablie knowen whiche made daniel esdras nehemias say plainely publique cofession sinns sainct matthewe thirde chapiter sayeth iewes make iurie came iohn forerunner lord baptised iordane cofessing sinnes publiquely receiue baptisme thereby declare openly confesse sinnes baptisme signe ye cleansing sinnes therfore baptised cofesse sinner baptised thought themselues otherwise purged needed sanctification ephesian publiquely confesse actes sinns gathering book witchcraft together burned ye fire burning bookes confesse committed wickednesse purged fire nowe confession made neighbour sort thou hast offended thy brother else hee confe made perhappes hath done thee iniurie whiche ye discord doe hate one case verilie ye must thincke reconciliation let one therefore goe confesse aske pardon fault committed let innocent matter freely forgiue confesseth faulte beecome friend againe confession apostle iames spake saying confesse faultes one pray one ye may healed lord sauiour iames teache v saying thou offerest thy gifte altar hee speaketh among whome time sacrifice law yet vse dost remeber thy brother hath thing thee leaue thy gifte altar goe thy wayes first reconciled thy brother thou mayest come offer thy gift also doeth belong parable lord putteth forth expoundeth eighteenthe chapiter matthewe caste perpetuall prison hee found fauoure lord hand ouer cruell vppon fellowe seruaunt whome hee would forgiue much farthing sixte chapiter sainct matthewe lord sayeth ye forgiue men trespass heauenly father also forgiue ye forgiue men trespass father forgiue trespass forgiuing others sinnes forgiuen v forgiuenes sinnes bee free come oure merites recompence oure desertes sinnes freely forgiuen thorough faith verily vnreconcileable harde heart assured argument faith hard stubborne vnappeaseable man faith remission therefore voluntarie forgiuenesse man toward neighbour whiche wee forgiuen god father euidet signe naturall fruite true faith grace god within v two kindes confession men add whereby consultation oppressed conscience greeuous sinne doe consulte aske counsell either pastoure lord flocke else experte skilfull lawe god rather termed consultation confession place either commaunded forbidden therefore lefte free euery man choice wherefore man ought bee compelled co sultation brother doe demaunde counsel either minister churhc priuate brother charitie commaundeth thee satisfie bee thou canst yea demaundeth thou doest see thy brother danger charitie againe commaundeth thee admonishe daunger handle brother paule galathians sayeth brother man preuented fault ye whiche spirituall restore one spirite meckenesse considering thee selfe least thou also tempted beare ye one others burthen fulfill lawe christ belongeth nothing confession therefore wee returne purpose againe thus muche haue wee hetherto confession sinnes ordeyned men said touching confession sinnes god hath instituted wee annexe somewhat touching confession sinnes men haue ordeyned confession also two sortes one publique rituall ceremoniall whiche part call nonlatin alphabet exhomologesis priuate secrete called auricular call publique confession rituall much acknowledging confession sinne penitentiall action sinne committed isidore bishoppe libro etymol cap sayeth exhomologesis discipline prostrating humbling men habite huing lye sacke ash deface bodie filthe mourne lament sorrowfull minde thorough sorrowe amende wherein sinned woordes bishop isidore would haue recited vnto deerely beloued authour famous vnlesse seene woordes manner bee read booke whiche tertullian wrote repentaunce vnlesse found example thereof eusebius fifte booke last chapiter ecclesiasticall historie find otherwise called natalius sayeth natalis martyre seduced heretiques leng vnderstanding errour riseth vpp morninge putting sackecloth sprinckling himselfe ash many teares bewayling errour casting himselfe prostrate feete zephyrinus bishoppe clearks onely layemen also great lamentation exceeding sorrowe prouoked congregation earnest continuall prayer request christe iesus pardon offence touching rite repentaunce hereafter speake nowe rituall ceromoniall repentaunce vsed amonge old appeareth haue beene comaunded god whosoeuer day committeth sinne compelled presently confesse openly sorte wont doe read penaunce inioyned sinnefull luke ioha adulterous woman mentioned gospell many sinner receiued christe grace god without outward penaunce well knowen howe christ dealt matthew zacheus peter denied many therefore wee doe amisse beleeue old bishoppes priestes inuent publique kind penance discipline sake time might haue lesse libertie sinne truely hermius sozomenus salaminius notable writer ecclesiasticall historie seuenth booke sixteenth chapiter sayeth beginning pleased priestes theatre congregation might beare record sinnes offender bee openly published loe heere hee sayeth pleased priestes hee addeth also priest appointed whome sinned come confesse sinnes heare penaunce wit doe abye transgression immediately describeth manner penaunce romane church vsed againe hee addeth church constantinople priest appointed heare penitent whiche office remayned still till length certaine gentlewoman whiche sinnes confessed inioyned penitentiarie fast pray god thereby haning occasion long ye church last bewrayed haue played whore deacon cause priestes euil spoken nectareus ye bishop deuising best deale greenous crime depriued deacon done sinne deaconshipp forbecause persuaded leaue free euery one according owne conscience confidence come communion mystery hee quite take away office penitentiarie priesthoode euer since time hath cousel giuen nectareus preuailed doth euen day indure foorth beginning chapiter sayeth nectareus bishopp constantinople first take church priest appointed heare confession penitent whome bishoppes manner followe thus farre hee bishop nectareus would haue abrogated exhomologesis holy man deede hee hee vnderstoode beene instituted god himselfe neither beene lawefull haue abrogated therefore hee knewe euen sozome doeth also confesse counsell bishoppes order penaunce vsurped church neither doe wee read iohn chrysostome succeeded nectareus diligent seuere bishopp euer restore rituall penaunce whiche predecessour abrogated homilie vppon paules epistle hebrues hee writeth bidd thee bewraye thee selfe openly yet accuse thee selfe others haue thee obey holy prophete sayeth open thy waye vnto lord therefore confesse thy sinnes god true vprighte iudge prayer imurie committed thy tongue memorie thy conscience lengthe beleeue thou mayest obteine mercie thou hast thy mind continually forth againe vppon psalme thou art ashamed tell thy sinnes man thou hast sinned yet saye daily thine owne heart bid thee confesse thy fellowe hee vpbraid thee tell thy god doth regard thou tellest god ignoraunt hand thou didst againe place hee sayeth bring thee forth theatre thy companion compell thee discouer thy sinnes vnto mortall men rehearse thy conscience god declare vnto shewe thy woundes vnto lord thy best physician aske salue againe take heed thou tell man thy sinnes least bewraye thee vpbrayd thee thou needest confesse thy companion bring abrode lord whiche hath care thee also gentle physician therefore thou shalt shewe thy woundes moreouer bringeth lord speaking saying compell thee come open theatre make many priuie thy sinnes tell thy sinne priuately mee alone may heale thy sore thus much chrysostome doeth manifestly argue ceremoniall penaunce vsed church instituted god without iniurie taken church restored againe bishoppes succeeded doe altogether vaine tell v reliques rituall repentaunce abided still romane church haue wee doe euerye church hath taken selfe either keepe else lay away wee rather oughte inquire christe hath deliuered vnto v apostle haue taught v whose doctrine haue thinke spoken enough alreadie priuate secrete confession sinnes wont made auricular confession none bye priestes alone one goeth secretely whispereth sinnes eare prieste appointed heare secrete confession absolued doeth thinke recitall fewe ordinarie woordes hee purged sinnes therefore call auricular confession vnknowen apostle time although good sort yeares ago since first toke roote yet notwithstanding free beginning last wee reade commaunded roughly extorted bishoppe rome state churche corrupted yeare grace yet yeares controuersie decree layed vppon menns neckes whether enough man confesse himselfe god alone else priest also purging sinnes hugo booke church power binde loose doth say dare boldly say priestes absolution man come communion body bloud lord hee doeth assuredly eate drincke owne damnation although repent neuer much doth neuer greatly lament offence hugo say boldly without warrant vnlesse word god doth instructe v falsly liued yeare lord within little vppstarted peter lombard commonlye called maister sentence beecause gathered together sentence father layed forth doctrine summarie whose woorke meane heere tell iudgement thincke thought hee flourished yeare christ hee sententiarum lib dict doeth authoritie father shew first sufficeth make confession sinnes god alone hee annexeth sentence teach contrarie lastly concludeth himselfe sayeth vndoubtedly proued wee must offer confession first god priest otherwise wee cannot enter paradise may haue priest againe certified sufficient confesse god without priest neither hee truely humble penitent doeth desire iudgment priest gratian gathered decretalls together somewhat honester peter lombard liued flourished time lombard hee determineth nothing definitiuely shewinge sentence either side wee must confesse sinnes priest cofesse doth leaue indifferently vnto reader iudgement thus concludeth vpon authority reason opinion confession satisfaction grounded haue briefely declared wee ought rather sticke reserued reader choose partes haue wise religious men fautours defender thus saith gratian ende first distinction penaunce fiftie yeares followed lotharius leuita doctor paris com ded scholer earnest follower peter lombard made bishop rome named innocent thirde called together rome generall counsell called lateranense made lawe gregorie ninthe iteth decretall penaunce remission lib chap almost verie wordes let euery person eyther sexe come yeres discretion faithfully co fesse alone least yeare sinnes vnto owne proper priest doe indeuour owne strength doe penaunce inioyned receiuing reuerently easter least sacrament euchariste vnlesse peraduenture counsel priest reasonable cause thinke good time absteine receiuing otherwise life let prohibited enter churche dead bee buried christian buriall newe lawe conteineth many absurd wicked blasphemy let passe verie many absurdity wil recite vnto past one twaine foulest wicked thinge sende sinner wot kinde priest owne christe hath giuen minister preacher church still selfe vniuersall prieste proper prieste euery one churche euen vntil ende worlde whome alone faithfull minister doe sende sinner selues confesse sinnes iohn saide christ sent beare recorde may bee saide moreouer detestable blasphemie attribute remission sinnes owne confession priestes absolution workes mortall men pray able reckon vp sinnes vnto prieste doth ieremie crie heart man euill vnserchable doth dauid saye knoweth sinnes cleanse mee hidden faultes vnpossible man confesse sinnes therefore man compelled lawe doeth consider reason ponder self cannot choose must needes bee drowned bottomlesse depth desperation greate burthen layde vppon free neckes christ faithfull people thing necessarie without cannot obteine eternall saluation directly contrary apostle decree seene fifteenth act lastly pray sinner able doe owne strength power pray haue sillie wretch oure selues good greeueth mee ashamed auricular confession proued place scripture mennes impudencie see haue auricular confession bee instituted god go vpholde confirme scripture guilefullye wresting place gospell lord sayeth lepre goe thy waye shew thee selfe prieste doe impudently wreste place alone contrarie true sense doe also corrupt testimony holie scripture whiche wont cite among rest tell one bonauentura commentary ad sententias magistri lib dist quaest imagineth two thinges bee confession one formall witt absolution power heale hee sayeth instituted lord giueing keyes materiall wit disclosing sin sayth lorde himselfe institute onely insinuate immediately addeth woordes therefore confession insinuated lorde instituted apostle openly proclamed iames bishop hierusalem hee proclamed decree keepinge ceremoniall lawes act also published layed vppon sinne necessitie confession saying confesse sinnes one thus muche hath bonauentura woonder blyndenesse age writer acknowledgeth auricular confession instituted lorde obscurely coniectures consequents apostle expounded mynde christ instituted iames name apostle decree openly proclame hee addeth woordes proclamation confesse sinnes one nowe else wreste scripture wrest euen hee blindest doth easily se champion vnweaponed combat bringing forth speare made wrapt vp wisp hay shake keepe coyle wt lancestaffe hector achilles euident apostle speaketh secreat auricular confession ye confession whiche certaine reciprocation made haue mutuallie offended one nowe agayne freely confessinge faultes one another mutuallie reconciled praye one agayne haue saide somewhat allreadie little doe see apostle woords two thinges beeing diligently considered make meere mockinge stockes perceyue firste apostle place vseth worde nonlatin alphabet whiche signifieth mutuallie one one one reciprocately vppon inferre thus according apostle precepte must confesse selues one nonlatin alphabet doth signifie mutuallie reciprocately yt wee muste confesse selues turnes firste hee signifieth verie deed muste needes layman haue confessed selues priestes priestes shoulde againe confesse themselues vnto layemen make confession one wee saye nonlatin alphabet loue one another mutuallie hee againe trouble ye priest haue confession heard layman let acknowlege place apostle dothmake nothinge theyr secrete auricular confession haue deuised commoditie apostle addeth praye yee one ye may bee healed hee doeth therefore associate ioyne vnder one yoke confession prayer vppon wee doe agayne gather wee muste confesse none priestes muste praye none priestes muste praye priestes alone ergo wee must confesse priest alone euerye one one another place sainct iames must bee vnderstoode secreate auricular confession open publique confession whiche returne charitie againe mutuall confession faultes offended eache mutuall iniuries beeing nowe againe reconciled praye one another may saued therefore leaue vndoubted trueth disputers auricular confession neither haue proued proue instituted ordeined god see confession wracke go weake proppes god wot staye vp saye confession bee reteined still churche nothinge else discipline sake make men blushe sinnes come light cause many time doe sinne seldomer also saye bee reteined priuate absolution peculiar singular consolation gospell auricular confession bee needefull profitable church seeme haue howe chaunced church space thousand yeares apostle tymes vtterlie without meruayle apostle place eyther vse commaunde agayne manifeste yt tymes comminge christ muche dreame confession neyther apostle leaue church god destitute thing necessary vnto saluation nowe discipline auricular confession planted church god abhominable deedes wycked act insued doe plainely declare hee confesse hee heard confession learned horrible wickednesse euen examination beatinge circumstaunces sinnes commytted meanes gyuen taken cause occasion whoredomes adultery vnder pretence confession chastitie matron virgin hath ben assaulted also corrupted oftener tymes sundrie wayes decent bee named confessours fished secret euerie man conscience thinge auayled greately establishinge theyr tyrannie confession confessours coulde cunningly spoyle robbe theyr shriftchildren called theyr good substaunce knewe rich euery one came peeres euery common wealth knewe priestes priuie fault could choose feare priestes came passe strongly might sett selues extreme corruption lust priestes otherwise suffered haue beene hearde saye haue lerned confession know fingars endes kinde men woman maydens citie knowe howe handle euery one according disposition feare stand awe mee knowe priuie secrete deedes thoughtes mindes secretes tolde confession many time foolishely blabbed abrode peril sillie soule firste confessed meanes confession small many treason hatched vpp put practise surely goodly matter feare carnal bluss ing wee haue meanes one man meane terme ghostly father wee shall ceasse sinne rather sincere feare haue god deede doe blushe thinke hee shalbee wittnesse againste oure conscience yet doe feare seueritie iudgement shal lighten vppon v may sayde moreouer auricular confession established church nothinge else wrought word god bee lesse regarded throughe tradition made slacker confesse sinnes hun whome right wee ought confesse often reme ber sinnes doe carelessely put againe vntill time co fession come come whoe praye goeth cheerefull minde let wise men therefore iudge kinde discipline howe well pleaseth god alledge priuate absolution meere deuise whe aurie confe kept chur solut sake mannes inuention hath sacred scripture precept example backe selfe withall verie deede none doeth absolue v men sinne blame punishment god alone whome alone glorie doth belong minister preaching consolation gospell doeth pronounce testifie faithfull sinnes forgiuen therefore preaching forgiuenesse beeing fetched mouth woorde god absolution wherewith minister absolueth neither absolutio made whit yt effectuall minister doe priuately whisper sinner eare publique preaching gospel instituted christ lorde doth satisfie faithfull minde whiche doth muche respect demeanour minister regardeth trueth whose name minister doth sinner saye doe heare priuately sayde vnto absolue thee thy sinnes vertue keyes hee dothe farre better vnderstand sinnes remitted forgiuenesse sinnes generally preached publiquely pronounced wee doe case set againste apostle example whome men hierusalem heard preache pricked hearte saide men brother shall doe whome peter aunswered repent baptised euerie one name christe iesus vnto remission youre sinnes c added church day soules nowe vnderstandeth vppon greate multitude baptisme bestowed remission sinnes vniuersally preached vnto euery one saying like whispered seuerally eare brother thy sinnes forgiuen thee verily godly mynded man may learne true faith iesus christe sinnes forgiuen well publique preaching gospell ye priuate whisperinges priuie penitentiary absoluinge confessours namely since publique preaching doth conteine commaundements god whisperinges nothing finally since publique preaching gospell doth apply euery one grace god sacrament testifie remission sinnes heauenly giftes prepared beleeue iesus christe yet saye thinke amisse occasion serueth doe minister preache priuatly one two ye gospel lord else wordes christ promise remission sinnes beleeueth doe dispute doe suppose publique generall preaching vsed apostle declaring euery seuerall man remission sinnes sufficient except sinner going priest doe confesse sinnes priuately aske receiue priuate peculiar absolution thinke priuate absolution sake priuate auricular confession muste bee reteined church saye euery peculiar sinne circumstance thereof bee reckoned vp rehearsed praye commaunded v whisper sinnes priestes eare primitiue churche wont confesse priestes neither fewe many sinnes bonauentura recordeth pope innocent thirde counted heretiques affirmed confession made god alone without anye priest sufficient doe faithfully beleeue decree published touching confession made euery man vnto owne priest iudged heretiques taught men confessed god onely though laye pope innocent make newe article faith churche wt space yeres christe therefore liued innocent without suspicion heresie poynte since read nectarius churche constantinople condemned heresie abrogating castinge churche exhomologesis whiche seemeth yet farre better auricular confession godly man vndoubtedly wil condemne v mainteine confession instituted god wont made god neighbour dee onely resect hisse secrete auricular confession bringeth discommoditie honest profite church god haue hitherto satisfaction workes saide thus muche secrete auricular confession vpon treatise satisfaction doth depend shoulde euen necessitie say somewhat satisfaction sufficiently spoken mine sermon worke sixte ninthe sermon first decade thirde decade entreate sainctes affliction tenthe sermon decade also fourth decade spake gospell priest monkes teache repentaunce sinne committed faith christ sufficient purgeing sinnes without satisfaction owne woorkes merites whiche make wearing sackcloth fasting teares prayer almes deedes offeringes sundrie affliction bodie pilgrimage many odde knackes like vnto affirme meanes note difference make betwixte paena culpa peccati penaltie due sinnes guilt whereof saye pardoned washed awaye showre water powred downe vpon wee alreadie haue taught canonicall scripture god doth onely forgiue freely guilte also penaltie oure sinnes wee haue alreadie taught men iustified theire owne workes merites ye meere grace god faith christe iesus otherwise hee vaine haue taken fleshe vpon vaine christ haue qiuen selfe vnto moste bitter reprochefull death crosse nowe add iustified workes doe wee woorkes make satisfaction sinnes effect although acknowledge difference confound iustification satisfaction come bothe one ende iustification christ absolued satisfaction christ rather satisfaction sake wee also absolued christ righteousenesse therefore also satisfaction price redemption christe selues wee make satisfaction selues price redemption selues therefore christes sauiours vnto selues whiche thing doth flatly make christ none effect therefore extreme blasphemie moses lawe doth little businesse none dissolue argument satisfactio wrought work describeth ye maner cleansing sinnes placeth iott thereof workes men sheweth consisteth ceremoniall sacrifice doe agree ioyntly confesse sacrifice onely sacrifice christe plainly prefigured added preaching promise newe testament wil appeased vpon vnrighteousenesse sinnes whipped whose sinnes hee hath forgiuen parent adam euah king dauid adulterie murther vrias haue alreadie shewed affliction satisfaction sinnes god pardoned exercise god discipline humiliation whiche muche misse vnderstande worde nonlatin alphabet commonly englished note inferring somewhat sense gathered manye sinnes bee forgiuen therefore shee loued muche whereby commeth shee loueth muche neither wee wrest ye wordes gospell mainteine wronge opinion historie goeth first able paye hee forgaue hee forgaue able paye forgiue loue beene able paye would haue forgiuen secondarily goeth whether loue simon saith whome hee forgaue therefore lordes answer could effecte bee nothing else haue forgiuen verie much therefore hath shee loued much saye loue forgiuenesse forgiuenesse loue followeth immediatelye saide woman thy faith hath saued go peace wee doe therefore conclude one onely satisfaction sinnes ye world wite christe offered vpp v faith made partaker nowe acknowledge admitt therefore make mony smoke deceiuing simple soules selling coyne thinge neuer neither possibly purchased money thus much hetherto bought solde indulgence writer haue made long discourse suppose little holye scripture fleshe put man must onely vnderstand massie substance grosser parte bodye fleshe together soule faculty thereof whole man yet regenerate lord gospell saith borne flesh flesh borne spirit spirit speaketh concerning regeneratio according fleshe nicodemus falsely imagine according spirit woord flesh therfore dooth importe naturall power faculty manne euen meane haue take first grandsyre adam new man said regenerate spirite god christe rerenued according image christe giftes vertues holye ghoste flesh vsually put olde man spirit antithesis commonly vsed taken newe man heere place requireth discourse somewhat power vertues man whiche although haue elsewhere disputed redye sermon freedome bondage sinne yet heere againe wil touch suche point thinck suffice present argument two partes faculty soule vnderstanding power man vnderstandinge doeth discerne thing obiect receiue refuse light guide soule chooseth dooth lye bothe nill againe impeld power faculty nowe vndersta ding vnderstanding two sortes vnderstand either earthlye heauenly thinges call earthly thing apperteine life come life present whervnto referre liberall artes handicraft gouerning publique weales ruling priuate house heauenly thing vnderstand god himselfe eternall felicitie life euerlastinge knowledge god kindes vertues faith hope charitie righteousnes holynes innocencie life let v see vnderstanding man able doo power hath iudgement vnderstanding man earthly thing altogither none yet weake verye smal god wot vnderstanding therefore man dooth come god small weake commeth man owne fault corruption bountifull lord doeth augment men giftes whereby commeth man wit bringeth woonderful thing passe cause read holie scripture artes wittes men handes god knowledge vnderstanding heauenly matter one small sparke light man witt selfe nothing darckenesse beginninge created god moste sharpe lightsome afterwardes man corruption vtterly rebated darkned againe therefore christe gospell sayed man commeth mee vnlesse father drawe prophet written shalbe taught god paule saith naturall man perceiueth thinges spirite god foolishnesse vnto neither knowe spiritually discerned naturall man olde man yet regenerate holie ghost blocke altogether without sense feeling vtterly without discourse reason preaching gospell seeme foolishnesse vnto doth therefore gifte god heare vnderstande wordes sense holie scripture reason naturall corruption touched wt doth rightly iudge seeme meere follie vnto neither doth perceiue must discerned spiritually hee regenerate yet without ye true light god moste holie spirite another place apostle saith able thinke good selues abilitie god therefore wee often scripture finde mention inlightening lumination shoulde without cause expressed named bee mannes vnderstanding cleare selfe darke mistie therefore borne togeather men blindenesse heart mynde doubting promise god vnbeleefe peruerse iudgement heauenly thinges albeit man hath god hand receiued vnderstanding yet reason owne corruption ignoraunce peculiar proper heritage belonging vnto kingdome blynd doth erre doth doubte hee doth beleeue vse gift god hath giuen rightly hee owne saluation glorie maker let v nowe see olde man able doe therefore since doeth followe blynde guide god wote say corrupt affection vnknowen man foolishe choyce maketh wherevnto tendeth although vnderstanding bee neuer true good yet like shippe tossed fro stormie tempestes affection walloweth vpp downe hope feare lust sorrowe anger chooseth followeth nothing euil holie apostle speakinge selfe doth saye knowe mee fleash dwelleth good thing present mee finde meanes perfourme whiche good good woulde doe euill woulde nowe since apostle spake selfe regenerate praye shall wee saye olde man olde man willeth thinges whiche god willeth breakinge kinde wickednesse doeth foulie fulfill filthie lustes say hee giueth member seruauntes vnto vncleannesse wickednesse one iniquitie vnto another haue verie many example exhibited vnto v bothe holie scripture daily experience let v nowe oppose set newe man man man eneratio regenerate spirite god faith iesus christe nowe regeneration renuing ye man faith iesus christe whiche sonnes adam wrath borne againe sonnes god therefore putt olde man put new bothe vnderstanding wil doeth freely serue lorde regeneration renuing minde bodie hearde place thirde chapter sainct iohns gospell author regeneration holie ghost heauen giuen vnto man meane faithfull man gifte holie ghoste giuen christe sake vnto none beleeue christe spirite god doeth testifie spirite wee sonnes god therefore heires kingdome wee therefore newe creature repayred nowe according image god indued newe nature disposition whereby commeth passe wee doe dayly put olde man putt newe whiche thinge done walk concupiscence carnall inclination fleshe newenesse sense according woorkinge holie ghoste whome wee regenerate substaunce forme bodie abideth still minde chaunged vnderstanding wil renued spirite god vnderstandinge illuminated faith vnderstanding god heauenly thinges plentiousely bestowed vnbeleefe ignoraunce darkenesse olde man vtterly expelled according saying apostle christe ye made riche thinges speeche knowledge againe wee haue receiued spirite worlde spirite god knowe thinges giuen christe v againe haue know spirite mynde christ againe ye haue neede man teache verie annoynting doth instruct thinges true abide ye regeneration man also doth receiue heauenly vertue good whiche vnderstandinge perceiued holie ghoste willeth chooseth woorketh good lorde hath shewed side nilleth hateth repelleth euil lorde hath forbidden paule saith knowe humble knowe exceede doe thinges christ strengtheneth mee againe philippian saith giuen christe onely beleeue also suffer againe yet doeth plainly say god worketh bothe performe according good purpose minde note soeuer doe whiche regenerate spirit god doo freely compulsion willes like god requireth cheerefull giuer spirit lord free libertie hartie goodwil zacharie father iohn baptist saide beeing deliuered handes enimyes might serue without feare holinesse righteousnes dayes life yea lorde selfe gospel saith ye abide saying ye shalbe disciple deede ye shall know trueth trueth shall make free againe sonne set libertie make free shall ye free deede touching libertie sonnes god haue alreadie discoursed ninthe sermon first decade kinde libertie man libertie sonnes god wee doe willingly acknowledge freely confesse arrogant disputation blasphemous prater concerning free thoughe power selues doe heauenly thing wee doe vtterly reiecte flatly denye yet wee doe make man subiecte fatall necessitie turne vppon god blame iniquitie haue elsewhere large declared augustine controuersie pelagians attemper disputation hee attributed good grace god euill vnto nature sense beeing sounde vncorrupted well weighed attributeth free graunteth bee v vnto grace woorketh v yea regeneration spirite rather selues owne power cite rehearse vnto dearely beloued one testimonie onely writinges bee founde firste chapter booke de correptione et gratia hee saith wee must confesse wee haue free doe bothe euill good euill euerie one free righteousenesse bound sinne good man bee free vnlesse hee bee made free saide sonne make free shall ye bee free deede yet euery one sett free condemnation sinne hee stand neede deliuerers ayde rather hee heareth deliuerer saye without mee yee doe nothinge hee presently saye againe bee thou helper forsake mee verily gladde oure brother florus founde faith without doubt true propheticall apostolicall faith must grace god iesus christe lorde bee needes vnderstoode whiche alone wee men deliuered euil without wee doe good either thought loue deede onely shewing teaching grace men knowe bee done also verie woorking perfourminge grace loue doe thing knowe forth haue hitherto rehearsed vnto saincte augustine opinion touching free sufficient note waye nowe returne purpose againe wee haue hearde olde man newe man man spirite howe wee renued holy spirite nowe therefore saye penitentes doe mortifie olde man renued spirite spiritually saye nothing else penitent affection sens lustes fleashe meane euen verie vnderstanding wee haue olde adam together onely suspected also conuicted impietie therefore thoughtes wordes deedes neuer admitte affection counsell doe al meanes resist continually studye breake necke side counsel word deedes admitt receiue yea prayer call vnto v heauenly guyde spirite christ whose conduite leading wee maye perceiue iudge speake woorke saye either omitt doe haue learned graunde patterne christe according whose likenesse wee must bee refourmed henceforth wee maye applye selues holinesse righteousnesse good woorkes godwarde nowe shall vnderstande rightly plainely wordes apostle hee sayeth saye testifie lorde ye henceforth walke gentile walke vanitie minde darkened cogitation alienated life god ignoraunce blyndnesse harte past feeling haue giuen selues ouer vnto wantonnesse worke vncleannesse greedinesse ye haue learned christ ye haue heard haue beene taught trueth iesus lay downe according former conuersation olde man corrupt according lustes errour bee renued spirite mynde put newe god shapen righteousenesse holinesse trueth forth followeth chapter ephesian apostle thirde colossian saith mortifie member whiche vpon earth fornication vncleannesse inordinate affection euill concupiscence couetousnesse idolatrie thinges sake wrath god commeth vpon child disobedience amonge ye also walked sometime whe ye liued nowe put yee also thing wrath fiercenesse maliciousenesse blasphemie filthie communication mouth lye one another seeing ye haue put old man workes haue put newe man renued knowledge image made put therefore elect god holie beloued bowel mercie kindnesse modestie meeknesse long suffering forbearing one forgiuing one another man haue quarell anie forth thou addest apostle hath matter sixt chapter romanes euery poynt wilbe expresse plaine vnto hearer nowe woordes apostle onely teach v old worthie fruites fruites worthie repentace man newe man mortifie olde man penitent renued newnesse spirite minde doe also shewe fruit worthie repentance wite rehearsed vertues office life towarde god neighbour owe god feare reuerence humblenesse minde knowledge selues faith hope hatred sinne loue righteousenesse charitie toward neighbour well towardes men innocencie thing kind fruit holie man iohn baptist require iewish nation saide bring forth fruit become repentance saincte luke beeinge demanded people publicanes mercenarie garrison souldiers thing shoulde worthie repentaunce prescribeth none whiche euen nowe recited lord selfe esaie chapter prophecie rehearsed vpp none fruites reuelation made iohn speaking minister churche ephesus saith reme ber whence thou arte falle repent doe firste woorkes wherevnto agree wordes paule speaking agrippa saying haue preached iewes gentile exhorting repent turne god woorkes become repent againe seuenth chapter seconde epistle corinthian hee saith sorrowe godwarde causeth repentaunce vnto saluation repented behold selfe thing ye made soarie godward howe muche carefulnesse hathe wrought yea clearing selues yea indignation yea feare yea vehement desire yea zeale yea punishment nowe carefulnesse intentiue diligence correcte amisse verily carelesse loosenesse doeth arise invred custome committ sinne negligent securitie penitent doe stande defence sinnes make supplicant apologie god haue remitted hypocrite excuse themselues seeke shiftes starting hole co fessing freely sinns offence praying god haue forgiuen repent th truely verie deed angrie selfe wicked manner life alreadie lewdly spent punishment doth exercise vpon selfe preuenteth turneth awaye reuengeing imminent wrath god moreouer feare doeth take heede howe hee sinneth contempte god originall mischiefes bonde impenitent life furthermore doeth truely repent rauished passing vehement desire loue god heauenly thinges hee burneth zeale whereby commeth passe hee neither foadeth daye day yet doth coldly slackely go whiche hee hath learned word god required hand done performed briefly soeuer doth doth al minde euen bottome roote heart sayeth great prophete god holy man moses thou wilt turne lord thy god hearken vnto voice thy heart thy soule lord thy god also shall turne thy captiuitie shewe pitie vpon thee bowel mercie thus much touching fruit repentaunce nowe vppon premiss inferre consequent repentaunce whose onely scope whereto tendeth renouation spirit christ image god whiche adam fall old defiled worke day twaine prescribed number yeres co tinuall obseruaunce whole life cosequently daily putting renuing old man euer regenerate holy spirite god neuer purged feele motion flesh sinne carnal affection alwayes obiecte eye faithful sentence paul cannot meanes pluckt mind know flesh dwelleth good thing preset mee finde meanes perfourme good neither doe thing moue stirre owne accord wee saye aduentures whiche stirred moued howe soeuer lord gospell sayeth father woorketh hetherto woorke paule sayeth god iohn sonne hath made world heb doeth rule vphold word power againe god liue moue haue actes againe god left without witnes shewed actes benefites heauen giuing v raine fruitefull season filling heart foode gladnesse theodorete de prouidetia sayeth absurd thinge saye god prouidece god hath created thinges hee hath care thinges hath made creature boate destitute steirsema cotrarie wind tossed fro knockt crackt vppon shelues rock therfore place haue say somewhat god prouidence gouernment wicked together epicure doe daye denie saying heart likely dwelleth heauen shuld regard ye thing earth doth almightie obserue marcke smallest word work hath giuen creature certeine inclination nature hath made owne leaueth hand owne counsell owne nature maye moue increase perish euen lust tush god neither knoweth doeth greatly trouble himselfe toyes thus wicked reason wickedly scripture dothe expressely many place pronounce proue god prouidence doeth care regard state mortall men ye thinges hee hath made vse mortall men therefore profitable necessarie cite testimony ye holy scripture proofe argument dauid psal psalmes sayth lord shal reigne euer kingdome kingdome al age dominion fro generation generation loe kingdome god sayeth kingdome age dominion throughout generation therfore god hath onelye created world thinges world doth also gouerne preserue daye shall gouerne preserue euen till end kingly prophete celebrating prouidence god man estate doeth saye thou lord knowest downe sitting psal mine vprising thou spiest wayes word togue thou lord doest know altogether thou hast fashioned behind layed thine hand vppon forth followeth psalme whiche psalme doeth wholie make purpose doctrine dauid doeth testimonie solomon agree sayth king heart hand lord like prou riuers water hee may turne whither soeuer euery man way seemeth right owne eye lord driueth ruleth hart gospel lord said two little sparrowes sold farthing one shal matth lighte ground without father yea euen haires head numbered besides euident testimony also prouidece god daniel wisest man easte excellent prophete god doth say wisedome strength lord hee daniel chaungeth time season hee taketh away kinges setteth vpp kinges giueth wisedome vnto wise vnderstanding vnderstand reuealeth deepe secrete thinges knoweth thing lyeth darkenesse light dwelleth moreouer ethan ezrachite sayeth thou lord rulest psal raging sea thou stillest waues thereof arise thou hast almightie arme thou strengthenest thy hand settest vp thy righthand iustice equitie thy royall throne stablished goodnesse faith goe thy face dauid sayeth fruite thy woorkes god shall earth psal bee filled hee bringeth foorth grasse cattell hear vse man bread strengthen heart man wine make merrie immediatly psalme thing waite vppon thee thou mayest giue meate due season whe thou giuest gather thou openest thy hand filled good thou hidest thy face troubled thou takest away breath die turned dust againe lord vppholdeth fall psal lifteth vpp bee downe lord loseth men fetter lord giueth sight vnto blinde lord keepeth straunger hee defendeth fatherlesse widowe waye wicked turneth vpsidedowne great psal lord great power wisedome none end telleth number starres calleth al name couereth heauens cloud prepareth raine earth hee giueth fodder vnto cattell meate younge rauens call vppon giueth snow woll scattereth hoare frost like ash hee casteth forth yse like morsel shall abide face cold hee shall send word melt hee shall blowe winde water shall flowe againe knowe lord great aboue godds psal pleased hath done heauen earth sea deepe place lifteth vpp cloudes endes world turneth lightening vnto raine bringeth windes treasury many testimony like seene cap booke iob rifely psalmes bookes ye holie prophet hetherto haue recited sufficiet enough testifying aboundantly god prouidence doeth gouerne world thing therein especially man himselfe possessour world whome thinges made heere attribute nothing gentili destinie either stoicall astrologicall neither haue thing doe ethnicke fortune either good ill vtterly detest philosophical disputation case contrarie trueth prophet writing doctrine apostle content selues onely word god therefore simplie beleeue teach god prouidence doth gouerne thing according owne good wil iust iudgment comely order meanes iuste equall meanes whosoeuer despiseth maketh boast bare name god prouidence cannot yt rightly vnderstand effecte god prouidence make obiection thing world done god prouidence therfore need put oare wee may snort idlely take oure ease sufficient v expect working impelling god need ayd hee wil whether wil euen impel v ye worke wil haue wrought v saincts saincts neglecte good meanes scripture layd v shewed haue thought spoken iudged sincerely god prouidece angel doth expresse word say lot hast thee zoar saue thee selfe nothing vntil thou gene art come thether loe god prouidence lot wt saued ye citizen sodom destroyed city thereabout yet euen woorke preseruation lot labour required hee bidde doe goodwill saue himselfe yea cannot saith lord doe thing till thou art come zoar king prophete dauid doeth plainly say haue hoped thee lord haue said thou art god dayes thy hand yet euen psal wholie betake prouidence god earnestly consider himselfe howe diligence industrie hee might deceiue escape laying waite saul father law neither sam doth despise ayde shift wife michol doth reply againe say thinges done prouidence god therefore needes wyles wrought almightie able take ye handes father souldiers otherwise saue mee miraculous meanes let v content selues suffer god woorke v hee argue thus vnderstand god prouidence doth proceed certaine order middle meanes part applie himselfe meanes feare god assayes best owne defence paul doeth heare lord flatly saying thou hast borne witnes hierusalem actes must thou beare record mee rome although nothing doubt trueth god promise ignoraunt power god prouidence yet notwt standing priuily send sister sonne told iewes cospired kill vnto tribune desire paul might brought forth iewes request neither shew himselfe vncourteous vnthanckfull souldiers carried antipatridis horseman went cesarea againe sailed adriaticke sea whe perill dangerous shipwracke copany stricken wt feare hee said sir exhort bee actes good cheare shall bee losse man life among shippe stood mee night angel god whose whome serue saying feare paule thou must brought caesar loe god hath giuen thee saile thee wherefore sir good cheare beleeue god shalbe euen told mee mariner went leaue ship paule said centurion souldiours vnlesse abide shipp yee cannot saued therefore meanes meteores impressios appearaunces somtimes rarenesse stragnes make men maruell doe belonge prouidence god woorketh therefore neglected truely god gouernement prouidence haue impression sort soeuer either fierie ayrie watrie power god power owne doeth ayre make earth fruitefull water flowe ebb againe earth doth bring forth increase although saincts thincke verily none done merit sake sauiour gospell sayeth father sendeth raine vppon iust vniust yet matth neuer forget woords prophete sayeth ye esai willing obedient ye shall eate good land ye obstinate rebellious ye shalbe deuoured swoord mouth lord hath spoken great prophete moses longe deut esaie said thou shalt hearken diligently vnto voyce lord thy god obserue commaundements blessinges shall come vppon thee thou shalt bee blessed citie blessed field blessed shall fruite thy body bee blessed shall fruit thy ground lord shal open heauen vnto thee giue raine thy land due season thou wilt hearken vnto voice lord thy god obserue doe commaundements curse shall come vppon thee cursed shalt thou citie cursed field heauen aboue thy head shall brasse lord shall smite thee many plague c history beare record thinges happened people god euen foretold without prouidence lord god good success prosperitie good blessing god side calamity aduersities curse god therefore herevppon saincts gather men affayres state wholie gouerned god prouidence yet must therfore sitt say hads bosomes idlely neglect good mean rather watchfully diligently walke grace god wayes meanes precept ordinaunces lord prouidence god doeth disturbe order thinges doth abrogate office life labour industrie doth take iust dispensation obedience thing worketh health men thrugh yt help god religiously apply themselues decree purpose woorking lord whome doe rightly ascribe good soeuer doeth chaunce betyde imputing man corruption owne vnskilfulnesse sinns euil soeuer doth happe vnto v therfore sainctes acknowledge although warres plague diuers calamity god prouidence afflict mortal men yet notwithstanding cause thereof arise nothing else sinns man god good wisheth v rather well euill yea oftentimes hee goodnesse turneth oure euill purpose vnto good end seene historie ioseph booke genesis truely vpon earnest consideration god prouidence al godly god goodwill learned pro dence sort doe gather good god wisheth well vnto man hath greate care ouer v greate thing onely also smallest knoweth number dayes life sight oure member wel within without lorde gospell sayth yt al haires haste communion fellowship christe thou art predestinate life thou arte number elect chosen thou straunger christe howe euer otherwise thou seeme flourish vertues thou arte predestinate death verily greatly tentation case tempted exceedingly troubled question election diuell goeth throwe myndes hate god though enuyed v oure saluation appointed ordeyned v death may easily persuade vnto v turned euery one owne waye lord hath layd vpon iniquity v therefore durst paule say offence one faulte came men condemnation rom euen also iustification one benefit abounded towards men iustification doe hitherto belong narrowly weighed might confirme establishe v god good towardes v christ hath chosen v saluation whiche saluation truely certeine meanes vndoubted especially lord selfe gospell faithe sticke sonne god first verily true faith required elect elect called called receiue calling faith frame selues like caled hee beleeueth alreadie tim condemned wherevpon also paule saith god sauiour men specially faithfull furthermore vnlesse drawne heauenly father beleeue must verie carefull leaste conceiuing vaine opinion diuine drawing neglect drawing selfe god verily drewe paule violently actes doth drawe vnto haire also wayes drawing whiche god draweth man vnto doth drawe like stocke blocke apostle paule sayth faith commeth hearing hearing rom word god god therfore doth drawe thee preacheth vnto thee gospell seruants toucheth thy hart stirreth thee prayer wherby thou mayest call crye grace assistance inlightening drawing thou feelest thinges thy minde woulde wishe thee looke drawing despise thou grace offered vse while tune preset serueth pray increase grace greater perfecter thinges thou aspirest godlily afterwards meane space cause thou shouldest despise lesser ye gospell matthewe receiue large rich hauing receiued fewe talent occupied matth faithfully despised talent wherewith put credite cloaked slouthfulnesse wot care greatly accused yea spoiled monie whiche giuen throwne euerlasting torment bound bondes condemnation lorde pronounceth matth generally euer hath shall giuen shall haue aboundance euer hath shall taken away euen hee hath hath acknowledgeth magnifieth reuerenceth grace god heape grace added made aboundaunt hath doth acknowledge giftes god imagineth tell kind mean time doth put vre grace receiued present wont vse excuse drawing came yet matter daungerous vse occupying make merchandize giftes god paule iudging farre otherwise saith worker together beseeche cor ye receiue grace god vaine timoth put tim thee remembraunce thou stir vp gift god thee without god able doe thing selues lorde requireth endeuour notwithstanding without assistance grace truely saide selfe apostle god worketh v doe euen good pleasure againe cor sufficient selues thinke thing selues al sufficiencie god furthermore wish man despaire feele faith hath increasinges try mynde ripe perfect faith gospell saith owne accord doth earth bring forth fruite first blade eare afterwards full corne eare likewise hath faith increasings therefore apostle lord pray lorde marke increase faith furthermore marke truely woefull man cryeth vnto sauiour thou canst thing lorde haue compassion luke vpon v helpe v hearde lord streightwayes saying vnto thou canst beleeue marke thing possible beleeueth silly soule cryed beleue lord helpe mine vnbeliefe loe wofull wretch beleeued feeling minde faith giuen god notwithstanding perceiued weake stoode neede god helpe ayde prayeth therefore helpe mine vnbeliefe faith compared absolute perfect faith may seeme vnbeliefe heare beseeche faith litle soeuer wrought brought passe humble minde hanging vpon mercie god able doe streightwayes healed childe wofull father restored vnto health raysed vp deade giueth againe faithfull father therefore doth feele faith mind let despaire although hee knowe weake enough god wot feeble let cast selfe wholy vpon god mercy let presume little nothing owne merites let pray incessantly increase faith purpose verily wordes sauiour verie ful comfort gospell maye confirme strengthen man wholesomly aske shall bee giuen seeke ye shal finde knocke shall opened vnto matth luke euer asketh receiueth euer seeketh findeth knocketh shall opened man among son aske bread wil giue stone aske fish giue serpent therefore euill giue good giftes vnto child howe much shal heauenly father giue good thinges euen holy ghost selfe shall aske suche like saying set foorth vnto v holy gospel consolation ought moue establish mindes good yea right good god towards v seuerally vnto men also vnto verie townes city end foretolde voyces prophetes yea throughout whole worlde whose endes plague decayes punishment vnbeliefe hath described least thinke infatigable olde simple shooes feete worne torne without good reason god comprehendeth whiche conteyneth thinges thinges whole doth consist partes particular shall care reache consequently euen euerie part
