likenesse soeuer beare lord doeth like allowe hee sayeth lawe thou shalt bow downe worshippe exod prophete isaie none sayeth considereth selfe matter sayeth one peece woode haue burnte fire haue baked bread coales thereof haue roasted fleshe therewithall eaten residue make abhominable idole fall downe worship rotten peece wood prophete thou readest wt muche indignation pronounced land f l vaine god idol woorkes hand haue bowed themselues adored yea euen thing owne finger haue made kneeleth man falleth man downe therfore forgiue therefore auncient writer second bok chapter lactantius inspired propheticall spirite disputing gentile hath thus lefte written image themselues whiche worshipped representation counterfects dead men peruerse absurde thinge image man bee worshipped image god witt man worshippeth thing worser weaker besides image ofsainctes whiche vaine men doe serue voyde sense feeling beecause earth hee vnderstandeth wicked sinnefull acte vprighte streight creature bowed downe adore worship earth whiche end vnder feete troden vppon adored v therefore made goe vppright looke vppward wee lye groueling downeward wee cast heauenly countenaunce earth thither looke directe eye whither codition nature hath guided whosoeuer therfore endeuoureth mainteine mysterie man chap creation hold reason nature let raise vp himselfe ground raised minde bende eye vnto heauen let seeke god vnder feete digge vnder footesteps hee may adore worship beecause whatsoeuer lyeth vnder subiect man must needes inferiour vnto man let seeke aloft let seeke highest place nothing greater man aboue man god greater man hee therefore aboue beneathe neither rather sought ye lowest highest region roome wherefore doubt wheresoeuer image religion religion consist diuine thinges nothinge diuine vnlesse amonge heauenly thinges doe image lacke religion made earth bee heauenly thing whiche matter euen name selfe may appeare bee manifest wise man whatsoeuer counterfecte must need false neither hath representation glose truth time take vnto name truth euery representation couterfect thing earnest toy sport religion image lesse religion bee whiche true therefore preferred thing false earthly thinges must bee troden vnder foote maye get obteine heauenly thinges word vnaduisedly haue wee cited hetherto lactantius returne nowe purpose outward gesture habite bodie commonly spirituall adoration worshipping framed according inward qualitie minde outwarde habite body adoreth submitteth yealdeth maketh subiect worshippeth whiche worshipped therefore adoration translated likewise inner man adore reuerence respecte god bequeath oure selues wholie vnto cleaue inseparably vnto vppon alone hange thinges haue recourse vnto necessity whatsoeuer furthermore outward adoration doth immediatly needfull abilitie graunted followe minde rightly indued true faith holy feare god adoration adoratio worshipping two sortes twofould two sortes one minde spirite inward sound sincere true another bodie whiche outward vnsounde counterfecte false whiche maye proceede whome sparckle religion true adoration fruite true faith holy feare god namely lowly suppliant yeelding humble consecrating whereby bequeath oure selues yeald submitt oure selues vnto god whome wee vnderstand best merciful father highe almightie god vppon therefore alone wholie depend onely wee haue respecte whiche also forthwith soone occasion ministred vnto v wee expresse testifie outward adoration wee shall better vnderstand testimony scripture following dauid sayth come let v singe vnto lord let v hartily reioyce god saluation let v come psalm presence thanckesgiuing shewe selues ioyfull psalmes lord great god great king aboue god hand corner earthe highte hilles sea made hand fastened drie land come let v adore worship fall downe kneele lord hath made v beecause hee lord god people pasture sheepe handes thou perceiuest therfore must adore worship god wee must cleaue vnto singe praise name hee mightie god creatour thinges yea creatour father sheepeheard likewise gospell according matthewe adoration doeth followe faith doeth growe nourished disciple beeing taughte myracle beleeued iesus christ came sayeth matthewe adored worshipped saying thou art matth truely sonne god againe thou readest iohn lord asked blinde man excommunicate caft synagogue whome restored sight saying doest thou beleeue sonne god blinde man aunswered hee lord might beleeue iesus aunsweared sayde thou hast seene hee talketh thee moreouer vppon followeth historie hee said beleeue lord worshipped hetherto nowe belongeth whiche lord sayed samaritane gospell true worshipper shall worship father spirite trueth lord doth allowe spirituall inward adoration worshipping outward counterfecte hypocriticall worshipping whiche proceedeth minde regenerated fayth holy ghost tendeth sincerely towardes one god wee read historie old history th kinges testament prince worshipped trueth whiche consecrated made one adam child required intercessour indeed doth communicate righteousnesse saintes fayth righteousnesse imputed saintes imputatiue christe righteousnesse natural borne yea properly owne christe iesus onely righteous heauen earth needeth first owne sinnes offence people eyther pray offer sacrifice onely hath sinne righteousnesse therfore maketh intercession father bycause none naturally properly intercession alwayes effectuall let v therefore drawe neare come god christe onely mediatour redemption intercession onely intercessour aduocate acceptable vnto god father commended vnto begotten sonne furthermore weake argumentes answeare certeine argume reason aduersaries rom wherewith maynteiners heauenly patrones goe establish patroneshippe intercession spirite saye maketh intercession v according doctrine apostle therefore christ alone doth make intercession answere paule speaketh intercessour heauen spirite man praying worlde inlightened kindled spirite god groneth maketh intercession saint word apostle playne men yet adde reade scripture prayer angel offer prayer faythfull god presence therefore christ alone prayeth maketh intercession v heauen also saintes denie followeth bycause scripture teacheth angel ministring spirites according office offer prayer angel heb prayer minister presence god make intercession men heard angel sake christes sake maketh intercession whose sake prayer whiche brought offered vnto god acceptable vnto nowe bring foorth like also touching blessed soules saintes reason asimili like let first teache soules appointed made ministring spirit coulde yet proued heauenly saintes intercessours angel themselues doutlesse therefore intercessours bycause offer prayer men vnto god agree say knit vnto v knot charitie loue forbycause spirites blessed whiche liue heauen loue v earth therfore according nature disposition loue also praye v answere gather without warrant scripture maye without wrangling graunt saintes heauen without loue neighbour yet notwithstanding adde loue heauenly saintes hathe nowe nature disposition office time past earth otherwise attribute many moe absurdity saint though eyther suffred thing neither yet suffer whilest liued earth according ye disposition nature loue sorie glad prayed v yea also made intercession v nowe haue put corruptio haue lefte v leading liues heauen lord neither knowe affaire neither moued earthly affectios vnderstad passing well v without helpe vnderstande likewise worke saluation already wrought accomplished may acquiet selues rest laboures reioyce defence nature christ sayeth nature woord flesh one since word euery flesh also found euerie flesh earth surely heauen heaue surely earth farre beeing earth according flesh wee doe looke christ come heauen whome according word wee beleeue v earth therfore acording opinion either word conteyned fleshe place else flesh ye word euery place whereas one nature receiueth selfe anye thing contrarie vnlike contrarie farre vnlike bee limitted within place bee euerie beecause word euerie place fleshe euerie place euident one ye selfe christ nature euerie according nature godhead conteined place according nature manhood created also without beginning subiect death also die one whiche agreeable nature word whereby god nature flesh wherby selfesame god man therefore one selfe sonne god also made ye sonne man hath beginning nature flesh hath beginning nature diuinitie nature fleshe hee created nature diuinitie hee created ye nature flesh limitted place nature diuinitie conteyned place confesse property nature christe remaine vnconfounded againe wee must meanes christe one perso remaineth vndiuided take heede least thorough defending reteyning property two nature diuide pull asunder vnitie person though two christes whereof one subiect suffering mortall subiect suffering immortall one ye christ according godhead acknowledged immortall mortall according manhoode nestorius denied blessed virgin marie mother god said god vnchaungeable therefore hee could borne mother wherevppon sprange suspicion say ye lord bare man hee mainteine hereticall opinion paulus samosatenus photinus whiche thing socrates handleth large historiarum lib cap nestorius iniurious ye scripture true faith elizabeth wife zacharie mother iohn baptist beeing full holy ghost expresse woordes saluteth holy virgin marie calleth mother lord mother god albeit heauenly nature without generation corruption yet notwithstading certeine hee whome marie brought forth god verie deede whiche borne sayeth angel sonne god therefore shee brought forth god shee worthily called mother god bare god brought forth bare man neither hath sonne god coupled man vnseparablie himselfe like manner since god owne nature immortall truely cannot die man cause absolutely denie god crucified offered yea died v hee gainesaye paule saying knowen would haue cr cified cor lord glorie ignorant god glorie glorious god cannot crucified meane since according fleshe suffered nailed crosse god bare man onely wee rightly say god suffered nailed ye crosse v though suffered suffered according onely could suffer peter apostle sayeth christ hath suffered v flesh first toletane counsell following decreed wordes shall say beleeue god head may borne let accursed shal say beleue deitie christ may turned chaunged iubiecte suffering let accursed shal say beleeue nature godhead manhoode one christe let bee accursed damasus bishop rome sayeth shall saye suffering crosse sonne god god suffered paine flesh soule whiche hee put fourme seruaunt whiche toke scripture sayeth let accursed therefore whereas paule sayeth god hath purchased actes himselfe churche owne bloud madd beleeue diuine nature hath euer bloud meane dorrhead vnderstandeth fleshe whiche god toke hath bloud since god accounteth others owne tooke vnto selfe wee truly say god owne bloud redeemed world wherevppon theodoretus also bishopp cyrus dialog eran little end sayeth christ god man holy scripture teacheth blessed father haue always preched man hee suffered god subiect suffering wee say bodie fleshe humanitie suffered wee separate diuine nature vnited humane nature whiche hungrie thirstie wearie yea slept also yea vexed sorrowe heauinesse passion hee suffer abyding deede none suffering abide affection passion nature euen ioyned vnto whiche also beleeue called member christ himselfe called head beleeue thus farre hee figure speache called nonlatin alphabet alteration chaunging communicatinge ope tie iohn damascenus nonlatin alphabet mutual giuing interchaunging property wont called communicating property witt propertie giuen one nature proper another example hath ascended vp heauen sayth ye lord iohn came downe heaue euen sonne man whiche heauen truelie humane nature heauen ye lord spake earth yet notwithstanding beecause flesh taken fellowshipp godhead whiche proper attributed manhood bishop fulgentius making mention interpretation second booke kinge thrasimundus hath thus left written said humane substance christ present euery place one selfe sonne god sonne man god father hee man man though according true humanitie hee locallie earth yet according diuinitie whiche meanes conteined place hee wholie fill heauen earth thus sayeth hee wherefore sentence bearing witnesse christ writinges euangelistes apostle diligetly marked peculiarly referred diuine nature father one abraham iam beginning word word god god woord hee thinges image inuisible god thinges made particularly referred humane nature mysterie embassage ministration whiche sort father greater thou madest heb little inferiour angel soule heauie euen death againe testimony whiche haue respecte nature neither seuerally sufficiently agree iohn flesh meate deede bloud drincke deede haue power iohn forgiue sinnes raise life whome giue righteousnes holinesse sheepeheard doore light waye trueth life man cometh father mee doe sett chapiter hebrues againe testimony whiche cannot aptly bee declared communicating woords touching whiche hope sufficient againe doth diuide person person christ diuided mediatour god man whosoeuer vnities sake nature doth farr extend humanitie diuinitie extended gospel matthewe lord goeth bodie ye house centurion whereas yet notwestanding matth doubt godhead present absent seruaunt centurion cured disease say therfore person diuided matthewe hath extended humanitie christe euen vnto diuinitie angel speaking woman concerning bodie christ risen ye dead glorified say heere risen ignorant marke diuinitie euery place yet angel diuided inseparable person make equal al respect humane body christ godhead angel selues doe diuide person christ body actes taken vp mount oliuet heauen standing earth testifie shall come againe maner sawe depart dare denie ye lord also present therefore lord manner verie body heauen earth according infinite godhead euery heauen earth man consisteth soule body contrarie nature betwene selues make one person two euer attributeth defendeth proper eyther doth diuide person body sleepeth soule sleepeth property partes make two person herevnto seemeth belong whiche theodoret hath left written dialogue saying diuide natural vnitie soule body neyther separate soules owne proper body consider thinges properly belong nature therefore scripture sayth deuout actes men carried stephan buriall made greate lamentation ouer wilt thou say soule buried body thincke thou shalt heare iacob patriarch saying burie ye father thou doest vnderstand spoken body soule againe thou doest reade buried abraham sara wife c whiche speach scripture doth make mention body al point signifieth soule body together wee rightly diuide say soules immortall body onely patriarch equitie righteousnes againe earth time shall iuda saued israel shall dwell without feare name shall call lorde righteousnesse lord king therefore must need haue kingdome god kingdome well realme taken v againe sathan furthermore king lordes ouer thinges free ruling christian kinge ruled subiection free say fro sinne euerlasting death vncleannesse lord ouer sathan prince worlde ouer world selfe rule world fleshe wee ruled herevnto belong wordes rom apostle let sinne reigne mortall bodie ye shoulde therunto obey lustes neither giue ye member instrument weapon vnrighteousnesse vnto sinne giue selues vnto god aliue dead member instrumentes weapon righteousnes vnto god sinne shal haue power dominion ouer therefore ye prince world yea world self flesh sinne wicked affection therof doe drawe v againe freedome bondage must king valiantly resist continuing conflict vanquishe ouer come vertue christe reigning v saint iohn apostle saith borne god ouercometh world victorie iohn hath desperation euerlasting destructio enuyeth v saluation vnto ordeined christ better speake somewhat distinctly thing satha hurtes men mindes body good enticeth prouoketh mind sinne furthermore also benefite say christ hath bestowed v therfore praise glorie thankes euer euer amen militant church congregation militant churche men vppon earth professing name religion christ continually fightinge world diuel sinne flesh world campe tentes vnder banner oure lord christe church cosidered two wayes holy churche either bee taken strictly comprehending onely bee onely called deede church faithfull electe god liuely mebers knit vnto christ bandes outward markes signes spirite faith often time meanes without matter wee speake hereafter inward inuisible church god may wel named electe spouse christ onely knowen vnto god alone knoweth wee bee first taught knowe church confesse apostle creede saying beleeue holie catholique church communion sainctes fewe beeleue holie catholique church woords wee conclude church also church manner one first wee confesse hath beene church god shall continue euer professing wee add communion sainctes say wee beleeue church bee nothing else companie sainctes haue beene shalbe wel present age age come enioye good thinges common granted vnto god also wee declare manner one calling holy say spouse christ cleansed blessed paule calleth holy whiche cleansed spirit bloud cor oure god whiche great part haue receiued crownes glorie residue labour heere vppon earth hoping receiue heauen truely consideration church chiefest matter thoroughe grace god wee made member christes body partaker heauenly gift angel wee confesse none holy owne selues else may taken largly doeth comprehende churche doeth comprehend wicked onely faithfull holy deede also althoughe beleeue truely vnfeignedly neither cleane holy conuersation life yet acknowledge professe true religion true beleeuers holy men god yea speake well allowe vertues reproue euill neither doe seauer themselues vnitie militant church whiche consideration much wicked hypocrits wee read haue beene church time christe apostle iudas ananias saphira simon magus also demas hymeneus alexander many excluded put church church maye well called outward visible church church whereof wee speake bee accompted either reason part thereof else whole considered generally particularly particular church whiche comprised certeine particular church number knowen sure certeine place named place called name city church zuericke berne c greekes called particular church nonlatin alphabet whiche wee commonly call parish call parish hath dwelling house streates ioyned together neighbourhoode city townes vnto certeine portion vsually ascribed church parish priestes serue whole circuite called cal preparer virgin therefore pastours church preparers virgin redeemer head church whiche christe bringing vnto chast vndefiled virgin short themselues prouided thing necessarie people god also church possible vniuersall church whole world assemble come together rebellious obstinate brought wherfore iudgment referred giuen yt stubborne particular church conclude vniuersal church consisteth al particular church whole world visible partes member thereof drue forth euen nowe wee spake large thereof catholique church god doeth abide v wee began church god hath bene halbe foreuer tell litle cotinually age age beginning time dispersed thorough whole world visiblye inuisiblye lord people god house shall continue vppon earth vnto world end neuer yet world neither shalbe age wherein god hath sanctifie vnto himselfe wherin dwell shall flocke holy house testimony auncient prophet doe record church perpetual thus wee finde written psalme lord hath chosen sion hee hath chosen habitation selfe resting place euer euer heere dwell haue chosen againe haue sworne vnto dauid holinesse seede shall remaine euer seate shall continue mee sunne knoweth vnderstode christ sonne dauid seate spirituall sion church also signifying continuaunce church sayeth gospell remaine matth continually vnto ende world againe aske iohn father hee shall giue coforter spirite truth may abide euer belongeth also saying gospel gate hell shal matth preuaile church whiche saying truely great comfort faithfull many great persecution intended vtter destruction ouerthrowe church christ alwayes church church diuell antichrist heere vppon earth hath euer shall haue likewise diuel longe world shall continue shall neuer want people hee maye reigne church diuel toke first beginning cain shall continue last wicked person comprehending also euill people haue beene meane time shalbe betwixte beginning ending liuing heere earth haue societie common tormented hell bee godly beeing vnder one head christ make one body wicked vnder one head sathan one incorporate body maye right worthily called yt wicked church sodome gomor babylon ye cogregation chora dathan abyron synagogue schole stewes diuell kingdome antichriste like sort church reckoned vpp wicked infidel separating themselues societie oure holy mother church forsaking communion thereof specially mocker god holy woord blasphemer persecutours christ church dayes heathen turkes iewes heretiques scismatikes generally professed enimies christian religion also wee may add hypocrite smal offence lord selfe euery math math part gospell doth earnestly persecute blame amonge thinges hee sayeth lord seruaunt shall come daye wherein loketh houre shall knowe shall diuide shall giue portion hypocrite shalbe weeping gnashing teeth doubt signified greatnesse offence sharpenesse punishment church doeth followe motion diuel deuises imagination owne heart busied exercised kinde blasphemie wickednesse wherein shee excelleth selfe last sincketh downe hell shee place separated head whervnto hath diligently rather obstinately ioyned selfe knowe rightwell ye obiecte mee haue howe hycrites may accounted church god reckoned hypocrite bee outward communion fellowship militant church nowe againe accompte companie diuels church moreouer saye impossible hypocrite maye take part church differing betwixte themselues lord sayeth either make tree good fruite good else tree matth nought fruite nought sainct paule also sayeth cor fellowship betwixt christ belial twixt lighte darckenesse twixt trueth lying hypocrisie lying darckenesse heere therefore perceiue fitt place shewe meanes howe farre may accompt hypocrite congregation churche first wee make distinction difference hypocrite certeine hypocrite put confidence hypocrits humane iustice equitie doeing woorkes openlye maye bee seene men firmely trusting stiffely standing men tradition custome propertie matth onely flie ye church whiche teacheth righteousnesse christ also curse detest persecute crueltie kinde people iewes iewishe phariseis whome oure lord iesus christe much contention euen day church contendeth maketh warres plaine visible member diuels church counted outward church yea worthie named ye church christ againe kinde hypocrite dissembler whiche neither giue confidence owne righteousnes iustice neither yet doe greatly regarde tradition men kindes people neither hate church flye persecute outwardly agree professing faith participating selfe sacramentes inwardly minde neither beleeue vnfeignedly sincerely neither doe liue holilie sorte season cleaue fellowship company church hauing occasion giuen wil fall heretikes scismatikes wont doe freendes become enimies againe neuer fall churche keepe selues fellowship church life time outwardly pretending feigning religion inwardly giuing selues vp owne error fault wickednes vnto whome without doubt outwarde behauiour fellowship profiteth nothing ought liue euer participate heauely gift desire ioyne fellowshippe church god onely outwarde visible societie inwarde communion felowship wherein consisteth life saluation matter speake conuenient place hypocrite dissembler hanging ecclesiasticall bodie called member body said ye church matter may better vnderstoode wil set foorth certeine parable say wicked hypocrite like sorte church chaffe corne indeed nature corne like therfore oft time hang member vnto men bodyes either drye rotten feeble member although haue societie take parte liuely member vitall spirite yet coupling together certeine stringes cleane fast vnto liuely member meanes whereof also called men member partes body whoe lest ect cut oft time let alone lest cutting whole bodie shuld danger life euen like sort saye hypocrite church christe though vnited church either bond spirit offaith loue neither taken liuely member yet suffered lest worse mischiefe happen whole bodie church ofttimes cut wherby better health may come ecclesiasticall body let v heare euangelicall apostolicall testimonie saith lord saith plainly matth ye gospel lord field cockell groweth vpp beeing soawen wicked man whiche forbiddeth plucked vpp least therewith corne plucked vp also beholde cockel soawen euil man say diuell selfe corne yet doeth increase lord fielde againe lord saith gospel kingdome heauen like vnto nett beeing cast sea draweth al maner thing vp filled brought shoare men sitting reserue good vessell euil cast away againe beholde ye may see bothe good bad drawen selfe nett therefore selfesame kingdome bothe good euil reckoned also matth parable entereth one among guestes hath wedding garment suffered season yet last cast doores lord feast place said matth hath fanne hand clenseth flower burneth chaffe vnquencheable fire paule epistle corinthes putteth cor difference betwixt professed open enimies christes church impure sorte men yet quite repugnaunte aduersaries church name christe man sayth called brother theefe whoremonger couetous person c one see ye eate meate doeth belong vnto iudge without god iudgeth without without say placeth called brother wthout bond compasse church witt doe acknowledge name christe church within say societie church meane outwarde church reckoneth vp yet doe acknowledge christian name neither yet doe withstand ecclesiasticall discipline though selues meane time defiled spotted much mischiefe men iohn apostle spake plainliest saying iohn went fro v none v beene v taried stil v seemeth straunge kinde speeche go church bene societie church could go church man come foorth place inthe neuer came neuer therefore hypocrits euill men gone churche surely sometime church witt yet gone plainly shew maner one indeede againe went church manifestly shewe neuer indeede true liuely member christe churche yet numbered amog member church apostle giueth reason disposition christes true member neuer forsake christe church continue also prosper increase dayly saincts holie men truely doe offend fall yet doe forsake christe vtterlye dauid hauing committed adulterie manslaughter cryeth sayinge psal make cleane hart lord renew right spirit within cast away thy presence take thy holie spirite giue comfort thy helpe againe stablish thy free spirite sainct peter denied lord weake flesh ouercame good spirite luke immediatly lord stirring vpp harte repented departing euill company adioyned himselfe good fellowship lord foretolde greate fall thereto added wordes prayed thee thy faith faile thou thou art conuerted confirme thy brother peter also place time manye fell iohn christe demaunded whether also prouided departe answered lord whome shall go thou haste word eternall life wee beleeue knowe thou art christe sonne liueing god wherefore iohn said verie truely went fro v none v addeth reason bene v stil taried v therefore bicause continued still v societie christ church shewed defectio falling away maner one hitherto haue bene accounted member church fallinge away declare chaffe lordes corne chaffe beeing stirred fanned doeth seeme heauie graine wheate beeinge moued appeareth emptie light fanning put aparte corne hypocrite beeinge light reason defection doe manifestly proue neuer heauie seede god worde neuer true corne christ hence generall auncient al church ot church opinion gathered saide church beautifie themselues title church church saint iohn plainely addeth may euident v read wisdome men power god perteineth testimony christ god heareth god word againe iohn truth heare iohn voyce againe plainely iohn saith shepe wil follow shepheard bicause know voyce follow stranger wil great inuiolable authoritie craftinesse whereby lay wait deceiue let v folow truth loue al thing grow vp whiche heade christ al body coupled knit together euery ioint furniture therof according effectual power mesure euery part receiueth increase body vnto edifying selfe loue increaseth body vnto edifying self loue word apostle plaine yt need better expositio tha haue selues place also ye order maner church ye preaching god word shuld right set downe many doe terme call ye ministerie word ye church wil speak ye god willing third sermo shalbe sufficient place defend yt lorde god hauing giuen doctours vnto church doth found build mainteine inlarge church word yea word come two thing co sidered first church good continual constant studie ye word propheticall apostolicall thodoxicall ye end ye world called orthodoxical bicause soud iudgement opinion faith wtout ye church true faith neither perfect doctrine touching true vertue felicitie faith doctrin church reuealed god self ada wtout ye word god chapions defender ye papisticall churche boast yt haue certein marke apostolique church wit continuall succession bishop coming peter clemet ye first clemet paul died late cotinuing iulius log agoe created moreouer add yt al member cut separate themselues ye church yt apostolical succession found deny right succession pastor ye primitiue church gret weit thei call pastor pastor deed executed office pastor maner pastor haue ben great many yeares rout cardinal mitred bishop sophisters haue ben caled pastor none ignorat altogether wtout vnderstading prophete zacharie heard word spoken yt lord take thee yet instrument foolish shepherd loe wil raise zacha vp shepheard lande whiche shall looke thing lost seeke tender lamb heale hurt feede standeth vp shal eate flesh fat teare hoofes piece woe idle shepeheard forsaketh flocke c therfore neuer whit men proue continuall succession byshops teache worde god sincerely execute office dutie pastours shuld set eye world companie idol dare denie great part yea part byshops rome since gregorie great suche maner idoles suche kinde woolues deuourers described prophete zacharie praye continuall succession false pastor proue yea crafty counsel subtile deceit men truly said common people ouerthrowne againe man wisedome first built man wisdome besides lord selfe doth remoue force armes fro ye building church since forbids witnesseth thes great enimie god antichrist shalbe destroied ye breth god mouth wherefore doubt thinges reade diuers place prophet chiefly ye zacharie cocerning war made nation ye apostle apostolical erre doth erre thing declare haue weyed diuersities error gathered ye number together wholy bundle errours doctrine faith life maners maner one either think man knoweth let v see whether ye church faithful vpon earth doe erre erre point howe farre erreth concerning manner life church wholy clearely acquite selfe errours say fro sinne alwayes long liuing earth prayeth hartily forgiue v trespass wee doe forgiue iohn trespasse v god mercy sake doth alwayes rom purge saint dreg infirmity long liue world continually renewing defiling elect ignorant may hinder thee faithfull hearer churche sayest thou holy pure howe holy church without spotte wrinkle called apostle holy without spot wrinkle answere thou wilt acknowledge churche vpon earth altogether without blemishe thou shalte forced acknowledge none shall neuer suche kinde church remayning earth moste righteous god scripture witnesseth hath shutte vppe thing vnder sinne might take mercie men paule therefore doeth call church pure without spot wrinkle benefite christes sanctification selfe flesh without spot spot deede otherwise cleauing vnto innocencie christ imbrace christe faith imputed sinally ye selfe church world come shall without spot wrinckle hauing put fleshe cast misery shal length brought passe shall want nothing besides saide church without spot continuall studie church wherby laboureth traueileth meanes farre possible may haue fewe spottes maye meanes chiefly benefite imputation church erreth moste pure without sinne moreouer touching doctrine faith ye church christ doth erre heareth voice shepeherd voice straungers knoweth followeth onely shepheard christ saying light world followeth iohn shal walk darknesse shall haue light life paule also timothie saith thinges hitherto haue writte vnto thee tim thou maist know thou oughtest behaue thy selfe house god whiche church liuing god piller grounde church piller grounde truthe trueth churche piller ground truth stablished vppon foundation goeth men counsel decree flesh forsaketh thing hath hitherto stayd erred word god christ thinke man denie greate congregation people exod israell desert excellent churche god whiche lord made errours destroyed wandering flocke lord brought backe againe holy fould church therfore said erre parte hauing loste god word doeth erre erreth wholie altogether forasmuch certeine remnauntes grace god reserued whome trueth maye flourishe againe may againe spred abroad euery place paule called church corinthian galathians holie church god yet erred greatly doctrine faith manner yet doubteth many amonge sincere follower pure doctrine preached sainct paule holy church therefore erred farre forth cotinued stedfastly true doctrine erred farre foorth departed truth deliuered apostle hence plainly diuels might cast diuels men sende men thoughe would haue desired neuer much also touching disease could doe would else would paule haue left trophimos sicke miletum might tim greatly haue beene profitable vnto holy ministerie two luke disciple able haue done would would haue commanded fire heauen haue fallen downe vppon samaria would haue taken vengeaunce vncourteous barbarous people samaria denied harbour lord christ like manner apostle receiued keyes saye power binde lose open shutt heauen forgiue reteine sinnes perfectly limitted could lose bound hell neither bind liuing heauen said soeuer ye binde heauen whatsoeuer ye binde vppon earth neither said whatsoeuer ye lose hell soeuer ye lose vppon earth againe able eyther binde lose would much vpon earth able lose say pronounce free sinne without faith againe could binde say pronounce condemned yt lightened faith truely penitent surely teach doctrine touching power keyes deceiue whole world whiche wee largly intreat place conuenient likewise church hath receiued power administer sacramentes power christ administer sacrament minister according owne pleasure according god forme manner sett downe lord himselfe church cannot institute sacrament neither yet alter end vse sacrament finallie church hath power giue iudgement doctrine euen power iudge doctrine one sentence apostle paule appeareth let prophet sayth speake two three cor let iudge thes place saith proue thinges kepe good iohn iohn said dearelie beloued beleeue euerie spirite trie spirit whether god kinde power iudge also certeine order church doth iudge owne pleasure sentence holy ghost according order rule holy scripture heere also order moderation charitie obserued therefore time church call counsel god according ye authority hath receiued fro ye lord call cou sel together weightie matter read apostle ye lord actes actes apostle leaneth owne fleshly iudgment giueth ouer selfe bee guided spirite examineth doinges rule word god twofould charitie wherefore ye church maketh new lawes church hierusalem rather apostolique church sayeth yt seemeth good holy ghost church burthen layd vppon faithful christian onely verie necessarie thinges neither beside contrarie holy scripture ecclesiastical matter power dispose affaire church diuers sortes good ordering well disposing whereof co moditie men power church whiche sorte thinges concerne restoreth againe assembly congregation saincts vppon earth feruently furthereth loueth thing harkeneth diligently preaching word god partaker sacramets de outly wt great ioy desire heauenly thinges prayeth god intercession mediatour christ strong faith feruetly continually attentiuely praiseth mai stie god euer great ioy giueth thanks heauenly benefit highly esteemeth euery institution christ neither doth neglect chieflie acknowledgeth receiueth thing belonging ether life saluation righteousnes felicitie onely sonne god lord iesus christ onely chose spirite bloud sanctifyed made church yt chosen people whose onely king redeemer high priest defender without saluation therefore god alone lord iesus christ resteth shee onely desireth loueth sake reioyceth loose thing apperteine world yea spend bloud life therefore cleaueth vnto christe faith inseparablie neither doeth hate thing bitterly falling awaye christ desperation without christ seemeth nothing whole life pleasant sathan deadly enimie hath vnappeaseable enimitie heresy errours striueth constantly wisely simplicitie christian faith sinceritie doctrine apostle diligently keepeth keepeth selfe much lieth vnspotted world flesh carnall spiritual infection therfore fleeth meanes detesteth vnlawefull congregation prophane religion wicked men willingly openly confesseth christe woord deede euen damage life exercised affliction yet neuer ouercome keepeth vnitie concord carefully euerye member body shee tenderly loueth doeth good vnto men much power abilitie suffer hurteth man forgiueth willingly beareth weake brotherlye till bee brought foorth forward perfection shee puffed vpp pride thoroughe humilitie kept obedience modestie dueties godlinesse praye able recite euery one study church large discourse much lesse short spoken catholique churche god affirme one vnseparable according holy oracle sacred scripture solomon canticle sayeth one doue beloued wherevnto doubtlesse doctour gentile cant respect said one body one spirite euen ephe ye called one hope vocation one lord one faith one baptisme one god father aboue heauenly testimony agree testimony men cyprian bishop martyre booke de simplicitate clericorum sayeth church one spred abroade fertile increase euen many beames sunne one light many boughes tree yet one oake grounded vppon stedfast roote whereas many brooke issue one spring though number seeme bee increased aboundance stoare yet one head plucke beame sunne globe one separated voide light breake boughe tree bring foorth fruite cutt brooke spring cutt drieth vpp euen church lightened god light spreadeth abroad beames light worlde yet one light whiche spread euerie neyther vnitie body separated shee extendeth braunches plentious increse earth sendeth plentifull riuers abroade yet one heade one spring one mother plentifull fertile succession foorth moreouer reade diuers name giuen church must imagine many church worlde neyther bodye bee separated whiche beare suffer kynde diuision writer call church catholique vndoubtedly signifieth vniuersall bycause one neither moe albeit distinguished churche triumphant militant churche olde father congregation people later time yet doe member remaine perpetually knit together one bodie vnder one heade christe euen seuerall condition bonde free men separateth kingdome common wealth partes neyther dothe quiet rest felicitie blessed spirites triumphing heauen labour sorrowes wherwith warring yet world vnder christes ensignes exercised make two church holie angel sayth sainte iohn apocalypse thy apoc fellowe seruant thy brother prophetes therefore acknowledgeth prophetes apostle sonnes seruauntes one god whereof reade gospell one onely vineyarde two diuers let matth husband men though diuerse euen one church olde father whiche comming christe newe people since christes comming taken gentile differ v hath beene sayde eight sermon thirde decade againe mingled holie churche euill men hypocrite churche separated euill men euen traytours mingled citizen yet discouered make two co mon wealthes although euill men cleaue good yet gathered one churche hypocrite depart vnitie churche churche rent peeces becommeth purer excellently sayth sainte augustine euill men hypocrite churche chaffe amongest wheate cockle standing corne traytours citie runnagates amongest souldiers playne wheate cleaner standing corne lustier citizen safer souldiers stro ger runnagates traytours cockle chaffe separated yea except sometimes rotten member churche cutte ecclesiasticall bodie churche safetie particular seuerall church townes city kingdome multitude city diuideth kingdome particular church dispersed throughout worlde bodie many member gathered compacted together catholique vniuersall churche whiche fellowshippe saintes therefore certeine one onely church god without church light saluatio many whereof onely monarche iesus christe whome glorie vnitie vnited societie churche god greate fellowshippe people found acceptable vnto god true saluation safetie light truth without pale god churche wholesome pasture founde infected poyson religion pleaseth god churche god olde time man sacrificed god selfe without tabernacle temple highe place accounted haue sacrificed diuelles esteemed haue shead innocent bloude rightly therefore blessed martyr byshoppe carthage cyprian hath left writing euer de simplicitate praelatorum separated churche ioyned adulterous churche man separated promise churche neyther perteineth hee christes merites whiche hath left churche christe hee straunger hee vncleane hee enimie hee haue god father hath churche mother hee might scape arke noah hee may also escape abroade churche hee must needes wicked man euer hee leaueth owne countrie fellowship verie good men falleth away enimies lactantius therefore moste truely institut li ca sayd catholique churche whiche reteyneth true religion founteine trueth housholde fayth temple god whiche one enter whiche departe hee excluded hope saluation life euerlasting oure sauiour firste sayde sheepefolde life found wherefore maruell enough againste certeine scismatiques corrupt scismaticall manner certeine men separate selues euerie light cause moste wholesome pleasaunt companie societie church shall finde dayes captious phantasticall men fewe whiche many yeares haue fellowshippe churche yet haue fellowship euerie man finde kynde faulte selues onely finde nothing worthy reprehension therefore conceiue selues wonderfull fashion churche whiche except see somewhere established fashion whiche selues haue deuised contende shame enough yet true churche christ world worthy surely maister builder vtopia cyribiria might set vppe building fit selues seemeth vnto haue iust cause scisme communicate churche seemeth doctrine minister churche yet sufficiently cleansed polished neyther yet loftie selues terme hoch gnug gericht subtile spirituall enough elsewhere complaine church diuers customes vsed furthermore desire rigour seueritie discipline finally exact purenesse life feare shal defiled vncleane companie certeine men many faultes vice certeine minister eyther forsake flee congregation churche whiche sorte day anabaptistes yet sufficient cause alledged men whiche right ought eyther ioyned vnto v whiche maye bee separated v wee acknowledge bee iust cause whiche godly bothe maye ought separate selues wicked congregation whiche onely lawfull vse sacrament altogether corrupted turned idolatrie also sounde doctrine altogether adulterated preacher pastours nowe prophet false prophetes whiche persecute god trueth finally sitte receiue foode lyfe minister poyson none thing god thanked obiect againste v concerning doctrine diuersitie doctrin scisme must made consisteth partely sure opinion numbered firme immutable whiche kynde article faythe withoute addition corruption lawfully sincerely vnderstoode sorte also principle al men sinner conceiued borne sinne none regenerate enter kingdome god men owne desartes grace god onely merites christe iustified fayth christe sacrificed sinne sacrificed onely perpetuall prieste good workes done iustified deede good workes whiche lorde hath prepared v walke sacramentes lorde churche bee receyued despised wee must pray cotinually maner ye lord hath appointed v bee moe sorte sufficeth like groundes bee vniformely purely simply taught churche according scripture thoughe bee added rhetoricall figure paynted eloquence bee hearde aptly blessed martyr irenaeus rule fayth sette firste booke againste heresy since one onely faythe sayth hee neyther hee whiche say muche sayth hee ought hee whiche sayth little thereby diminisheth therefore doctrine minister expoundeth thinges churche whiche agreeable true sincere fayth whiche also corrupteth haue captious smatterers rhetorique selfelearned require though eloquence plentifull learning wanting ye teacher doctrine apostle prophetes moste simple moste free subtiltie rightly might said much simple seemed muche safer meane season despise true eloquence singular gift god haue elsewhere often witnessed partly doctrine consisteth daily expounding scripture applying oure time place affaire kinde euer great varietie diuersitie whiche notwithstanding wise man euer yet separated selfe fellowshippe church commeth passe verie often two three else moe may expounde one place one manner diuers sort may one expoundeth verie darkely expoundeth plainlie man hitteth marke come neare man applyeth place whiche handleth fitly vseth like simplicitie application meane season notwithstanding saithe nothing contrarie soundnesse faithe loue god neighbour vseth thinges edification say diuersitie man taketh iust occasion depart church al godly men proue thinges keepe good al sermon holie exercise referr whole studie vnto edifying moreouer preacher agree wel among themselues herevnto direct thing selues hearer may become better may seeme better learned haue vttered man sawe heretofore best learned loathe sermon learned albeit may seeme altogether haue hit marke yet muche haue taughte wholesome thinges praysed condemned albeit fit time place somewhiles admonished againe vnskilfull doe enuie giftes learned refuse labour perfection neyther loath condemne learned sermon better learned prayse god warned striue perfection wisely sayd aurelius augustine firste booke christian doctrine sixe twentie chapter euer sayth seemeth selfe haue vnderstoode holy scripture part vnderstanding gather two folde charitie god neighbour yet vnderstandeth nothing euer gathereth suche sense thereof may profitable increase charitie yet gathereth sense may probably seeme whome hee readeth ment place perniciously deceiued neyther lyeth anon hee notwithstanding bee corrected must haue shewed howe muche profitable leaue highway lest accustomable straying hee forced eyther goe crosse croked thus farre therefore ecclesiasticall interpreter doth erre grossely lawfull better learned brotherly admonishe make scisme lawfull authours scisme lightly somewhat proude arrogant swell enuie therefore voyde al charitie modestie allowe nothing selues bring foorth neither haue thing common others alwayes musing high matter nothing comon simple vnto men well agreeth yt saying apostle paul knowledge puffeth vp loue edifieth therfore godly teacher cor church also godly hearer doctrine altogether foolish though somewhat grosse yet godly tending edification neither leaue forsake fellowship churche neither striue contend rather vse charitie thing minister liues attached grieuous vice vice minister scisme must made yet meane season faithful teaching admonishing exhorting rebuking comforting lawfully distribute lawful sacrament man hath iust occasion forsake church lorde expresly saith gospel scribe phariseis sit moses seate al therefore euer bid latth obserue obserue workes say behold lorde saith say therefore teacher liues agreable doctrine yet stoode moses seat say bicause taught word god lawfully sincerely biddeth receiue sincere doctrine life agreeable doctrine biddeth refuse therefore make scisme preacher euill liues sake lorde doth forbid surely commaundes ee false propetes euil life false doctrine maketh false prophet great con lict matter holy father augustine donati te contended ministerie smaller power imperfection minister case considered sort diuersitie ceremony scisme must made cause haue leaue forsake church vnlikelinesse varietie ceremony baptisme childre say obserue one order also celebration supper take breade lorde handes sitting come take handes minister also put mouthes receiuers celebrate communion often sildome vpon set dayes vse one forme prayer neither haue assembly one manner neyther meete one time howe shall beleeue spirite vnitie peace whome founde great diuersitie iust cause therefore doe communicate customes shall speake fitly proper place maruell men altogether rude ignoraunt ecclesiasticall matter bring argumentes defence wicked scisme poore wretch ignoraunt great diuersitie hath bene alwayes ceremony vnitie notwithstanding alwayes remayning vndiuided catholique church socrates famous writer ecclesiasticall historie fift booke history chapter setteth large diuersitie ceremony church god amongst thing sayth religion saith keepeth one kynde ceremony albeit agree doctrine agree faith differ ceremony againe shall laboursome troublesome yea impossible describe al ceremony church citie regio blessed martyr irenaeus writing victor bishop rome reherseth great diuersity ye church fasting keeping feast easter addeth yet withstanding euen varied obseruations peaceable among themselues v yet neyther doth disagreement fasting breake agreement faith againe blessed polycarpus saith hee whe came rome vnder anicete hauing small controuersie certeine matter reconciled kinde matter cotended awhit neither could anicetus persuade polycarpus obserue thinges iohn disciple lord rest apostle ben conuersant always obserued neither polycarpus persuade anicetus keepe custome traditio elder succeeded said kepe mater thus standing felowship one thus far moreouer ye auncient church vsed great libertie obseruatio ceremony yet always brake ye bond vnitie yea austine prescribing vnto ianuarius diuersitie ceremony shuld either followe biddeth make ascisme iudging moderately wisely rule saith thing better tha graue wise christian wil sort shal se euery church vnto chauce cometh whiche neither contrarie faith good maners comauded counted indifferent according society amongst liue obserued againe least vnder pretence rule counsel might force vpon euery ceremony wold addeth church god placed amidst muche chaffe cockle suffereth many thinges yet whatsoeuer either cotrarie faith good life alloweth neither hold peace neither doth last al whereas men thinke true impure life men conuersant churche scisme must made church yet faultie manner seen men conuersant ye churche whose conuersation feare polluted vnles either come ye churche else quickly forsake fall ye madnes ye heretikes called catharoi deceiued ye false imagination exact holinesse vsing sharpe crueltie fled church ye fruit ye doctrine gospel plainly appeared set ye prophetical apostolicall wit holy church esaie ieremie rebuking ye maners time greatly inueigh corruption doctrine maners neither charge light comon fault heynous esaie crieth crowne head soale foot whole place yet departed fro ye churche planted selfe newe albeit fro al vngodlinesse corruptio kept self diligetly many fault nay howe many errours pray amongest apostle christ selues lord depart church corynth corrupted maners also doctrine contetions factios brawlings whordome breaking wedlocke vndoutedly comon among thinke ye many present prophane sacrifice surely small error yt esteemed baptisme according ye worthinesse minister defiled lord supper priuate prodigal banquet yea resurrection dead thought aright ye apostle ye cause either depart selfe commaund others depart yea rather calleth holy church greatly rebuking cotentions exhorteth al obserue ye vnitie church sinceritie truth douted therfore ye greatly sinne abstein fellowship rather catholique churche albeit great corruption life yet ye doctrine sincere sacramets purely ministred men obiect ye vnworthie partaker lordes supper scisme must made admit al men wtout exception ye receiuing lordes supper wicked men drunkard couetous men souldiers like kindes men whome holy apostle forbids v eate comon breade far yt graunteth v partaker th lord table except therfore like defiled fellowship wicked needful either ioyne societie else altogether flee lord supper receiuing therof liue wil speak place apt time onely bring yt paule faithfull seruant iesu christe sharper maister manifest yt admitted iudas ye holy table knew wont saide intus cute yt say throughly within without yet put wold haue reiected knowne ye rest disciple wold haue ben polluted copanie iudas selfe polluted minde conscience corrupt rest apostls whose mind pure perfect faith could defiled another man trecherie therfore saith paule ye apostle let proue selfe let eate cor breade drinke cup biddeth euery man proue self iudge man seruant standeth lorde falleth thou beest indued faith dost lawfully participate lord table thou art defiled man wickednesse therefore auoyd pollution cause thou shouldest separated church yu seest bad mingled good partaker ye lord supper thou beest separated yu plainly declarest thy selfe hardned arrogancie partaker whome aug booke parmenian first chapter painteth forth proper liuely colour uil childre hatred men iniquity throughe studie owne contention go eyther wholy alure lest diuide simple people prouoked bragging title name puft vp pride folish wit quietly correct may mende patiently suffer louingly mourne till god selfe either amend day iudgement fan away chaffe furthermore vnitie must kepte scisme eschued concluding place wil recite vnto bee good corne corne shalbe laid vp lord barne may receiue fruite labour trauell apostle saith epistle great house vessel gold siluer also wood earth vessel honor dishonor let v indeuour labor may may vessel either gold siluer lorde hath libertie break peeces earthe vessel also giuen yron rod seruat greater tha lord neither let man think lawful challenge selfe father hath giue sonne might able purge owre fanne chaffe al wit man hath separate al chaff fro corne proud obstinacie wicked presumption lewde furie taketh selfe while men alwayes take selues dominion tha peaceable iustice requireth perish fro church while proudly lift vp selues blinded owne presumption bereft light truth lord iesus reduce wandering shepe vnitie ye catholique churche liuing vnitie keepe vphold amen aduersaries ouercome departing church rome arise vp new cruel enimes yt say ye defender romane monarchie apostolique sea cal auncient church cry eue whorse guiltie ye cryme whereof condemned anabaptistes certeine fantastical fellowes say wicked scisme forced necessitie haue forsaken olde romishe church haue set vp selues new hereticall synagogue alledge yt holy scripture hath yet authoritie church rome yt reade yet church yt fetch disputation al schooles yea also yt sacrament haue right place vse therfore wicked scismatiques wtout necessary cause go away departed catholique church faultes clergie bishop must need therefore digresse little contende defender pop church shewe neuer departed catholique church christe beecause matter chiefly ho beehoueth knowe truely said b heretique scismatique matter first speake word augustine thinketh yt differece betwene heretique scismatique yt heretique doth corrupt sinceritie faith doctrine apostle wicked doctrine scismatique although sinne pure doctrine sincere faith yet rashly separate himselfe church breaking bond vnitie surelie properly heretique whosoeuer hee bee contrarie scripture whiche word god article faith sound opinion church grounded word god hope te poral commoditie owne braine fleshly choice chooseth receiueth teacheth followeth straunge thinges stiffely reteyning doeth defend spread abroade imperiall edicte augustus cesar gratian valentinian theodosius defined bee catholiques christian continue religion whiche peter taught church rome blessed damasus peter bishop alexandria teach say confessing according teaching apostle doctrine gospel godhead father sonne holy ghost equall maiestie holy trinitie againe declared heretiques followe contrary opinion whome accompte madd infamous worthie punishment scismatique whosoeuer separateth himselfe vnitie ye true church god either himselfe gathereth together newe assembly ioyneth himselfe congregation gathered others albeit doctrine erre little nothing thinke man either gainesaye thinge description therefore defender romishe monarchie greatly offend v euermore hauing mouthes v heyndus crime heresie scisme wee teach nothing sinceritie trueth holy scripture article faith opinion catholique church whiche sounde established canonicall scripture liked v haue sought earthly commoditie would surely haue continued ye popishe doctrine thing gainefull haue receiued doctrine christ open euery man reproche whereof wee ignoraunt departed doctrine ye pope hope therfore temporall commoditie doe wee embrace doctrine christ neither doe wee presumptuously affirme thing man teach v better god word wee refuse embrace whiche better moreouer open voice heart condemne heresy heretiques whosoeuer auncient church either generall counsel without counsel hath killed sworde god word striue false doctrine pope new decree whiche fight word god filthie abuse corruption church bishop rome haue taken themselues wt conspiratours tyrannie ouer church playing part antichrist temple god tyrannie therfore antichristianisme wee flie refuse christe yoke wee refuse fellowship saincts flie yea rather end wee may remaine societie become true bers christ sainctes flying popish church wee gathered together againe one holy catholique apostolique church churche wee doe acknowledge verie house god proper sheepefould christ oure lord whereof hee sheepeheard freely without ceremony vsed receiued daye shee seene shee would surely haue accursed auncient churche wanted decree wherevppon churche rome daye altogether stayeth selfe ignoraunt monarchie stately court therfore auncient apostolique church rome wee neuer departed neither euer depart ack owledge moreouer rome day doe worshipp christ keepe themselues popish pollution beloued brother sort doubt rome hath great many finally wee doe acknowledge vpstart church rome ye true church christ whiche doeth acknowledge worshipp pope christ vicar earth obedient lawes wherefore wee cannot scismatiques leauing cotrarie church rome cannot come within compasse neither outward visible neither inward inuisible church god godly beare many thinges church say member church minister shewed late entreated scismatiques vppstart church rome thou shalt finde small tollerable faultes either doctrine life errours faultes heynous desperate abhominable manner charitie bee therefore could hope better vntoward lamentable thinges hypocrite euill men accompted parcell outward visible church god suffered romanistes neither euill men hypocrite verie worste cruell enimies christ trueth openlye blaspheming gospel persecuting beleeue christ therefore neither haue outward yet inward markes ye church spirite lord resteth vppon church ome th inward rkes church f god tremble woord god men fret fume man vnfeignedly reuerence woord god true faith attributeth onelye vnto christe meanes whereby commeth vnto euerlasting life men doe persecute faithfull beecause attribute vnto christe iesus alone meanes whereby atteine vnto euerlastinge life parte stake meanes saluation popish fancy steede charitie exercise crueltie brother neighbour shall man saye abuse publique goodes churche spende according owne priuate lustes whiche old time faithfull haue charitie giuen vse church sustentation poore doe men waste liuing lecherouflie filthilie whiche thing electe apostle lord pet stle peter thaddeus foretell church god concerning touchinge outwarde markes churche shall church ome arde rkes church f god saye men saye canonicall scripture hath authoritie churche rome woorde reade bothe church scholes sacramentes haue force effectuall amoungest shewe contrarie first make subiecte interpretation holy sacred scripture vnto sea righte iudgement case giue vnto idol pope rome canon euery man knoweth whatsoeuer hee decreeth soeuer hee establisheth men bee obserued euer inuiolably againe whole churche thoroughout vniuersall worlde knoweth holye churche rome hath authoritie giue iudgement thinges neither lawefull anye giue iudgement iudgements therfore shee also iudgeth scripture expoundeth turneth windeth whiche waye shee listeth nowe remember howe manifest woordes standardbearers sen doe write canonicall scripture taketh authoritie churche abusinge sentence auncient father sainct augustine would haue beleeued gospell authoritie holy churche moued mee c affirme whiche cannot bee manifest vnto men romishe church ruler churche doe take awaye naturall sense true meaning holy scripture haue sett downe straunge sense steede whiche sense ende maye better bee liked men call sense holye mother churche whiche sense also vrge great wickednesse oppose natiue sense shall receiue labour reprochefull name heretique fewe wordes except bring whole scripture wrested minde gaine saye tempered diuellishe decree poyson bee saide haue broughte holye scripture haue taught heresie example matter wil made plainer scripture teacheth iesus christe onely head church vnlesse also ioyne pope head church militant earth wilbe called heretique scripture teacheth iesus christe onely intercessour mediatour priest onely sacrifice propitiatorie faithfull vnlesse ioyne herevnto christ deed mediatour redemption sainctes together christe ye mediatours intercession priest daily offer vnbloudie sacrifice sainctes maye bee acknowledged intercessours together christ heauen priestes earth daily offer masse sacrifice quicke dead else called heretique scripture teacheth iesus christe righteousnesse faithfull righteousnesse receiue faith vnlesse part stake betweene righteousnesse christ woorkes men merit wilbe called heretique scripture teacheth christe ascended heauen hath established vicegerent power witt holy ghost also wil come againe ye world bodily onely daye iudgement vnlesse acknowledge christ also corporally present bread sacrament doest also worship thou wilt else called heretique christe lord said last supper reaching cup disciple drincke thou wilt contend kindes sacrament ought giuen al faithfull thou wilt called heretique god said lawe thou shalt make image thou shalt worship thou shalt serue vnlesse thou vnderstad image idol gentile saturne mercurie true god sainct thou wilt called heretique many e thinges sort could bring forth spake ignorant authoritie therfore place shall say word god sea seeth filthie beastes doe tread vnderfoote captiue holy word god establishe reestablishe lawes god according owne giantlike bouldnesse therefore cleare thing may cleare romish church destitute holy word god haue shewed plainely first sermon decade enough boast woords holy scripture vnlesse therewithall naturall sense reteined vncorrupted church rome hath corrupted sense meaning yt holy scripture thrust vppon simple people opinion contrarie yt scripture therfore church rome yt true church christ sacramet baptisme ministred popish priestes albeit doe reiterate baptised name father sonne holy ghoste first sermon decade haue shewed yet breaking bread distribution lord supper defiled also corrupted wt doctrine contrarie sound faith turned filthy merchaundize man sound iudgement safe conscience without corruption religion communicate filthie life wicked manner priestes romishe church time saye nothing alreadie appeareth doubt wilfully blinde sea rome hath outward markes true church god ioyned pure word god sound preaching gospell wanteth say heauenly ministerie lawefull minister church also wholsome vse lord supper therefore true churche god whiche man may depart without beeing guiltie scisme meanes man wil say christ shal haue church left lord eserueth himselfe church thoughe gouernoures erre earth gouernours church erre corrupt forsake word god hope pray remayneth church markes churche appeare pray church aunswere almightie god calamity church gouernours fall away word true worship god doe imbrace bring newe lawes newe ordinance churche true outward markes church time either darckened worne vse doth yet notwtstanding reserue vnto himselfe churche earth whiche church also furnisheth repaireth true teacher whome sendeth albeit acknowledged true minister teacher god church seeme true ordinarie gouernours church rather codemned founde israel famous church god helias great excellent prophet god horrible falling awaye god loathsomnesse miserable people appeared one token true church god flying wildernesse hid himselfe corner beeing asked lord hee aunsweared haue beene verie iealous lord god hostes reg childre israel haue forsaken thy couenaunt cast downe thine altar slaine thy prophet sword onely lefte seeke life take away streight wayes hee sent backe land israel whence fled heard moreouer word haue left vnto selfe seuen rom thousand israel haue neither bowed knee baal neither kissed behold mightie prophet thought himselfe beene left number faithful israel heard ye god reserued seuen thousand holy bowed knee say neuer serued baal much outward reuerece knoweth prophete vnderstood number seuen exceeding great number ye true seruants god vndoubtedly circu cised couenaunt baal couenaunt eternall god men lacked faith therefore without doctrine though common neither seemed vnto baalits either ordinary catholique vndoubtedly wanted ye vse sacrifice seeing lawfully offered would partaker yt vnlawful meane season destitute thing signified outward signes sacrament partaker throughe faith gift god selfe sort since though romish churche church yet god hathe church earth bishop rome ye maner king ieroboam hauing forsaken sound preaching gospell hauing corrupted first simple institution lord supper discerned outward mark steed sincere preaching gospell certeine kinde doctrine mixed corrupted wt men decree set forth steed ye lord supper popish masse celebrated steede ordinance god came high heap foolish superstitious ceremony whervnto great number men yelding made themselues subiect sea rome ye meane space notwtstanding church god vtterly extinguished throughout al world neither holy ministerie word god true worship god vtterly decayed amongest men found spred abrode euery place men neither alowed pope conspirator nether corruption matter church worshipped lord christ acknowledged onely authour saluation therfore kept selues free popish filthines god also sent almost euery age since beginning popedome men graue godly learned greuously accused ye pope kingdome tyrannie euen prophet old time dayes ieroboam idolatrous corruption costantly requiring ye reformation ye church popish corruption also teaching true doctrine saluation true vse sacramentes wheras pure reformation reason antichristes tyrannie could bee obteined notwithstanding found continual studie puritie godly desire lawful vse sacrament euen said elect member true church god dayes ieroboa achab manasses time captiuitie babylon euen time true prophet god acknowleged true prophet priest baal codemned scismatiques heretiques eue certeine age past ye bishop rome conspiratours excomunicate persecute godly learned men preached word god called reformation ye church many put death fire sword thing lord maister himselfe prophet apostle foreshewe come passe moreouer god could vndoubtedly reserue himselfe mightie church euen vnder papisme euen doubte hee hath done gret vnder mahometanisme thinke yt bers church god remayning asia africa could merciful god mightie power ye last calamitie ruine god church reserue againe sometime neuer one worshipped beast receiued mark hath turkie day let declare yt best rightly hath beene done amongest v last age man denie great goodnesse god see come passe yt euen circumcision signe god couenaunt old giue vnto people god euen ye middest falling god also day ye greatest darcknesse antichrist holy baptisme giuen christias seale forgiuenesse sinnes inheritance child god surely purenes doctrine prophaned wt infinite grosse tradition ye pope sworne frends yet meane time altogether abolished yt repeat againe thing yt haue said godly learned men sent god cry reformation church greatly profiting child god certein vniuersall consent receiued certeine vndoubted decalogue tenne commandements set downe short absolute summe commaundements god ye lord prayer taughte v ample forme prayer vnto god apostle creed conteyned perfect rule faith beleeued surelie custome recite creede almost vnto euery one departinge world lay euen last gasp perfect rule faith whiche bringeth saluation neither doubt mercifull god father mercy vouchsafed saue theefe vppon crosse euen giuing vp life mercie vppon oppressed tyrannie antichrist vnmeasurable grace touched heart men liuing readie die taught holy spirite cofessing one god father maker thing one iesus christ sonne god redeemer world haue suffered risen againe one holy ghoste finallie holie catholique church hath sanctifyed forgiuing sinnes hath translated soules faithfull men life euerlasting according beleeued place also wee beleeue flesh raised againe shalbe caried end world haue therfore answere also aske whether oure elder died beefore last time wherein gospell reuealed damned let therfore bee aliue rather looke least contempt word god cont ntions raised word god come worse end tha forefather came therfore thoughe acknowledge popish church true church yet followeth thereof neither church god earth say ye true church god beleeueth christe forsaketh word church also haue plentifully enough god worketh also beleeue againe therefore despiseth thing thess despiseth man god hath euen giuen holy spirite lorde sayth gospell luke heareth heareth despiseth despiseth mee againe euer ye shall scripture natural let euerie thinge giuen belongeth meane god th minister sense giue minister equall power manner christ perteineth vnto communicate also vnto say meanes ministerie must set lest wax vile estimation among prophane men othersome againe speake inwarde drawing spirite seeme make superfluous take cleane away outward ministerie attribute nothing vnto therefore ministerie must limited boundes leaste drawne hither thither affection lustes men either much little attributed vnto let ministerie deed beautified kept authoritie let done without dishonouring god neyther deede becommeth v vnder pretence ministerie attribute man labour god office whome men ought depend vnto whome onely welspring giuer goodnesse ought haue respect therfore faithfull minister lorde iesus ought haue regard herevnto may keepe glorie authoritie christ vnblemished priesthoode sound vnto selfe euerie point lorde iesus selfe sitting righte hande father true taber acle god pight man remaineth priest yea onely high priest church euer executing yet dueties priest church onely teacher maister churche teacheth disciple churche congregation faithful induing holy ghoste regenerating drawing sanctifying making free sinnes thing scripture euerie place plainely teacheth nto mini rie cor glory power hath giuen vnto none neyther doth minister vnles blinded diuelish pryde take vnto selfe though worke workes proper vnto christe eyther christe christes stead together christ apostle christ faithful minister chosen instrument god giue holy ghoste drawe men hart inwardly anoynt men mindes regenerate soules giueth minister preache dispose fellowe labourer apostle doctrine gospell resembleth teacher church one soweth matth seede compareth minister gardener planter tree committeth outward manuring god giueth increase whiche testimonie scripture augustine instructed learned speake write ministerie church nothing shoulde diminished glorie god inwardly moueth teacheth v yet meane time office ministerie taken away despised vnprofitable epistle ad circenses order accounted speaking secrete drawing god outwarde ministerie men sayth oure workes god would al attribute thinges vnto man working wee greate conuersion multitude speaking exhortation happen thing hee worketh bringeth passe minister outwardly warneth token signes thing thing selues inwardly teacheth selfe thus farre least might seem man spake briefly sparingly worthily enoughe ministerie church euen selfe immediately addeth sayth neyther therfore ought flowe come vnto bycause whatsoeuer done prayse woorthy among commeth v alone doth wonderfull thinges ought carefully runne behold workes god owne workes bycause euen selues haue goodnesse v worke man therefore apostle said neither plateth thing watereth god giueth increase writer speaking verie thing treatise vpon iohn al men kingdome sayth shall suche taught god shall heare men though heare men yet vnderstand inwardly giuen shineth inwardly inwardly reuealed occupied saying houres singing saying mass men sowe superstition obstinately defend bitterly persecute true religion another sort ye greatest part monkish priestes doe nothing else singe church mumble feare v popish archpriest neither vnderstood popish dignitie word office ouerseeinge whiche others call visiting haue charge degree countrie admonishing correcting haue prelacie superioritie reape reward thereby c wee returne purpose deriue priestes sacrificer seuentie disciple whome kindes bishop read ye gospel lord choose order bishop peter himselfe residue apostle immediatly diuide order bishop three partes namelye patriarch archbishoppes bishop account patriarch father prince highest father also call primate primate say haue authoritie ouer three archbishop king also hath authoritie ouer three duke thincke cardinal haue place church rome turned gate vpon ye hindges decretals gregorie de officio archip thus read cardinal haue name cardine hindg gate hindg gate ruled cardinal vniuersall churche gouerned archbishop prince bishop also syrnamed metropolitanes haue gouernment chiefest city verie deed metropolis greekes mother citie whence colony deducted people sent inhabite newe place wherevpon called metropolitane byshoppe gouerneth one prouince hath byshops vnder called byshops chiefe priestes presuls compare thinges whiche sayde byshops gouernours primitiue churche say greate difference betweene pop chiefe bishop whiche write touching pope chiefe byshop farre writing apostle euagelists first ordeyning minister made sauiour christ bishop saye holy lord pope doth excell dignitie power called pope father father also called vniuersall hee chiefe vniuersall churche hee also called apostolicall chiefe bishop supplieth roome chiefe apostle melchizedec whose priesthood compared vnto head bishoppes descend member head whose power receiue whome calleth partaker care burden bee partaker fulnesse power therfore define pope supreme head churche earth onely vniuersall sheepeheard whole world cannot erre nether ought iudged man saye iudge men hauing absolute power thus sayeth innocent pope thirde quest neither emperour neither clergie neither kinges people ought iudge iudged vppon whiche place wrote glosse writeth thus general cousell cannot iudge pope appeareth extrauagants title election cap significasti therfore whole world pronounce sentence anye matter pope seemeth wee must stand pope iudgement herevnto perteine common ground ye clawbacke flattering laweyers pope court plausible authenticall lawes pope receiued men proceeded fro mouth peter authoritie pope greater authoritie saincts pope aboue god pope haue one consistorie thing also hostien affirmeth c quanto de transl prael pope cannot bee brought order man thoughe hee bee accounted heretique hath supreme power neither hath fellowe hath lawes within breast general counsell pope hee hath lawes breast hath swordes whereby maye rightly bee called emperour yea hee aboue emperour hee onely depose emperour pronounce sentence emperour effect onely may spare reade anton de rosellis treatise power pope emperour maye also take awaye right one man giue another finallie may take away priuileges bee short saye hee lord lord hath right king kinges ouer subiectes yea also hath fulnes power ouer temporall thinges earth yea also whole world pope diocesse wherein ordinarie men standeth vppon necessitie saluation euerie man subiect bishop rome herevnto conclusion add word glosser sayeth ca quanto de transl episcopi tit pope sayeth said haue heauenly power therfore altereth verie nature thing applying thing substance one thing vnto another nothing hee make something sentence force hee make bee force thinges willeth steed reason neither may saye vnto doest thou hee sayde intreated power church wil therfore first speake somewhat muche shall thinke sufficient matter touching keyes keye instrument well knowne men wherwith gate keyes church doores chestes eyther selues came ye forbad sentence matth bringeth foorth sort woe vnto scribe phariseis hypocrite matth bicause ye shut vp kingdome heauen men ye selues goe neyther suffer ye wold enter come beholde luke calleth take away keye knowledge matthewe expoundeth shut heauen key therefore knowledge instruction selfe concerning blessed life mean made partaker thereof taketh away keye instructeth people true blessednes else hinderance instruct therfore key kingdome heauen nothing else ministerie preaching gospell worde god committed god vnto minister ende euery one may taught way leadeth vnto heauen way carrieth downe vnto hell keyes lord promised peter ye apostle said wil giue thee key kingdome heauen matth whatso euer thou shalt bind earth shalbe bound heaue whatso euer thou shalt loose earth shalbe loosed heauen let v inquire therefore keyes deliuered peter rest agreeable consent men giuen daye resurrection euident day ministerie function preaching gospell committed apostle whereby followeth keyes nothing else ministerie preaching ye gospel amogst al nation thing declared vnto world saluation purchased christ communicated beleeue hell open vnbeleeuers nowe let v heare testimony holy euangelistes iohn ye apostle euangelist saith lord came vnto disciple ohn sayde peace bee vnto father hath sent sende sayd breathed sayde vnto receiue holy ghoste whosoeuers sinnes ye remit remitted vnto whosoeuers sinns ye reteine reteined saying agree word whereby promised keyes sayde whatsoeuer ye shall binde earth shal bound heauen sayth whosoeuers sinnes ye reteine reteined saide whatsoeuer ye shall loose earth shall bee loosed heauen sayth whosoeuers sinnes ye remit remitted vnto wherefore binde reteine sinnes loose remit sinnes say howe men remitte sinnes since written onely god forgiueth sinnes let testimony therefore eua gelistes adioyned expressing historie done day resurrection luke sayth luke lorde opened vnderstanding might vnderstande scripture sayd vnto thus written thus behoued christe suffer rise againe deade thirde day repentaunce remission sinnes shuld preached name among nation marke saith mark appeared vnto sate together reproued vnbeliefe hardnesse heart saide vnto go ye world preach gospel euerie creature shal beleeue baptised shall saued beleeue shall damned therfore god forgiueth sinnes beleeue name christe say merites propitiation christe sinnes forgiuen minister doe assuredly declare preaching gospell preaching binde loose remitte reteine sinnes matter made playner example two peter speaking vnto citizen ierusalem repent ye saith let euery one baptised actes name iesus christ remission sinnes ye shall receiue gifte holy ghoste peter vsed keyes committed vnto manner howe th apostle binde loo e looseth earth remitteth sinnes vnto men promising beleeue assured remission sinnes christe whiche message god hath confirmed giuing remission sinnes vnto faythfull beleeued moreouer keeper prisonat philippos amazed saith silas paul act must doe saued apostle answered beleeue lord iesus thou shalt saued thy whole houshold apostle loosed bounde forgaue sinnes keyes preaching gospell gospell since beleeued earth lorde iudged loosed bene spoken seeing ye put thinke selues vnworthy euerlasting life loe wee turne gentile againe paule corinthe preached christe actes iewes resisted reuiled apostle shooke rayment sayde bloude vppon
