giuen apostle successours say office preaching remission sinnes repentaunce life euerlasting comitted wherevpon nowe conclude chiefe office pastour whence doctrine bee church vse keyes whiche lorde hath deliuered apostle preache onely pureworde god fetche doctrine place verie worde god perpetuall inuiolable lawe day also layde vpon pastours reade layd vpon auncient gouernours churche lorde selfe witnessing malachie saying couenaunt leuie life peace gaue feare feared afrayde name lawe truth mouth iniquitie found lippes walked peace equitie turned many iniquitie priestes lippes shoulde preserue knowledge shoulde seeke lawe mouth hee messinger lorde hoastes ezech againe lord sayth ezechiel thou shalt heare word mouth giue warning ieremie lorde sayth ere prophete hath dreame let tell dreame hee hath woorde let speake woorde faythfully expressely put difference betweene heauenly thing earthly thinges betweene thinges whiche word god feigned chosen man whiche hee willeth let passe vncerteine thinges dreames immediately addeth worde fire sayth lorde like hammer breaketh harde stone againe heare wordes prophetes preache vnto deceiue truly teache vanitie speake meaning owne hearte mouth lord therefore true prophetes god haue continually mouth thus sayth lorde mouth lorde hath spoken therefore deliuered vnto people nothing contrarie vnto worde god olde people also scripture prophetes nothing else interpreter lawe applying place time matter person also oure lorde iesus christe sayth oftentimes doctrine owne father whiche thing vnderstande literally according word knowe whether thing spoken absurde therefore lorde meaneth doctrine man god doth sende v continually writinges lawe prophetes confirmeth owne sayinges christe onely teacher religion maister lyfe appoynted prophetes yet neyther matter trusting thing owne wit ruled owne iudgement apostle peter saith euery man hath receiued gift euen minister et one good stewardes manifold grace god man speak let talke word god tertullian also booke intituled de praescript haeret haue also elswhere rehearsed expresly saith lawful v thing rest vpo owne fancie iudgemet neither yet negligent marker man bringeth foorth owne braine haue apostle lord authours selues choose thing whiche might establish fancie doctrine whiche receiued christe faythfully deliuered nation therefore euen angel heauen preach otherwise shal teacheth v true fayth worship delighteth therefore matthewe sonne god pronounceth esaie vayne doe worship teaching doctrine commaundementes matth men ioyne herevnto also newe constitution men apostle commanded often tolde archippus take heede ministerie coloss thou haste receiued lord thou fulfill moreouer neuer turne away eies liuely picture good euill shepehearde whiche ezechiel famous strengthened sicke haue ye healed neither haue ye bound vp broken brought againe whiche driuen away neyther haue ye sought whiche lost crueltie rigour haue ye ruled againe feede sheepe sayth lord god seeke whiche lost bring againe whiche driuen away binde vp broken strengthen weake destroy fat strong feede iudgement hereby gather duetie good pastour shepeheard fede deuour flocke minister exercise say vnto matth two shall agree earth touching thing shall aske shalbe done father whiche heauen two three gathered together name middest behold ye lord selfe middst assembly saincts ye lord plentie treasure good thing therefore experience selfe haue matter teacheth supplication church effectuall lord heareth prayer church deliuereth euil whose safetie church commendeth vnto haue oftentimes experience yt extreme daunger haue found verie present helpe euen instant wherein congregation hath offered prayer lord moreouer example moueth verie many otherwise hard hearted barbarous see ye deuout godlines holy congregation feruencie faithful assembly thereby moued entring themselues acknowledge yt miserable desire partaker fellowship according saying paul therfore whe whole church come together cor one speake straunge tongue come vnlearned whiche beleeue say ye witts prophecie come one beleueth one vnlearned rebuked men iudged ecrets heart made manifest wil fall downe face worship god say plainely god deede confidence therefore howe shamefully dare set light holy assembly onely set light also scorne assembled together without profite dauid banishment maketh complaint nothing much hee compelled wander wildernesse shutt holy assembly hee promiseth lord hee wil enter holie congregation euer restored againe verily lord sayeth gospell hee god heareth god word followeth whiche loue congregation wherin word god preached haue naturall mark sonnes god many doe onelye must pray loathe holy assembly also saye prayer altogether superfluous vaine vnprofitable proceed shew godly must pray prayer faithfull effectuall profitable necessarie say thinges done prouidence god therefore prayer vnprofitable god hath foreknowen verily hee bring passe manner fore knowledge neither hindered prayer men abuse prouidence god cut gather thing holy scripture teach gather deut expresse woords moses hath left written lord determined destroy deut therefore made intercession vnto lord found fauour ionas ion threatneth certeine destruction vnto niniuites lord euen foretold number dayes men niniue beleeued lord repented lord beecame fauourable againe neither hee destroye repented moreouer esaie spoken ezechias ye mouth ye lord thou esai shalt die liue king powred foorth prayer euen bottome ha vnto lord god chaunged sentence pronounced lord himselfe sayeth ieremie speake soudeinly nation kingdome plucke vp roote destroy iere nation whome haue pronounced turne wickednesse repent plague thought bring vppon c wherefore prayer faithfull effectuall stayinge wrathfull iudgementes god yea taking cleane away wheras obiect againe prayer declaration thinges obiection wee require lord god foreknoweth thinges therefore thinges vnprofitably super uouslie declared vnto alreadie knoweth cause prayer vnprofitable confuted christ lord himselfe hee plainely said heauenly father knoweth thinges ye haue neede ye aske yet neuerthelesse adding matth fourme prayer hee teacheth v praye place hee commaundeth v stirreth v vpp pray often watch pray sayth hee least enter temptation paule sayeth reioyce alwayes pray cotinually euery place many preceptes kinde thes neither doe declare matter one knoweth wee vtter vnderstandeth desire heart humble selues feete maiestie wee aske whiche wee knowe wee want yet certeinely receiued author goodnesse wee beleeue sure infallible promise meane time prayer super uons lord would assuredly giue whiche wee asked lord promised deliuerie ierem people whereof godly doubted nothing yet vncessant supplication prayed vnto lord cry deliuer v lord god neither thincke laboured vaine anabaptistes anabaptistes pretending absolute purenesse therefore pure neither ought pray forgiue v oure debtes since remaine debtes holy euangelist apostle iohn aunswereth saith say iohn haue sinne deceiue lues trueth v wee acknowledge sinnes faithful iust forgiue v sinnes cleanse v vnrighteousnes say haue sinned make lier woord v long wee liue world remaine remnaunts sinne bee washed away euery moment grace christ moreouer obiect written wee knowe god doth heare sinner wee iohn sinner therefore god eth heare none v men prayer found vnprofitable wee aunswere sinner altogether vngodly despisers god god heareth againe repentaunt men feare god whiche neuerthelesse sinner rightly called remnaunts sinne god heareth whiche might shewed example dauid manasses peter theefe erucified christe many sinner pray heard therefore say prayer faithfull onely profitable prayer necessarie effectuall also necessarie vnto men wee men defiled sinne destitute void goodnesse euerie good giuing euery perfecte gift aboue ames commeth downe father lightes commaundeth v pray offereth pray verie large promise wherefore oure father verie often exercised verie eruent prayer example teaching v prayer necessarie scripture also diligently large rehearseth howe great thinges prayer verie weightie affaire daungers yea matter necessarie obteined true bountifull lord god apostle pray holy ghost faith increase faith receiue request spareingly liberally beeing made partaker manner grace christ gospel publican prayeth temple sayeth god bee mercifull god whiche rehearse least man thincke perteineth nothing vnto v againe much faithfull prayer moses dauid iosaphat ezechias valiaunt men preuailed warres famine sickenesses exceeding great danger long recite example proue prayer alwayes necessarie vnto men verie effectuall wee plainely see god moued prayer faithfull hee good god moued prayer mercifull loueth v toke flesh might touched feeling infirmity least bee dismayed hee true faithfull perfourming thinges faithfully promiseth doth freely liberally bountifully call men vnto offering himselfe wholie call vppon faith pray alwaies receiue whiche praye doe alwayes receiue aske aske doeth proue prayer altogether vnprofitable oftetimes profitable prayeth receiue requestes moreouer many cause whiche god either putteth thing asked doeth graunt kind men pray whome read written stoppeth prou crie poore shal crie himselfe heard againe though ye make many prayer yet heare isai nothing seeing handes full bloud againe solomon wisedome cryeth testifying prou heare call would first heare giuing warning time thing maner gathered ye person pray thing selfe pray whiche followeth deriued iames sayeth yee aske receiue ye aske amisse euen iames consume vpon lustes matth lord also aunswering two euen chosen disciple required highest roomes kingdome christ saith ye knowe ye aske furthermore holy men aske holy necessarie thing least vniust euil whiche neuerthelesse receiue lord forthwith thincke god god iudgement iustice therefore hee immediatly deliuer affliction yet desire deliuerance continuall prayer whome lord loueth chasteneth whome chasteneth doeth end destroy rou hebr condened wicked world lawefull distress pray dauid rebuke thine anger lord neither chasten psal thy displeasure ieremie lord orrecte iudgement furie abacuch whe thou art angrie remeber thy mercie godly doubt nothing ye power goodnes god men ward god profitable child god god innumerable example thing old new testament doth affoard v wherefore deliuered obteine desire sure god wil haue profitable v meanes heareth prayer heareth v prayer tend end onely might go wel v god since onely wise knoweth profite hurt v doth giue v aske yet giuing verie deed grauteth whiche good v therefore lawful prayer ye faithful alwaies effectual euermore obteineth purpose lord gaunting knoweth good furthermore lord deferreth god eferreth giue e meaneth giue perfourme whiche asked yea somtime seemeth altogether neglecte prayer hee doeth prolonging trie may make faith ye feruent giftes also acceptable whiche much ioyfully receiued much looked ardent desire temptation let saying prophete comfort v woman forgett isai child haue compassion sonne owne wombe though shuld forget yet wil forget thee ye church said god hath forsaken lord hath forgotten let v cosider maner called vppon pray prayer shuld calleth god vseth question cannot bee better resolued weighing chiefest circumstance first therefore let v consider must bee called vppon pray none verily ye one god three thing required whiche prayed vnto first heare ye prayer men whole world pierce exactly know heart yea know rightly better desire men men themselues vtter secondly present euerie haue power ouer thinges heauen earth hell whiche hath power wayes meanes helpe thirdly exceeding good readie prepared may also willing property found god onely god onely searcheth reines hart onely seeth heareth thinges onely knoweth perfectly thing within without man man himselfe onely present place hee onely almightie onely wise god onely imbraceth man perfect goodnes alwayes readie onely procureth faithfully profitable man therefore ought god bee called vpon attribute property ye chosen soules heauen wt blasphemie sacrilege therefore soules heauen liuing god called vpon especially since ye scripture plaine word testifieth ye abraham iacob know v commaundeth v cal sai god forbiddeth communicate thinges god creature say nothing else pray saincts angel heauen say without blushing father whiche art heauen followeth lord prayer let v therfore call vpon god onely heauenly father whome alone sainctes godly men many haue bin ye church haue called vppon since mortal man good soeuer hee seeme god father called vpo worthie come forth sight ye eternall holy god whiche thinge men one voice confesse many deed diuerse patrones intercessours aduocates chosen receiued put confidence man ye man haue forged thinges vnto themselues imagination owne hart haue learned mouth ye lord scripture rule truth setteth forth v one mediatour intercessour patrone aduocate come god deede spirite god said make intercession deed prayeth groaneth stirreth vp mindes pray sighe bringeth passe according pleasure god wee make intercession pray sainctes saye oure selues let v consider ability hee must furnished wha ability must b furnished co meth pray vnto god cometh purpose pray vnto god first necessarie hee lay aside opinion owne worthinesse righteousnesse hee nakednes weakenes pouertie pray wil pray vnto god bestrong bee sicke haue neede physician lorde gospell sayth aske ye shal receiue knocke shalbe opened vnto seeke ye shall finde hee therfore commaunded aske may receiue hath yet asketh knocketh knocking signifieth standeth without doores whiche seeketh hathe lost yet seeketh therefore shut ioyes paradise prayer seeke aske whiche haue lost haue therefore dauid ezechias saintes god prayer alledge owne righteousnes seeme worthily require heard truely regarde owne worthinesse rather trueth god hath promised heare worship therfore godly say beholde wee thy worshipper therefore meete thou shouldest neglect v deliuer v meane place speake suche sort righteousnesse cannot doubt prayer made mention righteousnesse certeine measure limitation enter iudgement thy seruant sayth dauid thy sight shal man liuing iustified c furthermore whiche chiefe needefull faith pray must haue true feruent faith let doctrine faith therefore matter prayer shewe v lighte morning starr assured hope obtein god thing asked let prayeth make petition let aske faith sayth saint iames nothing wauering me wauereth like waue sea tost winde carried violence neither let man think shal receiue thing lord paule also sayth howe shall call vppon whome haue beleeued haue spoken faith fourth sermon firste decade ende faith may increase iust measure flourish continue stable must labour promise example euery place gathered together recite fewe booke psalmes read offer vnto god psal thanksgiuing pay thy vowes vnto highest cal vpon day trouble deliuer thee thou shalt glorifie mee againe lord nigh vnto al psal call vpon vnto cal vpon trueth faithfully wil fulfil desire feare also heare crie saue againe esaie esa lord saith shal come passe call answere yet thinking speake wil heare matth lord sayth aske shalbe giuen seeke ye shall finde knock shalbe opened vnyou whosouer asketh receiueth whosoeuer seeketh findeth knocketh shalbe opened c gospell againe gospel according saint iohn lord saith whatsoeuer iohn ye shall aske name wil againe verily verily say vnto whatsoeuer ye shall aske iohn father name hee wil giue aske ye shall receiue dauid verie many example seene exceedingly confirme establish faith godly since faith vaine imagination effectual power let life prayeth answearable faith working holy ghost kinde good woorkes thoughe neither trust vnto neither thinke consideration heard yet neuerthelesse suche sinner faithfull doe impudently without repentaunce trust owne wittes dealing onely wordes lorde ioyne holy life prayer solomon sayth hee turneth prou eare hearing lawe prayer shal bee abhominable lorde saith esaie though ye make many prayer yet heare isaie nothing seeing handes full bloud suche impenitent person vnderstande gospell god heareth sinner saintes shal obteine nothinge continue iohn prayer suche ieremie praying earnestly people otherwise obstinately wicked heareth thou shalt pray people thou shalte neither giue iere thankes bidde prayer make thou intercession wise heare thee seest thou doe city iuda child gather stickes father kindle fire woman kneade doughe make cake que ne heauen powre drinke daughter saue owne soules righteousnesse wherefore followeth supplication vnrepentant men impudently perseuearing sinnes thoughe crie without ceassing helpe v god sauiour deliuer v lorde beeseeche thee heare v altogether fruitelesse desire preserued might take pleasure committe wickednesse though god giue v freely thinges whiche aske yet necessarie affection desire liue wel accompany great benefit receiued hand god ought diligently take heede thinke shalbe heard vertues sake meere mercy god christe iesu moreouer whosoeuer desireth mind must bee fted vp heauenly thinges haue praiers acceptable vnto god let lift vp mind earthly thing vnto heauenly thing touching thing ye blessed martyr christ cyprian eloquently holily intreating sayth wee stand occupied prayer wee must whole hart watch diligent prayer let worldly fleshly thoughtes departe neither let mind thinke vpon thing else time whiche praieth let thy breast shut aduersarie let open god neither let suffer enimie god enter time prayer oftentimes stealeth vpon v entereth subtily deceiuing v turneth away prayer god may haue one thing hart another thing mouthe sound voice minde sense ought pray vnto god vnfeigned affection thus farre hee minde ye prayeth may bee lifted vp earthly thinges vnto heauenly thinges chiefly worke spirit true fayth stedfastnes hope feruent loue god also haue remembrance dreadfull maiestie god whose eye stande praying al creature heauen earth worship reuerece thousand thousandes angel serue let v thinke selues profitable necessarie thing aske god without whiche happie let v moreouer remoue fro v al thing whiche either deteine keepe v world pull v backe vnto earthly thing sort slouthfulnes couetousnes surfetting shorte al sinnes like vnto contrariwise let v applie selues watchfulnes almes deed remembraunce actes sight god surely god requireth v feruent prayer choose let prayer proceede loue colde whiche inflamed charitie therfore cruell vnwilling forgiue brother trespass still retein hatred toward brother cannot pray god sayth ye stand praying forgiue ye haue ought man mark father also whiche heauen may forgiue trespass ye forgiue men trespass matth heauenly father shal also forgiue ye forgiue men trespass shal heauenly father forgiue trespass another place sayeth matth therefore thou bring thy gyft vnthe altar remembrest thy brother hathe ought thee leaue thy gyfte altar goe thy waye first reconciled thy brother come offer thy gyft otherwise thy gyftes shall bee acceptable vnto god let v therefore willingly forgiue let v loue good vnto oure neighbor prayer shal pearce ye heauens agreable vnto pray muste praye mouthe nely mouth voice mind inward affection hart spirite feruencie voice heard moses neither anna mother samuel prayed earnestly spirite cried vnto damnation know sophisters bring foorth alledge defence prayer said rewarde stipend fewe wordes giue knotte loose men pray sorte either haue fayth charitie else haue haue pray without rewarde charity sake haue prayer ar effect therefore false shewe deceiue ignorant people paying money lawfull prayer whereas requite vnlawful lawful yet neither sold boght also required prayeth desire thing vnworthie god graunt require must require nothing vnwor hy god graunt cotrary lawes thing contrarie lawes god iohn apostle saith aske thing according wil heareth v therefore aske thinges vnworthie god graut heareth v moreouer alwayes iohn prayer wil desire ought obedient god wil therefore let man go aboute wickedly tye god certein circu staces let man prescribe vnto god time place manner hee shall bring passe thing wil doe god wise knoweth whe time helpe also faithfull omnipotent able deede doe greater thinges either aske vnderstand thing also read paule hath said therfore without cause moste honest widowe iudith verie angrie osias priest appointed iudith sette number dayes vnto god ended deliuer otherwise wold giue vp citie iudith saith maner sentence whereunto osias hath consented deliuer citie vnto assyrian within fiue dayes come succour v ye tempt lord sentence like obteine mercie rather prouoke wrath kindle displeasure haue set mercie god time haue appointed day phantasie asmuch lord patient let v much rather repent craue pardon handes powring teares therfore dauid read haue spoken godly extreme daunger shal finde fauour eye lorde hee samu bring againe say haue lust thee behold place another goodnesse worthines prayer esteemed place minde prayeth lorde gospel sayth houre come true worshipper iohn shall worship father spirite trueth c wise passed ouer praye chamber place persuaded godly may pray place home chamber confirmation wherof wrest word sauiour thou matth thou prayest enter thy chamber thou haste shut thy doore pray thy father secrete thy father seeeth secrete immediately opposeth thou whe thou prayest enter thy chaber reprouing ye abuse prayer hee properly condemne place rather spake figuratiuely manner phariseis prayer whiche make streetes hunt praise commendation people contrarie parte making mention chamber meant place selfe maketh prayer either better worse hee taught figuratiue speeche wee ought pray vpright minde moste free hunting praise men prayeth minde troubled affection hauing regarde vnto god prayeth chamber whether pray churche streete otherwise lord prayed disciple temple citie fielde wheresoeuer occasion offered also followeth father seeth thee secrete shal reward thee openly say father alloweth minde proud humble free ambition rewarde thee openly publique prayer vsed churche assemblie saintes man despise saying prayer gesture pray let riot pride immoderate trimming bodie farr fro shal come church christ pray seeme filthily haue scorned godly magistrate whosoeuer comming craue pardon fault would lay aside mourning weedes putting white apparell proudely appeare assembly graue godly senatours suche one might iudged worthie onely denied request also cast prison wil denie shamefully mock god comming churche aske sighes vttered manner soeuer findeth man doubtlesse prayer deferred vntill haue sought place may sitt may stande kneele downe tertullian making mention behauiour christian time whe prayed apologie gentile saith christian al v euermore praying al men looking vppe heauen handes spread abroade harmlesse bare headed wee ashamed bee shorte wee neede none put v remembraunce wee pray harte notwithstanding must chefely haue remembrance doctrine sauiour gospell saying thou prayest thou shalt bee hypocrite loue pray standing synagogue corner street may seene men verily say vnto haue reward aboue thinges must beware neither pray priuately publiquely end neither yet fashion gesture bodie get vaine prayse people may seeme renowmed accounted holie men sufficeth wee please god allowed among whiche vnfitly reckoned giftes vnderstandinge liberall science well ordered scholes faithfull teacher godlie magistrate vpright lawes corporall thing peaceable common wealth strong valiant army spirituall thing corporall thinges principally desire heauenlie thing corporall thing also choyce vsed profit common wealth preferred priuate gain common wealth continuing safetie citizen may also safe long scholes vniuersities place learning mainteyned hope common wealth shall neuer destitute wise vpright gouernours also temporall good better thinges beste therefore saincts godly men doe chiefely require lord neuerthelesse whiche lesse value vnderstand come therefore aske also lorde meanely lawful aske corporall goodes lorde exercised scripture affirme lawful prayer aske corporall good lord cofuted many example scripture onely patriarch prophet also apostle christe asked temporall good lord defence enimies good reporte thing necessary bodie thing shall lerne anon fourme prayer lord selfe hath taught v diligently shewing v aske also commeth question toung prayer must made affirme priuatly tongue must pray publiquely wee muste praye latine seeme iudgement wit vnlesse speake suche skilfull latine tounge since wee must pray onely mouth voice also hart minde pray shall praye hearte minde vseth language vnderstandeth indeede vttereth godlie wordes knoweth sayeth cometh one reckoning pray neuer whit babble word vnderstoode let euery nation therefore pray language vnderstandeth best moste familiarly lesse madnesse publique assembly vse straunge language thinge also hath roote greatest euilles church whatsoeuer priest ordained god prophetes sente spake rehearsed people olde time church speake recite chaldean indian persian hebrue tongue vulgar mother tongue wrote also bookes vulgar tongue christ lorde together apostle vsed vulgar tongue furnished apostle gift tongue might speake euery nation much age greeke tongue plentifull common apostle wrote hebrue tongue straunge tongue church god haue troubled thinges haue quenched feruentnesse mennes mindes yea haue banished church prayer selfe vse prayer fruite profite shoulde come thinges done church truely romane another world kingdome grace kingdome christe world wherein christ reigneth holy spirite faithfull one whiche owne accord submit themselues vnto bee gouerned saying doeing thinges beautifie beseeme iudgement god diuel king vngodly catcheth vnto hell kingdome death iudgement continually burne moreouer earthly kingdome prince world gouerne called either kingdome god kingdome diuell euen shall fashion frame selfe one twaine thing wee knit vpp fewe word wee haue plentifully entreated another place wherefore pray second petition christe might reigne liue v wee kingdome christ might spread abroad inlarged preuaile thoroughe whole world doctours teacher ecclesiasticall magistrate finally prince also yea scholes whosoeuer may kingdome christe beeing annoynted watered grace may flourish ouercome triumphe furthermore pray kingdome diuel antichriste maye bee broken vanquished least hurte annoye sainctes kingdome diuell vngodlinesse may dasht troden vnder foote short weapon armour antichristianisme may broken shiuers come naught lastly pray second petition haue sayled tempestuous gulfe worlde might receiued gathered vnto christ saintes euerlasting kingdome glory desire kingdome god come vnto v god reigne v praye come receiued kingdome liue euer holily thirde petition thy thy done done wel earth heauen god reigneth v vnlesse obedient vnto therefore kingdome desire grace perfect obedience desire god continually god done albeit neuer pray though wrestle striue might prophet sayth god heauen hath psal done whatsoeuer pleased heauen earth aske therefore maye make v wil alwayes good wil corruption sinne euill therefore pray present v wt grace may regenerated framed good wil god accorde yealde selfe holie ghoste framed grace inspireth finish v hath wel begon giue v moreouer strength patience herevnto yt well prosperitie aduersitie wee maye acknowledge ye wil god least wil thing selues swel puffed vp prosperitie aduersitie also faint perish may apply selues thinges thinges gouerned wit maner submit furthermore aske thing contrarie would graunt rather pardon oure foolishnesse weaken whiche good v instruct teache v good end may doubt nothing alwayes followed alwayes good worketh thinges commoditie benefite pointe faithfull feele verie greate battell selues well earth hea en paule witnessing saying flesh lusteth spirite spirit flesh two mutual enimitie betwene selues thinges ye would ye therefore desire kinde framing god adde well earth heauen graunt father thy wil may done v earthly men done thy saint blessed spirites doe striue againste thy holy heauen one mynde wil whiche thou wilt yea rather one thing blessed happie agree acquiet themselues thy truely least part felicitie happinesse god willeth good part happinesse earth god willeth greatest vnhappinesse whiche god willeth truely infinite example might declared alledge one common one grieuously sicke feeleth paine torment scarce tollerable meane time acknowledgeth suffereth thinges commaundement god good bountifull iust father wisheth well hath sent grieuous calamitie saluation owne glory doth middest torment submitting selfe god feele refreshing seemed sharpe bitter man voluntarie free submission maketh delightfull sweete againe another sick vexed verie great disease man doth acknowledge sicknesse layde vpon good god yea rather thinketh god knoweth disease god doth care disease therefore referreth vnto diuers sundrie cause imagineth seeketh diuers meanes heale thing wo derfully vexed afflicted yet striuing god feeleth refreshing comfort therefore doth else nilling whiche god willeth whiche wont doe yll meanes auoyding euill double wherefore foundation happinesse faythfull obedience whereby fully submit selues euer else vnto v belongeth good wil god iordane power god faithfull obedience lepres also gospel fewe clensed power christ faith pronouncing speaking word lorde indeede said thou cleane man day shoulde haue recited wordes hundred time ouer bee examined deede done sickman meanes made whole knowen vnto name iesus christe nazareth man standeth heere whole people hee sayeth name faith name hath made man sounde whome yee see knowe faith hath commending exceedinge loue whiche christe beareth toward church wherewith beeing inflamed gaue selfe end make selfe pure glorious spouse way hee setteth downe manner purgeing lord iesus selfe sayeth hee hath cleansed onlye christes office purge cleanse manner purgeing followeth founteine water worde briefly spoken hath obscuritie maketh mention two thinges lord vseth cleanse bee founteine water worde founteine water baptisme whiche outwarde action witnessebearing inwarde purifying cleansing wrought grace spirite god apostle sayeth according mercie tit hee saued v founteine regeneration renewing holie ghoste hee shed vpon v richlie throughe iesus christe sauiour hee addeth way interpretation renewing holie ghoste whereof founteine water signe moreouer worde verie preaching gospell sainct marke goe whole worlde preache gospell creature hee whiche shall beleeue baptised shall saued c word also lord shadoweth vnto v manner meanes saluation hee onelie whiche purgeth v faithe yet meane hee willeth beleeuers bee signed baptisme shoulde preached openlye worlde pardoneth sinnes yea freely giueth euerlasting life doe thinges pray make purpose wil proue wordes paule force vertue word sanctifie baptisme wordes lord spoken apostle yet make matter manifest ye cleane saith worde iohn haue spoken vnto shall say wordes christ rehearsed disciple christ made cleane needed nexte day haue bene crucified haue died ende might purchase power vnto wordes therefore boastinge force wordes shal cleane taken away doth faith godlunesse tell v worde lorde rather vnderstande declared pronounced beleeued word selfe sounde passing away one thing vertue remaineth thinge worde faith wee preach saieth apostle thou shalt confesse thy mouth iesus lord beleeue thy heart god hath raised deade thou shalt saued hart man rom beleeueth vnto righteousnesse mouth confession made vnto saluation whereupon reade actes apostle purifying actes cleasing heates faith peter epistle saith also hath loued church gaue selfe reade apostle marke addeth saying might sanctifie cleansing founteine water worde vaine therefore cleansing attributed fraile vading element vnlesse added word forth thus obedient godwarde would speake largely analogie signe thing signified see maye doe hereafter place conuenient thinke shall need place scripture open thinges euidently since followe owne accorde vppon haue hitherto testimony scripture confirmed hereafter large confirme moreouer respect likenesse signes borowe name thing signified signe thing signified name one giuen proue euident testimony scripture genesis lorde sayth thus abraham thou shalt keepe couenaunt therefore bothe thou thy seede thee generation couenaunt whiche ye shall keepe betweene euerie manchild among shall circumcised ye shall circumcise fleshe foreskinne shall token couenaunt betweene circumcision mouthe lorde hath spoken gainesay worde god worde god calleth circumcision couenaunt therefore name thing signified giuen signe verie deede circumcision couenaunt selfe couenaunt bargaine agreement betweene god men whiche hath certeine condition article wherfore afterwarde interpretation circumcision called token couenaunt finde fault interpretation god signes therefore yea god beeing interpreter take name thinges signified may reade twelfth chapter exodus yee shall eate paschallamb lambe hast lord passeouer againe bloud shall vnto signe house wherein c againe day shall vnto remembraunce c spoken plainely lambe called passeouer proper meaning passeouer let v giue eare lorde agayne expounding selfe saying pasle lande aegypte night smite first borne aegypt man beast shall see bloude lambe passe ouer plague shall bee vppon destroye beholde passeouer god selfe interpreting passing ouer whereby angel god passing ouer house israelite whiche marked bloude lambe spared firstborne slue ye first borne ye egyptian thou art ignoraunt manner lambe listen againe lorde instructing thee saying tenth day moneth euerie man take vnto lambe according housholde let lambe without blemishe male yeare olde yee shall take among sheepe among goates lambe playnely called passeouer dothe see lamb passeouer yet bycause signe remembrance passeouer mouth lorde sayth surely taketh name passeouer passing againe reade nintenth num thus spake lorde vnto moses speake vnto child sacrifice israel bring thee red cow without blemishe ye shall giue vnto eleazar priest may bring without hoast cause bee slayne face bee burnt whole man cleane shal gather vp ash cow lay without hoast cleane place shall bee kept multitude child might cleanse purge v sinne hitherto also belongeth whiche apostle speaking sacrifice vnto hebrues sayth sacrifice mention hebr made sinnes euerie yeare possible bloude bulles goates take awaye sinnes spirite god therefore due right coparing place betweene selues doth manifestly proue signe baptisme whithe water giuen name thing signified manner seene institution lordes supper euchariste broade supper lorde called body christe wine bloude christe since right faythe beleeueth true bodye christe ascended world liueth nowe heauen lorde returneth worlde vntill come cloudes heauen iudge quicke bee considered shoulde followe rocke really v rye deede beene christe none dranke rocke beene reprobate acceptable vnto god partaker christe many dranke rocke lorde delight stayne wildernesse paule apostle writinges onely laboureth proue beleeue iustified faith lorde iesus workes againe ignoraunt receiuing celebration sacramentes also counted among workes wherevnto add sacramentes giue whiche haue themselues haue grace righteousnesse heauenly gyftes therfore doe giue whether grace god conteined n sacramentes hence springeth vppe another disputation v handle whether grace god certeine heauenly power put included sacramentes conteined might conueyed receyuers whole rable priestes monkes well worde deede haue bewrayed selues thinke bare signes heauenly grace included yea god sealing sacramentes thing faith gifte holie ghost goeth sealing sacramentes strong sure also haue saide wel four mindes destitute holie ghoste sacramentes doe profite v doth blinde man looke vppon bright beames sunne eye opened illumination spirit wonderfully delighted heauenly sight sacramentes zwinglius libello ad principe germanil sayth doeth offende v though thing holie ghoste worketh referred externall sacrament long wee vnderstand spoken figuratiuely father spake thus saith although sacrament seale sacrament seal nothing vnbeleeuers promise vnbeleeuers mistrust yet neuerthelesse ye sacrament instituted god might seale wicked vngodly person receiueth doctrine gospel yet man therefore doeth gather doctrine instituted god teache one wil giue credit sealed charter yet doeth therfore followe sealed charter serueth assure confirme one faithe therefore since doctrine gospel worketh nothing yt obstinate rebellious since sacramentes doe nothing moue prophane vnholie neither profite wicked manner meanes commeth passe institute worde sacrament default vnbeleeuer meane time selues instituted profit seale haue holie vse end holie thus much haue said yt principall vertue sacrament yt testimony god truth good wil towarde v seales yt promise gospel sealing assuring v yt faith righteousnesse good giftes christe perteine beleeue sacramets represente thinges also another end vse sacramentall signes yt say signifie signifying represent superfluous proue many testimony since moste manifest men least spake signifie shew signes token declare pointe thing represent doth signifie dreame bring giue make corporally present somtime taken away resemble likenes certeine imitation call back againe minde set eye say sonne doth represent resemble father sort expresseth father fauour likenes manner seeth may verily think seeth father present manner doe sacrament sacramets doe stirre vppe healpe faith stir vp help faith wee see outwardely eye whiche stirreth vpp minde worketh v warneth v dutie yea thing comprehended minde nowe sorte visibly offered sens similitude parable type figure viewed weighed minde mutuallie might helpe one another similitude therefore contend baptise want holy ghoste errour springeth herevppon attributeth muche ministerie baptisme doth thinke men purified cleansed baptisme therby dothe gather vncleane person purifie cleanse therefore baptise baptisme vncleane person baptisme whence deriueth anabaptisme rebaptising holie man rightly religiously distinguished power ministerie betweene signe thing signified betweene outwarde inwarde sanctification vndoubtedly vnderstoode inuisibly sanctified meere grace god inward sanctification outwardly ministerie represented sealed might haue vnderstoode sealed euidences may published well euill minister good god sacrament referred god authour faithfull true ordinaunces howe false faithlesse euer men although iudas theefe yet preached baptised whose doctrine baptisme well doctrine baptisme christe peter andrewes iames iohns touching perfectnesse purenesse bothe doctrine baptisme done ministerie iudas man euer doubted though neuer taught baptised whome taught baptised meane called lorde selfe diuelishe man iohn verie diuell baptised owne name name christe preached owne doctrine christ conclude lorde goodnesse truthes sake iudas sake wrought faythfull whiche working others vngratiousnesse maliciousnesse coulde hinder daye verily hindereth whit truely muste doe haue holy vnblameable minister farre foorthe oure care diligence able procure bring passe yea let v depriue disgrade shall finde behaue selues vnworthy function meane time let v doubt purenesse sacramentes whiche office ministred vnto v say manner fourme lorde instituted verily faythful doe fasten myndes element neyther doe minister althings looke vp god authour goodnesse ende thinges lord ordeyned saint augustine hath handled matter verie diligently excellently well applying thinges verie effectuall argument whose wordes wil set lib contra donatist de baptismo cap water vnholy sayth defiled ouer name lorde called though bee called vnholy vncleane person bycause neyther creature self yet name vncleane baptisme christe consecrated wordes gospell holy vncleane vncleane thoughe bee defiled vncleane bycause holinesse bee polluted sacramets diuine power present eyther saluation vse well condemnation vse yll dothe lighte sunne candle shineth filthy sinke gather vncleannesse thence baptisme christ polluted man wickednesse wee apply myndes vnto verie visible thing vnder sacrament deliuered knoweth corruptible wee ascend vnto whiche figured seeth incorruptible though men ministred according deseruinges eyther rewarded punished foorth could alledge many example kynde thought necessarie think largely plainly enough declared perfectnesse purenesse sacramentes esteemed worthinesse vnworthinesse minister truth god institute glory power dominion euer euer amen holie baptisme baptisme eighth sermon nowe haue intreate particularly holy baptisme holy supper lorde whiche may done somuch briefly haue largely spoken alreadie sacrament generall christe lorde open myndes guyde toung vnto glorie prayse blessed name euer baptisme worde fetcht baptisme ereekes vse bothe word baptismus baptisma whiche signifie baptisme latines also baptisme dipping whiche worde tertullian willingly vseth nonlatin alphabet signifieth dip dip nonlatin alphabet plunge put farre wherevppon also baptise vsed plunge washe away cleanse baptisings scripture put washing purifyings appereth institute baptisme thing consisteth whether simple one selfe drawne many partes rite ceremonie baptising deliuered churche ende force baptisme man institute sacrament baptisme instituted baptisme god yea euen day receiue baptisme handes god selfe though baptised ministerie men lorde establishing institution spirite worketh saluatio elect must need followe vertue efficacie baptisme hindered euill distinguishe betweene power ministerie august tract ioh sayth one thing baptise way ministerie another thing baptise power lorde iesus christe coulde would haue giuen power one seruaunt giue baptisme steede could translate remoue fro power baptise place one seruauntes giue greate force baptisme translated remoued seruant haue giue lord wold doe purpose hope wer baptised shuld hang acknowledge selues baptised would therefore seruaunte shoulde settle hope seruaunt therefore cryed apostle hee sawe men willinge putte hope truste paule crucified yee baptised name paule paule therefore baptised minister power selfe lorde baptised power againe iohn baptist learned doue vppon whomesoeuer thou shalt see spirite descending like vnto iohn doue tariestil vpon whiche baptiseth holy ghost therefore doue let deceiuers seduce thee say wee baptise doue acknowlege doue taught baptiseth holy ghost doue knowen hee doest thou thinke thou arte baptised power whose ministerie thou art baptised thou bee minde thou art yet bodie doue thou bee bodie doue maruel thou hast simplicitie simplicitie especially figured doue iohn learned simplicitie doue hee baptiseth holy ghost thus farre furthermore minister church lawfully ordeined ought baptise donatistes contende none baptise whiche pure holy boldly auouched ye baptisme fruitelesse voide effecte lewde liuing minister defiled wicked vice administer augustine grauely disputed conuinced trueth scripture epistle saith see howe peruersely wickedly spoken ye wont say good man sanctifieth baptiseth euill man know muche baptised god sanctifieth true men ought rather wishe baptised minster vnknown euil whiche knowen bee good may rather sanctified god man farre v madnesse doe wee speake trueth rightly wise grace belongeth alway god sacramente ministerie onely committed vnto man good cleaueth god worketh god euil god woorketh visible fourme sacrament himselfe giueth inuisible grace herein let v al wise let bee schismes diuisions among v augustine thirde booke contra literas petiliani ca doeth plentifully sette forth mattter wee haue also handled thinge ende former sermon nexte needelesse speake one thing twise question obiected vnto v touching baptisme middewiues whether midwiues may baptise whether woman midwiues vppon point necessitie infante ieopardie die hee come bee baptised handes ecclesiasticall minister vnto beersabe coulde haue shewed himselfe cherefull courtier whome among thinges said shoulde goe vnto dead childe witte land liuing danger vnto woman child die vncircumcised without circumcision time past amonge olde grace promise effectuall necessitie withoute signe among v beeing without ye signe begin voide force wherefore trusting god mercie true vndoubted promise beleeue infant departing world timely death ba sed saued meere mercie god power trueth promise christe saieth gospel suffer little one come mark vnto suche kingdome god againe matt father whiche heauen one little one perish verily god cannot lye hath said thy god god gen thy seede thee wherevpon sainte paule also affirmeth borne holy begotten holie parent flesh bloud holie thing borne borne fleash cor fleashe holinesse separation comon seed men promise right couenaunt nature naturall birth borne sonnes wrathe death damnation paul attributeth speciall priuiledge child faithfull wherewith grace god nature vncleane purified apostle place doeth gather holy braunches holy roote againe elsewhere sayeth sinne one many deade much grace god gyft grace whiche one man iesus christ hath abounded vnto many therefore augustine doubted say die die otherwise adam euen yt made aliue made aliue christe vpon whosoeuer shal say vnto v ye resurrection dead made aliue otherwise christ abhorred detested comon plague christian faith ad hiero epi obiecte meanes vse baptisme made void quite taken away yea pelagianisme sprung vp againe wt greate trauell aug many learned holie men beate downe kept vnder falsely spake said soule whose foreskin circumcised shalbe cut fro gen people hath broke couenant falsely spake said verily verily say vnto except iohn man borne water spirite cannot enter kingdome god sayinges true child baptised truly ye sequele dying without baptisme saued aunswere weaken holy baptisme meanes muche lesse take quite away defende infantes vpon pinche necessitie beeing guiltie contempte god wicked negligence damned though die vnbaptised saluation tyed ye signe promise god shuld made voide though alone without signe vpon point necessitie vaine could worke nothing hand god shortened boud signe otherwise teache al mean infantes baptised ye baptisme delaied negligetly put maliciously meane time speedy death departe vnbaptised exhort charge good hope confidence trueth mercie lorde promiseth law gospel yt god young infantes muche one little one perishe pelagius pelagians haue nothing pelagians deny baptisme infant doe neither ignorant augustine hath writen vnto hierome epist behalfe euer shal say sayth infant leaue life hauing ben partaker christ sacramente baptisme quickened made aliue man doubtlesse doth sette himselfe preaching apostle condeneth whole churche cause make hast runne child haue baptised without doubt beleeue meanes otherwise coulde made aliue christe againste pelagians epistle apostolicall seate dealing pelagius accurseth whiche saide infantes vnbaptised haue life euerlasting aug lib de c ca renatus disputeth vincentius victor graunted infant inthralled original sinn yet neuerthelesse saued though baptised bringeth forth saying sauiour except borne water spirit enter kingedome god codemne pelagius pelagias affirme thing denie wit yt infantes borne originall sinne therfore sanctification christ necessary vnto without saued defend maintein yt infant ought baptised possible though ye right couenaunt belong bodie christ sanctified bloud christ pelagius taught infant ought baptised yt helde opinion wtout fault sinne blame offence wicked vngodly man therfore acknowledge either owne corruptio benefit god hath performed christ yet canst thou find neither assertion doctrine wherfore take part ye pelagians aug selfe epistle vnto hierome expressly saith thou art none say guilt drawne fro adam fro infant bee washed baptisme iulian also li ca proueth sentence holy father infant haue original sinne thervpon gathereth yt therfore infantes ought baptised haue sinne pelagians gathered cleane contrarie haue sinne therefore baptised counsel carthage writeth thus innocent pelagians denie infantes baptised say perished neither thing saued nothing corrupt wicked c much beleeue infantes borne sinne yea borne child wrath corrupt wicked moreouer wee beleeue sonne god borne without sinne pure virgin fulfill confirme god promise doe shut infantes saluation let ioyncteparteners league therefore holde defende baptised therefore reason gathered augustine cannot simplie allowe lib depec remiss cap felowshippe christ man commeth vnto life baptisme wee ioyned member bodie christ haue fellowship therefore infantes baptised without fellowship christ therefore condemned denie graffed bodie christe partaking sacramentes declared last sermon sacramentes nexte immediately going haue elsewhere shewed oftentimes alreadie verie largely firste beginning vniting fellowship christe wought sacramentes vniting fellowshipp whiche founded grounded vpon promise grace god thoroughe holy ghost communicated vnto v yea vse sacramentes continued sealed vnto v participation receiuing sacrament although therfore infant die without baptisme shut necessitie hauing felowship christ yt neither partaker yet sealed ye visible signe couenant yet altogether aliant stranger fro christ fastened spiritual knot couenant vertue whereof saued exposition place soul vncircumcised shal cut place gen alledged cutting vncircumcised fro people god consideration time fitly agreeth yt perfect age wel grown yeres babe infantes thing seen moses ye angel ye lord neglecting circumcisio delaying longer lawfull would haue slaine testifieth himselfe neither ignorant certeine olde interpetours referre moses eleazar ye sonne moses verie course hystorie circumstance doe sufficiently proue danger lay father ye sonns necke reason added wordes law whiche meanes agreeth infantes therfore shal vncircumcised perish saith hath broken couenant consider circumcision verie place commaunded infantes perfect age abraham ismael others desiring visibly ioyned felowship god maruell ye destruction threatened disobediet day vnderstande knowe lord ordinaunce comprehended wordes shall beleeue bee baptised shalbe saued wil yet neuertheles baptised boasteth ye faith sufficient vnto saluation baptisme superfluous hath despised ordinance god condemned rebell enimie god furthermore place iohn exposition place except man borne water c iohn vnderstood ye ourward signe holy baptisme simplie inward spiritual regeneration holy spirite nicodemus vnderstoode perfectely lorde figured made manifest vnto parable water spirit yt say winde ye ayer element verie base familiar addeth whiche borne flesh flesh c winde bloweth lusteth c whiche must needes ment ye ayer part coparison followeth euery one borne spirite furthermore addeth tel earthly thinges ye beleeue beleeue tel heauely thing argumet put forth altogether earthly argument whole disputatio except man borne aboue cannot see kingdome god say vnlesse man renued borne againe spirite god giuen aboue yt say powred heauen canot saued doctrine altogether heauenly meanes wherby deliuered declared set forthe heauenly doctrine earthly thinges taken earth shadowed man beeing grosse vnderstanding earthly spiritual heauenly thing laid open euen view eye water ayre oftentimes quality body changed effecte woorking water aire body merueilous like manner working holy ghoste soule man changeth purifieth quickeneth c lorde himselfe afterward whiche tolde euen expoundeth parable spirite al olde writer moste part water haue vnderstood sacramentall water say holy baptisme also receiue interpretation willingly graunte baptisme necessarie saluation wel perfect age also babe infantes necessitie constraine contrarie otherwise goe forwarde stubbernly august condemne infantes place truely shalbe compelled also codemne euen baptised departe life without partaking bodie bloud christ augustine beeing infected ye de peccatorum meritis remissione lib ca like errour defendeth sacrament lordes supper ought put infantes mouthe else daunger death damnation written except ye eate fleshe sonne iohn man drink bloud yee haue life therefore order placeth two sentence except man born water spirite cannot see kingdome god excepte ye eate flesh sonne man c thou persist obstinately augustine sentence verily thou wilt condemne whole church day denieth ye partaking lordes supper vnto infantes thing admitted couenient interpretation ye rigorous obstinate another like place cause disagreeable wil say opinion augustine doeth satisfie himselfe euery point layman thinketh veniall sinne baptise time necessitie cannot tell whether godlily spoken ye baptisme ministred layman ought iterated done againe much better safer beene letting necessitie baptisme pa hath lawful cause holde opinion ye infantes preuented death ought baptised minister ye church ye church parent procuring opportunitie first serueth yt speedie souden death cal ye pinch necessitie let hinderance saluation yet broght baptised augustine trembleth afraide determine punishmente damned infant beeing baptised neither knoweth truly might certeinly say first booke de anim c ca hee saith let promise infantes vnbaptised middle place rest felicity whatsoeuer whersoeuer betweene hell kingdome heauen sentence part receiued men whervpon also infantes buried churchyarde certeine middle place betweene prophane holy ground againe aug contra iulianum pelagianum lib ca writeth infantes shal come easiest damnation immediately bee addeth maner great shalbe although cannot describe yet dare say better body tha againe epistle sainte hierome sayth come determine punishment little infant beleeue driuen narrowe streightes neyther finde thing aunswere heere also may added whiche hee disputeth vppon lib contra donatist cap touching theefe whiche crucified christe among thing saying baptisme fulfilled inuisibly contempt religion poynt necessitie excludeth shutteth visible baptisme wee beleeue also infantes departing timely death baptisme inuisibly perfourmed since contempt religion extremitie necessitie whiche bee auoyded excludeth debarreth visible baptisme since verie many day doe graunt man perfect age withoute baptisme point necessitie may bee saued hee haue desire baptisme may godly desire parentes acquite infantes nowe newly borne guiltinesse thus much hitherto touching also ar baptised baptised time past age hath bene bitter iarring pelagius time past denyed infant ought baptised heard euen nowe pelagius time auxetius arianus sectary denyed baptised time barnard denied may gather writing anabaptistes day kinde men raysed vp sathan destroy gospel denie likewise life time let v call oure remembrance mysterie holy baptisme wherewith whole course life washed might know doubt sinnes forgiuen v god oure lord yea bloud christe whome baptisme graffed might alwayes woorke saluation v euen til receiued myserie glorie neither doubt abraham whole life continually minde mysterie circumcision rested god seede promised vnto yet thinke ought diligently marked augustine pithily plainly hath ofte cited sinnes forgiuen purged baptisme v long liue concupiscence beareth swaye alwayes breedeth bringeth forth v somewhat like selfe shuld imputed vnto v neither wee may inne bee hurtfull v haue sinned sinnes may remitted committed suffered continued de fide operib cap also many kind gratian reciteth distinct de consecrat beside baptisme wee gathered together fellowship baptisme gathered together people god people god wherevppon called first signe entrie christianitie whiche entraunce churche lieth open vnto v wee belong church whosoeuer christ partaker promise god eternall couenaunt belongeth vnto churche baptisme therefore visible signe testimonie ingraffing bodie christ rightly called planting incorporating ingraffing bodie christe said generall discourse sacramentes wee first baptisme ioyned christe afterward member christ brother paul saith ye baptised haue put christ put christ bee gal made one ioyned incorporated may liue v hee onely spirite regenerateth renueth v liberally inricheth v manner good giftes apostle another place expresseth word god saued v founteine regeneration renuing holy tit ghost whiche shedd v richly iesus christ sauiour yea therefore christ lord baptised oure baptisme declare luke brother ioynteheires verie well therefore said august baptisme thus farre forceable wee beeing baptised incorporated christ counted member aug calleth baptisme sacrament christian felowship gathered againe visibly baptisme vnitie one bodie faithfull many haue beene shalbe paule also saith one spirite wee baptised cor one bodie followeth hereby baptisme serueth cofession baptisme serueth confession rightly called token christian religion badge cognizaunce wherby witnesse professe wee consent lincked christian religion wee cofesse nature sinner vncleane sanctified grace god christ cleane nature needed cleansing since wee cleansed doubteth truth god therefore receiue baptisme wee truely freely confesse sinne wherein borne also free forgiuenesse sinnes lastly remembrance consideration mysterie baptisme putteth v minde dueties christianitie godlines say al life long weigh diligently selues whose bodie made member epistle must celebrating supper nothinge followed haue receiued christ sayth depart respect doctrine gospel thing maister taught scholers also ought obserue blessed apostle another place speaketh costantly stoutly saying meruell soone chaunged called grace vnto another gospel nothing else besome trouble go ouerthrowe gospell christ howbeit selues angel heauen preach vnto thing wee haue taught let accursed haue said say againe man preache thing vnto whiche haue receiued let accursed since therefore neither apostle himselfe neither angel heauen preache teache otherwise christe selfe hathe welbeloued sonne wh e haue delight heare wherefore onely christe heard wee ought regard v hath thought meete v doe christ first neither ought case follow custome men trueth god considering lord saith plainly bloud new testament shed many remission sinnes also place scripture manifestly set downe ye christ bloud shed remission ye sinns al faithful wherfore laitie capeable thing muche signe simple woman vnto lordes supper since manifest neither one according vnto speaking matter sate lord table point taken tarde goe obiect daunger cup giuen vnto without exception would come passe follie negligence men might great offence committed letting fall powring floore shuld say eternal prouidence hath foreseen great offence wisemen doe well perceiue nowe length end world amend wherein sonne god amisse crie one kinde enough lay people asmuch necessarie coherence foloweth bodie christ bloud also thus must followe one kinde instituted vaine lord distinctly first offered bread afterward cup lord instituted nothing vaine therefore kind since lord hath comanded ought parted among faithful many haue read writing ancient father wil report obserued euer euen almost vnto time counsell constance many haue beene afraide say diuiding sacrament maner could done without sacrilege matter substace ye supper declared lightly co eratio breade wine question moued concerning ye forme like euerie man doth baptise lawfull minister church apperteyneth vnto euerie man prepare minister holy supper minister ordeyned god herein disproue papistical doctrine alloweth priuate mass teacheth yt prieste offreth vp bodie bloud lord stander masse applteth merite redemption vnto yt deuotion come sacristce one worde lord extent commaundeth priestes sacrifice priuately apply supper others promiseth thinge vnto stande looke sayth doe eate yee drinke ye remembraunce sayeth looke vppon priest onely eating drinking christ bodily present breade wine ioyned vnto heartes mindes spirit none effect remained breade present deede yet coulde sacrificed hath offered vp selfe vppon crosse neither moste worthy onely begotten sonne god offered vp againe god father sinnefull man also neede offer againe paule saith christ beeing one onely sacrifice offered vp hebr sinne sitteth euer righte hand god looking yet come vntill enimies bee made footestoole one oblation hee hath made euer perfect holie mystery owne hand receiue mouth hand ministreth moste agreeable first simplicitie institution supper sit receiue sacrament man owne handes ministreth afterwards breake eate dinide vnto others lord sat table disciple reached foorth yt mystery saying take diuide among moreouer quietnes lesse stur sitting supper minister carrie holie mystery congregation well knowen history antiquitie communicant thing handled springeth question remnantes supper thought remnaunts leauings lord supper whether ought parte reserued whether whiche reserued shut vp ought adored question seemeth haue godlines al altogether superstition hurtfull knoweth bread wine holie lawfull vse appointed sacrament shall praceede demaund sophisters yt mouse gnaweth hee gnaweth lord bread question vnworthy bee demanded raked vp holie obliuion touching shutting vp sacrament whether shut vp adored lord teacheth v one word gospel much lesse worshipping take saith hee eate diuide among saith lay vp worshipp true worshipper worship father spirit trueth moreouer wee read lord hath plainly said gospel say vnto beholde desert go foorth beholde hee innermoste partes house doe beleeue setteth downe cause commaundement like lightening goeth foorth east appeareth west shall comming sonne man comming againe sonne man saith shall glorious obscure neither shall come againe iudge bothe quicke dead therefore paule coloss apostle teaching v true religion willeth v worshipp christe vppon earth mindes lifted vnto heauen hee sitteth right hand father frantique beseeche worshipp holie signe holie thing selfe appeareth decree made late thinges inuented man deuise certeine feaste christes bodie commonly called corpus christi instituted late yeeres vnder pope vrbane yeere lorde may appeare clement booke title chapter beginning si dominum remaineth discusse question concerning time celebrating time celebrated lordes supper season meetest ye morning euening whether ought sup together whether must receiue fasting wee haue dyned also often must celebrate supper often seldome euidently enough knowen christe sat downe table disciple euening followeth heereof supper cannot rightly celebrated time euening lorde vppon occasion feast passeouer bee betrayed night bothe eate supper euening disciple instituted also ye supper v notwithstanding hee le te libertie remoue mysterie vnto morning sober meete deale matter specialy religion fitter bellyes full good cheere wherefore banquet requireth fasting emptie guest yet fastinge man maye taste somewhat aforehand healthes sake paule sayeth man bee hungry let eate home apostle also wil haue feast bee receuied together lordes mysticall supper therefore say wee ought receiue meate tertullian writeth christian haue vsed oftentimes eate meate kinde supper hee writeth called nonlatin alphabet say mutuall loue charitie borrowing name fro loue poore refreshed feastinge richer sorte howbeit prouision meate drink necessaryes might wel enough made without churche paule permit one place publique feastes made also mysticall supper lorde celebrated furthermore many time yeere faithfull ought receiue ofte celbrated sacrament lord supper apostle haue giuen forth commaundement haue lefte indifferent vnto euery church discretion plaine paule hath said often shall eate bread drink cup shall declare lord death vntill come lord apostle setteth downe first commaunding said doe oft shal drink reme brance howbeit let think celebration ye lord supper left freely vnto yt hee need neuer receiue yt lawful libertie vnlawful licentiousnes yt celbrate ye supper lord vpo certeine ordinary time yere would haue brought contempt loathed reason daily frequenting haue consideratio owne people would haue supper celebrated worthily people may haue desire vnto celebrate verie oft suppose vnmeete thing good thinges often frequenting shuld despised better thing oftener say vsed sortes desire serue lorde would haue done great good effecte lord hath left free betweene augustine bee made vmpier iudge doubtlesse would pronounce none iudgment yt hath alreadie pronounced ye cause writing vnto ianuarius saying hee shall best decide strife beetweene aduised especially abide peace christ euerie man doe whiche according faithe hee persuaded bee good godly neither dishonoreth bodie bloud lorde onely meate must contemned whome holy supper iustituted whome supper instituted ministred haue also consider seemeth instituted bee giuen vnto faythfull christian people sexe soeuer men woman high lowe wherfore great mysterie cast vnto swine dog contemned troden vnder foote bee ministred men earnestly effectually bee admonished vnto meat apperteineth namely ye acknowledg sin yt sorie fault beleeue christe admonished euery man descending selfe doe proue selfe afterwarde eate holie bread drinke holie drink eate drinke thereof vnworthily vnto condemnation seuere admonition approch vnto table sit sitting opely professe also desire remaine true worshipper christ whoe truste haue remission sinnes surely put back ye minister neither ye holy mystery denied lord himselfe searcher hart seuerely diligently plainly many word last supper distributed holie dog ye lord warned diligently matter whereof warned hearing vnderstanding remaineth notwithsteding among ye saint daunteth one faithful hogg one fathfull taketh parte bread cup hypocrisie sinne nowe manifest spake true sensible bodie sayeth body addeth whiche broken giuen true natural sensible humane body deliuered died v appeareth bread vnder bread wherefore lord word must expounded surely beene lord make body bread bloud wine according ye power wherby made thinges word soone euer said body bread beene body christ body whereof spake mortall passible felt seene spake word made christes body sens doe witnesse verie substance remayning onely accidentes breade necessarie therefore aduersaries doe vnderstand vnder christes body gone simplicitie lordes wordes sayde body vnder body againe tyed word aboue recited vpon paine sacrilege may starte haires breadth beseeche durst luke paule recite word belong cup farre otherwise matthewe marke two doe sette downe wordes belonging cup sorte bloude new testament whiche shead manye remission sinnes two recite thus cup beeing newe testament bloud whiche shead cuppe newe testament bloud shal thinke difference betweene bloude christe newe testament paule defineth newe testament ieremie full remission sinnes self sayth remission sinnes obteined bloud christ impudently contend dare affirme verie cup wine cup really substantially remission sinnes cause wee holde sticke precisely letter forced confesse cuppe wine drinke eyther bloude christ eyther newe testament remission sinnes lord sayth wine cup howbeit place avoyde absurditie wee willingly admitte trope wherfore indifferet matter equal importace therfore like cup wine testament remission sinnes likewise cup wine christes bloude like maner also breade christes body ye cup substantially remissio sinnes bloud sacrament christes bloude whereby new testament dedicated full remission sinnes obteyned v therefore breade bodye christe bycause sacramente body christ surely strong firme argumente wee haue brought foorth lesse force strengthe hope behinde whiche nowe bring foorth lord celebrating holy supper sayth doe ye remebrance wordes import determine really present whome ought remember shall sayde remember thing beholdeth presence must goe simple signification remembrance memorie specially since paule sayth declare lord death vntill come thus wee gather thereby hee whose remembrance repeated vntill hee come returne hee surely counted present looked come therfore lord body giuen v remembraunce whereof celebrated mysticall supper present looked come place touching christes leauing world departing hence doe simply admit interpretation word supper expedient saith iohn depart goe away coforter shal come vnto depart send vnto also went father came worlde againe leaue world go father againe hencefoorth worlde worlde come vnto thee sayinges truely repugnaunt went hence longer world left worlde natural body world verily giuen receyued really substantially supper neyther lawfull figuratiuely interpret testimony whiche brought foorth sainte iohns gospel concerning christes departure apostle doe confesse lord spake plainely simply without parable much therefore apostle testifie speach lord simple simply pronounced needeful wordes whiche contrarie vnto body expounded figure scripture repugnant moreouer place whiche selfe beare recorde christes bodie resurrection circumscribed place seene felt also doe make difference betweene christes body clarified angelicall spirites way may see place left deuice definitiue meane admit bare interpretation solemne wordes lorde mark angel say risen beholde place layde also shall goe galilee shall see againe selfe saythe luke disciple feele see spirite hath fleshe bone see mee haue sayinges clarified body whiche ascended sitteth righte hande father repugne wholy vbiquitie euerie place insensibilitie christes body whiche notwithstanding must needes graunted proceede inforce reall presence christes bodye wordes supper simply vnderstood whervnto belongeth whiche apostle disputing resurrection cor deade sayth deade doe rise neyther christe risen christe risen first fruites sleepe therefore shall wee rise also wherefore owne body raysed againe appeareth manner bodye christes glorious body wherevnto body made like bodyes shall true bodyes consisting sinewes veynes fleshe skinne bone visible inuisible remayning certeine place heauen euerie wherevpon foloweth lord bodye inuisible euerie man thinke good argument whiche fet raysed bodyes lord raysed body contrariwise let cor accuse saint paul hath taught v example therefore catholique righte auncient fayth constreyneth v expound wordes supper trope figure finally capernaites hearde lord dispute touching eating body drinking bloud thinke imagine carnall eating drinking sayde would ascend heauen wit shoulde thinke eating naturall body since selfe body would ascend heauen neyther lefte place newe friuolous deuice certeine men whiche feigne ascend heauen nothing el lay downe weake state ascend nto heauen condition thereof receiue supernaturall sainte luke whome altogether muste rather actes beleeue suche subtile deuises rather folly saith lord lifted vp highe carried vp heauen sight disciple moreouer body receyned cloude disciple looked vp heauen vntill heard angel say vnto would returne againe verie manner altogether saw depart away knoweth shall come againe cloudes heaue therfore heauen lord ascended name place state condition also gospell promiseth v place selfe saying go prepare iohn place come againe take vnto may also yea layd downe condition infirmity mortall body resurrection need lay ascension suppose none faythfull denye lorde instituted nothing v vaine without singular speciall commoditie v lorde sayde gospell fleshe corporally eaten auayled nothing speaketh none body verie whereof spake word supper wit whiche gaue v followeth without contradiction lorde deliuered nothing vnto v supper would profite v haue deliuered would haue profited v hee giuen v body eaten corporally euident therefore necessarie wordes supper shoulde expounded herevnto belongeth notable prophecie manifest commaundement oure lorde iesus christe saying gospell shall say vnto loe christe matth christe doe beleeue shal arise false christes false prophetes shall worke greate signes wonder possible verie elect shall bee brought errour beholde haue tolde therefore shall say vnto beholde wildernesse goe foorth behold innermost part house ye closet coffer say word nonlatin alphabet signifieth secrete innermost partes house wherein vse lay vp thing whiche would haue safest kept dutche call schryn schloss vnd ghalt doe beleeue like lightning goeth east appeareth euen vnto west shall coming sonne man bee although place vsed expounded many calamity iewes yet denyed whiche hierome also selfe confesseth likewise destinie worlde prophecied euen vnto end therof wherefore place haue alledged concluded saying concerning christes last comming worlde daye iudgement moreouer cannot denyed lorde doth absolutely condemne doctrine defendeth christe remaineth presente diuers place world box close place whiche book teacher transubstantiation seene also tabernacle whiche erected vnto christes body whiche call meate tentes also chapells famous temple monastery euerie one place say shewe v christe plentie suche great number people receiue errour running christe desarts innermost place house ye elect shalbe danger ye mean great perill daunger thinges doth christ teach elect immediately addeth therefore nowe whole world counsel world kinges prince yea angel saintes commaund v beleeue christ corporally yet commaundement redeemer iesus christe sonne god father wisedome whome thinges made forbiddeth v beleue ought authoritie among godly may knowe muste beleeue creature commaud creatour hath commaunded yea moreouer lorde vouchsafeth verie place gospell giue v reson doctrine must beleeue christe conuersant bodily present vpon earth inuisibly bycause like lightening goeth foorth east appeareth west shall comming sonne man much sayde sonne god came humbly earthe redeeme v throughe like lightning right terrible wicked therefore cause time ascension vntill comming iudgement shuld looke come inuisibly remayne v corporally present hierome expounding place sayth also must sayd second comming oure sauiour shall shewed humilitie glory foolishe part therefore seeke little corner secrete place light whole world thus farre least may seeme stay self vpon humane authoritie gaue sentence themselues setting selues againste god worde vnbeleefe neither apprehendinge christ faith life righteousnesse world wherefore chiefe greatest portion worthinesse vnworthinesse consisteth aith vnbeleefe peter witnesseth harte purified faith true actes faith therfore cleannes christian wherevpon augustine sayth vnbeleeuer eateth flesh christ spiritually rather eateth drinketh sacrament bread called christ bodie common meate paule saith eateth drinketh vnwoorthily eateth drinketh owne damnation making difference lordes bodie therefore make difference ye lord make difference lord
