furthermore lord bodie spiritual body lord wit church faithfull verie bodie lord tooke virgin offred vp redemptio sitteth right hand father short bread ye sacrament supper lord bodie say sacrament true bodie giuen v whosoeuer therfore putteth difference betweene lord mystical bread prophane meate commeth christes table would table common grosse meate acknowledgeth heauenly meat differeth farre humane meate neither commeth sort lord hath instituted foloweth owne reason surely maketh difference lord bodie eateth drinketh damnation paul againe expoundeth himselfe saying therefore brother come together eate tarrie one another yee meete condemnation therfore preuenteth publique supper eating priuate supper say suppeth ye lord hath appointed eateth drinketh vnworthily vn worthie eater drinker said eate drinke damnatio said meete togither condemnation ye make hast supper tarying brother make difference lord bodie augustine treatise vpon iohn sayth apostle speketh receiued lord bodie without difference carelesly bin kind meate whatsoeuer heretherefore reproued maketh difference lord bodie say doth discerne lord body fro meates shuld iudas daned came lord table feigning friend enimie c much grieuously doe seeme sinne day peruerting lawfull first vse ye instituted lord stablish abuse great contentio yea grieuously persecute cry wil receiue furthermore since experience finde euerie day ye many thinges wanting vnto faithe meanes whereof diuerse vice spring vppe among v whereof vnworthines hightest lest lord grace may easily washe away almost wipeth away sending crosse vpon v imputing infirmity v condemnation ye apostle another place aith condemnation whiche graffed christ iesus walk flesh spirit neither equall punishment doth iust lord punish sundry punishment eate vnworthily sortes vnworthinesse let v therefore see blessed apostle teacheth v concerning punishmente eate vnworthily therefore sayth eateth bread drinketh lord cup vnworthily shalbe gyltie lord bodie bloud whiche wordes verily meaneth chiefe moste owle vnworthines al wit vnbeleefe guiltie ye lord body bloud fault lord death imputed say whome christes death becommeth death life also happened vnto vnbeleefe wickednes crucifie christ vnto christes bloud seemed prophane bloud beast murtherer wicked person worthily offence pray else doeth thinke ye christes bloud prophane beleeueth ye shed sinnes worlde yet dareth take part ye lord supper ye may worthily saide guiltie lord bodie bloud verie great offence eate lord bread drinke cup vnworthily vnbeleefe thing example iudas laid eye beleeued ye lord iesus yea inuented howe deliuer hand theeues murtherers yet neuerthelesse sate meate tooke part lord supper therfore end diuel worthily chalenged wholy vnto iohn witnesseth yt end supper diuell iohn entred iudas ye came ye supper begonne dwell stir forward luke many admonitios lord christ yt prophaned mystery christ troden vnder foote wholy entred fully possessed apostle paule threateneth damnation make difference lord bodie placed another degree vnworthinesse saying eateth drinketh vnworthily eateth drinketh owne damnation reason hereof setteth sentence wit wee oughte rashly carelesly come lord table yt approche condemnation condenation iudgment paine punishment lord laieth vpon faithfull people sin another world truly doth vpon vnbeleeuers world followeth word apostle ministreth vnto v sense cause many weake feeble among many slepe iudged selues haue bene iudged iudged corrected lord wee bee condemned world apostle plainelie distinguisheth betweene vnworthie eater subiecte god correction worldly men say vnbeeleeuers whose punishment lord deferreth world vpon faithful people yet offende negligence come supper sufficiently instructed layeth diuers sundrie affliction pestilence famine sicknes like shake drousinesse foloweth iudged selues yt selues restrained vice separated selues euil bene iudged say punished corrected immediatly addeth iudged chastised lord bee iudged therefore chastised hereby learne whence flow many mischiefes church wit vnworthie vse lord supper man wil answer howe shoulde prepare selues lordes supper ye matter better wholy absteine ye lord supper absteine wholie also therby sinneth againste lorde grieuously hee setteth nought lordes commandement saieth yea setteth nought lord death gyfts god wherefore hath escaped dager hath omitted celebrate ye supper thing also haue said thou must go way worke thou desire auoide danger sin heare counsel paule copendiously saying let man examine himselfe let eate bread drinke cup wee muste mark yt examination sendeth man another euerie man selfe papistes bidd thee goe auricular confessour confesse thy selfe receiue absolution make satisfaction thy sinnes accordinge fourme comaunded thee bid thee sufficiently clensed go lordes table paule ye doctour gentile vessell election speaketh word thing saith simply let man examine himselfe let eat bread drink cup like god ye searcher harte requireth affection minde hateth hypocrisie none knoweth hart man affection wee beare godward selues therfore willeth v selues examine euery thing ourselues say willeth euerie man descend himselfe examine selfe examination cannot bee made without faith light god word faithfull man haueing light god worde shining faith extendinge force power inquireth himselfe whether hee doth acknowledge al sinnes whiche hath manifoldly committed god whether sorte committed whether sincere fayth hart beleeue christ hath washed away forgiuen al sinnes whether confesse freely mouth beleeueth hart life saluation consisteth iesus christ onely none whether haue determined himselfe die confession whether meane diligently earnestly applie himselfe innocencie holines life whether readie loue helpe member christes bodie also member readie spend life according example christe whether haue remitted pardoned anger enimitie whether desirous call minde christes passion ye whole mysterie redemption giue thanks god redeption gyftes god already receiued receiued right examining agreeth wt ye receiuing mystical supper haue done may humblenes feare lord gladnesse approche supper lord christ faithful tremble priuie comfort afflicted conscience owne imperfection infirmitie finde thinges perfect mindes otherwise kn w iust perfection requireth satan commeth casteth many great stayes intent may drawe v backe celebration supper therefore say man suppose none admitted supper purged al sinne infirmitie surely shall driue away exclude al men howe many soeuer liue world nay shal altogether depriue lord supper loger sinful men angel must remeber yt examinatio resteth wtin bound god also euerie else doth vse clemencie mercie towards v knoweth weakenesse corruption v beare prayeth increase faith charitie perfection christ first supper apostle christes guest among iudas hee lacked faith traitour yea murtherer made guiltie ye bodie bloud lord apostle also sinner theselues wicked thei beleued christ thei loued christ one loued aother like brethre therfore eate lord supper vnworthily iudas although meane time table shewed token great imperfectio peter wtout great contempt reproch brother preferreth matth luke himselfe moreouer contend among themselues honour seme greater another nowe recite streightway arose ye table shamefully forsoke maister ranne away many wayes behaud selues vnworthili al thing easily washed away ye faith taken deepe roote wtin neither sticke recite worde worde comfort iohn caluine godly learned man great commendation teacheth church day fellow minister welbeloued deere brother whiche hathe sette afflicted case let v call remembrance saith holy banquet medicine sick cofort sinfull largesse pore whole righteous rich could found would bring small vantage seing banquet christ giuen vnto v eaten vnderstand without faynt faile forsaken moreouer seeing giuen v life vnderstande without wee dead wherfore greatest worthines giue vnto god lay vilenes vnworthines mercy may make v worthie himselfe despaire selues may coforted humble selues may lift vp accuse ourselues may iustified moreouer attein vnto vnitie whiche comendeth vnto v supper like maketh v dwel may likewise ther one soul one hart one tongue v wel wey meditate thing shal thought neuer trouble v ar naked destitute goodnes stayned spot sinn halfe deade shoulde wee worthily eate lord bodie let v rather think poore doe come plentifull giuer sicke come physician sinful come sauiour worthines comanded god co sisteth faith chiefly reposeth al god nothing selues secondly charitie suche charitie sufficient offer vnto god vnperfect may increse better seing cannot performe absolute ought thus farr muche haue saide hetherto ye holie supper lord iesus christe moste excellent wholesome sacrament christian euen beginning apostle yet liuing sathan deadly enimie saluation lying wayte hath gone ouerthrow many corruption defilings whiche nowe time faithfully sumptuous worshipping notwithstandinge thinges therein certeine moderate neither would hee haue thing added taken pleasure men otherwise vsed appointed wil thinke abrogating lawe lorde would deliuer might exercised verie profitable furtheraunce studie holie scripture sorte chiefest study knowledge holy tongs logicke naturall philosophie mathematicks moderately knowne directed vnto certeine scope contemne holie scripture thinges playne barbarous man also may find wit busied studie mathematickes meete maisters buildinges gouernours pastoures church yea farre crept studie astronomie astronomer heauen yt quite forget blessed heauen seate ye blessed saintes thing perteine vnto shall sufficiently happie atteine vnto ye knowledge ye motion visible heaue course starres meddle ouermuch studie philosophie trifle logicke rule khetoricke neuer attaine vnto ende earnestly thinke vpon bestowing trauels edifying church commonly become contentious brawling disputers parte arrogant controller vnto nothing semeth neatly aptly enoughe eyther spoken done others whiche tempered tuned great conceiuing heades agreeing prescript rule swarne much haires bredth men snarle intangle thinges doltishe disputation puffing nothing else quarelling controuersies taking vpon moste arrogantly iudge men doings saying euer though good tollerable snap maliciously cauill rather vayne babbler philosopher yea verie plague scholes church spitte poyson debate contention variance strises diuisions church sainte paule apostle timothie seemeth speake tim hadde briefly set downe summe sounde doctrine addeth vpon teache exhorte euer teacheth otherwise holdeth selfe contented healthfull worde lorde iesus christe doctrine whiche according vnto godlinesse puffed vp knowing nothing spending time aboute question contention wordes whereof groweth hatred strife slander euill suspicion vaine conflictes men corrupt hart destitute trueth whiche suppose gayne bee godlinesse avoyde companie truely neuer went well corruption scholes churche learned studious men forsaking playnenesse purenesse worde god turned eye way aymed word god alone auncient time contemne worde god meane attributed tradition conuenient meanes bothe gaue occasion vnto errours confirmed abuse already brought certeine yeares past gone gratian lombard ecclesiasticall writer went make agreement opinion gather togither perfect certeine sum diuinitie thereby onely carried scholes awaye scripture also intruded straunge doctri churche followed alexander albertus thomas onely depended vpon sentence commended vnto others also endeuoured mingle philosophie diuinitie couche together one body heereof came passe many wayes sectes many puddle crauling full frogges many scholes many abbayes many sophisters day likewise continue vnhappily couple philosophie holy scripture superstitiously call disputation call vnto examination humane rule handling artes shall also corrupt scholes peruerting integritie apostolique doctrine great detriment churche meane certeine good artes learning doe make muche vnto perspicuitie playnenesse moderately religiously applyed iudgement scripture may haue vpper hand artes obey wherefore let pure godlinesse taught ecclesiasticall scholes true ende scholes yea let godlinesse ende study first let studious diligently taught catechisme let neuer rest vntill suche time haue learned perfectly made familiar vnto selues let young begunne godlinesse daily increased lecture holy sermon let writing holy euangelistes apostle alwayes read vnto may become perfect due season let also commodiously learne tongs good artes let exercised writing reasoning aboue let dissolutenesse wantonnesse banished discipline scholes godly instituted christian scholes let discipline yea though somewhat sharpe flourishe youth corrupted scholes growe vp corruption praye shall looke hand set authoritie ouer churche let v beleeue wil salt church dissolute blockish abide sharpnesse shall thinke become lightes churche doe selues hate light delighted darknesse woorkes darkenesse wherefore sonnes helie churche israel shall corrupt sonnes prophetes church christ therfore shal likewise perishe people whiche committed vnto therefore nowe adayes greate offence committed muche lenitie scholes mischiefe whiche neuer washed away man shall come many scholes shall thinke seeth many souldiers ruffian scholers student whome commonly call clearkes neyther fare neyther apparell neyther maners neyther wordes neyther deedes declare anye good disposition honest studious knowe muche ascribed vnto vnhappy dissolute age stubborne rebellious hearken counsel elder againe knowe great offence committed negligence fonde gentlenesse authoritie much welfare churche consisteth scholes well ordered ought v vse great diligence behalfe maye offence committed carelesnesse negligence muche haue sayd concerning ecclesiasticall scholes fewe wordes might conueniently whiche haue intreated large booke institution byshops furthermore end scholes ecclesiasticall goodes whole ministerie may mainteyned together holy building ecclesiastical charge needeth good wealth abilitie correspondent place therefore admonisheth v say somewhat concerning ecclesiasticall goodes god commonwealth whiche would haue excell best furnished thing necessarie appoynted standing fee payde vnto holie ministerie common charge witte tythes first fruites sundrye kyndes offering thinges lawe expressed moses man god many wordes nothing feared least handling matter shoulde accused greedie desire couetousnesse thinges whiche god commaunded declare plainely people vttered vnto faythfully yea lawe nature commaundeth rewarde taketh payne maynteine common charge common contribution reuenues tribute publiquely gathered bestowed publique v partly giuen minister ministerie seruice partly disbursed vpon publique building holy charge parte employed reliefe poore although newe testament leuiticall lawe c urche new testament hath goodes reuenues whole priesthoode abrogated notwithstanding certeine vniuersall lawe whiche commandeth publique charge shuld leuied publique contribution abolished reade lorde iesus christe although luke liued tenth reuenues priestes yet liued contribution godly executed publique function sending disciple abroade preache expressely matth sayth vnto woulde haue carefull foode apparell labourer worthy hire wherefore primitiue church apostle haue gathered christe bestoweth house landes monie preseruation ministerie thinges necessarie churche priestes leuites time possessed holie reuenues actes giuing one iote apostolique churche whiche rather wished might storue hunger godly faythfull people knewe verie well earthly substance rich verie necessarie preseruation churche god hath appoynted men angel minister church hathe recommended poore men vnto church stand stead men wont doe lacke destitute many thinges wherefore good men motion holy ghoste doe contribute together bestowe mony house landes good wherby poore also holy ministerie may mainteyned herevppon also euident church people new testament hadde euer since time christe apostle goodes possession publiquely gathered receiued also layde bestowed againe publique common commoditie gregorie first name bishop howe olde time church goodes bestowed rome saythe custome time also time ought foure portion part ye church god one byshop familie clergie third poore fourth repayring church great many say byshoppe oughte receiue wage church let v therefore examine christ apostle teach v touching matter christe lord neuer committed vniust thing receiued read maintenance woman taught ministred vnto substance also sending disciple abroade willing careful meate drink rayment sayth labourer worthy hire lorde iudgeth worthy meete minister church ought rewarded right minister necessary vnto preacher wherefore doe vnworthy deed receiue wage thereby prouide necessary selues familie yea compareth preacher idle belly eate freely men breade neyther beggers labourer lord setteth downe lawe howe great offence deny labourer hire euen offence smal suffer faythful feeder flocke perishe decay thorough need place lord speaketh disciple saying ye haue freely receiued therefore matth giue freely speaketh gifte working myracles benefit health bestowed vppon sicke diseased oppressed thus written heale sicke cleanse leaprous rayse deade cast diuels word added saying ye haue receiued freely therfore bestowe frely therfore though apostle receiued reward preached yet neuer man read ye euer tooke thing gift healing receiued lord name like heliseus would take thinge though frely offred naaman syrian capteine yt counsel healed leprosie yet selfe heliseus refused gifte man came vnto fro baalsalisa selfe gospel christ lord minister haue learne vse ought put wage haue church time lord commanded iudas carried ye pursse iohn depart residue disciple thought ben commanded go buy necessary serue ye holie day else bestow something poore therefore plaine lord vsed ipend whiche receiued prouide necessary al giue almes therof marke wel minister churche may prouide thing necessarie liuing function maintenaunce housholde wage receiue church againe may also ye wage giue almes vnto poore euen good truly gotten lord saith plainly lawe ye sacrifice leuites made tythes oblatios holy reuenues shall acceptable vnto sacrifice offer thing owne chest store possession truly labourer offer vnto god thing hire wage yt say giue vnto ye poore doth seeme verie acceptable sacrifice vnto god verie acceptable almes minister churche doth bestow proceeding wage holie ministerie put case labourer building church receyueth wage churche good shoulde man therefore say labourer tooke almes one almes ought giuen receiued wage worke labour therefore giueth almes wage owne lawful proper good wherfore shoulde minister church seem liue almes ought giue almes alms notwithstanding dothe labour wage therfore receiueth reward work labourer doth vnto lord self compareth ye minister man far past honestie think shal heare say paul apostle saith sow vnto spiritual thing great matter wee mowe carnall thing againe cor tim elder gouern wel worthy double honor chiefly trauell preaching teaching scripture saith thou shalt mousell mouth treading come labourer worthy hire behold therfore ye apostle doth think inestimable goodnesse ministerie mean reco penced vile thing meane wt earthly wage againe labour saith labour say saith loyter teaching doth compare vnto oxe toyling beast thresher corn also labouring man wherof greatly warne bycause wicked vnthankfull world certeine men nay rather monster vnthankfull found persuaded minister doe nothing yea euen suche moste faithfully dutie cry saying eate bread beggers costeth nought name infamie terrifie many fine wit make forsake ye studie good learning diuinitie yt vtterly abhorr ye ministerie thing beggerly vnhonest sort diuel deuise enlarge kingdom abusing rather fitly vsing purpose ingratitude malice suffer selues numbred christ holy apostle fed mainteined yt church stipend reckoned vp among vnthankful proude people haue seraped gathered al good together ye part vsery wicked mean least haue gotten good sinister mean haue receiued liberalitie meere goodnesse god neuer sweat tooke paynes paule proueth strong many argumets right receiue stipende holie ministerie cor haue saith power authoritie eate drinke maye wee carrie v woman sister meaneth lawfulnesse apostle receiued wagis authoritie receyue thing necessarie selfe wife whole housholde asketh question sheweth meaneth thereby may declare playne truth equitie amongst men thereto addeth example euerie man seuerally generally specially chiefest apostls christ kinne vnto christe bloud saying euen apostle brother oure lorde cephas cephas peter cephas lorde sayde first chapter iohn thou shalt called cephas whiche man interprete signifieth stone peter also syrnamed rocke intent interpretation name may alwayes fail vppon pray lordes brother iohn iames marke iames brother iudas iudas simon brother iames sayth sainte baule liued stipend gathered common assembly church vnto example addeth also like vnto commonly put practise sayth doth goe warre owne costes charge planteth vineyarde eateth fruite thereof feedeth flocke eateth mylke thereof surely bringeth foorth similitude finely properly applied vnto vnto minister church somtime called souldiers vine yardkeepers sometime husbandman shepherd pray farr reason woulde denie vnto souldiers husbandman shepheards meate clothing paynes take warfare husbandrie cattel true hearted men therfore suche indifferent iudgement acknowledge minister church may liue ecclesiasticall ministerie least man obtect humane parable similitude taken common vse proue nothing ecclesiasticall cause addeth presently doe speake thing according doth lawe say also written lawe moses thou shalt mussell oxe treadeth corne though shoulde say haue readinesse cofirmation right humane similitude also testimony ye holy scripture allegeth place chap deuteronomie concerning nourishing labouring ox againe lest man shuld say place vnderstood preathers simply ox addeth dothe god take care ox dothe hee speake altogether oure sake doubtlesse hee hath writen sake ploweth may plowe hope thresheth hope may partaker hope lorde sayd lawe would prouide v would haue qualitie gathered certaine syllogisme kinde argument suche like manner lorde prouided beastes cattell woulde haue consideration hadde howe much men truly vniust thing husbandman labour oxe without hope saye vaine without commoditie therefore also vniust thing minister exercise ecclesiastical husbandrie church without hope due stipend moreouer againe obiected vnto spiritual ministerie belongeth corporall spirituall reward apostle aunsweareth wee vnto spiritual thing great matter reape temporal thing therefore thinketh corinthian giue nothing giue temporall thinges namely compared eternall good thinges minister bring teaching looke farre soule excelleth bodie muche spiritual thinges better temporall apostle also concealeth euident argument word admonisheth meet soweth also reape point also great inequalitie minister sowe better reap worse men set light god diuine ministerie therefore thincke minister doe nothing paule againe confirmeth owne right example others saying others bee partaker power towardes rather wee seeing none taken paine amonge corinthian paule man worthie reward moreouer confirmeth right example commaundement ordinaunce lord saying knowe ye whiche take paine holy thinges doe eate holy thinges minister altar partaker altar euen hath lord ordeined doe preach gospell liue gospell hath lord ordeined forsooth said gospell ye labourer worthie hire iudge especially obserued whiche apostle speaketh plaine word lord instituted ordinaunce concerning maintenaunce minister church vnto imitation auncient lawes iewishe people hereof wee gather wee misse much marcke like case wee vtterly reiect auncient institution father paule apostle vsed authoritie mighte paule receiued wage haue done maketh nothing thinges one question deede another right thing deede hee toke nothing corinthian diner cause yet notwithstanding hee toke church neither receiued thing church thessalonica yet deeing prtiudiciall equitie right saith vnto corinthian haue robbed church cor hauing receiued wage thintent might seruice wanted burthensome vnto man thing lacking vnto giuen brother came macedonia vnto thessalonian saith behaued oure selues inordinately amongst thess neither take bread nothing labour paine night day woorke intent wee would burden vnto lawefull v doe would set downe selues patterne followe againe paule saith vnto thessalonian besech acknowledge laboure among ouer thess lord admonishe haue singular loue loue woorke sake peace let much therefore churche goodes sufficient giuen vnto minister teacher farre forth honest necessitie requireth thus much haue spoken concerning portion due vnto pastours time past second part ecclesiasticall good allotted vnto clearkes clearks haruest studentes mainteined wage churche pastours studious diuinitie promise wedlock brake firste promise made continencie chastitie de bono viduitatis cap litle hee addeth wordes therefore say suche marriage marriage deede rather adultery seemeth mee speake foolishly without consideratio thus much vnderstande worde condemnation iudgment men apostle reprehension whiche wee switzers terme ein anszricte oder nachred euil spoken many haue broken firste faith say haue broken promise continencie wherefore apostle thinketh much better young woman matche themselues marriage set downe themselues suche order life although necessitie forceth thervnto cannot depart without reprehension men place speaketh virgin widowes saint cyprian speaketh simplie virgin monkes nonnes altegether vnknowne primitiue monastery onkes churche christe apostle latter age monkes nowe dayes whiche owne rule lawe whose monastery abound filthinesse vncleannes though holde peace yet true trueth selfe experience wil sufficiently declare seeme bee gouerned seuere discipline defiled hypocrisie wil say none thing touching firste monkes dwelt city neyther intermedled selues worldly affaire haue declared another place howe writer middle age made abbat required might leaue beeing clerke man could well bothe monke clerke since one impediment liued common reuenues church trauel owne hand lay people hierome disputing originall monkes life paulus hath thus written among many hath oftentimes called question first beganne chiefly dwell wildernes monkes fetching matter somewhat farre beginne reckon helias holy prophet iohn whome helias seemeth v haue beene monke iohn began prophecie borne others opinion moste part people doe commonly agree affirme saint anthonie firste beginner order part true onely first also motioner others therevnto amathas macarius saint anthony scholar whereof first buried maisters bodie nowe affirme one paulus thebius first beginner way whiche thing also confirme name also opinion anon hee addeth paulus forsaking citie thereto inforced feare torment vnder persecuters cecius valerianus departed wildernesse found aue lay hid therein vntil hee founde anthonie emperours decius valerianus gouerned ye empyre yeare lord saide anthonie dyed hundred fiue yeres olde yeare lord augustine epistle hesychius reporteth time howe liued yeare lorde foure hundreth twentie eutropius beda reporte howe died yeare lord foure hundreth thirtie thirtie one chapter maners catholique church reciting manner institution monkes time reporteth suche thinges verie farre order institution monkes dayes time iustinian emperour made certeine lawes monkes monastery liued one benet many monkes nowe dayes call father whose life recite vnto trittenheymius died aboue fiftie yeares since intent may vnderstande power dignitie obteyned processe time beginning contemned none authoritie benet abbat cassina sayeth first founder beginner gouernour monkes west wroate eloquent style graue iudgement rule monkes one booke whiche beginneth giue care sonneto precept c conteineth three score thirteene chapter died yeare lord marianus scotus supposeth hee died yeare lord last yeare emperour maurice writeth also twentie order monkes vnder benet rule benet order haue beene eightteene pope sea rome cardinal aboue two hudred archebishops diuerse church number one thousand sixe hundred bishop almost foure thousand famous abbats excelled life doctrine writing fifteene thousand seuen hundred suche canonized fifteene thousand sixe hundred may recite many order monkes knowne mendicant monkes frier beeing faithful diligent valiaunt romane champion pope spirituall monarchie confirmed honorius yeare lorde one thousand two hundred twentie two hereby would declare nothing else onely men shoulde vnderstande monkerie deuised mannes inuention deliuered vnto churche christe apostle firste semed tollerable afterward became altogether intollerable howe profitable common wealth experience selfe teacheth euer knoweth quite repugnant true religion knoweth nothing feigne meritorius god state perfection seeth repugnant christes merite sincere doctrine gospell godlinesse necessitie moueth v haue wholy betaken selues one god baptisme betake selues also make vowes sainctes binde selues religio othe obseruing rule true religion forbiddeth v vowe selues saintes meanes depende way religion vppon true religion forbiddeth v choose v father maisters true religion forbiddeth v deuise new maners worshippings new religion receiue deuised others example ieroboam fellow maketh v affeard true religion forbiddeth v sweare name god religion referreth v one god faith obedience superstition breaketh bande admitteth creature paul ye corinthian saith euerie one sayeth paules cor apollo cephaes christes christ diuided paule crucified baptised name paule beholde christ redeemer maister faith christe hath made v one bodie baptisme baptised one body might called christian petrines paulines paule would suffer christian shoulde take name apostle much lesse would abide day shoulde bee called benedictine franciscanes dominicanes lordes inheritance possession lawfull v binde selues seruice men binde themselues teare sunder vnitie christes body prophane crosse baptisme christ apostle sayeth playnly christe diuided paule crucified wer baptised name paul therefore although commonly called spirituall person yet nothing lesse spirituall apostle sayth one sayeth paules apolloes ye carnall end receiuing gospel christe iesus doctrine apostle whiche conteyne deliuer vnto v godlinesse inuent newe rule truely founde certeine peculiar lawes meanes liuing separated themselues common sorte christian outward maner liuing behauiour apparell intent meanes might make euident men woulde liue apart common laye imperfect church liue holily perfectly spiritually well hath framed doth frame whole world speaketh day vowes vowe foolish vowe chastitie haue chastitie mona ical vowes ye gift god incident men paul sayth whoso canot liue continently let marrie better marry burne generally sayde burne whether vowe vowe neither lawfull humane vow foolishly taken hande vowed shoulde preiudice law god maner pouertie whiche abbyes experience selfe teacheth put pouertie put comon garment coule put great rich monkes thing whiche old time would haue semed strange monstruous matter made prince common sort liue idely eate bread freely nought apostle rule epistle thessalonian cap also accursed forsake parentes kinsfolke whome lawe god bound serue obey betake themselues vnto straunge men whome enforced finite superstition thus freely set libertie parentes either set libertie superstition intent may haue dayes life wherewithall lye rot idlenesse euidet put coule belly sake religion obedience yt quite contrarie obedience whiche reuealed worde god magistrate commaunded susteine beare publique burden residue faithfull euermore free exempted olde time minister straunge religion vnder kinges iuda princely priuileges customes confirmed prescription long time forasmuche ministerie allowed worde god rather repugnant woorde god vngodlily neither vniustly sacrilegiously broaken disolued holie kinges well abide heare excuse admonished doe penance sinnes whiche haue committed make exception vertue othe referred monkish order safe conscience cannot depart euident othe pretend altogether rash oth perfourmed haue declared sermon seconde decade pray bond made man without god yea rather worde god binde one vnto specially beeing made vnwisely vnaduisedly crosse christ bee great vertue hathe released v curse vnto subiect much shal deliuer v fro outward bond wherewith intrapped god otherwise follie wickednesse men crafte diuell apostle saint paule crieth yee bought price become seruantes men happily cor malice men owne follie wee become seruants godly muste endeuour true faith obedience may restored libertie child god verily gospell preached vnto v intent wee bee deliuered vniust captiuitie serue god spirite trueth moreouer obiect good conuenient monastery whole worlde refourmed brought back first simplicitie aunswere vnhappie age vaine yea plaine follie hope cannot reduced auncient simplicitie neither prince monkes suffer reformation made know must depart onely muche profites honoures pleasure together howbeit rather whole worlde together eares wold deliuer vp god kingdome whiche haue hitherto enioyed admit thing easie enough accomplish shall persuade v abbyes refourmed according auncient institution age shoulde bee aswell better gouerned olde time see beginning howe haue gone forward howe increased see hypocrisie ambition couetousnesse pleasure idlenesse could doe point al thing come wee thinke men desire day bee moderate doe wee thinke discipline shall nowe lesse corrupted v posteritie forefather yea constreined hope better feare worse euery day experiment worse wee liue dregges worlde verie latter end age wherein dragon bottomlesse pitte malice vngodlinesse men hath gotten selfe great power force disturbe corrupte thinges whole worlde howbeit great peril comforteth v litle written word truth yt elect sake dayes shall shortened shalbe loosed short time anon caste lake burneth fire brimstone moreouer make iust reformation muste needes goe founteines themselues primitiue church wee read nothing set doctrine christ apostle concerning monkerie wee vnderstand necessary church yea haue learned experience noysome hurtefull churche wherfore true reformation persuadeth v altogether abrogate monkerie reiecting neglectinge meane season repent wickednes time hath made vnprofitable themselues others gently receiue care almes church thus much hitherto haue wee sayde occasion way concerning monkerie wee haue declared haue place primitiue churche christe apostle let v therfore returne necessary institution church likewise faithfull churche church sealeth sicke christe vseth discipline aboute sicke departing life come aboute neighbour brother euerie one part sheweth dueties loue charitie relieue needie good sick needie shew dueties goodwill commeth also minister churche comforting sicke person prepareth die makeing firste confession sinnes god pronouceth word god forgiuen doe stedfastly beleeue requireth also forgiue bee loue charitie men hee keepe olde grudge malice hart soe publique prayer made god sicke person partie point death hee also admonished sundrie thinges hee confirmed fayth hee called patience hee instructed according goodes euerie thing else requireth taught departing worlde commend soule hand god father according doctrine example redeemer pointe death cried aloud saying father thy hand commend spirite discipline haue wee learned apostle lorde christe apostle saint iames saieth bee sicke among lette sende elder church let pray ouer anoynting oyle name iames lorde prayer whiche made fayth shall deliuer sicke lorde shall rayse vp againe bee sinne shalbe forgiuen confesse sinns one another pray one another may bee safe heartie prayer iust greate force c apostolique discipline say vnto mee annoynting oyle oyle answere saint iames apostle time certeine age remained yet churche miraculous gifte healing sicke wee reade saint markes gospell disciple going foorth preached gospell mighte repent cast many diuels annoynted many oyle sick healed place saieth moreouer signes shal follow beleeue name shall cast diuels c anon sayth shall lay handes vppon sicke shall healed benefite remayned yet church saint iames biddeth v vse oyle vse name lorde lorde commaunded seing gift ceassed churche wee finde experience oyle doth good sicke according time duetie bindeth v best assuage cure disease sicke medicine conuenient sicknes applied name christ knowe howe testimonie apostle papistes go last annoyling set comend extreame vnction last annoyling labour vaine let passe saint iames speaketh nothing hallowed oyle admit medicine verie extremitie iames commaundeth annoynt euery sick pray defend saint iames wordes priest demaundeth sick person doest thou beleeue lord heare prayer merites sake prayer saintes sick man answering beleeue saith let v therefore pray god sainctes beseech hath saint iames apostle christe taught bring annointing name father sonne holy ghost annoynt thee holy oile anointing thou mayest receiue full remission thy sinnes scripture pray teacheth v full remission sinnes obteined anointing thinges done manifestly principall article religion whiche teacheth purged sinnes onely bloud christ fully onely glory due oyle creature whole worlde moreouer church christe funeral buriall doth reiect body dead deade dogge acknowledgeth body haue beene temple holy ghoste hath dwelt acknowledgeth buried hope resurrection glorie life euerlasting wherefore churche doeth moste reuerent manner take body windeth sheete couereth verie decently beeinge put coffine carefully carrieth vnto place buriall churchyard neere friend neighbour brother following accompanying corse bodie set downe laid earth publique prayer made brought corse giue thankes vnto god hath called partie deceased world true faithe pray also may please lorde take likewise vnto speedily beeing lightened true faith moreouer name dead brother sister recited publique assemblie churche honour people put minde destinie speedily prepare selues die manner read scripture ancient father buried dead yea moste holie reade nothing canonizating woorshipping reliques monethes yeares mindes dead offered ende soules departed shoulde deliuered paynes purgatorie certeine burialles described vnto v olde testament buriall abraham sara isaac iacob ioseph aaron marie iosua samuel dauid c new testament iohn baptiste stephan sparing without manner superstition iosephes bone carried forth carried mysterie israelite might gather thereof shoulde bee brought lande promise wherevnto also belongeth patriarch chose buriall hebron otherwise place auayleth nothing purchase better worse speed bodie buried must thinke place reason body saintes holy men buried maner sanctified least wise called holie body gett holinesse safetie grounde therefore vnlesse seeme good otherwise ye diuine prouidence god saint would gladly lye auncestours selfe place buriall please god otherwise acknowledge notwithstanding receiued earth without exception separated auncestours distance place wherefore superstition churche god burial graues howe muche time poperie man declare fewe wordes necessarie institution churche god churche hath neede leagal instruc ion faithfull religiously obserued without superstition edification matter onely deuised inuention man godly nothing weighe knowe thinges may obiected forsoothe auncient people olde testament sundrie manifolde rite ceremony instituted god prophetes beeing rude neede instruction since common sorte christian also rude wished many sundrie diuerse ceremony deuised auncient father without motion ye spirit must also obey answer true sounde reason whereby weake faith may receiue commoditie surely would ye apostle christ haue saide nothing therof moreouer experience teacheth yt state condition weake simple ceremony left vnto mindes diuersly dispersed lesse vnited christ alone al thing ascribed pleased father fulnesse dwell heape together al thing apperteining life saluation yea diuine wisedome god hathe taken away whole externall discipline instructio setting difference v therefore proceede bring againe iudaisme shuld leaue multiplie heape together rite ceremony according maner olde church olde time ceremony vse althoughe infinite comprised within certein number present vse place ye church neither want moste graue authoritie proue apostle elder greate assemblie actes meete together hierusale cou sell apostle peter plainely telleth tempt lord going lay yoake lawe vpon free neck christian also synodall epistle written wherin one consent testifie hath seemed good ye holy ghost lay none burthen church christ tha word inten therby may euident yt doctrine ye gospel sufficient church without ye c remonies law would haue rite olde time god instituted ioyned ye gospell much lesse ought present couple therewith ye inuentions men vnto moreouer wickedly ascribed either preparation grace worshipping god part saluation may say lesse day paule said long agoe haue knowne god howe chaunceth galath ye returne againe weake beggerly element would begin serue new ye obserue day moneths time yeres feard lest haue taken paine aboute vaine vnto thing also added instruction ceremony whereof speake belongeth worshipping god fordidden deuise vnto ourselues strange worshipping forbidden also put take away thing institution word god wherfore church god neither ordeineth receiueth constitution matter haue also spoken somewhat whereas intreated abrogating lawe christian libertie trust fiftie sermon haue shortely conueniently might comprehended ye whole matter faith godlinesse true religion also church often repeate al sermon book also againe repeat place learned may goodwill thankes gather imbrace better thing scripture vnto lorde god euerlasting founteine al goodnes praise glorie lorde iesus christ amen finis
